Then her manager Jimmy came by and by then I was upset and told them that it's rude to have the customer sitting there waiting. I asked to be seated. I told them I had been there for so long that I even knew how many seats were open.  Instead of apologizing Jimmy said, "Good for you!"   I finally sat down and my family came in.  When I told my husband what happened he immediately got up and wanted to leave.  On our way out Jimmy, the manager stopped me to "apologize" and I told him to not treat people like a jerk next time so he'll have nothing to apologize for!!   I have supported Olive and Ivy for YEARS!!!  I come here all the time and have celebrated many important events here.  There are MANY restaurant choices in PV/Scottsdale area. I wont be supporting this one any longer, and I'm happy to spread the word on how horribly I was treated.

What a cool place. You can either sit and be served in the dining area, or order sandwiches and salads to go, or eat those outside on the front patio. Did a lunch group here for a buddy's birthday, and we enjoyed ourselves.  I ordered the mediterranean salad w/ chicken, and it was great! Delicious, very healthy (not the typical overloaded salad you buy at chain restaurants), good size, and I wasn't under the spell of a carb coma the rest of the afternoon!
Great prices, and fast food.  Downsides... Limited drink selection, and no butter or jam for bread.  Other than that, this place is good to go.
I love this place! They have a gluten free menu which is great for those allergic, super convenient. I eat here all the time!
Aaron was our server for brunch and exceeded all of our expectations! He made sure everything was up to our standards and the food was great as usual. See ya guys next Sunday!
This place always delivers.  Solid food, solid service, great atmosphere.
Cool for sure, great design and staff. The dishes are great however the quality of product is meh. I like being there, i just feel ripped eating there:/

A few years ago my friend had her birthday dinner here. We were seated in the back room w/ the long table. It was a fun night. One of the Phoenix Suns coach was there that night and took care of us.  Anyway I've been here several times since then, and always have a great time. I love the open high ceilings w/ dark wood flooring and swanky decor. Of all the times we would come here, it had always been on a busy wkend night... So the ambiance is perfect... packed w/ good-looking people mingling at the inviting open bar.  My most recent visit was yesterday...which was my first experience having lunch here. There was a live band and the floor-to-ceiling windows were wide open to the patio... wow it looked great. We decided to not wait for the table since we found seats at the bar. I have to rave about the salad.... Mediterranean w/ chicken.... OMG one of the best I've ever tasted... absolutely delicious! And the crisp White Haven was paired perfectly w/ it ( and I'm not a big fan of white wine... but it was a warm sunny day). The service was a bit slow but the bartender admitted they were short- staffed... And it was super busy. So I didn't mind as long as our wine glasses were topped off... :) which he promptly always did w/ a smile.

Smoke and mirrors...atmosphere vs substance....  I am NOT a fan. This is your typical Scottsdale spot that puts their efforts into the decor (which is REALLY nice) and not into their boring menu.  Skip it.

Whenever I have the opportunity to go "out" with my husband, we go here.  Its worth the drive from Gilbert and the food is amazing.  The portions are just the right size and are delicious.  There is also some great people watching!  Its also a great place to bring out of town guests.

I would give a 5 star because the service deserves 5 stars our server was Michael and made our experience amazing! We were there celebrating our friends birthday and he was so attentive, fun, and just enough attention but not being annoying! He had great suggestions and was very knowledgeable about the menu! The food was also great!   The reason I gave a 3 star was because I called to make A reservation for the private room and apparently you have to call a separate  number and they are only there Mon - fri 8-4 or something so if you have weekend plans don't waste your time calling because they won't even bother to call you back.  I did call Friday at like 10 am but still I can't even get a call back by four?! This is the second time I have tried to reserve this room and have not received a call. To top it off during the time of the reservation that room was empty!! This probably isn't the restaurants fault so I feel bad giving the 3 stars but I think its kinda crappy I can't  get a call back when this is their job!   I highly recommend this restaurant and Michael but if you have a private party your better off just making reservations in the dining room.

We gave this place 2 chances and both times were unimpressed by the food, atmosphere and the service.  Yes, the location is awesome but the food has more than disappointed both times. It's difficult to get the attention of your waitperson, like they couldn't be bothered, and the atmosphere just feels cold, very anonymous, no warmth from anyone.  Last time, the chefs needed 3 times to make the eggs even acceptable. This time, no one greeted us, bartender was uninterested; the only ones to say hello were the hostesses on the way out. So, yes, great location but as the review says...Meh. I've definitely experienced better.

On the evening of Mar 17 our group of 4 ate at the Olive and Grape.  Booked the reservation by phone several days ahead, on arrival the table was ready.  Staff arrived promptly.  Drink orders were taken and served promptly.  The atmosphere was quite noisey, at times it was hard to hear conversation at the table.  Decor was very appropiate.  Menu had great selection.  All  4 had a first course, 3 different salads and one soup.  All were outstanding.  The main courses were spinach and veal ravioli, monk fish and sweet potatoe cannelloni.  Again outstanding in presentation and taste.  Dessert was cheesecake, gelato and a torte.  Service was excellent.  Price was appropiate to the restaurant.  Parking is a real plus, free indoor parking in the building.  Valet parking is also available.  We have been here on a prior trip and would go back in the future.

I went to Olive & Ivy for the first time for my friends bridal shower which was held in the banquet room.  We were promptly greeted and were offered mimosas or white sangria.  I had the sangria which was awesome, not too sweet.  The server was extremely attentive and very nice (I wish I knew her name).  Anyhow, the entire menu was great.  I especially enjoyed the pizza which had lox on it.  I never had lox on pizza, but it might just be my favorite thing.  You could tell the ingredients were super fresh.  I will definitely be back and only gave 4 stars because I need to try the rest of the menu.

One of the best restaurants in Old Town is Olive & Ivy. You can come here and sit on the patio for some appetizers and cocktails or dine in for the most amazing Wild Mushroom Papparedelli (spelling?). The caesar salad is wonderful as well and cocktails are fabulous. Try the blood orange one!

So delicious.  Went here for mother's day with my mom.  I ordered a pizza, absolutely delicious.  And the bread they bring out is one of the best I have ever tasted!  I seriously recommend this restaurant.

Olive and Ivy has become our favorite weekend dinner spot! The people and food are both amazing! We love the happy smiles and great service that we get every time.  I advise calling in a week ahead (or more) of when you are planning on coming because they fill up fast. If you aren't able to get a table we always love to sit at the bar or on the smalls bar couches around it. I strongly suggest ordering the bruschetta and the lamb meatballs! For dessert my favorite is their cheesecake. There is a new flavor everytime. But honestly everything I've had there has been amazing and Olive and Ivy is definitely one of my favorite restaurants!

This place is characterized by rude service, okay food, and a generally callous attitude toward customers . Ideally, this place would suit those who are looking for an awful evening in a nice part of town!  If you are anything other than lily white, blondes preferred,   expect to wait an eternity for any service.  The waitress we were unlucky to get was indeed a RACIST.  She was downright belligerent and rude, behaving as if she was doing us a favor by even getting us food and drinks. We were a group of eight people and had a tab in the $400-500 range yet got lousy service.  The manager was not helpful either and his attitude was simply that the waitress is usually very good - this despite the fact that we complained that she was awful. I have been here twice and will NEVER GO HERE again.

Just OK.  There are so many restaurants to choose from in South Scottsdale that you really need to stand out.  Olive & Ivy didn't do it for me.  Don't get me wrong, nothing was terrible, it was just OK.  At this price point, in this location, OK may not be good enough.

Friends of ours from the area took us here after a Cubs game and we had a very enjoyable experience. The ambience is very cool/trendy and the patio looked awesome. Super comfortable, with good seats/couches, heaters (which for Arizonians is a must), and acoustic musicians...I hear at night the bar can be somewhat of a pain because of overcrowdedness.  Food was solid. For app: Prosciutto with an abnormally large portion of meat. Fried Calamari which had a good reception for those who ate it and an awesome salad.  For dinner: I ordered the short rib which was fantastic...however when I first looked at it...wasn't so sure. Not a big portion upon first glance but after devouring an extremely tender piece of meat (even sharing a few bites) I felt differently. The pureed corn was a nice touch and I was extremely satisfied once finished. The dessert looked just as good and was from what the rest of the table said.  Only downside: Waitress seemed preoccupied the entire meal and not really all that friendly. No recommendations, monotone, and looking over your shoulder as she explained the specials and taking your order...maybe she wasn't a Cubs fan....who knows.

lunch today with a friend have not been here for quiet some time. they changed up  the menu a bit but some of my favorites are still there and are still just a good. (dates wrapped in bacon) shared a med salad and sweet potatoe cannonolli was wonderful. we sat at the bar and peter took great care of us very pleasennt and knowledgable of the menu and made some great suggestions. fox resturant knows how to do somethings right and this place is still a hit with me...thx
Service was good, food was average and location was great. Felt a little rushed as they were trying to turn tables. Pesto flatbed had great flavor but but my chicken dish fell flat.

Not sure why this place got such mixed reviews. Restaurant decor was really nice. Out waitress was attentive but not over bearing. They had a good wine list. I ordered the sea bass which was pretty good. The best thing however was the free bread and pesto they served. The pesto was so yummy. Would definitely come back.

We were visiting from Minnesota and found this adorable place for lunch. This restaurant is amazing  it's absolutely beautiful and I have never had better food or better service. Melinda was the sweetest server ever. She was never overbearing but was always there when we needed her. We were celebrating a bride-to-be and they gave her a complimentary desert and wrote Congratulations on the plate! I would absolutely come back if I was ever in Scottsdale again!

The location is good, and the patio can be wonderful on a winter afternoon.  The food, however, seems to be about 20% overpriced for what you receive.  It isn't bad, mind you, but it certainly isn't worth the prices they charge.  The bar area gets very, very crowded on Friday nights, which can be good or bad, depending on what you're in the mood for.  It is a nice place for drinks, and maybe appetizers.  Skip it for dinner, though, and try someplace else within walking distance in old town Scottsdale.

After a long search found a restaurant in scottsdale which not only looks good, has great ambience but also serves outstanding food. The watermelon salad was very fresh and the bruschetta was double thumbs up!! Not very pricey even though it looks upscale. Absolutely fallen in love with this place and I just can't wait for the next weekend to try rest of the menu.

Bacon wrapped dates.  I don't think I need to say more, but I will anyway!  I had the dates and an arugula salad, both were very fresh and delicious.  The bread that's brought to the table is good too - don't skip the pesto that comes with it.  This is not your average "throw-some-olive-oil-and-cracked-pepper-together-and-call-it-a-dipping-sauce" kind of stuff.  I could almost make a meal out of the bread and pesto alone.  Our waitress was almost over the top attentive, but I'll take that over one that disappears any day.

I am in town for work with a few coworkers. We wanted a restaurant that was more unique to Scottsdale. Olive & Ivy was wonderful. Great atmosphere without being stuffy, the waitress knew the menu and answered all of our questions, and the red sangrias were delicious. Definitely recommend.

We were pleasantly surprised at how good the food was here after coming for a late dinner.  We started out with the beet salad and lamb meatballs.  The beet salad was full of beets, which I find to be so rare at most restaurants.  The lamb meatballs were really juicy, but I wish they gave more tzatziki with them.  For entrees, I got the margherita flatbread and my husband got the chicken.  Both were really delicious and flavorful.  Our favorite was the foccacia and pesto that we got with our meal, and it was soooooo good!  I want that pesto recipe!  We also got a few cocktails to go with our meal, which were well-priced for the size of the glass.  Next time, we'll save room for dessert because the gelatos looked great!  Loved the ambiance and bar seating in front of the open kitchen too.
Love the atmosphere! Very chill spot. Great food. Service was so nice and efficient.

Wine Enthusiasts Beware! A party of 6 (2 winery owners, 1 collector,  and 4 wine industry professionals STRUGGLED to find a white wine by the glass that wasn't over-oaked or sweet.    Our server was patient and accommodating but we have to question the wine buyers palate.   If you are listening.. PLEASE offer a better variety of white wine BTG selections. Not everyone enjoys oaky buttery high alcohol wines with RS.

This restaurant was surprisingly really good. I've found that a lot of the restaurants in Scottsdale are either pretty or have high quality food, but Olive and Ivy offer both. I recommend coming here for a birthday or special event. (They also offer vegetarian options!)

I give O & I 4 stars because it is such a SCOTTSDALE SCENE that I want to really turn my nose up at it...but, really, it is intended to be that sort of place, and it is fabulous at what it does...so ignore the criticism, lol!  Really, at the end of the day, there is a reason this place is a classic here.  It may be enormous, but it is truly gorgeous, the food is phenomenal and interesting, and for a crowd place, nothing provides the same kind of elegant fun.  If you are over 40 and want to soak up the Scottsdale Nightlife vibe without feeling out of place, this spot is Paradise indeed!

Tried this with friend on a Thursday night - made a reservation and got a lovely table that was inside/outside.  The outside tables look a little difficult to eat at, so we were glad we were  "on the edge" !  The bread and pesto is DELICIOUS - perhaps a bad discovery as I could come back to this place just for that !  The red sangria is also fabulous.  We split a salad and a flatbread and a cheese plate - all were awesome - we wanted to try everything. Then 2 folks had scallops and for the non-seafood folks they had the veal ravioli - all were excellent - what we loved was they they split the plates already between us so there was no reaching over or fighting over the last piece  We will be back !

I've been here a few times and always enjoy myself.  Being from Seattle...I love the opportunity to eat outside.  The outdoor seating is really nice and staff is friendly.  Come here for drinks, dinner or the gelato!

We went here for Mother's Day.  We ordered the wild mushroom, shrimp and corn soup, which was so good even my seven year old ate it.  I also had the Crab Eggs Benedict which was so-so.  The best eggs benedict are still at Crackers and Co. in Mesa.  There was no kids menu, so we just had them make fettucini with butter for the kids.  My four year old really enjoyed the focaccia with pesto.  Overall, I'd say the food was decent, but I won't be rushing back.

Olive and Ivy was the suggestion of a friend. I wasn't to keen on the idea of driving up to Scottsdale in the middle of the week to eat expensive and tasteless food. Now, I come from California so my idea of a "waterfront" is very different than that of someone who lives in the desert. I'll give Scottsdale some credit though; the "waterfront" looks better when you're sitting beside it, at night, eating pesto and bread with sangria at Olive and Ivy.  We waited about 30 minutes for a table for three on a Wednesday night. We sat outside on their very nice patio right on the "waterfront". They bring you pesto and bread to start, and its so delicious and plentiful, we probably didn't need to order an appetizer. The appetizer we did get was the calamari which was delish. A friend and I split a pitcher of sangria...a little pricey but good. For my main, I ordered the mediterrean flatbread with no cheese and it was very good. The portion was huge so I took almost the entire thing home for lunch the next day. Service was good and the atmosphere is nice, especially the outside.  Overall, very good experience. A little on the pricier side (if you order drinks!) but I think its a great place to start a night out with friends.

I absolutely loved the vibe at Olive and Ivy! The indoor is just as great as the amazing outdoor.  The open kitchen and spacious dining room is great.  The food is definitely delicious and innovative.  My compliments to the chef and the creative minds who put together the menu. I recommend this place for a cocktail after work, dinner, or even a nice weekend afternoon, I will definitely be back.
The best airport breakfast out there. Fast easy and fresh.  The price was excellent too for an airport.

Well lets see.  Come here a bunch of times, mostly decent but over priced for quality of food. Service USUALLY is good. However went there with a party of 4. Paid $100 in cash and then the rest on my card....(50/50 split between two people)  Turns out the waiter took all the cash and charged the whole bill to my card.....took a long time to dispute it with the manager who for whatever reason was very hesitant to reverse the transaction until I threatened to file a fraud report with my bank.....  I read another review of a similar situation....seems like a real problem there

I tried Margherita Flatbread at lunch today. The strong scent of basil was refreshing. Melted mozzarella embraced my taste buds. Server was very kind and offered timely service. Overall, wonderful experience

Always a nice experience at O&I, especially on chill winter nites where an outdoor gas fire pit gives that extra romance to ones Friday date nites! It's always packed in the dining room on weekends so we were happy to just curl up on one of their rocking patio chairs and warm up our toes  al fresco style. Service was spot on and we were attended to with waters and warm tasty focaccia bread as we waited for our entrees.   I hate to pry in on other neighboring conversations but when distance to ones nearby diner is an arms length away one can get caught up on a perhaps first date encounter as were we. Cute divorcee doctor with kids and a seemingly nice real estate agent were engaged in fabulous banter over some champ. Ahhh so nostalgic are the days of butterfly flurries during mating season, but I digress.  Dinner was promptly served, our prosciutto flatbread got rave remarks from the hubs, excellent dough texture and not too charred as some places fail. My sea bass kept its temperature outdoors and was perfectly cooked. While hubby's filet had a wonderful red wine reduction over scalloped potatoes.  O&I is the perfect location for an intimate casual yet impressing outing and ask the old adage goes, make love not war! Next month I'm considering booking the private room for my next annual Valentines girls nite out...

Had a Sunday dinner here and I love Olive & Ivy every single time i go.  Our waitress, Tess, was very nice and attentive. I love the Hummus!!!! Its a little on the spicy side and oh so delicious. Th patio is perfection, so check this place out. The ambiance is amazing and perfect for a date too. Happy Dinning
Simple review. Good food. Great atmosphere and service. I will be coming back.

We arrive to test drive this eatery for the 1st time only to be warned that two groups had booked the main dining area & a separate private room.  While I scouted the edges for an acceptable spot for the two of us, my wife appraised the patio. Finding the latter uncrowded and heaters available to ward of a light breeze on a cool eve, we settled in with Suzie as our attentive server...We hastened our selection to get them to the kitchen and bar before the herds arrived. Pleasantly affordable, generously proportioned and delightfully flavored. We'll return again this week to try some other offerings & bring our friends along to delight them when we return to the valley next month.  Very nice setting on the canal, convenient to parking and the Old Town core.

Only because I have to give a rating.  Nothing bothers me more than when you bring friends in from out of town and not only do you get the worst service, but unfortunately we got no service.  Save yourself the trip and pick any place else.
Amazing food every time! Love the patio atmosphere. The service is always excellent. Good for special occasions or well needed happy hours.

This wouldn't be 5 stars if it weren't in the airport.  However, for an airport restaurant, never had better service and a fresher salad.  After a day's worth of travel, it was a pleasant experience to be helped and served by the staff and Olive & Ivy.  For instance, sitting at my table but I didn't have a drink and a young lady came by and asked if I wanted water...  with a smile!  She genuinely seemed happy to serve the customer!  Server behind the counter was just as helpful when ordering.  More than willing to change my order and make the already-made salad exactly the way I wanted it.  I will go out of my way to eat there again if I'm in the PHX airport.  Thank you!!

I had an hour long layover in Phoenix and was looking for an early lunch. There weren't many restaurants with vegetarian options around but I decided to try O+I. I was initially hesitant about getting an airport salad but I was happily surprised with the Mediterranean! The veggies were fresh and the toasted almonds added a great crunch. I'll be recreating this one at home. The paninis also looked tasty but most included some kind of meat. All in all, worth a stop if you are in Terminal 4!

I went for the birthday party of a friend. We had a table of 10 but we got our own private room so it was very nice.   I ordered the Sangria, and that was not Sangria, i lived in spain, i know what Sangria tastes like, and that was like wine mixed with water....It was super strong as well, so at least if you didn't like it you could get drunk quickly and forget.   We ordered the Calamari for the appetizer and it was so so. It was supposed to come with Aioli sauce, once again, i've lived in spain, i know what aioli is and what its supposed to taste like. I felt like this tasted more like dill dip....   We ordered the Shrimp Risotto which I was thoroughly looking forward to, but it was bland.... It was a cream sauce without any real flavor to it. The side potato dish was better than the risotto, but it was nothing more that scalloped potatoes.   The honest truth is that the best thing i had while i was there was the bread and olive oil pesto dip. Which is ridiculous when you think how much you're paying to eat here.   Another thing i would say is that everything we ordered was recommended by the server. I'm totally not blaming him, because we wanted to order it before we even asked him, but he told us each time that it was a good selection.   Generally, I might try it again, but it wont be anytime soon and I'll be a lot more skeptical.
Best mediterranean salad in all of AZ! The marketplace is my go-to for a quick salad.

We had a reservation for two, they took us straight back right on time. The patio is awesome! Right on the water and lots of trees! We had the bruschetta appetizer and it was great! Great stiff drinks! Our server was great. Definitely a place worth checking out.
Above my expectation for airport food. I always disliked the food that I got in airports and this us the first time I actually liked the food. Staff are also friendly

I was able to snag the chef's table on a busy night and it was a wonderful experience. The chef influenced my husband to finally try hummus despite my years of trying!   They were very understanding of my dietary allergies and restrictions. They were charming and the food is absolutely amazing!   I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to any and all that want a superb dining experience.

Went to dinner here with a group friends. We shared the Mediterranean salad and the butternut squash flatbread. It was all delicious and filling. I had the shrimp risotto for my entree and tried so hard to finish it but it was just too much food. Service was excellent.  Would definitely recommend to everyone.

Bar tender really bad.  Stands in front of you and acts busy.  We ate and had a few drinks and he could not even refill the drinks.  Food is not great and with this service I'd say find someplace else. Who needs bad service at these prices!!!
Pleasantly surprised! Had a breakfast club sandwich and it was very good. Actually GREAT for airport food! Hot, fresh, and tasty!
One of my favorite restaurants!! The pesto is amazing! Cool cocktails and entrees.  Sweet potato canneloni is super yummy!! Love the ambiance of this place.  Have always had great service here too.

Fabulous Downtown Scottsdale farm to table restaurant. Delicious food, nicely presented, reasonably priced. Very accommodating chef that customized my meal. Sit outside on the rear patio overlooking the river. Great gelato flavors served with yummy shortbread cookie. Save room!

Came here for the first time this week on a Monday and to my surprise it was busy! The food and drinks took a while to come to our table maybe bc they were busy but the food was very good and the place was very nicely decorated

Oh me oh my, but such a welcoming refuge from the three-digit heat of Arizona. Located at the Waterfront in Scottsdale, which is in fact a man-made canal that is surrounded by a plethora of restaurants, condos, business establishments and a huge indoor mall. Olive and Ivy serves food to order/take out at their deli section, or food to dine in their patio outside under umbrellas and h20 forced mist (misters?). Since it was 120 degrees outside, we chose to chill inside the large dining area near the windows - this way, we still got a nice view of the outdoor patio that borders the beautiful tree- covered walkway along the canal.  The restaurant is very "foo-foo" Italian dining in a casual atmosphere. I love ordering the melon salad, which is only served in summer or very hot days - lucky me. The pupu appetizer platter is enough for party of four because of the more than adequate amount of bread served with the other ingredients on the plate (prosciutto, salami, cheese, nuts, dates, etc). A favorite is the tomato/basil soup with complimentary bread and... drumroll... their homemade pesto dipping sauce. Oh drool!  The piece a la resistance was the desert.  Must must must try the oh-my-shshshut-the-door-already peanut butter mousse with smoked sea salt dentelle, topped off with a nutty, crunchy, chocolate shell. Ohhhhhh such delectable joy.  I tell you, I don't know if it was sheer relief from the heat, but boy did I ever have a most orgasmic-ly satisfying meal.  By the way, they also serve and have a good selection of wine/alcohol and beverages at the bar. Our "tame" party settled for raspberry drinks with ice water all around.  Great service; great food; great ambiance. May be a little pricey but worth it.
I would like to go here but every time I try it is too busy.  One time they told me it was like a 6 hour wait???    It is pricey and 'totally upscale Scottsdale-ish'

The airport seems to have a lot of junk food. It was good to find this place. I was over at B terminal and walked over to A. I had a ready made salad. I didn't realize it had bacon bits. Isn't a salad suppose to be healthy? What's with the bacon bits? The salad was OK, but I thought it was small.

Our last night in Arizona was at Olive and Ivy. The server was Sarah and she was excellent. The restaurant held our reservation promptly even though things were hopping on a Friday night. Food was very good too.  Cannot go wrong IMHO.  Not gourmet food, but a fun, vibrant place with good food and (for us) a great server.
Food was so good and so was the service.  We came here for lunch today and sat on the patio.  It was relaxing and fun. I had the lamb gyro and my husband had the pesto flatbread.  Both were tasty!

This place does everything right. We had to wait for a table, no problem! The large outdoor patio has waitresses. You can  come for the drinks but you will stay for the food. Both meals I have had here rank among the greatest I have eaten anywhere. My wife, who has different taste than I, agrees. The dessert we ordered was amazing as well.   It is fancy here and you are treated like it. Excellent place.

Immediately seated. Free flow of fresh bread with an olive dipping to die for. Got the sweet potato cannelloni (as recommended by server). Didn't regret my decision. Others on my table got the lasagna and the flatbread which were both equally tasty. Great ambience too. Should definitely stop by if you're in the area. It's a mix of Mediterranean food with a Californian twist.
Beautiful patio overlooking the Scottsdale Waterfront...perfect for Sunday brunch and yummy mimosas!

The waiter was great the service was awesome but finding fur with a bone in my salad while chewing is the most horrid experience I have ever had. The manager was very nice and gracious and apologetic about us finding this in our salad but that does not make up for the fact that I might get sick tonight and that I had a piece of who-knows-what in my mouth. I will never come to this establishment again. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!
I love this restaurant. The food and drinks are great. The outdoor patio is a great spot to hang out with friends.

The staff here was amazing! They were so accommodating to our large party that expanded our reservation last minute. We got multiple updates on our food from our waiter and management. The food was excellent and everyone enjoyed. We recommend the kale salad, risotto, or lasagna Bolognese.
Wonderful lunch while on vacation.  The food was very fresh, the outside patio was super quaint and great view on the water. Our server Matt was exceptional.
I sat on the patio and was served by Amanda!  She was amazing!  I am gluten free and had the bacon wrapped dates!  I'll be back for them again and the beautiful patio!

We had an awesome table--right next to their big patio. So it was like we were on the patio, but had the benefit of air conditioning. Food was good, but we felt a bit rushed. It was just my husband and I and the hostess sat us at a table set for four. The waiter made it quite clear that our seat was "prime real estate" (yes, those were his exact words) and tried to hurry us through our dinner.

I came here for brunch for the first time a few weeks ago and loved it. The ambience is just so cute and classy, it made me glad I dressed up a bit that day. The wait wasn't too bad, but I was sad that the outdoor seating was closed due to rain that day. The sun did come out while we were eating though, and it is simply gorgeous out in their garden! I ordered the breakfast sandwich with egg, bacon, avocado and cheese and it was oh so yummy. The server was attentive and friendly. Hoping to come back soon for more!

This is one of my favorite new spots in scottsdale!   First I must say, the host at the door was very pleasant and made me feel very welcome upon arrival. Olive, if you read these reviews take good care of Maddie, she's wonderful!   The service was great and the food was even better. Definitely will be a returning customer!
The food and service were great! The ambiance on the back patio was beautiful. Would definitely recommend.

Just had an amazing meal here. I had the salmon and my husband  had the sweet potato ravioli which was to die for. The service was great  and the outdoor seating added to the experience. Our waitress, Alexandria was a doll.  I would definitely go back.
One of the better patio's to enjoy in Scottsdale. The food is always spot on and it's close to everything in Old Town Scottsdale.

This place is terrific! We had this restaurant recommended to us by friends and we were excited to try it. We had such a great dining experience tonight on our last night here in Scottsdale! We had an 8:30 reservation and arrived to have the table ready for us. They read our reservation request to be outside and they were able to seat us on the patio! The bartenders up front were so nice and they made us great cocktails while we checked in for our table. Our server Melissa is AMAZING! As soon as we sat down and were greeted by her, we knew it was going to be a great experience based on her energy. Melissa knew the menu so well and really set us up for some good decisions. We will definitely recommend this place to others! The music and vibe in the restaurant is fun and on point. The food and the drinks were excellent!

I've eaten lunch at Olive & Ivy on a number of occasions, including this week.  The great service we received deserves a review.  I have always enjoyed the atmosphere at this restaurant for a business lunch - relaxed, not stuffy, not too noisy (but not too quiet), attentive staff and pretty good and affordable food.  This is why I choose it relatively frequently.  When we sat down this time our waitress had difficulty answering a question.  Immediately her colleague, who was within earshot, came over, as she was explaining that she was new on the job.  He answered the question and also assisted her throughout the meal with several other questions about what was in the food (important due to allergy issues).  As my colleague was enjoying his sandwich, he observed that there was not very much filling, although what was there tasted great.  When they came by to ask how things were, he shared that comment, to which the response was "we'd be happy to provide more if you would like" - very good response.  Later, when the bill came, we were told that our dessert was on the house for sharing our comments.  Totally unexpected.  An example of a great service attitude that more restaurants would be well to copy.

I wasn't that hungry when I came so I ordered there Cesar salad. I was expecting a pretty bland salad but I got the opposite. It was the best salad I have ever had! So much texture, flavors, and deliciousness in every single bite! The nuts and the oats added with the blue cheese just finished it off perfectly. The chicken served in it was also so moist.  I recommend this salad to anyone.

My husband and I decided to go out for a nice dinner this last Friday night and we decided on Olive & Ivy, and let me tell you this was a great decision! The food was absolutely delicious, the decor is super cute, and the service was exceptional!!! Not to mention the food was unexpectedly fast! Definitely recommend, and be returning in the future!

My wife and I have been a couple dozen times. Must be good, right? So we stopped in for a bite, and a pre-shopping cocktail today. There wasn't much of a crowd, and based on our experience, it is totally understandable. The food tasted just as good, leaving the service as the game changer.  I like to sit at the bar for my meals out, and I've been known to tip a shot of tequila from time to time. I'd even go so far as to say that there are no shortage of bartenders throughout the valley who know me well enough to serve me a chilled shot. No salt, no lime. EVER. Haven't had to use training wheels since the early 2000's.    I ordered a shot of Patron Silver, chilled, and before I knew it, the bartender was turning away, but I still said, no salt, no lime. He didn't acknowledge that he heard, so when my shot was served with salt around the entire rim, i assumed he had indeed not heard me. Not that big a deal, so I brushed the salt off the rim. My wife, who knows me better than anyone, said, wait! Before I knew it she had the bartender's attention, and asked for a saltless shot for me.  Here starts the slippery slope. Rather than believing the customer, our barkeep looked at me and told my wife that I had asked for salt. I'm sorry, what? I said, no, I asked for no salt no lime, to which he replied something other than okay. Basically calling me a liar.He rudely continued to argue the point  Excuse me, who the f*** are you to tell me what I said. Anyway, we were there, we were hungry, so on to faux pas number two.  We ordered a turkey hoagie to split. Having had it before, I knew it was enough for our desire to have a fairly lite lunch. I can name 50 restaurants that will bring the meal to you split in two on separate plates. Not at O&I today. We asked the guy who brought the food for an additional plate, and after he went to get one, the gem of a bartender asked, oh do you need an extra plate.  This may sound nit picky, and maybe it is. But we live in the Biltmore corridor, and there are just too many viable options for every occasion to have to put oneself through that kind of experience. Wake up O&I. You have what it takes, just show your customers a little common courtesy and respect.

We had an early dinner here today. Megan was our waitress and she was amazing. I have lots of dietary restrictions, and eating out is a challenge. Megan knew what was in each of the dishes and was able to make great recommendations for me, and they subbed out a vegetable I can't eat and exchanged it for some I can eat. I got the salmon and it was the best I've ever had. The rest of my party got the hummus, lamb meatballs and pesto with bread for appetizers, and flat bread, kale salad, the Mediterranean salad with shrimp and Mediterranean salad with salmon. Everyone loved their food. I would highly recommend this restaurant, and get Megan if you can. Fabulous food and amazing service!

3rd time here in as many years. This has become a regular stop during our Spring Training visits. Love the location. We have sat outside which I prefer but this visit we were inside in a booth however the entire from of the dining area opens to the outside. Service was excellent and attentive. We ended up with 4 different dishes between my girlfriend and I. We started with bacon wrapped dates, good! Then the beet salad which had a wonderful variety of flavors. We shared a piccante flatbread which was great. Finally we had the mushroom Tortelli just because we had already ordered it. Despite being full from the previous items it was still fantastic. We shared a fairly cheap bottle of wine though they have a fairly large list to choose from. Thoroughly enjoyed the meal and the venue. Easy reservations and had great service.

This is one of my favorite Fox concepts. The atmosphere on the patio during the mild weather seasons is to die for! The service is always incredible.  The break and pesto before the meal is what I look forward to. I can eat just that alone! I am biased towards the veal ravioli mainly because I'm a picky eater. It is truly delicious though. The potato and prosciutto flatbread is also a must have.

A tad over priced, but love the chicken chop salad--I get it with Parmesan instead of blue cheese and oregano dressing soooo good!! Also the iced teas are amazing--will come just for the tea! Love love passport tea!
The food was decent, drinks were good. Minus one star for the bartender that tried to over charge us for our drinks thinking we would be too buzzed to notice. Their cafe side has good mocha's.

I hadn't been here in ages - delicious food, great atmosphere and excellent service from Zach F..  He had great recommendations and was very attentive to my table's needs without being annoying.  I will definitely be back soon!!
This is a good spot for a quick bite to eat. I always enjoy their breakfast club sandwich. You really cannot go wrong here.
So Wonderful!  Delicious food. Great service. Amazing ambience.  The only thing that made it not a perfect 5 stars was the bruschetta. It was a bit of a let down compared to everything else we had.

I loved this restaurant, although it may be a chain (not sure). The food was terrific, as was the service and ambiance. We took our waiters suggestions on splitting a few salads (that we couldn't choose from) and a beef short rib flat bread. Everything was delicious. The manager was very visible and he took the time to explain their olive oil and Parmesan Reggiano  qualities. It happened to be a beautiful day and the outdoor seating was perfect. We watched a lot of dishes come out of the (open) kitchen and everything looked wonderful. I believe they really use fresh ingredients, cooked to order and beautifully presented. When visiting Scottsdale, or any of their other cities, I will absolutely return to Olive & Ivy.

It is definatley time for an update!  after a few dozen ++ visits since last rvw!    Loved the cooking class last week in thier intimate executive room.  Sam Fox was available throughout the evening to give updates on FRC, to answer questions, and serve food.  Was very informative, and alot of fun.  Right now, there is a drop-dead special: 3 courses for $20 - yes, you heard me right: THREE course meal for less than the cost of an entree !!  O.M.G.  can't wait to go back - again, and again, and again.  Oh, HH is now 7 days/wk !   Whoooooooooooooo :-)

One of my favorites. The food is always great, service can be hit or miss but typically a really nice experience. Their bread and pesto dipping is fantastic. Sometimes you have to ask for it but it's worth it!
This is my favorite place in downtown Scottsdale. Great severs and great atmosphere. The food it's amazing.

It's been a while since I was in Arizona, but I still remember the Olive and Ivy.  I was in Phoenix on a business trip and went out for dinner at this place with a bunch of work people based on a recommendation from a local.  We were not disappointed.  Firstly I want to say that the decor and outdoor area in this place is just fabulous.  We sat outside and enjoyed a delicious meal.  The staff were professional, welcoming and accommodating.  I enjoyed the experience so much that I brought the gf along for dinner when she arrived that weekend.  Both times I was extremely pleased with the food, drink, level of service and the ambience of the place.  5-stars for mine.
awesome and delicious place! good for groups!

My ex fiancé and I, really enjoyed this place the food was amazing and we got to talk to the chef with our dinner. My Ex and I were both chefs in other kitchens so having a date night and getting to talk to the chef was nice. Atmosphere was great and we sat at the table looking into the kitchen.

After an afternoon shopping, my gf and I make dinner reservations at Olive & Ivy. Wanting to take advantage of the beautiful day, we waited for a table on the patio.   The cobblestone, foliage and water feature made the patio that much more enjoyable as we sipped our cocktails in the sun and watched people bustling about at the courtyard across the way at a festival.  When our kale salad, bruschetta and sea scallops arrived, I couldn't decide where to start! A light citrus dressing and slices of granny smith apples gave the salad a nice tartness. Of the trio of bruschetta, my fave was the sautéed mushrooms served with melted swiss - savoury deliciousness! Accompanying the sweet scallops were seared asparagus and polenta drizzled in a balsamic reduction.  You can really notice the freshness and quality of the ingredients they use here. If you want to enjoy Olive but don't have the time to sit down, they have a marketplace inside the restaurant where you can pick up things like sandwiches and fresh pressed juices - something I'll keep in mind if I want a quick snack while shopping!

A beautiful place for brunch with friends. I would recommend sitting outdoors if it is a nice, sunny, and not too hot day. Sitting indoors is nice as well since the interior is all open to the outdoors.  Lots of food and drink options available for everyone, the server let us know that everything is made from scratch in house (impressive!) I ordered the table side mimosa with the smoked salmon & bagel and it was delicious! I had already snacked a lot at the farmer's market and had to take half to go, but no regrets would 100% get this again. Whatever my friends got too looked delicious (biscuits and gravy, egg sandwich, eggs Benedict, etc.) The Bloody Mary had a kick, perfect to wake you up in the morning.  What kind of was meh to me was the fact that we looked at the next table over & they got a full glass of mimosa while our table when first poured, only got maybe half a glass. Not a huge deal, but something that I saw while dining. Besides this little thing, service was great and we were in and out quickly.  Would recommend for anyone looking for a nice brunch in the area!
The Sicilian pizza was awesome, and the workers are friendly and helpful. Best service I've received at any airport
The food, service, and ambiance was great.  Came here on a recommendation from a sales guy at Neimans, and it did not disappoint.  Will definitely come back the next time im in Scottsdale.

Food was okay, atmosphere outside was kind of loud.  I had the lamb pita and it came out cold, but was ok overall. I dont live in AZ so I am not able to return, but I would go back for dinner since its a bigger menu and would be cooler outside.

Absolutely love the food and service at this restaurant - it has now become our "go-to" place for all celebrations! Staff goes above and beyond, and the menu is eclectic enough that everyone we have gone with (been different each time) never has a problem finding something yummy to eat.

We were attempting to have a sandwich. Spent 30 dollars on sandwiches. There were patrons (kids, sky harbor employees) that were incredibly OBNOXIOUS , loud, disruptive, using filthy language sitting behind us. We gave it a try, they continued, relentless with their awful behavior. We told the manager of Olive and Ivy and they just smiled and snickered. We left. Wasted our money and food to escape their behavior. I hope Olive and Ivy know that their name is attached to this establishment poorly run! I live in Phoenix/Scottsdale and will never go to an Olive and Ivy again.

For those travelers looking for a quick bite to eat, but prefer something fresher than your regular airport Chili's, look at the new Olive and Ivy located across from Gate A4 in Terminal 4. Last year the City of Phoenix made a great decision when renewing their food service contracts to push vendors to bring in versions of local restaurants found thought the Valley. Here at Olive and Ivy, you'll find a fresh panini or two (recommend the Pastrami), a few salads and select coffee drinks made to order.

We decided to visit after the crushbrew festival. The music and decor lured us in. We were quickly seated in the outside area, service was fast and friendly. We ordered the lamb meatballs and a pasta dish. The food was delicious, tasty and at a great temperature. Definitely something to try another night when we aren't tired of drinking/walking all day... Perfect for a nice date-night.

Bartender who took our order didn't do anything the hour we were there. He made some new guy make all the drinks and the new guy asking waitresses what garnishes go on which drink. He should be asking the bartender. I can get a better old fashioned in a dive bar.
Great spot, good food.  Sam Fox is some kind of genius.

Our waiter introduced the restaurant as a Mediterranean/Italian restaurant with a twist. As best I can tell, the "twist" was the lack of Italian dishes on the menu!  Good drinks, great food, prompt service and a nice atmosphere at Scottsdale prices - need I say more?

Impressed yet again by another Fox Concept Restaurant. This place is amazing! Julia, our server, was super sweet and beyond accommodating. The next time we come in we will definitely be looking forward in sitting in her section again. The food was amazing!! We got the jalapeño cilantro hummus as an appetizer (yum!) and as an entree we got the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin cooked to perfection! The dish was beautiful and they even split it for us! We also split the chicken pesto pizza. The chicken is shredded inside the pesto and even came with pine nuts! It was amazing! Before they entree they give you complimentary bread and pesto with olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette. Oh, and get the Strawberry & Thyme cocktail; you'll be hooked!

We were lucky to secure a reservation for a private room to celebrate our daughter's graduation (ASU!) at this fabulous restaurant!  The banquet coordinator was excellent and worked closely with us throughout the planning process. Her suggestions were spot on and resulted in some of the highlights of the evening.  Even after the party got underway we were able to make some significant changes and the coordinator and staff were gracious and accommodating.  Our service that evening was beyond our expectations and the food was truly divine.  I can't say enough good things about our experience.  Just wish I kept a list of all the names of the terrific folks that helped make our party a complete success!  Don't hesitate to book a special event or dinner at Olive & Ivy. Be sure to order any of their flatbreads, their amazing scallops, and/or their tender steaks.  And don't miss their antipasti...the best presentation and so delicious!

Dined outside. It's a must do when the weather is right. Fit's nicely into the 'Fashion Square' mentality an aura. Great appetizers and they did a great job on the steak. We'll go back again sometime.

My lovely bride and I visited on a nearly perfect day in Scottsdale (not hard to find).  We had lunch around 2:00 on a Friday and were astounded how busy the restaurant was but soon learned why that was the case.  Enjoyed an ice cold Peroni along with their bread and pesto dipping sauce.  Just ridiculously good.  I literally could have had the bread for lunch.  Light, airy, slightly salty.  Pesto was perfection.  We then shared the Mediterranean Salad and Chicken Pannini.  Salad was very, very good.  The Pannini was literally one of the best sandwiches I have wolfed down in a very long time.  Moist, simple, filling.  Unreal.   We found the service to be very solid.  Friendly, attentive but not intrusive.  There is not question that we will return.  The nice part is I already know what to order, as well.

Awesome service and environment.  Our waiter was well informed and friendly. Had sweet potato CANNELLONI the taste was a combination of dinner and dessert. It was too much of one thing.  Maybe served as a side or for sharing would be good.  The spicy shrimp RISOTTO was good but not spicy at all. Overall good quality food and lovely ambiance. Has unique food not found at other restaurants. Would recommend to a friend

I came here with a work group after Cowboy Ciao lost our reservation and were pretty well taken care of on short notice. Check the website, the atmosphere is pretty swank. Huge space with a lot of thought put into it...neat-o. The service was absolutely excellent, and we never had to ask/wait for anything.   Now the food... not too bad, but not amazing. We had a global group of visitors (Sydney, NYC, London, Chicago, Dublin) and everyone was happy with the choices, and what they ordered. Decent value for the money, but not overly memorable. On the plus side, the wine list was extensive and fairly diverse, so we were quite happy with that. The cocktails were creative, but all the ones I tried slanted a bit to the sweet side on balance (not a bad idea for mass appeal).  P.S. Cowboy Ciao was pretty accommodating. Their manager got on the phone and arranged for a group of 10 to walk in to Olive & Ivy with no notice, so I appreciated the effort.

I expected this to be good because their regular restaurant in Scottsdale is good.  It was early morning so the Irish Oats sounded good.  Not sure what is Irish about them (I was expecting Irish Steel cut) as they really seem like normal Quaker Oats and definitely were not Irish Steel Cut).  They were severely undercooked, and barely warm.  The wait staff was quite friendly and helpful and immediately offered to replace the item with something else, which is why I gave 2 stars instead of one.  So the repacement was eggs, bacon and potatoes.  The dish seemed like it had been prepared well in advance and had just been sitting.  It was not very appetizing.  I gave two stars instead of 1 because they tried to make it right and I appreciate that.  Perhaps translsating from an upscale restaurant to an airport concession is not easy.  Not sure.
I come here for the pancakes once a week and now they are gone. Bring them back please! #disappointed

The atmosphere of this restaurant was great, very spacious. The food was delicious. Our table was under a vent which made it very uncomfortable to eat. Service was pretty good. Would love to go back to this place sometime but also enjoy trying new places.

Great place. The food was fresh and delicious. Not the biggest selection ever, but I can see their "quality not quantity" motto. The brushetta is amazing and I love the fresh focaccia ad pesto they bring to the table. Great service and their sangria ROCKS!!!

After my last review, the manager of Olive and Ivy contacted me and asked us to give them another try.  He apologized for the poor service. I am so glad he took an interest in our comments and asked us to return. This latest visit definitely rates 5 stars. We again sat outside on the patio that overlooks the canal. It was perfect. The service was excellent and the waiter was very attentive without hovering. The food was perfect. My husband ordered the rib-eye steak and said it was cooked to perfection and very tender. I ordered two vegetarian appetizers, hummus with vegetables and the flatbread. The margherita flatbread rates among the best I have ever eaten.  I am so glad we were asked to give this establishment a second visit. The outside atmosphere and location makes it a favorite of ours to take out of town guests.

After hearing good things about this place, I finally made it here for lunch.  Unfortunately, it was after the menu change so I was expecting different choices.  Upon entering, the first thing I noticed was that there wasn't much space to sit.  There were maybe 5 small tables near the ordering counter and just as much at the patio.  This was a fast casual place(you order at the counter but they'll bring food out to you).  The menu was somewhat small.  You get to pick between pizza, salad, or sandwich.  I decided on a gyro and my bf got the corn pizza.  Since we wanted to sit inside, we decided to go past the ordering counter to see if there were any tables there.  I was skeptical since all I could see was the kitchen and waitstaff in that area, but it turned out there was a ton of restaurant seating that you can't see when you go in.  We weren't sure if we were suppose to sit there since it looked more formal, but we did anyway.  The food came within a reasonable amount of time and it was decent.  My gyro was generously portioned.  The pickle that came with my gyro could have been more crisp and the tzatziki sauce was pretty bland.  The corn pizza was also a generous portion and seemed quite good from the bite I got.  My main dislike of this place was the layout.  Seating shouldn't be hidden in the back.  The food is slightly pricey and none of the menu items jumped out at me.  I'd describe this place as underwhelming.  At least this place has underground parking.

I understand! I do! I get it that I'm a 22 year old guy that doesn't look like he could tell the difference between caviar and cold salty bean dip, but honestly when I went out for a nice sweet date night with my bangin' girlfriend, we had no idea that we were doomed to be shoved into the day care section at the haughtiest country club this side of Cafe la Ritz.   Everything felt good as our hostess walked us back through the crowded dining room. However, the fuzziness in the pit of my stomach soon morphed itself into a dull pooing sensation as we were plopped down at a table next to another set of young diners. Soda pop and water was on their table, and sexual tension (theirs) was in the air as we lifted our menus to let our eyes feast on the over priced menu.   Our service was fine, with the exception of a few awkward mishaps with our ID's, but the real issue was the food. Maybe it's just my misunderstanding of fine dining, but I thought that really good food was always served in small portions(because of the high quality ingredients, which in turn are high price ingredients) but tasted really really AWESOME. Olive and ivy only accomplished half of this with their veal and spinach ravioli. Wow, I didn't know that chef boyardee could be sold for 14 dollars. It was so bland, super under cooked and needed a serious hit of salt.   On the upside, I got a Sausage and mushroom pizza that was pretty good, but not amazing. Hand tossed...meh. Fennel Sausage...okay. This is one of the top five pizza topping combos and SHOULD be totally delicious every time. But I still think their are better places to get some killer sausage and mushroom pizza for a way better price.   On the way upside, my girlfriend got the red wine sangria and it was delicious. Smooth and sweet, but not too sweet like fruit punch or some crap. It still had the taste of wine, which rocks, but it was soooo cold and fruity and refreshing.   All in all, it was just alright. Maybe I expected too much. Maybe I thought that I could have the perfect restaurant experience. Ambiance, good food, good service. I guess that when things don't go right it gives me something to talk about, complain about, moan about. Like the right wing, or bad ranch dressing.

Amazing ambience with a killer seat yourself patio and fireplaces (first come first serve. Make friends with someone on be couches and join their party). Great service. Ordered seasonal chef board and ate every crumb. Prosciutto, cherry compote, olives pistachios, focaccia, and a homemade rosemary butter. Worth it for a light dinner or heavy snack. Service delightful.

Pretentious is the one word that comes to mind while dining here.  Pros: 1. Vegetarian options 2. Delicious 3. Even though it is pretentious it is "Scottsdale Pretentious" meaning you can come in with jeans and a nice top and you'll be seated. 4. They allow substitutes and exclusions. I ordered the kale salad (yummy!) but wanted it without bacon and it was no problem. I have been to places with the whole "No. We are making it the way the chef wants" this is not one of those places.   Cons: 1. Its pretentious 2. It's a Fox Restaurant meaning it is a restaurant group. If you want a local, independent restaurant with vision of some struggling kids putting themselves through culinary school and opening up a restaurant and that the profit goes to their children softball and dance classes well this is not the place for you.

Expensive, definitely, but I would say worth it.  The strong points in my opinion are the flatbread pizza, the booze, and the gelato.  I've been there several times and the only entree I remember was the flatbread pizza so that might be a bad thing I guess?  The store attached to the restaurant has some great stuff.  Definitely has that Scottsdale vibe going on, but I enjoyed it anyway.  They serve AWESOME french toast for breakfast.

Very nice atmosphere. The artichoke appetizer was spot on delicious. The rib eye steak was cooked perfectly and the veal ravioli was a nice light meal. Oh the pesto they serve with the bread was my favorite very yummy!

What a lovely restaurant! Tonight was my second Olive & Ivy happy hour and it did not disappoint! I kid you not I've been dreaming about the strawberry bruschetta for a week! Everything is super fresh and quickly served, and the wait staff are lovely.  Thank you to our waitress who got my to-go order of lamb meatballs expedited since my boyfriend was home sick. He enjoyed them a lot and will be joining us next happy hour for the bruschetta and truffle fries!
The food and service were wonderful.  We loved the out-door seating area.  However, we spent more money for the meal that I'd like.
Wow...amazing breakfast, love this place. Had a sausage breakfast sandwich on a homemade English muffin, who knew? Love the decor, the open kitchen, and the staff. Very friendly place!! Great job!!!

I was in Phoenix for a business trip recently and enjoyed a dinner here on Saturday, 5/20/17; in short, it was fabulous!  There were three of us, and we were seated in a half round booth with a view of the terrace/patio.  It's clean, modern and the service was fantastic; our server was knowledgeable and his smile was genuine, and since this was our first time there we all had questions which he answered cheerfully.  We started with the Humus plate, and the Humas is made from scratch (as is their bread and pasta) and it was the best I've ever had.  Never had scratch made pita before this, and what a difference!  One gal had the Mushroom Ravioli which she was thrilled with, my other companion had the Sea Bass which she adored.  I had the Shrimp Scampi Risotto; the shrimp was tender and perfectly cooked, and Risotto was creamy, delicious and melted in my mouth!!  Even their Iced Tea was wonderful!!!  The only negative is that it's a bit loud and hard to hear each other which made us all raise our voices.  If you're anywhere near Scottsdale, you have to go to Olive & Ivy!!!
Nice place to sit outside in good weather and good friends for cocktails and appetizers.

Wow from the moment I walked in the door until I left, I was impressed with their customer service and the food. The bartenders really know their cocktails, I would try the margaritas, they are great!!

Guaranteed satisfaction!!! The gyro is huge, but delicious (I can never finish it), it is on the lunch menu. In the evenings my favorite dish is the sea scallops with polenta and brussel sprouts (some times the brussel sprouts are not available due to seasonality, they will have an optional veggie).  I also love their kale salad and the hummus.   The customer service is always good and consistent.

One of my favorite restaurants in Old Town! The staff here are absolutely amazing, and I have never had a bad experience! Always friendly, kind, and willing to go above and beyond expectations to provide excellent service! Brandon, Calay, Nick, Amber, Zak, John, Meca, Jake, Stefan, Dan, Zane, Easton, Jeff - YOU GUYS ARE INCREDIBLE! Every time I walk in the door, you guys are like family! (Sorry to anyone I missed!) Been coming here for years and of course the food is always ABOVE & BEYOND just like the service!   All of my friends and family that I bring in always feel so welcomed and rave about the incredible service. Thank you all so much! Olive will always be a top pick for me and anyone visiting from out of town!  Food favs: lamb meatballs, veal & spinach ravioli, chicken pesto flatbread, & mediterranean salad with salmon!
Really cool vibe, solid service, and great food.  I really dig the flat bread appetizers, in particular.  Definitely recommend this place!

Nice atmosphere and had potential but service is marginal and hostess was no help.  I was there for a business meeting and was seated at a very dirty outdoor seating area.  They indicated they did not have a two top table available but this was on a Wednesday afternoon and did not look busy.  I would not recommend for business and expect slow and uncaring service.
Olive and Ivy's foods and drinks are amazing, also the restaurants atmosphere is very warm and welcoming.
Great place to chill and dine with their nice patio. The service was great. The food was delicious and appropriately priced.

I've been to Olive & Ivy three times and each experience has been flawless. The food is EXCELLENT, the service is good and the ambience and setting are some of the best in Scottsdale. The outdoor patio overlooking the canal is lovely even on hot summer nights and the inside dining room is classy and full of understated character.   The restaurant does fill up on weekends, so be sure to make a reservation.

Fantastic place.  Lucked out when a table opened up as soon as we arrived (I asked about the wait time for sitting outside, it was 3 hours...).  Bread & Pesto = amazing. Bruschetta = amazing. Natural Chicken = Very good.  Bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin = amazing.  Beautiful restaurant, great location, terrific service.  You are missing out if you don't try this place.

You'll Be Disappointed  Very attractive restaurant belies terrible service and worse food preparation and presentation.  My advice -- stay away, there are lots better places in Scottsdale and environs.  Waiter started out by lauding the size of various salads, entrees, etc.  Touted as very splitable. We split the prawn risotto. A dollop of risotto, covered by 2 prawns each.  That 4th prawn was an extra charge.  Friends split the lasagne.  We all know what a slice of lasagne should look like.  The split portions were served in a cup the size of a small custard cup.  But each had a slice of bread attached to this sumptuous presentation!  The restaurant should have been embarrassed to have brought such a joke to the table.    A third friend sent her seared tuna entree back twice.  It was served ice cold each time. They gave up and just took it off the bill.  The days of free dessert to atone for bad food and service are long gone.  This place is a culinary joke.  Don't waster your time and money.  You'll be disappointed.

Came to Scottsdale for a bachelorette and we had dinner here the first night. The place was packed when we got there! There was a DJ playing and people were fully enjoying themselves with the happy hour/bar area.   We sat at a table in the main seating area, right by the patio (so cute!). We started with a lot of appetizers The appetizers were SO good. The various bruschettas we got, as well as the salads were great. but that duck confit flatbread - OMG TO DIE FOR.    All of the entrees were also excellent although after all of the appetizers, we opted to share entrees given the size of each of the dishes! The salmon was cooked to perfection and SO fresh. The sea bass - definitely great.    My onnnlllyyyyy complaint is the scallops. They were cooked TO PERFECTION, but they had an overbearing sweet sauce that completely ruined the dish.   Overall, I was disappointed given my obsession with scallops but would definitely come back here again given how great everything else was.

I live in Scottsdale and this is easily one of my favorite restaurants! Everything is top notch; the food, cocktails, service, ambiance, etc. I have never had a less than wonderful experience here. I love coming here for brunch or dinner. Some of my favorites are the bruschetta (mozzerella is the best), the scallops, chicken scallopini, and bacon wrapped dates, and for brunch the ivy sausage sandwich and the smoked salmon.

Stopped in as my hotel was close by while I was in town on business.  Started off with a great salad. The amount of fresh ingredients was fantastic and did not disappoint. The dressing was not over powering!  For dinner I had the sea bass off the menu. The presentation was very good but I felt like the fish lacked seasoning. It tastes very plain when eaten on its own. But when comings with the other ingredients on the plate it was better but did failed to deliver a WOW factor for a main course.  After the great salad I was expecting the main course to deliver awesomeness. I was disappointed.  Would I be back..meh! Not sure someone would have to twist my arm!

Let me start out with ambiance: The patio is gorgeous very Mediterranean garden feeling and located at the Waterfront which adds to a peaceful Meal. I gave it a 4 star as I have gluten allergy and couldn't believe that they didn't offer Gluten free bread or pasta like Postino. I ordered fritto misto which was crispy and delicious calamari mixed with zucchini. I added the very ,arugula goat cheese salad half size and was in heaven. My hubby had the lasagna bolognese which he enjoyed very much . For dessert we had chocolate ganache which was too dry for my taste not chocolaty enough  All in All great experience,prices reasonable for lunch. We will be back

Dinner was delicious!  The appetizers, or small plates, as they are referred to on the menu, offered interesting possibilities.  I recommend the fritto misto - a combo of calamari, rock shrimp and zucchini - fantastic!  The beet salad was also quite delicious.  For my entree, I chose the lobster risotto.  It was tasty, though a tad bit salty.  Admittedly, I have some regrets about having such a rich dinner, but that was my bad, not a reflection on the restaurant lol.     I loved the decor and vibe at Olive & Ivy.  It's a trendy Scottsdale restaurant, for sure, but it didn't have that pretentious air about it.  I found the waiter very attentive and helpful with questions about the menu and area.  I guess I'm a real fan of the Fox concept restaurants.  I've enjoyed all the ones I've visited, thus far.
Went there on a Saturday night.  Wasn't expecting loud DJ music.  Food was well prepared.  Service was friendly, informative, and timely.
Great food and service! Beautiful place to go for dinner. Their Atlantic salmon and bacon wrapped dates were especially good!
Great restaurant - atmosphere and staff service.  Really big menu, so many options.  Exceptional outdoor seating as well.

The Fox family of restaurants hits another home run on this concept!   Great food and service as usual from this great restaurant company.   Very hip and cool setting on the Scottsdale waterfront.  Great patio!

I always have high expectations from the Fox Restaurants, and Olive & Ivy did not disappoint.  My mom and I went in for lunch, meeting my mother-in-law, sister-in-law, and her mother.  We came in the wrong door (the entrance for the attached marketplace) and tried to follow the signs to the hostess, but the signs ended before we found her.  An understanding server, who has probably seen this happen a lot, found us and pointed us in the right direction.  I ordered the tuna salad sandwich, and it was delicious.  Crispy warm toast, creamy tuna salad, fresh greens and a side of fries made for a lunch I wish I could replicate at home.  Our server expertly handled the special requests for our table, which pleased those who were avoiding gluten, dairy, or both.  My only complaint about the visit was that the music was a bit loud for the middle of the day.  Other patrons were raising their voices to be heard above it, creating even more noise.  It was nearly impossible to have a conversation with anyone not sitting directly next to, or across from me.  I can't help but notice restrooms in restaurants.  The ladies room here is very nice, with cute little touches that I was taking note of for my own home!  It was clean and well decorated, which is always a good sign, if you ask me.    I'd love to return for brunch or dinner and sample more of the menu.  For lunch, it definitely hit the spot.

Stopped in for lunch after a referral from a local shop owner.  Couldn't be happier with the food and service. Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable, friendly and genuinely seemed to enjoy his job and the restaurant.  Very reasonably priced and the food was delicious.  We will definitely return and look forward to their dinner menu. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone in Scottsdale.

Excellent customer service this morning! The french toast is to die for! It was cooked to perfection with what tasted like REAL maple syrup! Definitely ask for the fruit topping on the side though. It's overwhelmingly sweet and would probably make the french toast a bit soggy.  We also ordered a lox bagel which was delicious! The bagel was toasted just right along with a lovely array of toppings including a whipped cream cheese, salmon, capers, and sliced tomatoes. YUM!  So I had to update this since I just opened my left overs.. I usually prefer to box things up myself at restaurants for this reason: The rest of my french toast was thrown in with the fruit sauce and is now ruined. :( The worst part is that there is no side of maple syrup! I had plenty left when they took my plate.. How am I supposed to eat this???

I am currently finishing up an incredible meal. Literally still in the restaurant, but I can't wait to post this. Not because of the food (though that was delish), but because of our server, Clenard.  We came in, sat for maybe ten minutes, when he came over, profusely apologized for our wait, and informed us he'd be getting us bruschetta on the house. Then, as we proceeded to order, he was incredibly attentive and helpful. My friend got around four Arnold palmers, and he kept them coming!! He was cordial, kind and incredibly professional. Then we also received dessert on the house (for a wait that, honestly, was NOT bad). Everyone was wonderful, and I'm sure clenard is a reflection of the entire staff and restaurant.   Because of this amazing server (and, not to forget, an awesome meal of the lamb meatballs and artichoke heart salad) I am set on being a regular here.  I've never leave reviews but because of the quality of service and meal, I must. Thank you!

I love this place!! it's good for groups or for intimate dates as well. I particularly loveeeeee the patio!! it's right on the waterfront with all the lights and fountains so this is one of my to-go places for romantic dates. their food's very good too and wine list isn't bad either. I haven't had anything there that i was disappointed at. Definitely will be keep going back!

This restaurant has real quality food. The food tastes great and the ambience is nice. The only thing that I wish they could change is to have their waiter come by our table less. The waitress literally came by our table asking:  "Is everything all right?" at least 8 times. Just a tad bit less would be fine.
My daughter and I were staying at the Phoenician and went to Olive and Ivy by their recommendation. Good fresh food. Fun vibe and wonderful service!
I ate at Olive and Ivy on Dec 5th about 1pm. My server was Casey. he was amazing. he was so cheerful and knowledgeable. It was only his 2nd day. I hope he is there when I go next time.

The atmosphere of O & I is so perfect for a double date with some good friends. Very good food and drinks and the service was perfect. Will remind you of a coastal place in California in both atmosphere and food. We all enjoyed ourselves.

Ate dinner here on Friday for the first time. Place was rocking with loud music and good looking people. The service I had was phenomenal..probably one of the best servers Ive ever had. I wish I knew his name but knew we wanted to take out time sharing dishes. He was on point recommending small plates and entrees. The bacon wrapped dates were delicious.

I think I got unlucky.  The atmosphere is great, and the menu sounds amazing from all the reviews.  I went on a Saturday night and got a great booth.  The bread was delicious, as all the reviews state.  I ordered the bacon wrapped dates and the veal ravioli.  The bacon wrapped dates didn't really have much flavor to it.  The texture was great - crispy bacon around a soft, chewy date...but there needs to be some sort of sauce with this to bring out the flavors of the dates.  The veal ravioli was a fail - twice.  The first time they brought it out, the center of the ravioli was cold!  The sauce was warm and quite delicious.  I sent it back, (service was extremely polite), and when it came back, the food was hot, but the pasta shell of the ravioli was undercooked and hard.  I didn't want to send it back a 2nd time, so I just ate it.  The drinks were good - I had a pitcher of white sangria, and some wine.

While visiting Phoenix we happened upon this fabulous restaurant with amazing food and service! Josh P., our incredible server, gave excellent advice on the menu and knew the perfect balance for taking care of us without hovering.  The ambiance was perfect!  The bruschetta was outstanding... The artichoke "small plate" had great flavor.....the focaccia and pesto was absolutely delicious.  Then the main courses...we had three: the chicken scallipini, sea bass, and sweet potato cannelloni.  Every taste was a work of art!   Kuddos to chef Chris and his team of culinary artists...and to Josh P. for making the meal more like an EVENT.  We will be back!!

Had Brunch here yesterday with my friend and it was amazing! The service was impressive! My friend ordered Diet Coke and they brought her out a bottle of Diet Coke and poured it for her at the table as they only have Diet Pepsi on tap. I thought this was above and beyond.  Our server was Easton and he was the best! He was very nice and knowledgeable about the menu. We loved his suggestions. His positive energy was contagious. Not once did I run out of water or my drink. They were on top of it. The atmosphere and decor is really pretty awesome as well. I will definitely return here and recommend it to friends.

Had a reservation for a large party on Sunday afternoon for lunch - had 5 tables which were served by individual waiters. Had to wait a very long time (about 30 min) before the waiter came by to take our drink order, ordered food at the same time.   Didn't see the waiter again until the food came, got a vegetable frittata which was very undersized for what it cost ($11) but did have good flavor and was gluten free as noted on their menu.   Never saw the waiter again until bill time, and I had wanted a second drink. At that point, every single person at the other tables had paid and started leaving before our waiter even came back to give us our bills. Worst part - I was automatically charged an 18% tip for terrible service.   While i understand that waitstaff should be fairly compensated for handling a large party, this waiter was responsible for 2 tables, not a very hefty work investment. That I couldn't elect not to tip when given bad service was an insult on top of it all.
