One of the best patios in Scottsdale.  Great stop on an afternoon of day drinking.   Recommend the side where you seat yourself.  One thing that gets me is that they change their menu every few hours.  It goes from brunch to some sort of mid-afternoon selection then to the whole dinner menu.  I find it annoying but the great service and relaxed vibe keeps me coming back.  Luckily I rarely order food.  When I do, the bruscetta trio is stellar.

Unique and fun place to eat! You walk in to a little café with a refrigerated drink area across from an espresso stand which is next to a large pastry case. You walk further back to a very large and industrial mid century modern with antique accent open room where the restaurant is. The way the kitchen is set up you can sit at a bar and watch them cook or across the room you can sit around their drink bar. We sat in the main dining room and split a lamb gyro which was delicious! I know it was a fluke but I ordered the gyro and literally within two minutes it arrived at our table. The fries were also on point. The outside dining had a lovely view and the overall ambience was very enjoyable and impressive.

Great place to go on a Friday night! Make a reservation though this place gets busy. Loved everything we ate. Great fungi bruschetta, margarita flatbread, and natural chicken with mushrooms and potatoes gnocchi. Yum! Great Chardonnay too

I have been here quite a few times and I love it!!!  I love the cool decor and the little market.  I like the patio area..but mostly I love their red sangria..mmm...you can buy it by the pitcher!!  I have always found everyone working there to treat us with great service...It is a favorite lunch spot of mine!

Olive & Ivy is such a unique restaurant that I frequent for Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and Drinks.  I have a spa business at the Waterfront, so the marketplace is awesome for Coffee, the Egg Sandwich or just grabbing a naked juice togo.  The patio's are great for people-watching.  I also appreciate that the staff (Jillian, Cory, Klaus, etc.) remember me, what I ordered, that I haven't been in 3 weeks!  FOXRC has the midas touch as far as their ideas, locations, concepts.  Your wondering about the 4 stars?   Shoulder to shoulder, vying to get a drink, more men than women, it's the price you have to pay occasionally.

I love eating at olive and ivy! It's great for a refreshing breakfast or date night! I always get the Mediterranean salad, but you really can't go wrong here! If you are in the area, it's a must have!

Amazing Interior and food- CANNOT SAY THAT about SERVICE! HORRIBLE SERVICE almost every time we have gone there- We had to flag people every time to get food, drinks- anything- ONE waitress quit and went home and NO one took over her section- (US)- But food is good- and inside gets better service than the outside-   If you want Amazing ALL- Go to Sanctuary resort- Elements restaurant-  Been to many times- A++++ every time!   4th time there- STILL HORRIBLE......sheesh ...service, service, service!!!! Food is fine- interior great- PLEASE UP-TUNE THE SERVICE!!!!!!!!not enough wait staff and very snooty hostesses... baby...I am wearing good, hot swag...dont look me up and down just cause you got walmart clothes on... :)

Great food, wonderful lighting, gorgeous huge outdoor patio, fantastic brunch, and one of my favorite places to take out-of-towners. Great for groups, and a perfect "you just can't go wrong" restaurant. Literally, date, folks in town, girls brunch, afternoon happy hour with the kids, you name it, this place will do it perfectly!

Great food, great atmosphere. My favorite spot in Phoenix so far!   P.S.   Their focaccia bread and pesto sauce is to DIE for. You can also buy this at the bakery to bring home. Too bad they do not sell their other baked breads...

Can't go wrong here. Great place to eat. Vibrant Bar Scene, Fit for Foodies, Great for Outdoor Dining, Late-Night Find, Neighborhood Gem, Notable Wine List, Romantic, Special Occasion, Scenic View, Great for Lunch, Hot Spot

I had to take some clients out for dinner yesterday and asked my wife for some eatery ideas.  She suggested this place which I never heard of and I must admit I jumped to some negative conclusions.  I expected to find a pretentious, small portioned, over priced cafe next to the "Scottsdale Ditch" (sorry I meant to say Riverfront) where the seen and want to be seen hang.  When we showed up not a lot of big surprises.  There is parking for about a dozen cars on the cul du sac for all of the shops but never fear there is the trusty valet who has already coned most of them off  (is that even legal?) and will happily park your car for six bucks a throw.  Sorry, I digress.  It's just one of my pet peaves.  To be fair the restaurant decour was a pleasant surprise.  Very contemporary; open room, high ceiling with an outside patio next to the ditch... uh river.  The restaurant was about half full which was a departure from most of the others in the area which were empty.  I mean like not one party inside!  We were seated in a back room with floor to ceiling window views looking out on the patio and river.  Now you can't exactly see the river from the restaurant cause they planted bushes on the edge of the patio.  I'm paying a premium for a water front experience... where's my water?  I read about lousy service here but ours was OK.  They kind of figured we were here to spend corporate money on a big party so they were  tip motivated.  The general impression from around the table was that the food was excellent, portions were ok, prices kind of high but what do you expect in that area?  The wine list is extensive and pricey and the sommelier is well schooled in spending your money.  With my thirsty crew I was looking in the two figure column and he was making three figure suggestions.  Ouch!  Bottom line.  I would return to Olive & Ivy but maybe in the fall so I can sit on the patio and get a peek at the beautiful Scottsdale river.

I always have a great meal here! My boyfriend and I love to stroll around Scottsdale and stop here for a quick bite. I typically get a mushroom pasta and bruschetta. If the main seating area is full trying sitting to the far left in the lounge. They serve the same menu but it is first come.

I love everything about this place! The water was very friendly, all the food was of high quality and amazing taste, and the restaurant itself is just awesome! Very trendy and chic. The interior decor is very nicely done and the outdoor terrace is absolutely gorgeous. I highly recommend any of their flatbreads, pastas, or salads. All are great. Same goes to desserts! This place is definitely worth checking out if you're in the Scottsdale area.

I've been at this place many times and is one of my favorite spots to meet friends in Old Town; every time they had offered a good experience regardless of time, number of people or how busy they are.   Restaurant is in a prime location of Old Town, you can get there from both sides of the bridge (parking garages are close) or they have valet if you prefer that. Both the patio and the inside areas have a nice atmosphere. Good Service. Good Food

I'm jealous that we don't have Olive & Ivy in Denver....  My friend and I hadn't planned on going here last week, but after getting lost on our way somewhere else we wound up here.   It was a hopping Saturday night and everyone looked very dressed up. All ages filled the restaurant. We got lucky with 2 lounge chairs outside. There were limited seats and they are 1st come 1st serve and beware of couples making out.  We loved the Braised Short Rib flat bread with Caramelized Onions & Gorgonzola. I wish we knew how big it was going to be as we didn't need the Prosciutto di Parma Bruschetta with Crescenza Cheese, Arugula & Fig Preserves. But we love everything in front of us.  And their Red Raspberry Mojito was fabulous to look at and drink. Enjoy my pictures.

One of my favorites if not favorite restaurant in old town / waterfront area. Always busy so be sure to get a reservation! Some favorites include the chopped salad and the bruschetta boards. Also the complimentary bread w/ pesto is a plus! If you're going in the cooler months / spring try to sit on the patio! The little café at the front is great too for grab and go breakfast items like croissants and coffee.

Favorite place we went to in Scottsdale. Great food, amazing wine list, and I would suggest getting some share plates. Absolutely fell in love with the meatballs and savory pasta dish. Service was great.  Fabulous cocktails. Will come back again!!

In a great location, came here for dinner while visiting Scottsdale for a girls' trip. Without a reservation, we were still seated within 30 minutes which isn't bad for a Friday night or for 5 guests. The inside ambiance is fantastic. Lanterns hung so it looks like they are floating, great mood lighting, open kitchen... Mediterranean feel to the decor and drinks. Great start for our Friday night out.  Mediterranean food always sounds great to my friends and I but O&I's menu seemed more Italian influenced. As others mentioned, the bread and pesto is delicious. The portion sizes are large for my friends and I opted to split entrees. To be honest, I don't even remember the vegetarian option I ate (something wit mushrooms) because all I can remember is how amazing the pumpkin cannelloni is (which our other friends got).  Definitely reservations if you can. With a centralized location, it's easily a great place to start your night off in Scottsdale.

This place is huge and on a weekend definitely requires a reservation. We were lucky enough to walk in and take a table due to cancellation.   The size does not affect the service, our server was very prompt in checking in on us throughout our time there.   I ordered the chicken Scallopini which says it comes with prosciutto but I didn't see nor taste it, I also would have liked to know it was breaded or I wouldn't have ordered it. Nonetheless the chicken was good as well as the spinach. I was also surprised to find there wasn't any grain to go with it however it was filling and good the way it came.   My sister ordered the pesto chicken flatbread, the pesto was good however It could have used more chicken. Just like in pizza there should be one of every topping in each bite.  My other sister ordered Blue Cheese salad which was large and she said quite good.   Overall it was ok, for the price the portions were not up to par. Our service was excellent and the place is cool however from 6:30-8 on a Thursday the music was super loud so it was hard to have a conversation as well.

My boyfriend and I came here last night with some friends that were in town from Minnesota and once again this place didn't let me down!   My favorite part of Olive & Ivy has got to be the stunning patio! Seriously, don't even bother sitting inside. The patio is worth it even in the middle of the AZ summer heat, thats how pretty it is. I always get the Margarita Flat Bread and it is to die for. My boyfriend gets the Veil and Spinach Ravioli and loves it every time as well (I can't vouch for this one though, seeing as Veil is not my thing).  I have only ever had one issue with any food I have tasted here and that was my starter from last night. I chose to start with a cup of their soup of the day - Broccoli Cheddar. I don't know about you, but when I envision Broccoli Cheddar Soup, I envision orange, cheesy soup with a ton of chunks of Broccoli. The consistency of this soup could be compared to water, no chunks of broccoli and was green! I have never seen green broccoli cheddar soup. Honestly think they just pureed broccoli together, added water and a little bit of cheese and called it a day. I would definitely pass on this next time it is available.   Other than that, our guests loved the suggestion and we loved it to. Will be back time and time again!

I came here for happy hour with a friend and enjoyed it! I've heard good stuff about this place and was happy to say that I too was pleased with the food and drinks! We ordered the butternut squash bruschetta & margarita flatbread, which was good.  We sat at the bar and the bartender was attentive when we first arrived, but forgot about us as the night continued. My friend eventually got up to find our bartender, so we could order another drink. The bartenders were friendly though just slow. Overall, it's a super cute restaurant with tasty food and good drink specials for happy hour!

I'll start by saying the restaurant is a really nice space which is why it got two stars instead of one.  After being seated we waited ten minutes before anyone even came over to get a drink order or give us water, and it was a server from another section that felt bad for us.  I'm not exaggerating when I say that literally nothing was good which is why I don't feel the need to go into more detail.  I had much higher hopes given the ratings here, and so I write this in the hopes that possibly even one person will be spared the same experience.
Eggs Benedict:  meh - kinda dry biscuit, potatoes were tasteless and strangely uniformely sized cubes Latte:  good  Nice space and service was good.  Maybe come back, maybe not.

So disappointed, brought out of town guest here on Friday around 4:30.  Had a seat on the patio, waited for about ten minutes for someone to come over and ask if these were our dishes.  Another ten for them to be cleared and the table was never wiped down there was food and sauce and dried beverages on the table  but never cleaned, asked about the happy hour wine "it's not good but that's what you get for the price".  Sangria was terrible.  I understand it is spring break here,however it's no surprise and a restaurant of this caliber should be stepping up their game not saying the wine is bad but that's what you get.  So disappointed and embarrassed that I brought out of town guest to this establishment.

The bacon wrapped dates are so yummy! The pumpkin cannelloni were delicious! Super rich and decadent -- one critique though is that there's so much filling and it's so thick that texturally, a bite was almost like the feeling when your mouth is full of peanut butter. The chicken scallopini had the most delicious sauce! My critique with that though was they take the time to get the panko crusted chicken breast so crunchy but the way it's plated on top of moist sautéed spinach and the sauce on top makes it all soggy and you loose most of the crunch. If it were played differently it could be better. Overall a great dinner experience though!

I could seriously sit all day on their patio and enjoy the surroundings. Great location on the Scottsdale waterfront. Great large outdoor seating selection for big groups as well as smaller, nook-like areas for couples.. Sat outside with husband while his sister was in town. Plenty of misters. Only got the chance to try  cocktails and appetizers here, but everything was fantastic. Food came out quick and they were busy. Can't wait to go back for brunch!

Loved the large industrial feel, open kitchen, seated in a nice tall-backed booth onlooking the kitchen and bar. (Patio closed due to rain) Tried 6 different food items from apps to entrees and everything was really good. Favorites being prosciutto/fig bruschetta and the veal tortelli. The peach whisky drink was delicious too. Really can't wait to try the rest of the menu... Busy for a Tuesday night so you know they're doing something right.
Nice place with the typical Sam Fox feel. Very relaxed feel to the restaurant. The portions are small and expensive. The flavors are great. Not a place to go if you are hungry or on a budget.

No complaints about Olive & Ivy!  Free underground parking.  It looked like they have items to purchase for takeout in addition to the restaurant and bar.  There was a bit of a wait to be seated for Sunday brunch, but they have pagers and we were able to wait at the bar.  Waiting is always better when there are cocktails involved!  When we were seated, we got bread made in house & served with amazing fresh pesto. You must try it.  (see pic:  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wUKzaS1MHg94RGM6z8u9mw?select=_G2ZOQRe-pVGpNNKajnqCw)  White sangria was yummy, but didn't have any fresh fruit & was served in a low ball glass (see pic:  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wUKzaS1MHg94RGM6z8u9mw?select=Zwif3G0eX8d5LHGae_HA9w). Bellini was very good and very strong!  I had a good buzz after 2 drinks.  Eggs Benedict was very good with fresh shaved ham & a little fresh basil in the hollandaise. I would've liked a bit more hollandaise (see pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wUKzaS1MHg94RGM6z8u9mw?select=RybLwKuSPLit5o2PPxy1aw).  My man's Breakfast sandwich was very good. The home fries were perfectly crispy in the outside & soft on the inside. (see pic:  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wUKzaS1MHg94RGM6z8u9mw?select=YveKHBF94smnOuN-utOxOg)  Patio seating with waterfront view is quaint and has a European feeling with the umbrellas, stone fountains & geraniums in the tree planter boxes. All in all... A wonderful brunch experience. I would DEFINITELY come back the next time I'm in Scottsdale.

After the event at Mitchell Gold + Bob Williams last night, a group of us decided to grab some dinner and drinks at Olive. Miraculously, there was one table left outside on the beautiful patio. We were greeted promptly by our waiter, Joey, and our drinks were on their way. Pesto and bread was brought over which went perfectly with my Chianti. Highly, highly recommend the pappardelle. Exquisite. Joey was very attentive and good, positive energy. Water and wine glasses were never left empty. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and will return soon!

We thought it would be nice to sit outdoors on our Anniversary.   We made a reservation in advance to sit outdoors.   We were delayed due to traffic so  I called them to let them know that we would be less than five minutes late.   They gave our table away anyway.  We ended up seated inside so we left.   We ended up on Maggiano's patio where we had an outstanding and plentiful entree and dessert.

This place was great! Awesome atmosphere and great food. Service was spectacular and everyone was happy with their meal. The Mediterranean salad with shrimp was a good way to start the dinner and could be split. I had the natural chicken and it was moist and savory. The broth and mashed potatoes it was served with were to die for. We were out of town guests who considered going back a second night. Yum!

The atmosphere is so amazing.  The back patio looking over the greenbelt is so serene.  I had the salmon it was great.  Kids had the pizza as well as the yogurt parfait. Everyone was happy it is such a pleasant place.

We stopped in for lunch and I have to say...seriously impressed!  We had to wait 15 minutes for a table but I'm glad the wait didn't deter us from eating here. We just took a short stroll along the water area and by the time we came back, our table was ready.   I LOVED the ambiance of this restaurant.  Very rustic decor, open kitchen, large dining and bar area and near the entrance; a section with bench seating with low coffee tables where patrons seemed to be enjoying cocktails and appetizers. I later discovered this was part of the bar. Very chic.  Even with high ceilings and openness of this restaurant, it was still very welcoming.  We were seated near the entrance to the outdoor patio so while we didn't sit outdoors, we felt like we were dining el fresco. This time of the year in Scottsdale is wonderful so we could not be any happier with where we were seated.   I ordered a Bloody Mary extra spicy and a margherita pizza (err flatbread) for lunch. The cocktail was made PERFECTLY and had a nice little kick to it...just how I like it.  The margherita pizza was absolutely delicious as well. The crust was thin, light and had great flavor and the toppings just made it that much more irresistible.  I didn't think I would be able to finish the entire pizza but I somehow did. I just could not stop myself, it was that tasty.  After complimenting our waitress (which I forgot her name (sorry!) on how great the service and food was, we discovered this is owned by the same company that manages True Food Kitchen, one of our favorite restaurants. We would come back here in a heartbeat....but since this is in Scottsdale and not in San Diego, it will be tough to get back here when we're craving you. So, can you please open an Olive & Ivy out here?

This place has become our "go to" place after hiking Camelback every weekend for the past 4 (soon to be 5) weekends! The pastries are very good. This last time we had the egg, bacon, Avocado & cheese breakfast sandwich on a toasted roll - which was extremely tasty. The bread was really good - nice and soft - perfect for a sandwich with these ingredients. The staff is always friendly, patient and helpful.

I come here almost every day for lunch and I have been satisfied with the service and the food every time. If you are new to the restaurant, it have to try the chopped salad WITH GRILLED CHICKEN. I never thought I would say I crave a salad but this one is delicious.

I was disappointed that Cinnabon at Sky Harbor had closed, but Olive & Ivy has great cinnamon rolls. Mine was just the right size, gooey (after a brief warm-ip in their pizza oven), nicely iced, and cheap! $2.75 seems like a price from the last century. My big decaf was only $1.75.   What a great find!

I don't understand all the five star reviews. We had an awful dinner. We ordered two appetizers, the hummus and 3 bruschetta (prosciutto, mushroom, and avocado.) All were lacking in flavor. The bread was sliced too thick, it was soft inside, and wasn't brushed with oil. Not true bruschetta, more like dip on top of a thick slice of French bread. The hummus was inedible. So much cumin that that is all you could taste. Totally overpowering. Were they trying to give it an Indian influence? My sister's beet salad was fine, but a salad you could find on any menu. My Caesar salad and my sister's flatbread were flavorless. The worst was the "gelato." How they call that gelato is beyond me. Nowhere close to what gelato really tastes like. It was closer to ice milk.  I am not sure why this place is so popular. Perhaps because of the social scene or the ability to sit outside. If you are interested in good food, skip it.

I was searching for a place to have some birthday drinks before going out into old town. My friend wanted some wine, and we compromised on sangria. I have been wanting to try out this place based on the menu alone, but I was pleasantly surprised when I stepped in. There's a market side and then a restaurant side. The restaurant size itself is large and there's a great big patio too! The ambiance, although a little on the dimmer side, remained cute and cozy.   Our waitress was super nice and attentive. She offered some great suggestions. We ended up getting the cilantro jalapeno hummus to start (comes with cucumbers, celery, AND carrot sticks) to snack on while we drank our white sangria that we ordered by the pitcher. We ended it with a lemon pudding cake (complimentary). It's good if you like lemon! The top was fluffy and the bottom was a little soggier...but not in a bad way? Soggy is the wrong word probably but I can't think of another way to describe it!! Haha. It comes with a burnt honey ice cream and blackberries. Yum! :)  It was a great spot.
Amazing! Our server was wonderful, knowledgable, and fun! The food was amazing. There were so many more items that I cannot wait to try. I had the surf and turf. The steak was cooked perfectly.

Followed the Yelp reviews to this destination. Ate on the Market side and the food and portions were perfect. My only regret is that we didn't find this place sooner! Would love to come back for lunch.

We came in on a busy Friday night and lucked out with two seats at the bar.   We ordered the white sangria and bacon wrapped dates as happy hour was about to end. The dates were SO good. White sangria was kind of odd... But not bad.  We split a Caesar salad and the bone in rib eye. They were very accommodating about splitting the food and everything was split prior to us receiving it.   The rib eye was cooked a smidge under medium but it was so good, it didn't even matter. The potatoes were very crunchy and yummy too!  Our bartender was a very friendly man as well, and he made the experience even better!  My boyfriend is not much of a foodie, but he absolutely loved this place. So that's saying a lot!

As a general rule I try to avoid Olive & Ivy on weekend nights, not that the ambiance isn't great or there is a food or service problem it's just BUSY! If you don't have reservations popping in for a cocktail during peak times in the bar can be challenging, on the one hand you get to get a good look at "The Real Housewives" of Scottsdale in their natural habitat and many variations there of.  So I went with two friends and I was so happy we got a small comfortable cocktail table next to the bar which can be like hitting the lottery on a busy night. Service is always good I feel even on a busy night my water was always replaced. Cocktails always good they can take a while but you will understand looking at the packed bar so you have to give them a break. In previous visits I usually get the Chefs seasonal board, Italian meats and fresh cheeses and roasted vegetables this visit we got the Hummus it was fine I mean Hummus is hummus. Two flat breads the braised short rib with Gorgonzola and arugula, I'm the only human I think that does not like short rib, I've had it before in other establishments but it's not my go to. My choice was the pesto chicken with pine nuts and I asked if we could leave the caramelized onions off half of it since I was in a picky mood and do not like onions, they were so nice about it and despite the busy kitchen it came out perfect. Service + food + ambiance +

While the food was good, it was really the service that was outstanding!!! Our server Michael deserves 5 stars. Michael was so accommodating throughout, always arriving to our table with a smile and some jokes. He really took time with us, answering questions when deciding what to order. And just overall, Michael had such a pleasant demeanor. Thank you, Michael! I ordered the Hash, I believe, which is 2 easy-over eggs atop potatoes and sautéed green peppers, topped with a gravy. Also had the delicious home-made cinnamon roll! The end.

A nice classy place in Scottsdale. Good for a romantic outing.  Service is good and the food is upscale - so is the pricing.  We had appetizers there along with drinks. Food was great but mixed drinks left a lot to be desired.  Rightfully so, they have a very limited cocktail menu. More focus on wine and other liquor - hence the upscale menu. Great location and ambiance

Yum yum yum! I love coming here before shopping at fashion square. I always get the kale salad, it is basically the best salad ever. The bread and pesto is so good I could honestly just go for a glass of wine and bread and be happy. The sea bass though, how did you guys come up with it?!? Sooooo amazing! Mine was cooked perfectly, and the sauce was so good I almost licked the plate (okay, I did lick the plate) when it's nice outside I like to sit outside, any other time, the bar is the place to be.

Out of towners - call ahead even on weekdays! We showed up tonight (monday) and the only space for us was at the chef's table, overlooking the kitchen. That was actually very pleasant to watch the food prep, but it was surprising that all the tables were booked for the next 1.5 hours when the space is large and the patio is huge! Also, it meant having to sit on high stools with very difficult to reach hooks underneath the counter for our purses.  Decor is gorgeous - high ceilings, Edison lightbulbs hanging from the ceiling, candles, huge glass walls looking onto the patio & canal... Very romantic and chill.  Our server was very friendly and pleasant. We had asparagus bruschetta, bacon wrapped dates, the sweet potato cannelloni, and tried both sangrias. All tasty. Had toasted coconut and white chocolate raspberry gelato for dessert. Food was good quality, focaccia & pesto were great for setting the Mediterranean/California vibe.  The general manager even came to check on us and we enjoyed chatting with her. Lots of friendly people in a beautiful relaxing place with tasty food. Exactly what we were looking for (minus the high stools) on our vacation!

Very cute restaurant in Scottsdale! My friend was visiting from LA and we decided to come here which was the perfect choice. We sat outside across the water on the cute couch/chairs.   We were there for happy hour and most things on their menu were 1/2 off. We started with three types of bruschetta: butternut squash w/goat cheese, prosciutto w/fig and mozzarella w/tomato jam. The bread was super fluffy and the  flavors were very good. I also ordered a glass of white wine which paired well  with my appetizers.   For my main dish I ordered the chicken pesto flatbread which was really good. The pesto was just right and I even had enough to take 1/2 of it to go. Overall, great restaurant and atmosphere. I will definitely be returning to try some of their dinner dishes!

Great service. We went for a belated birthday and they treated us very nicely and with a lot of attention. This place is easy to find and pretty central. We got the 33oz bone in ribeye, mac and cheese, and also brussels sprouts. We ordered it medium rare and it came out pretty rare in general (which was fine with us). The ambiance is nice and since it's a large open kitchen with patio and bar space...you have a lot of options in terms of seating.

Came here for brunch on a Saturday afternoon.  Ordered the breakfast burrito and a side of fruit.  We sat out on the patio.  It was a beautiful day and the farmer's market was going on so there were a lot of people walking around.  The food and service at Olive & Ivy was great.  My breakfast burrito (with egg whites) was delicious.  I also liked the potatoes that it came with and the fruit that I ordered was very fresh.  The service was on point too.  Overall a good experience and I would definitely come back.

Wonderful patio with a great view, misters and plentiful shade for the summer. Interesting cocktails and a nice variety of wine both by the glass or bottle.  Diverse menu with everything from lighter fare to hearty steaks and seafood.

It was a lunch on a random Wednesday, but the restaurant seemed vast and a little empty when we arrived.  We did see two of their private rooms which seemed to be a great choice for group dining.  I thought the food was average, our waiter was cute and friendly but a little slow for lunch, and the prices a little high.  I may need to revisit but there are so many places to go.  Luckily, my lunch friend makes all places fun!

I have visited this restaurant 4-5 times now with my family, girlfriends and other groups. Every time, we had a great time. Great atmosphere, delicious food, I have tried many items from their menu and all were delicious. See information below: Bruschetta appetizers- Asparagus, Prosciutto, Manchego- all were delicious Bacon Wrapped Dates- little too sweet for my taste, but for a person who loves sweets, this would be perfect Margherita flatbread- it was okay, nothing to brag about Wild Mushroom Pappardelle Pasta- for all mushroom lovers, it had beautiful earthy flavor, loved every bite of it, and leftovers are delicious too!! Sea Scallops*- a light dinner dish, scallops were perfectly done, not overcooked.  Chicken Scallopini- this was amazing, not too strong on the spices but chicken was nice and tender Natural Chicken- another beautiful chicken dish, perfectly done.  Flavors of all dishes are great and different. Their customer service is always amazing and they are very attentive to your needs. Their cocktails are more on the sweeter side so i preferred to stick with either beer or wine and they have great selection as well.  The atmosphere inside the restaurant can be little too loud if you are planning to talk a lot more with your girlfriend, their outdoor seating area would be a better choice and with the perfect weather and temperature, it is pretty nice.  Taking one star away, as they are little pricey with their menu but the quantity of main dishes is more on the smaller side.But that is definitely not going to stop me from going there again or recommending this wonderful restaurant to my friends and family members.

We had a great dinner at this restaurant, fair prices, great flatbreads, beautiful restaurant.   Food tasted very fresh and and "waterfront" locale was refreshing after a few hot days in Phoneix. Very nice outdoor bar area as well.  Would definitely go back.

UPDATE:  Management reached out to us to "correct" and "investigate" the poor service we received our first time in.  We decided to give Olive & Ivy another chance and tried out their Brunch today without telling them.  The hostess station greeted us and arranged to seat us without any delay.  Good so far.   Tony, our waiter, arrived thereafter and introduced himself asking if we had been here before, sharing the soup of the day and answering our menu questions.  Again, good so far, but it only got better.  Tony took our orders and returned with fresh bread and pesto sauce on the side.  We ordered.  My Eggs Benedict were not only superb but the Coffee Mocha was excellent!!  My wife enjoyed her eggs, bacon, and potatoes as well.  Tony continued to check on us.  Here's what I learned as I looked around.  The service and food should not only be "good", but it looked as if "excellent" was the expectation, the bar.  People were happy, the different food looked great - and the wait staff was very attentive.  We have become fans.  Thank you to Tony and the management.

Very Hipster with prices to match.Tried scallops for the first time- they were okay.  Tried 4 of the appetizers, bacon wrapped dates were decent, felt they could have been warmer.  There were a caucophany of flavors that were trying just a little too hard.  I did try the chicken scallopini, which is probably what I would order if i came back.

Breakfast / Brunch here is one of the best! Lovely to sit outside and enjoy the AZ weather with tableside mimosas. The coffee is my favorite in town, love the granola in the parfait, the breakfast sandwiches and potatoes are delicious and the kids love all of the fresh baked treats. Bring the family, the dogs, great to walk around the waterfront too.   Come ready to relax or after a run/walk down the canal. Just love this place!

I've been to Olive and Ivy a few times now and I've enjoyed the food, service and ambiance each time. I'm a big fan of the beef filet. This place has a great patio and the inside decor is modern and fun.

On the positive side, the food was imaginative, well executed and presented. However on the other side of the coin, the waitstaff is poorly trained and aggressive in telling you what you want, even after you order it your way. For example, my medium rare tuna arrived medium well because I wouldn't order it rare. There appeared to be little service training: when ordering wines by the glass, the waiter said that is what we call it even if it is wrong, when he missed one of the ladies in our party during the drink order, there was no apology just a flip comment from the waiter that clearly offended her. The staff clearly has the priority and walked thru parties while they were being seated rather than taking the 2 extra steps to walk around. It is a shame, since this a nice place with good food at a reasonable price and everyone in our party enjoyed their food but the waiter ruined it for some of us and there are so many good alternatives close by.

Trendy and located right on the Scottsdale "waterfront", its a typical fox-con restaurant.  Our service was great. We were seated promptly at our reservation time. Our waiter was helpful with menu recommendations and a little too attentive to our drink.  we had a starter consisting of a pile of fried food.  All of it was pretty good, but nothing special.  I had a chicken dish. If was fried but the breading was a little soggy. My lady-friends sea bass suffered the same problems as the skins were not crispy in the slightest.  Overall, this is probably more of a place to be seen than a place to actually enjoy the food.
Get the sweet potato cannelloni! Its delicious. If you are having brunch try the yogurt with granola and fruit.

Love this place, as long as you make an advanced rez. Awesome patio. Ambiance is perfect. DJ was on point   The homemade pesto was delicious and the kale salad so, so good! Will definitely dine here again in Scottsdale!

LOVE LOVE LOVE!  Went here on a suggestion by a local socialite and boy were we oh so pleased! This place is soo cute at night on the inside with all the hanging lights rustic feel and the deejay, which played amazing music. We sat outside under the cute trees with strung lights. I was so in love with the look of this place. You can come with friends or on a date and it works! And service was excellent!  The food was very creative and if I was local I would be here every week to try all the food and hang out on patio with a glass of wine! Wish I had this place in Miami...it would be a success here! We had the watermelon avocado goat cheese salad, fungi flat bread, bacon wrapped dates, arugula artichoke salad, shrimp with corn risotto, and the scallops...all hands down incredible! Love the menu!   My only question is this place is in water front...where the hell is the water anyway??

So... I fully intended to take photos of my food here, but I blame hunger, sun, great conversation, and delicious food for preventing me from following through! The patio is so amazing - right next to the canal, and covered in greenery, cute tables and chairs, and good shade coverage for that spicy Arizona sun! Our server was super sweet, friendly, and had some great humour - respecting the fact that we were deep in conversation, but still getting our order in reasonable time, and connecting with us on a human level too. The restaurant was quite busy, but I felt that he was still very attentive, and did a great job.  We ordered bread and pesto, and the hummus plate with veggies to start. Holy moly, guys. Holy. Moly. I got really into making pesto this summer, with bunches of fresh Italian basil being so cheap, and this was just as good, if not better than homemade (always a huge compliment!!) I also love making my own hummus and this was at least 5 times better than mine! We got a huge heap of hummus with yummy, warm pita, a great variety of veggies - cucumber, celery, snap peas etc. - all covered with semi-pickled cucumber, red onion, and feta. YUM!! You guys... go get some, stat!   For my main I got the Mediterranean Chicken Salad (as did EVERYONE else at the table, which says a lot!) and it was really good. If you pushed me I'd have had two more plates of hummus rather than the salad, but I would almost sell my first born for more of that hummus... almost. The salad was fresh, and I liked the mix of ingredients - they felt well balanced, and well dressed, but the chicken was a bit dry.   I had a great time at Olive & Ivy - it's a great place for a relatively healthy working lunch, and I'm sure I'll be back.

Food was good. Nice atmosphere. Our server seemed to be overwhelmed with tables when I went with a friend for lunch. I would go back as the food was good. Not exceptional but good and worth going back too.

Great breakfast and great service. If you are looking for food in terminal A get to Olive & Ivy. Breakfast sandwich with avacado, egg, bacon and cheese is awesome. I had no cheese though. People are really friendly here too.
Good food, great atmosphere and friendly staff made this a great choice. Bruschetta was a hit as were the bacon wrapped dates. Will definitely be back next time I'm in town!
Cranberry margarita is delicious. Butternut squash tortelli is fabulous! Ambiance is nice, comfortable and lively, but a touch loud. Portions are perfectly sized. Very satisfying!

Loved Olive & Ivy. Went here for brunch with the grandparents & kids and it was a cute setting right on the waterfront canal in Old Town Scottsdale. Food was top notch classy... also, DESSERT...my daughter had a peanut butter chocolate brownie that we passed around the table to share and it was by far the most complimented.

I went on a Friday night to grab a late night meal. The place is beautiful and the atmosphere is lounge-like. I saw a few families there and I thought that was a little weird since it was pretty late. So far...it's ok. Then we get to the bad part: our waiter. I don't remember his name nor will I put him on blast here. He was horrible! First he took forever to greet us. He was very apologetic for not being attentive. Then he takes our drink order and runs around cover his section. We get our drinks maybe 20 minutes later. He apologizes again. Then he grabs our menus and walks away. That's the thing...he was always around but was so fast we couldn't ask for anything. We tried for about 10 minutes to get anyone's attention so we could order. He come back and asked if we ordered. Really?!? You took our menus... So now we get to the insulting part. I asked him if the scallops were enough to split if we order an appetizer and salad. Simple question, right? Here's his answer: oh honey, don't you know...the better the restaurant the smaller the portion. Really?!? A simple yes or no could have been sufficient. Oh and he food....it wasn't great. It was just very ok. We ordered the bacon wrapped dates. Those were pretty good. Then we had he kale salad. It was so bitter I couldn't eat it. The scallop were good. Not bad but not excellent either. I would recommend this place for drinks and small bites in the patio area but this isn't a place I would come to for great food.
We had an amazing breakfast here. Staff is friendly. No wait time and the food came out pretty quick. We will be back!

Updating my review because I decided to give this place another chance, based on all the positive reviews and because I was starving. This time I thoroughly enjoyed by slice of Mediterranean pizza and glass of Chardonnay, and the service was friendly and courteous. For airport food, definitely 4 stars.

We came to Olive & Ivy for dinner on last Saturday while we were on vacation in paradise valley. It had a good atmosphere and service was great. I ordered the Natural Chicken and my husband ordered the Ribeye and both were delicious.

One of my favorite places in Scottsdale!  Amazing ambience!  Superb service!  The food was delish! Breathtaking decor with huge airwalls that are open to a beautiful patio.  The pesto with bread is ridiculous good!  They also have a cute little cafe side with smoothies and breakfast stuff!

LOVE this restaurant! Gorgeous ambiance and decor, great music, wonderful service, and delicious food! Just celebrated my end of post doc party there last night and had the best party of my life there thanks to the amazing staff!   We had folks with gluten, meat, and egg allergies and the staff took great care to prepare our order to specification even offering to substitute items on the menu. Especially loved the fresh mozzarella bruschetta and Mediterranean salad. Reasonable prices on these items.   They have a range of seating options including beautifully decorated outdoor patio with misters, fire pit, and plush seats for a chill atmosphere, indoor booths and tables (had a live DJ there too last night) with soft lighting indoors, and a gorgeous private room for events that (can seat up to 12) for a high class flair.   Usually the require a minimum charge to use their private room but yesterday out of kindness they offered me the room and waived this since the room was available and they didn't want it to go to waste. Made for a perfect evening with my friends and family. They turned the music down for us in the room so we could mingle and make our champagne toast and even let us bring in our own cake and provided us plates and silverware. Perfect amount of checking on us. Attentive waiter while giving us enough privacy.   Only feedback is to expand options for vegans and vegetarians at least by having more items available for entree substitutions. Other than that, perfect place for any occasion!! :-)

We have been new residents of Old Town Scottsdale almost a year, and we have had several visitors since coming to this lively and lovely community. We have taken ALL of them to Olive & Ivy.   Their food is first rate, the mood can be restful and peaceful on their beautiful shaded patio overlooking the water, and it can be energizing and electric inside.   Of our several dining outings there so far, all have been highly satisfying.

We love this place, and we wish there was a location in Chandler where we live.  Make sure you check Costco for Fox Concepts Restaurant gift cards before you go.  You can get $100 gift card for $80! My wife and I love the flat bread pizzas here, and their homemade gelato is outstanding! I would highly recommend this place.

Excellent happy hour! We sat at the bar and enjoyed sangria along with a very satisfying assortment of bruschettas and an order of bacon-wrapped dates.   Only downside was that happy hour is not available in all parts of the restaurant.

Nick is an awesome bartender! He's so much fun and knows what I want before I know what I want! I highly recommend the Mediterranean Salad ( Nicks suggestion!) I got it with salmon! I will definitely be one of his regulars! Also, the pesto is phenomenal!
Love their food and funky outdoor patio. I crave their red sangria and I highly recommend the bacon wrapped dates. Sounds strange but everyone who I've had try them is always pleasantly surprised.
I stopped here for lunch with a friend while I was visiting from Cali, and I had a wonderful experience. Service is excellent and the food was phenomenal!

Went here for a birthday dinner with some girlfriends. This restaurant is in a great location in old town scottsdale. Food was ok and the atmosphere was pretty good. Huge place with modern decor. Their patio area overlook the canal.

Olive & Ivy is a perfect Italian & Mediterranean style restaurant. They have a mix of pasta dishes, flatbread options as well as seafood dishes.   For an appetizer, we ordered the vine ripe tomato bruschetta. It's really only good for 1 serving, so I suggest if you're sharing order 3 for $11.  We also ordered the fritto misto which is a mix of fried zucchini, rock shrimp and calamari.  I felt it was a little salty for my taste but still a good appetizer.   My friend was craving beets, so she ordered the beet salad. For some reason, I thought beets were dark reddish colored but these beets were yellow/orangeish.   My main dish was the chicken scallopini which consisted for 2 large chicken breasts with prosciutto and mozzarella in the middle. You can definitely share this dish because it was big.  My friend ordered the sweet potato cannelloni which basically to me was like a stuffed ravioli. I love sweet potatoes so this dish was really yummy. I will order this one next time.   The restaurant has a bar (the white sangria was yummy) and the space is very open/large.  Price wise: Entrees range from $15 to $30 depending on what you order. I think fish options and seafood dishes were pretty expensive for me personally.   Overall, great dining experience.

Wonderful place! Great atmosphere and decor. Adorable outside seating. Fabulous private room! We went here for brunch for a bachelorette party and had amazing service. All the food was delicious and of great, fresh, quality. Highly recommended!

My husband took me to Olive & Ivy for my birthday last year and it was perfect! Their pesto is made in house and has the best flavor! I could go for a jar of that right now actually... My husband ordered the scallops, which I believe were a seasonal special, and they were the best scallops we've ever had. We also ordered a charcuterie style appetizer which was delicious. Wine was flowing and service was great! Can't wait to stop back here! (also - this is the cutest restaurant - definitely try to sit on the patio)

Olive and Ivy is great! We were recently in Scottsdale, AZ for my sister's bachelorette. We decided to hit up Olive & Ivy for dinner during one of the nights that we were in town. Interestingly enough, our group was one of four bachelorette parties there that night! We were originally seated at a table, but, after talking with our waiter, we were able to move our five person group to a much more roomy, comfortable booth. The restaurant has great ambience - it felt very cozy and had a fun atmosphere. We tried the following: various bruschetta, the kale salad, and a bunch of different entrees. Everything was delicious! Somehow we were able to save enough room for dessert - we all tried the gelato!

Nice atmosphere and a good place to pass the time while waiting for a flight. Unfortunately, the breakfast isn't very good. I ordered the traditional breakfast with scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon and English muffin. Portions were generous. I watched the woman who took my order put it together, and items were premade and were lukewarm. The bacon was a huge pile of extremely soggy and sad precooked bacon from a pot. Eggs were old and hard. I had asked for cheese with the eggs, and even though it's on the menu the women didn't understand me and offered me a tub a cream cheese instead. The English muffin was from a pile under the toaster and wasn't toasted. The potatoes were the frozen seasoned kind and were probably the best thing on the plate. Since most of this ended up being inedible I went back for a cinnamon roll that was dry and burnt on the bottom. I would recommend eating elsewhere for breakfast.

Every time I dine at Olive & Ivy, the service never fails to exceed expectations. Starting from the lovely ladies at the host stand to my favorite spot on the patio lounge couches.  I personally love brunch. They always offer a wide variety of delicious pastries and tasty cocktails. My server recommended the Peach Bellini, which was a wonderful addition with my chocolate croissant. Great hospitality and yummy food, definitely recommend bringing friends and family!

Olive and Ivy is a great place for a tasty meal. The staff was wonderful. Our waiter had recommended the grapefruit mojito. Most of their sangrias are puree based so don't expect any fruit pulp.  I had the homestyle cheddar biscuit off of their breakfast menu. It was very yummy. Scrambled eggs on top of a cheddar biscuit on the bottom.  The Iced Chai Tea Latte was prime. The only thing that took me by surprise was how heavy the whip cream was on the top of the latte.   Overall, two thumbs up.

came here for something already made since i had a transfer and just came from a long flight. they had pizza ready to go. female cashier charged me and gave 2 other people their orders and walked off to do seemingly nothing at all. there was no one around and when she finally came back, my pizza was cold and i couldn't wait any longer since my flight was already boarding. they need to train their employees better and be aware that people have flights to catch.
It is always good here. A wonderful spot on the canal in Scottsdale.
This is a gorgeous (albeit large) restaurant with many favorites on the menu. I have dined here twice and both times the food and service were just average. Left me wanting.

I was looking through Yelp and read the reviews and thought why not try something different. A couple days ago a friend and I decided to try it out for brunch and it was a beautiful place to just sit and have a conversation with great food. Our server ( I wish I remembered his name ) brought us a pesto and bread for an appetizer it was amazing but be careful you can easily get full from the bread. I order the sweet potato cannelloni - OH MY LANTA! It was so good! I love sweet potato AND I have a big sweet tooth so this was right up my alley. It had 5-6 sweet potato stuffed pasta with spinach, mushroom and toasted almonds to top off. I Highly recommend this if you like sweet food! And also my friend got the kale salad which consist of bacon, blue cheese, apples and candied pecans - I had a chance to try it and that was definitely delicious as well! Overall do yourself a favor and try it out! You won't be disappointed!

The service was great and the ambiance is awesome. Would try again for that alone.  But the pesto that comes with the focaccia was salty, and the trio of bruschettas we chose (asparagus, vine ripe tomato, funghi) were all unbearably sweet. Cheese tortelli has a twinge of sugar as well. I dont understand why everything was sweet :/ I dont like my savory food to be sweet too, so I was a little disappointed.  The strawberry cheesecake gelato on the other hand, which I WANTED to be sweet, was to die for. yum.

Went here for dinner last night and enjoyed my experience.  I thought it was pretty busy for a Thursday night, but the service was excellent and my waiter took the time to explain the menu in detail to me.  Good selection of menu options and I ended-up ordering the Chicken Scallopini, which was excellent.  It was cooked perfectly and was served with mushrooms and over a bed of spinach with a Madeira sauce.  Didn't have any room for dessert, but will have to go back when I'm in Scottsdale.
Very good!  Did find a small piece of chicken and beacon in my vegan salad (cross contamination, accident).
Had breakfast here yesterday. The service was fantastic (our server's name was Landis) and the food was great will definitely return.

Great ambiance, fantastic food, great drinks! Just a great place to people watch and listen to a great DJ. I went on a Saturday night with my boyfriend without a reservation and we were seated in 20 minutes. I love the decor...very polished.

I like Olive & Ivy's food, but I love their Mojitos. I could completely forgo the food and solely sip on that delicious drink. However, my gripe is that I don't really think it's worth $10. That is a little steep for that particular drink in my opinion, as they don't make it too strong and it's not muddled to perfection a la Trader Vic's style.  Their food is good to really good, and I do think that most of the menu is over priced. That's probably because you are paying for the "concept" not the food. As per usual, Olive & Ivy attracts a fake crowd - just like most of the Sam Fox spots. On the other side though, this restaurant does provide me with some excellent people watching and that's always fun every once in a while.   Some other good aspects of Olive & Ivy are the: outdoor patio (great place to sip my Mojito and people watch), sea bass or seared ahi tuna dishes (I'll usual order one or the other) and the service (their wait staff is on top of their tables).  Olive & Ivy doesn't get me too excited so it's a solid 3 stars... because if someone asked me to suggest a restaurant in the Waterfront area, it probably wouldn't be my first recommendation.
I love the atmosphere and food!  Great service and relaxing environment to go on the weekend.  I would recommend to anyone!

I loved, loved the food here.  We went there for brunch and i had a croissant and the Braised Short Rib. Both were so ,so , so good!!  The service was great , the bread and pesto delish.   We decided to stay outside and The only thing i did not like was all the bird poop falling on our table/ on our clothes and on our plates. Those trees outside are beautiful so maybe just install something to catch all  poop drops. :D.

This location is soooo hard to find. My stupid google map took me somewhere else. I called the restaurant and the host was very thorough and stayed on the phone with me and directed me til I see the restaurant. The ambience is really nice. Food was good. Service is great.

The chicken salad pressed panini, was delicious! Enough for 2 people to share while waiting for your flight to board. They have 2 big screen TVs with sports on and plenty of seating space. A long bar in the middle for large groups and booths. The booths have power outlets in the bottom for you to charge your electronics while you dine. Service is fast and friendly.

My wife and I came here recently for a romantic date night dinner. The service was impeccable, and the food was superb. Try the toasted bruchettas (roasted brussel sprouts and butternut squash); you won't be disappointed. The lamb meatballs were good, but not great. My natural chicken dish was quite good and quite filling. The atmosphere is fun, friendly, and I would recommend this place if you're in the area.

I recently visited Olive and Ivy for business last week, and after 3 visits, I am convinced that Fox Restaurants has some of the best establishments in the valley.  Olive and Ivy is the Fox Restaurant of choice for consistently good food, great drinks, and most of all, outstanding service.  I spend a lot of time in various restaurants across the valley and am always amazed at how bad service can be at some of the more popular valley restaurants.  Not Olive and Ivy.  From the first phone call for reservations, to the greeting upon walking in the door to the smiles and warm reception you receive from every server you cross, this restaurant knows how to make you feel special.  Many of the reviews here will focus on the food and I could spend hours talking about my experiences but I will sum it up in a couple of my favorites.   I hate dates and prunes, but the bacon wrapped dates are crazy good! The shrimp and risotto main course is one of the best dishes I have tasted since arriving in Phoenix 3 years ago.  And hands down, their short rib entree is best in the valley.  The only catch is the cost.  Olive and Ivy is not cheap and definitely not for brothers looking to execute the cheap date.  With wine, apps, and main course, you will easy break the century mark, and if you are really being generous, $200 is obtainable.  But, it's worth every dollar and who knows, you may even get breakfast out of the deal!
Sat at the bar for happy hour- the bartender was super attentive. Sangria was delicious and food was great!!!

We always try to find a new place to eat when we come here, especially for breakfast - most important meal!!  We walked in and this place is a place after my own heart. My partner and I shared The Classic Egg Sandwich; avocado, bacon, white American cheese, mayo, all on a toasted brioche bun, with some breakfast potatoes on the side.  So. Damn. Good.   I'm not sure I would be able to eat it all on my own, but I'd sure try!!  Next time I come I want to try the Caramelized Brussels Sprouts Flatbread (glazed sweet potato, chèvre, smoked pistachios) *drool*

We ordered caramelized Brussels sprouts flatbread  And Bacon wrapped dates and they both were amazing!! I had the sweet potato cannelloni and it was to die for!!! So many amazing flavors!! This restaurant is a must!!! Loved everything!!
My girlfriend and I loved this restaurant. Everything from the food, drinks, service, and decor were great. Next time we are in town we will for sure be back!
Super service by Josh and delicious food! The outdoor patio space is huge and comfortable; feels like home but without having the clean up after party. Spot on for champagne and light bites.

Excellent.  My only complaint is that they never seem to have the bacon wrapped dates.  I have been dying to try these, and I've been through PHX 3 times this year, but have not been able to get them once.  Apparently they don't have them for lunch, and they sell out really quickly for dinner.  For the food I actually got, the bacon wrapped pork loin was heavenly.  It sits on a bed of squash that absorb the bacon/pork flavor.  I almost licked the plate.  The watermelon salad was also good.  The dressing is sweet, but has a slight kick of savory pepper.  I had it for lunch once, but I think I might order for desert next time I go.  Speaking of desert, the huckleberry cheesecake was momentous.  It's served in mini-mason jars, which some of my colleges got a kick out of.  The service has been outstanding every time I've been there.  Both waiters I've had demonstrated extensive knowledge of the wine list and menu and made great recommendations.  The scenery isn't too bad either.
I haven't been here for a few years, but I have had a few great experiences at this restaurant.
Place is very good.  Good wine list, good unique food.  Not gigantic portions, which I view as a good thing...

We had a great experience at Olive & Ivy. Our server was very attentive and friendly, and the food came out quickly and was superb. I want to try to recreate their beet salad at home, but doubt it will taste as good! I did have a small problem with my meal, but after telling the server, we got a visit from the manager (who was very nice) and he apologized and bought us two desserts. It totally made up for any problem - the desserts (lemon cake with blueberry compote and peanut butter pudding) were too good - had trouble eating just a little!

Love the patio! You feel like you are in the middle of a patio in the Mediteranean! Started with happy hour bruchetta's. We got three different ones and they were only $3 each on happy hour. My favorite was the funghi but the fig and procutto and the corizo was really good as well. I got a flat bread that was again mushroom and cheese and arugala. It was good, but a little burnt. And not just "crispy." Actual black burnt edges which the server should have probably noticed and not brought out. I left all the crust but the rest was very flavorful. The server was very nice, didn't rush us and we sat in between appetizers and meals for a little while.   You should call ahead for a table in the evening, we had very limited choices since we didn't but it was nice and relaxing on the patio but not as comforable for a meal, better for drinks and apps. Great location, good food, and good service but it is the atmosphere that I really loved about this place!

This location is the worst. Even if they did provide decent food I would not spend any money here again due to the customer service alone. An employee here when I ordered an americano was extremely rude, condescending and demanding. What ever happened to a simple smile and hey how are you?

Great spot in Scottsdale! We couldn't get a table so we opted for seats at the bar. Entire staff was awesome and very knowledgable. We had fig and dates, flatbread and shared a salad. Great upbeat vibe! Check it out!  Would def suggest making a reservation!!
Great brunch spot in Downtown Scottsdale with a helpful staff and a wonderful patio.

We only came for breakfast because we were leaving to come back to Chicago, but I definitely want to try their dinner! After eating at Modern Steak and Sauce, we decided to come here and grab a bite. Fox group is three for three in our book! I had their egg sandwich with avocado, bacon and cheese and that was amazing! Those potatoes that it came with were so yummy too! It was deceiving, I wasn't sure if it was going to keep me full, but I was stuffed after eating it! Their muffins were yummy and my dog loved the treats I brought him home :) The outdoor patio was so beautiful and the dining room looked amazing. We will definitely try dinner when we come back to Arizona!

I returned to Olive and Ivy after a couple of years. We sat on the patio even though it was 100+ degrees out. We had Maria as our server she is amazing she made sure we had water, came back to check on us, she is friendly and made our experience so much better.

Need reservations for dinner inside....but if you walk in there's a common fire pit area to chill in ...you just shove in and enjoy...great menu...sweet server Miranda...nice ambiance...relaxed by the firepit...nice salad, pizza n sangria. Enjoy...good music...we'd come back...thx

Nice seating options,  I like the outdoor patio seating. The beard and pesto is super delicious.  I tried the lamb gyro and was nice and they are really generous unless you're really hungry, you might not be able to finish it all. My friend had the atlantic salmon which he liked. Service was excellent.
Peach Bellini nummy nummy nummy. Love the bread with pesto  and my gyros were delicious.

I'm going to update my review for Olive and Ivy up to 4 stars. I've come back here with new friends to introduce them to the deliciousness and each has absolutely loved it!  Menu items that remain my favorite for brunch include the Turkey Grinder and Chicken Panini. For dinner I really like the Fungi Trifoliati flatbread, Mediterranean Salad (with either salmon well done or chicken), Sweet Potato Cannelloni, and Natural Chicken. The flatbread and salad are available on their lunch menu as well!  As I've mentioned in my previous reviews, the pesto and bread they serve is absolutely phenomenal. The patio area is great for a group get togethers. We've been out there a few times just to enjoy cocktails and appetizers. The main dining room also provides a great ambiance for a group dinner or intimate date night. We'll be back!

I've been here on several occasions and I'm always impressed by how attentive the staff is. As busy as they are on the weekends, the staff always made sure that our drinks were being filled while we waited for our food. During my most recent visit, it got really windy outside (we sat out on the patio this particular night), and the staff was nice enough to move 2-3 of the space heaters near to our table so that my guests and I can be warm. In addition, the food is spectacular. Very flavorful and piping hot upon serving. I highly recommend the shrimp risotto and the sea scallops.

Stopped by here for a nice lunch and nothing tops the food, sangria and atmosphere sitting under the trees enjoying the canal. We had three different types of bruchetta a Rueben sandwich and ended with honey gelato. The food was excellent I can't begin to describe the flavor combinations on the bruchetta it was perfection. I am a sangria snob and to date this is hands down the best sangria I have ever had! the waitress was attentive without hovering over us the whole time. We will be going back but this time it will be at night. They have beautiful lighting out on the patio that is so romantic but reservations are a must at night! Enjoy!!!
A very cool and neat atmosphere. They have outdoor and indoor seating. I had a salad and it was huge and filled me up! The staff is wonderful as well

I had dinner at Olive & Ivy back in April and the food and service were excellent! I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant. For appetizers we got the bruschetta-prosciutto and the mozzarella. We also got the margarita flatbread. These three appetizers were phenomenal. As for my dinner, I got the lasagna bolognese and it was very tasty!  As for the service, our waiter was very knowledgeable, professional and sociable.

I'm not sure what all the fuss is about.  5 stars?  Maybe out of 10...  Brunch was below average, offering a handful of mediocre breakfast-y things.  There was no yummy French toast, pancakes or even an omelette!  I ordered the eggs benny which was served dry boasting a teaspoon of hollandaise and was extremely underwhelming.    For lack of choice, my mom ordered a tuna salad sandwich for $14.  Really?  What respectable chef even puts a tuna sandwich on a brunch menu! ?  It was my birthday this information was in the reservation comments AND I INFORMED THE HOSTESS.  Not only did my server not acknowledge the day with a complimentary ANYTHING I wasn't even told "Happy Birthday"...  While I'm new to AZ, I know in my foodie heart that there's got to be a better place to dine as this couldn't possibly be "as good as it gets".
Wow best customer service I've ever received in Scottsdale. Now my favorite place. Thank you. Absolutely love the staff and the decor.

Chris was absolutely amazing. He was very attentive, had a great memory, and even brought an umbrella outside to shade me when he saw me covering my head. I love the service here. The bread and pesto is one of the next appetizers in old town! Ps. Grab a cinnamon roll when you can

Amazing customer service and the food is great!  It's location is perfect.  Set nicely in old town right next to the mall.  The service was fast but they didn't make you feel in a rush to eat.  Most importantly, my drink was never empty!  You know that's the worst when you have to flag down a waiter. Not here!  I will go back for sure!
Sooooo good. Beautiful place with lovely outdoor seating on the canal. Close to everything. Great service. Fast service too. Food is awesome. I had a great salad. I highly recommend.
Scallops were under cooked. Service more interested in drinks. 3 beets in the salad. Not acceptable. Wine was good. More interested in bar service.
Decent food and good service for the happy hour on the patio. Lamb meatballs were the best
This place is a must if in old town Scottsdale. The chill atmosphere on the patio if hard to beat.
Had a great experience and the food was good. My wife enjoyed the sangria especially the white sangria.

I've known Sam Fox (Fox Restaurant Concepts) since his days running City Grill and Gilligan's back in Tucson so I was pleased many years ago when he decided to expand to the Valley.  I believe that Olive and Ivy was one of the first restaurants he opened outside of Tucson and at the time it was no sure thing that he would make it. That's why I am happy that it is so good and that he has done so well.  The food is delicious and I can't even begin to pick my favorite because everything is so good.   What I really love though is the atmosphere. Whether you sit inside or out, it's great... but I always try and sit on the patio. There's nothing like enjoying a beautiful Scottsdale day overlooking the Arizona Canal.  With new restaurants constantly opening and closing, I'm glad that Olive and Ivy has stood for so long and I hope it's around for many more years.
Very nice place, Ate on outdoor patio. Shared a bottle of really good Riesling wine. All the food we had was very good.

3.5 stars - overall pleased, would adopt as a happy hr. standby, rated downward b/c food was decent, not raveworthy.  Quite pleasantly surprised to discover this airy, spacious resto-lounge in Scottsdale Fashion Sq. Stopped in during happy hr. on a Thursday, decent mix of patrons. Overall space is versatile and occasion-friendly, great alfresco feel as giant oak doors were opened to the outdoor patio.  Lounge is perfect for small parties with low couches and leather sofa chair seating.  Great happy hr. specials (M-F 4-6pm) $5 small plates, well drinks, house wine, sangria.   Prosciutto bruschetta w/crescenza cheese, arugula & fig preserves was perfectly balanced. Italian sausage flatbread w/pequillo peppers & goat cheese - the peppers and goat cheese made this flatbread, the sausage was overly crumbled and didn't add much flavor. The cheese plate was fine - a mild blue and a mild Spanish cheese, plated with thinly sliced apples, marinated in a fruit jam.  Apparently, they're serving a $20 3-course prix-fixe w/several interesting options through 10/31. Menu here: http://www.foxrc.com/downloads/menus/O&I_Prix_Fixe_Menu.pdf  Cons: White (pink) sangria was prettily presented sugar-rimmed, but served sans fruit (odd). Have had much better sangria. Service was spotty but potentially b/c bartender was doubling as our server, other servers ended up busing our table and were helpful.  Look forward to checking out other Fox concepts True Food Kitchen and Zinburger.

Used to be okay. Now it's getting a bit greasy joint with half of its  menu always not available. They need to hire somebody to keep the front area clean. A bit pricey but at least it's fresh - so s'okay for an airport. Service is helpful. Don't forget to be friendly when you order as this place is run by boys and girls from da hood. Give 3* and will not to upset them... ;)

Quick service and decent food. Wanted the chopped salad but it's not actually chopped ....?? The counter guy didn't even know what the difference between a chopped salad and a normal salad was.... Pretty sad....

I don't know what was better, the food or the service? Great patio on the water. Delicious vodka mule. Sweet potato cannelloni with roasted almonds. Tres leches lemon meringue cake. YUM! Can't wait to go back and try other dishes....too bad I don't live in Scottsdale.  P.s. Any dish is available to go in their market section.

This was an excellent experience.  Found this location on Yelp while looking for a nice lunch.  Easy parking, nice facility and very very nice people.  The yelp menu had the Pastrami sandwich that sounded so good but when we arrived, it was not on the menu.    I mentioned it to the very nice server and a few minutes later, she comes back over and tells me that they will make it special.  I did not ask, just went out of their way to do something nice for a customer.  The overall experience was excellent and the Pastrami was really good too.  I actually am looking forward to going back...

We kind of liked this place, but probably won't be back unless we're shopping nearby. Unlike some other posters, we received excellent and attentive service -- walked in with no reservation just before 5 pm on Saturday and while we couldn't get patio seating, we got a nice table right away. The food was a bit inconsistent, though. The bruschetta was cold -- flavor was good, but would have tasted better hot. Hubby and I split the scallop entree and the ravioli entree -- again, the service was terrific, in that they split them both for us without us having to ask. And, the flavor, seasoning and texture of both were excellent...but the food didn't arrive hot. Desert of coconut cake was forgettable.

The decor of this place is great.  Very classy and well put together.  I was a little disappointed with the food.  The bruschetta was lacking in flavor.  Some of the toppings didn't taste that great together.  It wasn't bad, but I won't be back to have that again.  The veal and spinach ravioli was good.  I thought there was a sharp cheesy flavor that was almost too much.  I split that plate with my mom and thank god I did cause I could only handle eating three ravioli due to the rich flavor.  I won't be ordering that again. Overall if I were to come back, I'd order completely different menu items.  I just wasn't impressed with my choices this time :/

I hate to leave a bad review because I really like the decor and feel of this place. I have been here three times in the past year and I am just not crazy about the new menu. My husband had the lasagna last night and could not eat it. It looked like it had been reheated for three days in a row. He is actually sick with some kind of stomach virus today and I am thinking about calling the restaurant. I had the flatbread and it was not near as good as my last visit here 3 months ago. I probably won't return. For the price there are much better restaurants in the area.

I love this restaurant. I have been coming here with my family for years and they always provide great service.  The only downside is that if you are going on a weekend day or a busy peak time, you MUST make a reservation or you will not get a seat. The bar and marketplace area is open seating but the patio here is the best place to sit. The Fritto Misto is the best dish ever by the way. I love the Fox Restaurant Concepts.   Thank you again!
Amazing food. Incredible, fast service and fabulous outdoor dining experience! Definitely coming here again and would highly recommend it.

Phenomenal. The food, service, and atmosphere here is amazing. I brought my Mom, Aunt, and Grandma here for lunch and they absolutely loved it. Mark Anthony helped make the experience exceptional through his incredible customer service, attentive nature, and spot on recommendations. I really can't say enough about this place or the server.
Great outdoor seating by fire pit.  Appetizers really good as well. Great people watching on weekends.
If you come here, Sit in the booth facing outside. And have Easton as your server. He is amazing, this place is amazing: Thank you again Easton!
My wife and i enjoy having a meal after taking in a movie in the Scottsdale Fashion mall.. sitting in the patio area only if the weather permits is the way to go... good place

The food, service and setting are perfect for a spring time lunch. We were celebrating two birthdays and our server Carlos made it even more special by bringing us two delicious desserts to share. I would highly recommend Olive & Ivy.

I have been here for brunch twice, absolute best mimosas. Breakfast sandwich is awesome and the food was good. The restaurant is also big and good atmosphere. Good for large groups too and they take reservations.

I'm kind of obligated to love this place, because my wife and I had our first date here AND I proposed to her here (she said yes, too).  Obviously, the restaurant holds lots of sentimental value to us, and I love that.  I also love the food and wine menu.  We've tried many of the entrees, including the Braised Short Ribs and Rack of Lamb, all of which were outstanding.  We've also ordered many of the red wines, and always enjoyed our selections.  Nearly everything on the dinner and wine list is pricey, but it's also worth it, so go there when you can enjoy it.  The big BUT I have to include here is that we've had both exceptional service and terrible service.  On at least three or four occasions, our service was fast and friendly, just what you want.  The last time we visited Olive & Ivy was for our one-year wedding anniversary.  I called ahead, made reservations, and told the hostess over the phone what we were celebrating and the fact that I had proposed to my wife there as well.  Once there, no one ever wished us a happy anniversary, and we were sat in, possibly, the worst location in the restaurant, adjacent to a door (in January) that was constantly being opened and closed.  It actually looked like the table was placed there at the last minute, because no one would ever want to sit that close to a cold drafty door in January.  Not only that, but our server was unfamiliar with the wine list and couldn't give us any recommendations on appetizers (she said everything was good).  Hopefully, that one bad server is no longer there, and everything is back to the way it was.  If so, I'd recommend Olive & Ivy to anyone!

We had a group of 5 come here last weekend and had the pleasure of having Victoria helping our table out.  The food was delicious.  My girlfriend and I loved that everything was made from scratch.  She had a chicken salad, which was amazing, I opted for a breakfast sandwich, also fantastic.  Everyone from our group enjoyed the food, and enjoyed the GREAT service from our host.  If I lived in Scottsdale, I would be here a couple times a week for sure, its too good to pass up.

Loved this place!!! Awesome atmosphere. Had drinks and apps by the fire pits.  Got a bunch of food to share and all was so good. Waiters were awesome and the bill came out reasonably for a group of 4. I wish we had this place in Dallas.

Great breakfast at the marketplace!  Highly recommend!  Wonderful portions, great coffee, great location near Fashion Square.  Dogs allowed on the marketplace patio, would have given 5 stars except for he barking puppy at the next table.
