I miss living near here!  So good, i love the market place and their coffee is always perfect!

I tried Olive & Ivy for the first time and it was amazing! I love the decorations and the atmosphere. The 2 hosts at the front, Whitney and Natalie, were really sweet and helpful when I mentioned I wanted a table outside. I got the market soup (cauliflower) which was delicious, and some of the bruschetta. Our server Joe was  awesome too! The atmosphere and food is great but the staff makes it even better Would highly recommend and I'll be back soon!

This is a beautiful restaurant.  I've been here twice now, both times were excellent.  There's a huge bar area and also a big back patio with a misting system in the summer time.  Both times we've ordered the hummus.  It's that good.  It's got a lil kick to it, and it's served with pita bread.  It's excellent.  What else is excellent is their lasagna.  It's some of the best I've ever had!!!  It's served with two little amazing pieces of garlic bread, that's so yummy and pairs perfectly with the lasagna sauce.  If you're really hungry the portion is perfect, if not, it heats up well, so take it home and have it as a midnight shnack ;)  My friend ordered the Med salad and it looked really good and the portion is ginormous.  Overall, this place is awesome  and we will definitely visit again when we're on that side of town.

First time here. Here for lunch with family. Found on Yelp Review with attractive rating and many reviews.  Parking was fairly easy to find in a shaded parking structure. There were parking spaces available right in front of the restaurant, but we decided to park in the parking structure.   The hostess was welcoming. The restaurant presentation was a mix between industry and classic. Loved the ambiance!   We ordered Mediterranean salad with grilled chicken, Gyro sandwich, Bacon Cheeseburger, Sweet potato cannelloni, and Piccante flat bread. The server brought complimentary bread with pesto sauce which was surprisingly good! It was the BEST bread from any of the restaurants I've ever visited in my entire life!   The my unsweetened Black tropical ice tea. The tea was excellent as well as the rest of the dishes. We couldn't believe every single dish was so great!!  Our server, Mike, was top of the notch server!

My husband and I have only dined here once. The restaurant is beautiful and the staff was superb. We had one of the yummiest deserts I've ever tasted. I would certainly recommend this place to our friends and family.
The service and the food was excellent! This was our second visit and there were no surprises; consistently great!

Beautiful day on the patio!  Zach, our server, was awesome. Husband had eggs Benedict and I had the kale salad with chicken added. A bottle of rose' to share and life is good. Be sure to start with the house made focaccia and pesto.

Formulaic restaurant that works to move you quickly through your meal. Staff was knowledgable and had the company storyline down pat. Food was good, wine list was okay but sommelier lacked basic wine knowledge.  Appetizers were appealing. Salads had balanced flavor and showed up very quickly. Plates were removed as soon as last bite. Bread and pesto provided but only lasted on the table less than 5 minutes. We had to ask for the bread's return. Entrees tasted good too but were in the small side.  Not a bad restaurant but as I said they look to turn you in and out quickly. We were looking for something a little more relaxed.

The place has a great patio which although most seats were open and we came on time for our noon reservation they claimed we had to have requested it. We had an important meeting and they still stuck us next to the kitchen! They did nothing to appease us. The food is OK. For the area there are way better places. I would never recommend due to horrible hosting and management.

Pretty good food!  I love the bread and pesto they bring to he table.   Bacon wrapped dates were excellent. Bruschetta was excellent. Hummus was average and the pitas were pathetic  Lemonade was very good not too sweet not too sour  I had the bone in ribeye medium rare.it was very good. Uniform doneness suggests sous vide plus a quick grill.  Demi glacé was done well not too over powering and just a touch to not overpower the steak.Potatoes and spinach were a nice balance.  Service was very good. Unobtrusive but on top of making sure drinks were refilled food plates out of the way etc  Only knock is the music is waaaaaay too loud.  Turn it down!

I tried to take my secretary here for lunch Friday. They were busy, and I had no reservation. Totally understandable, we'll go somewhere else. However, they said we could sit at the bar which was wide open. Silly me; I didn't think they meant it literally! We did sit there, totally ignored for 10 minutes. No water, no "we'll be right with you." We were simply invisible. The worst part? There were 4-5 employees standing around doing nothing. We gave up and left. Bye, Felicia!
The bread, the ambiance and the bruschetta alone are worth visiting this quaint restaurant located on the waterfront.  Such a relaxing last lunch before heading home to Chicago.

We love the location of this place and their food. The patio is great and there's lots of open space. On weekends there are sometimes open air markets along the canal. We are thinking about coming here after our wedding rehearsal.

So this was my fourth time at Olive and Ivy before writing a review.     The first three times were at breakfast where we utilized the the little marketplace they have.  I really enjoyed going there, a little over priced but good food and a great atmosphere.   This last time I was at Sunday brunch with my girls and it sucked!!!  Sangria in a carafe $20!!!!  Granted the white sangria is pretty amazing. ..but geesh!  It doesn't even look pretty!  No pretty fruit floating around or anything.   What really brings my review down was the gyro.  It sucked.  Wilted lettuce, a tomato that looked like it had been sliced last week and cold fries.  I get that they were trying to time it out right after our appetizer but letting it die in the window? ... that is just bad service.  And at $12 it should have have been perfect.  Soooo...I will be trying some new places and staying away from here.
Amazing food and outstanding service! Plus the gelato is sooooo yummy and refreshing!

The location and vibe in this place are great. The patron is lovely along the canal. Go for drinks and really enjoy yourselves. But I have been consistently disappointed by the food. Oily pasta dishes, lackluster flavors. Sorry that I cannot recommend this place for food. I do check it out every once in a while, but my last time was a few years ago. So, take this review with a grain of salt, but don't blame me if the food isn't up to your standards.

Dined here at 3pm and it was fairly busy, but we got seated immediately. We asked if we could have the dinner menu in the happy hour area and were told that the lounge was strictly HH which was odd. So we sat at a table in the patio with dinner menus. The menu was pretty good however they are only limited to half the dinner menu at 3 which didn't make sense to give a full dinner menu , but we did with it.  We order a bruschetta with too much cheese and no spicy chorizo, the lamb meat balls which I enjoyed and the short rib flatbread which I loved! The service was ok. We ordered wines and our server spilt over an ounce on the table and cleaned off the menus but not the table which really made it uncomfortable to eat knowing I had puddles around me , also I didn't get that lost wine back. Bottom line, food is good, ambiance is great, and service was ok. Will potentially return , but definitely no rush

Olive and Ivy is one of the best places to go in Scottsdale for a lovely weekend breakfast or my personal favorite, Sunday brunch.  The food is beyond delicious - my favorite is the egg sandwich that comes complete with avocado, egg, cheese, mayo, bacon, and all served on a deliciously fluffy croissant. My sister loves the hanger steak with eggs and asparagus too!  The staff is very nice and accommodating. Olive and Ivy serves potatoes on the side of my egg sandwich, but they are always eager to please me when I ask or a fruit salad instead - sweet juicy fresh fruit in a bowl is the perfect addition to a delectable breakfast sandwich.   I also highly suggest the morning cocktails. My mother and I visit Olive and Ivy EVERY time she is in town. She loves the Peach Bellini and has actually made me a fan as well although their white sangria (which is actually pink) as a perfect morning pick me up!   If you get a chance to visit Olive and Ivy I would STRONGLY recommend it! Best breakfast in Scottsdale. It is beyond affordable for how delicious the food is and how great the service is!
Very good food and a beautiful setting. My only complaint is the fact that they seat you as if they are doing you a favor by letting you eat there.

I typically go to Olive and Ivy often. I even had my bridal shower at the restaurant in October. My friend wanted to eat here on her birthday which was on Valentine's Day. She had made a reservation for 5 people. Our server Bart was very nice, however, Heather, one of the managers, was EXTREMELY rude. She came over and she said that she had a reservation that had been waiting for 30 minutes for our table on the patio. This happened less than five minutes after our gelato and drinks had hit the table. I still had a full glass and half of the dessert left (that took over 15 minutes after ordering to be brought to the table). All 5 of us are in the industry, so we are all pretty understanding and we know how stressful it can be, but we would never speak to anyone how Heather spoke to us. She then went on to blame the late joiners, which was my husband and I. She was inconsiderate, loud and disrespectful. I told her we will leave as soon as we are finished with our drinks and desserts. At this point, we still haven't even received our split checks! She stood against the wall and stared at us for about five minutes and came over again with a male manager and said "Like I said before, I need your table." (WHILE I HAD MY MOUTH COMPLETELY FULL OF FOOD.) We were all shocked in disbelief and completely embarrassed while other people at surrounding tables stared at the ordeal taking place. We asked to speak to the general manager and Heather would not budge until I had to demand to speak to the general manager. When the general manager Kim came over, we expressed our concerns about Heather's attitude. Kim went on to tell us that this reservation had been waiting over an hour for the table (when five minutes before that Heather said 30) and that they were busy, which is a good problem to have. One of our friends mentioned to Kim that we wouldn't have minded if we were completely finished or if they offered to move us to another table inside. We told the manager this and SHE STILL DIDN'T OFFER TO! We had planned to stay and drink more but we decided to spend our money elsewhere. The server even came by and felt the need to apologize for both of the managers poor reaction to the situation. As we got up and walked through the inside of the restaurant there were over 6 tables open. Needless to say, We will not be going back to this restaurant anytime soon. The staff has always been so friendly but there is extremely poor management. I left Olive and Ivy feeling embarrassed and disrespected, not how you want to feel after celebrating a friends birthday.

I went here tonight for my boyfriend's birthday (11/11/11). First let me say the five star rating was for our waitress Andrea. She was amazing. The atmosphere was great...a little loud but died down after 11pm.  Andrea was very prompt, polite, and quick to make recommendations (which were all great). I asked if they could make a chicken alfredo dinner because I didn't see it on the menu and they were more than happy to accommodate, making the alfredo fresh! At the end of dinner I asked Andrea if she could do something for my boyfriend's birthday and without question she quickly brought a strawberry shortcake to the table. Tasted amazing and she even comped the price of dessert. If it weren't for Andrea I'd have given a 4 star review only because it was slightly pricey.  Overall food and  atmosphere were great, but the service was exceptional! Thanks Andrea for making our night special!
Good food, good happy hour.  Kinda of a trendy see and be scene Scottsdale place.  I do enjoy their patio on the canal.
Stopped for a glass of wine and ended up staying for a couple plus appetizers. The patio was so inviting and comfortable; service was good; food was great. Can't wait to go back!

For an airport terminal establishment, this place is top notch.  Ordered a sandwich, grabbed a seat and it was delivered to me like at one of their traditional restaurants. The place was JAMMED, but my sandwich came out very quickly.  The food was fresh and delicious!
Great atmosphere, good food, great service.  Portion sizes were good and the apps delivered as expected.  great happy hour spot...

Had a great lunch with some friends and the food was wonderful! Our waiter was Mark Anthony, made our experience that more enjoyable. Martins were nice... They need to step it up in this area. They could learn a few more twist on different ways to serve up a really great Martini by Venturing out side the box... Food was wonderful. Everything was cooked from scratch... From the flat breads, to the Turkey grinder. My Mediterranean salad was ok, not the best and could have used more ingredients (dated, currents, chicken, curry, other spices to take it to the next level). The restaurant sits on the river so the ambiance was nice...  They still need some work in the creativity department. They own many other restaurants through out AZ and rest of the  Country. Maybe they should think about hiring me as a consultant to kick it up to the next level.... If there was my creativity then just the standard mix of food, I would have given it more stars. $5 dollars for s tiny piece of bruschetta with, cheese prosciutto and they forgot the fig jam was a bit much. Messed up the drink order... But the experience was pleasurable. The waiter did his best, but they others fell short... The mixologist behind the bar could use some more experience and should learn to kick it up a notch... Chef as well. May be too many balls in the air that they are trying to juggle!
Very delicious brunch.  Great drinks.  Super chic decor.

Gonna be real blunt, the food here is on the better end of the spectrum when it comes to grab and go airport fare, but the line and service is average on its best day and atrocious more often than not. For one I don't understand the point of having a bunch of premade sandwiches and salads in the counter coolers if you're just gonna make them fresh every time regardless. Like I honestly wonder when they actually sell any of those things I see every time I'm inching through the line.   Also doesn't help that they have 3 diff ppl taking orders, just adds to the confusion and chaos. Meanwhile I observed at least 3 employees not actually doing anything, one guy was calling out orders but not actually making anything, like why? On this most recent visit I literally just waited 10 min extra bc they just straight up forgot to make my order, putting into perspective just how useless it is  to just call out an order to someone without follow through. I had to remind someone to check on it after I clearly saw 3 ppl working on orders placed 7 or 8 behind me, with no one making me a "fresh" salad until I asked. No oops, or sorry, just business as usual here. They hand you a # when you order and it's worthwhile to remember you are just that, a number, when you decide to get food here, nothing more.

Conflicted about how to write this review, since I actually ended up getting sick after my meal, and so did two of my friends the week prior. BUT still three stars because it's actually awesome. If we didn't get sick, easily a 4 or 5. Could have just been a weird coincidence!   First of all the place is ADORABLE. The inside is great, but the outside patio is amazingly beautiful. It's right on the water and there are cute string lights and fountains. It looks like a European garden. There are misters so don't worry about being too hot during the summer.   You HAVE to try the bruschetta board. It's fantastic. The bread is so fresh and the toppings were perfect. For my meal I ordered the chicken and mashed potatoes. It was flavored really well... the only thing I wish was that the skin was crispy. And for my favorite part: dessert. We had the strawberry shortcake. Amazing.   SO if you have a strong stomach, try it. If you don't, try it and bring Tums just in case. It's worth it.

This place is doing something right to fill the place. Low expectations in servuce and food taste must be par for the course. Six of us ate there. Not one of us finished nor did one of us really enjoy the meal. Environment is nice, server was awesome but hostesses all were all a bit kitschy and stuck in their clique. Had reservations for six and the couldn't nor would attempt to try and seat us together. No smiles, no personal interaction and no interest in assisting us. Will not be back.

Had a weird experience coming here for happy hour with coworkers. The manager redeemed it in the end, but it was still quite off-putting.  We had a group of about 20 people from work, who were going out as a farewell to one of our colleagues. Someone in our party had called Olive & Ivy the week before to ask if we could make a reservation since we had a large group. She was told that they don't take reservations for happy hour, but that since we'd be coming in on a Tuesday, it shouldn't be any problem to seat our whole group. Sounded great.  Our group arrived, and there was only enough "happy hour" seating available for about half of our group... despite the fact that there were many other open tables throughout the restaurant. Half of our group sat, while the other half tried to figure out what to do. Finally we asked about taking one of the other nearby tables that was empty (unfortunately not next to the rest of the group), and we were told we could sit there. The stray half of our group sat down, the server brought us water, and then left. She came back, dropped off an appetizer that our boss had bought for us, and then told us "I can't have you guys sitting here. We have to leave these tables open for dinner service. I'm gonna need to have you clear out of here by 5." (It was 4:45.) So we asked "Do you have another table we can go to? We were told we could sit here." She said there were no other tables we could move to, since the rest of the "happy hour" section was full. Mind you, most of the group was going to order non-happy-hour food.  The server walked away. Our half of the group (still removed from the rest of coworkers, including our departing friend who the whole outing was for) was left to figure out what to do. Honestly, we didn't really have any options... there was nowhere we were "allowed" to sit, so they were essentially just kicking us out of the restaurant even though we were ready to be paying customers. We hadn't even had the chance to order a drink. It was very awkward and rude.  As we were about to leave, a manager suddenly came over and told us he had made space for us in the happy hour section next to the rest of our group. We were immediately seated in that section, and were finally treated like normal customers. We enjoyed ourselves from that point on, but none of us could believe how poorly the situation was handled up until then.   The food and drinks were good, not great. I gave this place 3 stars instead of 2 only because the manager handled things right. It's just a shame it took so long for that to happen. This was my first time at Olive & Ivy, and I definitely wouldn't come here again by my own choice.

Amazing!! That is the best word to describe this place!! Everything was perfect from walking I to the fun ambiance, to the perfect drinks and the most amazing food! Not a thing was wrong. Great service and such a knowledgeable waiter!!! Please bring this place to Houston!!!!!

Delicious fresh food. I always appreciate freshly made items that are healthy and this place has a lot. Nice patio, staff is friendly. I'm giving it 4/5 stars due to the atmosphere at night. I have been here during the day and it is pleasant. At night the place turns into what I like to call "The Scottsdale wannabe rich dude hang out," full of over plastic surgery individuals.. Not my cup of tea.

This was my first time eating here & the food is amazing!! But the real recognition I'd like to give is to our server, Jeremy, he went above and beyond to provide exceptional service! He was so smiley, polite and had immense knowledge of the menu and great recommendations! Will be returning soon!

What an incredible meal!! Had a reservation for 7 on a Tuesday. There was a sight delay for our reservation and they brought us water and bread with pesto to the patio. Went above and beyond for service and menu choice. Meal was absolutely delicious! Everything from the bacon wrapped dates and artichoke hearts appetizers to the salmon and steaks, PERFECT! Donovan was our server and he went out of his way to make sure we had an incredible meal. Will definitely eat here every time we're in town!

So, my daughters and I wanted to dine there Sat nite but we were unable to get a reservation. But we did get one for brunch on Sunday. We were very excited to experience the outdoor patio. Sadly, our experience was filled with lows and highs. Our waiter provided very poor service. When I asked the origin of the House sparkling wine for the mimosas he could only respond that "yeah it's good." Our food orders were completely incorrect, poached eggs looked inedible but were delivered to my one daughter. We asked for the manager. She was lovely and responsive. We were delivered a whole new cream fast. And we expressed our appreciation. But unfortunately my other daughters over easy eggs were swimming in a pool of grease. When the manager checked in with us again she comped the whole meal. The lows were that the meal was only ok and the service awful. But the highs were that the manager really cared about us and took care of us. We have high expectations for Olive and Ivy. And they need to do better for brunch.
One of my favorite spots in Scottsdale for dinner or just drinks. Amazing atmosphere, music, food on point and staff! Love it!

We've celebrated anniversaries and business deals that have closed here so obviously I like it. :) I've only gone for dinner and happy hour and the ambiance is always upscale, trendy yet refined.  You see all ages groups represented and quite a few tourist in the mix.  I've had the Veal & Spinach Ravioli, Sea Bass, Sea Scallops - all very good.  Taste and presentation is important to them so I don't think you can go wrong with anything from their menu.  Overall one of my favorite places to dine.

I hate it that I love it....Fox Restaurants are taking over, but this place is great. The bread and pesto are amazing. I have never ordered something that I didnt like. The prices more than fair for the quality of service and deliciousness of the food.
This is one of my fave places to go during the week if I'm in the area. I love the vibe, the food and the drinks. The service is always good.

I have to say that our recent trip  overall was a pleasant.  My only complaint would be with the host staff.  We had made a reservation with open-table.com and shortly after Leaving we received a No Show email from open table.  I assume that the Hostess did not know how to check someone in that had a reservation.  While this was eventually resolved I did take several calls and emails to do so and they only way it was closed was for us to provide a copy of the receipt to open table to verify that were had arrived for our reservation.  While the service, food, and beverages were fantastic the attention to detail needs just a bit of polishing.

I really loved the lighting, staff, crowd and overall ambience of this place. Colorful booths and their patio is awesome with couches and Edison lights. Unless you make a reservation, you most likely will have to wait though. The hostess was super sweet and our waitress was as well. Very friendly vibe here.   Items we tried and truly enjoyed were:  Classic Caesar salad (huge bowl-very filling and fresh) Beet salad (smaller portion served in a flat rectangle plate) Mozzarella bruschetta (all the brushettas were bomb) Prosciutto bruschetta  Brussels sprout bruschetta  Chicken and barely soup (could tell it was homemade) Lasagna Margarita pizza (nothing special, basic pizza) Spanish shrimp risotto (AMAZING!!! Cooked to perfection) I must add that one of the highlights is that they stuff their own blue cheese olives and make their own blue cheese as well...so the martinis are extra good ;)

I liked the ambiance. It's a big venue with nice outside setting. The food was good. I wasn't a fan of what I ordered ( sweet potato cannelloni) too sweet and too oily. But the scallops and sea bass were delicious. A good overall experience.

I have been to this place a number of times for dinner, (2ppl-8ppl), Happy Hour, Breakfast and today, lunch.   it is always a perfectly wonderful experience. The ambiance is beautiful to start with. The hostess is always great, service great, food great, drinks great!   I love walking up to Olive and Ivy for breakfast. They make the BEST yogurt/fruit/granola bowl anywhere. The coffee is good. I have never had  bad or mediocre service there.   It's a great place for a date, business meeting, special event dinner party, girls lunch, happy hour...etc... etc..   Advice to mgmt- Keep up the good work.   P.S. While I've always had good service here; today I had a server named Tommy. A++++++ The perfect mixture of personality, service and leaving you alone while being attentive. Amazing!

Ok. Let me start by saying that the atmosphere of Olive & Ivy is gorgeous! I will take you through our meal so you know why we didn't love this...let me also disclose that my opinion made even me sad! I started off with a glass of white wine. I got the Chenin Blanc. The wine was delicious BUT it was wayyyy too warm. Having such and extensive wine collection, they should have known to serve more chilled white wine. I could have said something but I didn't, so that is my fault. Every table gets fresh bread and pesto. This was probably the highlight of the meal. It is seriously DELICIOUS! We decided to start with the bacon wrapped dates, recommended by our server. They were...ok. The dates were a bit too smokey and needed more of a salty element. Even with the chorizo and bacon, I found them to be much too sweet. They also had some greenery that was unnecessary. For my meal, I got 3 of the bruschetta. Great concept! You can choose 3 flavors for $12. Sounds amazing right!? BEWARE. The menu discloses GF and Veg. Again, this was MY FAULT but, the menu didn't list all of the ingredients and all of the bruschetta options have cheese on them. I don't eat dairy....so, I basically suffered through my entire meal. The brussels sprout option was 100% the best. The mushroom was pretty good and the prosciutto was less than impressive, unfortunately. My sister got the scallops and said they were pretty good and cooked perfectly! They come with 5 as well as some hearty butternut squash puree. There were chunks of squash that she said were a bit overwhelming and a bit rich. They were missing depth and needed a bit of acidity.   Overall, this wasn't a BAD meal but we were expecting a lot more. I would try it again but I would be much more cautious of what I was ordering and next time I will probably ask for more chilled wine.

Wow. Never been so disrespected on the phone after THEY failed to change my reservation time. I called them yesterday to adjust my reservation from 10:00 AM to 12:15 PM then preceded to realize this morning that it was not changed after receiving an email saying they missed me at my reservation. The food may be fairly good, but if there are employees at this place who are rude to their customers (especially when they make a mistake), I wouldn't go here.

For airport food, their Greek salad is solid. It has plenty of veggies and they usually have some already prepared. So you can grab one and go.  My one tip for some of their salads would be to ask for extra dressing on the side since they don't put enough on.

This is our to-go-to place when visitors come to town. Always great service. Love starting with the focaccia & fresh pesto. The bruschetta appetizers are excellent. Some favorites are the flatbreads, sea scallops, sea bass, Mediterranean salad, sweet potato cannelloni and peanut butter mousse dessert!

The salad here is amazing. My friend got a flatbread and it was great. Not too many options for gluten free if you don't like salad but my salad was delicious. Really nice outdoor seating with view of the waterfront. Really nice workers. Definitely would recommend.

Not a fan.  The food was good, but it only had 9 bites total in my bowl.  I ate 4 rations of bread to fill up and used the sauce from my pasta.  Scottsdale prices, McDonald's dollar menu portions. Walk across the street and go to The Herb Box.

When I like something I tend to order it again...and again...and again.  After a morning hike at Camelback Gabi M and I stopped by here for breakfast. I ordered their breakfast smoothie (mmm) and an egg white omelette, served with tomatoes and avocado. Oh, and a side of fruit too!  I liked it so much that when we finished our workout the next morning I asked if we could go back to Olive and Ivy. Same order this time around, but this time I added cheddar cheese to the omelette. They put a layer of cheese on top (rather than inside), which isn't how I usually like it, but this was actually really good.  I was bummed when I ran out of time on my 3rd morning in Phoenix to stop by for my usual breakfast, but I hope to be back next time.

Olive & Ivy is the perfect place for a girl's dinner!  Went here with a friend during the week.  We waited about 15 minutes for a table outside and grabbed drinks at the bar.  We sat outside which was in a cute garden with tables and even couches for large groups.  It was right on the waterway and had a nice view of other buildings in the area.  When we were seated, the waiter was fine that we ordered drinks at the bar which is always a good way to start out dinner!  My friend and I split a salad and a flatbread which were the perfect amount of food.  The chopped mediterranean salad was awesome.  I have no idea why it tasted so good but it did.  Our flatbread was unique and very good with asparagus and mushrooms which I normally don't like but they made this taste great.

After spending what turned out to be the best Thanksgiving of my life with the love of my life and her truly amazing vegetarian family in Scottsdale, I looked forward to continuing the holiday into the next day at Olive & Ivy. One would think that after a Thanksgiving meal of salmon (that's the extent of the meat that was served), an assortment of vegetables, and Gouda grits, I would be dying for some meat. Not the case at all.   The mall to which this restaurant was attached was bustling with half crazed Black Friday shoppers; however, once inside we were led into a private room that must have been designed precisely for our party of ten.   I began my meal with the heirloom beet salad with pistachio and goat cheese dressing, followed by the smoked salmon flatbread. They were both out of this world. The couple of bites that I had of my lady's sea bass with wild mushroom ravioli, Brussels Sprouts and roasted squash confirmed to me that this place will not disappoint with any dish that you might order. I caution you, however, do not fill up on the delicious bread and pesto that they serve with the meal.   The wine list seemed a bit eclectic, and I would have loved to try something new, or the "kilt lifter" beer, but my goal to get the body fat below five percent limited my drink of choice to Grey Goose on the rocks. Next time maybe.   Save room for a cookie or gelato from the adjoining marketplace. This restaurant has the concept of restaurant and marketplace nailed. It was for me one of my high culinary experiences with plenty of love and friendship to go around. I know what you're thinking. How will I get to five percent BF while consuming flatbread and cookies? Well, how much willpower do you expect me to have after three vodkas?

Wow! We had a fab dinner AND a great experience. Josh P (aka Detroit) was our server and his attentive energy was astounding and made my husband's birthday dinner one of his favorites. Dan enjoyed the bouillabase...every single saffron kissed drop. The sea bass was amazingly light with little gifts of grapefruit zest to bring out the flavor. We started by sharing a duo of greens.. the warm artichoke salad and the chilled beet salad. Yum! Josh made great recommendations and they were spot on. All in all...Josh made the evening amazing. We also appreciated Matt, the manager, informing us about all their restaurants in the area that are chef driven. We cannot wait to try them all!

Unfortunately I loved this place, but they seem to have changed their menu without notification online.  I took my wife there for her bday on a Saturday at 2:30.  We both looked at the menu online and decided they had what we wanted.  When we for there, we were given a totally different menu which had nothing that we had picked.  I'm guessing it was their new lunch menu.  It didn't even include their bruschetta which we love getting every time we go.  We were told we could sit at the bar for over a half an hour for their limited dinner menu to kick in, but that is unacceptable.  We ended up leaving and will probably never return since they did seem to care why we decided to leave.  A company without concern for their patrons is a company that won't get our money.  I hope in the future they decide to go back to a menu that actually has some substance, but I would bet money on them staying the course, even though it has alienated at least us as customers.

Was an impromptu dining visit and did not have a reservation but we were greeted quickly and told of our seating options without a reservation, we opted to done outside on the patio since it was a nice evening, we were given a table along the canal and it was perfect.  Our server was also fantastic!  We decided to do the AZ Restaurant Week menu as the options were just perfect for what we were looking for.  The fresh bread and pesto that were brought to the table was delicious.  The bacon wrapped dates were amazing, and not a small portion  either. I had the white bean and kale minestrone and it was also very good. For dinner we had seared scallops over a sweet corn and asparagus, and bacon wrapped pork tenderloin with fingerling potatoes and swiss chard.  The scallops were cooked great and the corn and asparagus very tasty.  The pork was cooked to perfection, moist and melted in your mouth with the smokiness of the bacon just yummy.  For dessert we chose the chocolate mousse and apple crisp.  The mousse was a perfect size and not too sweet.  The apple crisp was a bit disappointing, it was extremely soupy, which our server also recognized but said there was no manager to tell.  Over all a great evening.
Excellent first time experience. Service was superb.  Can't wait to bring my friends here for our annual girls trip!

Wouldn't it be nice to write a decent review for an airport restaurant without biasing your information to the location?  Airport food doesn't have to be good, so it usually is not.  O&I tries a little harder, but still falls into this category.  It did hook me from the start, in that it did not LOOK like your typical airport place.  The menu on the wall appeared hand-made, the food choices were creative and attractive.  They even have a coffee bar displaying a list of real espresso drinks!    Execution, on the other hand, wasn't what I was hoping for.  All the signs of fast-food were there: sloppy assembly, cold-in-the-middle-hot-on-the-outside temperature distribution, and an ordering process that confused everyone.  But most of all, the menu items were fast-food sized.  Two sandwiches would have been a more appropriate order for my meager frame.  And the coffee?  It was ok, I'll give it that much.  Maybe some day the world will find an airport restaurant that doesn't capitalize on it's captive customer base by providing a truly decent meal.  O&I isn't there yet.

Very, very nice!    Went for New Year's Day lunch and the place was packed so service was a bit strained but understandably.   Wish there would have been tables available on the patio as it's gorgeous out there.  Nevertheless the interior is also very attractive.  The warm foccacia bread with pesto was awesome and complimentary.   We had an amazing butternut squash and shrimp soup to take the chill out on a cold afternoon.   My husband had the goat cheese and duck confit tortellini (fresh), I had the lasagna bolognese and my son had the salmon.  All were perfectly cooked.   For dessert we shared the cheesecake.  The only thing we found odd was that the lasagna was served in a bowl and the cheesecake in a mason type jar.  Nevertheless the flavors were there!  We will be back to check out the dinner menu for sure.

We had a delicious Valentine's Day celebration dinner including dessert and a great server who took time to be courteous  And they gave us all the time we needed to relax and enjoy our meal We also want to thank the hostess for seating us in a great spot that was not in a crowded area so we had privacy in a booth so we could have a conversation  And we were both happy with our meals We will go back for sure and not just for a holiday event as it is in the neighborhood and a great restaurant for the price

We sat out on the patio celebrating with a few and it was just amazing!  The atmosphere on the lake front is beautiful on a gorg day!  We only had enough time for a champagne toast but I will definitely come back for dinner.  I love just hanging out casually in a stunning restaurant.

Great location along the river, food was very good and portions were good.  All food was specially prepared while you waited.  The bar area was right beside the dining tables.  The people there were a little loud causing us to speak louder while eating in the dining area . It was a little distracting, but not bad. Still very nice place,  and I highly recommend it. Our server was Angelo. He made us feel welcome and paid attention to us while we were there. The Marriott Courtyard Concierge recommended it as a nice place for a sit down dinner.

Was here for a quick 2 hour Happy Hour thingy. The patio is great with lots of tables and a firepit in the corner. They have a special happy Hour menu, but watch out for the Brushetta part. The prices at $3 are attractive, but they are only giving you $3 worth of food, not a Happy Hour deal or anything. The pumpkin/Hazelnut cheese concoction wasn't even good, moreorless worth the $3 it cost for one slice of bread cut up into three pieces. Are you really that freakin cheap people? It was unhappy Hour in terms of food, but they had AZ craft beers for $5 at HH and although that isn't a great deal, it's the best you can find in this upscale happy hour, which should be renamed. Waitress was nice and staff was polite, but also an aging crowd was hanging out at the bar if your into grey, then head that way.

This place had amazingly good food and service! We went there Saturday night and had an amazing experience from the start to the end. We made reservations a week in advance and highly recommend doing it otherwise you most likely will have to wait.
good food, great ambience, reasonable prices, and great variety. minus one star because service could have been better.  for lunch, try the lamb gyro or turkey sandwich.

I have lived near here and had never made it before today. The patio is perfect. They have comfy couches and chairs set for large groups or multiple small parties. The patio overlooks the canal and has misters to keep you cool.   I came in between lunch and dinner so they had a restricted dinner menu. I got some bruschetta (fungi) and thought it was very tasty. I love mushrooms and it was piled high.   Great lounge spot for nice days!

So I received emails from Olive and Ivy asking when we were there,etc., I provided the information and sent them a picture of the lame sandwich and now nobody gets back to me!  Why bother asking questions if they don't get back to you!  Will NEVER go back to this place.

The entrance was confusing.  When you walk in its like a deli and to the back is the restaurant.  The employees look at you like you are an idiot and then finally they break down and point to the back where the restaurant is.  The hostess station had 3 or 4 people standing around and one extremely rude girl that took charge.  We asked how long the wait was it was a long time but she said you can go to the back patio and possibly get a seat.  We had never been there before so we asked is there a table available?  The rude girls response was "we dont know" since its first come we dont keep track of it for you.  you will have to see if there is one available.  We walked through and obviously there was no open table which the dumb B already knew.  Really bad vibe from this place.  Really rude staff.  Staff seems ultimately annoyed that you had the audacity to walk in and expect to eat there.  It was almost like "is this really happening right now?"   That was our first and last visit we walked out after the hostess was a big b and I was completely bummed because the restaurant is beautiful.  I have wanted to try it for a few years now but I cant put up with that kind of treatment.  The management here must be the absolute worst otherwise there wouldnt be so many hateful people working here.

We originally came to grab a drink prior to dinner but came back for lunch the next day. It's situated along the waterfront so a good place to sit outside and enjoy the breeze. There's plenty of outdoor seating. Even though it's packed, service was never lacking. The grapefruit mojito was cold and refreshing. I liked how it didn't have so much mint floating in the glass to get caught in the straw.  As for lunch I had the tuna sandwich. It's pretty standard so not much to write about but I'd order it again. Take a walk around the area after you're done. There's a lot to explore.
Vegan option: Ask for a veggie sandwich with artichokes, roasted red peppers, mushrooms, and spinach!!

Awesome atmosphere and incredible small plates! Haven't had dinner there yet but sure we will.   I'm going back just for the bread and pesto--amazing!!   Boyfriend had the chicken flatbread with pine nuts  and it was great

Loved our meal out on the beautiful patio. Mediterranean salad was great and the sweet potato pasta was out of this world-a must order if you like the sweet taste. Salmon was just ok-nothing special. Kid's each ordered flatbread pizza and delicious buttered noodles. Not your typical kid's menu items-high quality. Bread and pesto was uhhmazing that you get complimentary. Friendly staff, hot spot in town!

Such an amazing cuisine and atmosphere!   Loved the design and vibe there have going. The food is amazing! Definitely recommend a reservation.   Our server was Dan and boy was he awesome. We went with my parents and we was really sweet with my father "jokes" haha.   You have to try the Chiefs Sample Board, it's so yummy and so different combos of flavor. I had the Natural Chicken for dinner as it's Gluten Free. (That's another bonus, there is Vegetarian & Gluten Free options available)   My dad called ahead and order a Gluten Free Dessert and it was fantastic. I definitely recommend this place and I can't wait to go back.
Sandwiches have no taste. Leave at least 15 min to get your sandwich. Better to get the grab and go and bypass the people making sandwiches. Bad bad

Haven't had dinner at O&I in quite a while and was very pleased with the Watermelon Salad (with avocado, goat cheese, red chili gremolata) that I enjoyed. True Foods has a delish watermelon/heirloom tomato salad on their menu, so I asked my server to add heirlooms to my salad. It came out FANTASTIC! I almost licked the plate! The light vinegairette dressing complimented by the red chili gremolata was a perfect balance of sweet and spicy. Very light and refreshing starter or meal.

I've only been here during Happy Hour (Mon-Fri 3-6pm) , I've tried a few of the Flatbreads and both the Red and White Sangria. The White Sangria tastes like white gummy bears so I was pumped about that.  The Flatbreads are $9 (during Happy Hour) which in my opinion is a little steep considering they aren't that big or that great. Even if I were starving and desperate, I'd still be a bit disappointed.   Here's the thing, this place like most Fox Restaurants is about the decor, ambiance and providing a "cool "experience. Never have I ever been to a Fox Restaurant and tasted food that made me want to go back.   It's a "cool" place to hang out, they also have a fun patio area but, I wouldn't recommend it for its culinary wonders or value for money.

What a great experience trying this place for the first time this past weekend!  If you've read my other reviews, you know I don't give 5 stars all that often. This place surprised me and delivered more than I expected.  Let's start with the food. My family and I decided to get a few small plates instead of ordering entrees.  We ordered the Fritto Misto, Lamb Meatballs, Seasonal Chef's Board and a half order of the Chicken Chopped Salad.  All were wonderful!  If I had to pick my favorite, I'd have to go with the salad.  One of the best salads I've ever had!  Who knew granola in a salad would work so well?  Our waiter was so personable and friendly.  I wish I could remember his name.  He gave good recommendations, checked on us frequently and was super attentive.  Great service goes a long way!  I will definitely be back soon.  Can't wait to try some more items off their menu!

Great Atmosphere!! We always go sit on the patio for drinks. Very nice :) I think the food here is good, but it's overpriced, in my opinion (which of course this review is ;) ). We come here often just for the atmosphere and sangria. Pitcher of sangria is $20, which I think is a good deal here.

Sunday brunch w the fam. Egg sandwich, caramel apple pancakes, scrambled eggs w bacon, biscuits and gravy, and cinnamon roll. Oh yeah, delicious peach Bellini. Awesome pesto, devoured it. Everything was delicious. We all kept eating after we were full. Cool atmosphere.

One of the best help food alternatives I've seen any airport. They have a massive cinnamon rolls drowning in several different types of sugar creamed toppings. There are many healthy drinks fresh healthy sandwiches and a great selection of grapes. I like most about it is the protein smoothie. Reasonable priced a good size and very tasty. This is perfect for meal on the run in between flights! I will remember this my next time through this airport. Prices of moderate for the other items on the menu much lower than typical airport food. The staff was friendly and they bring the food out. A hidden gem are the power outlets on the hightops, be careful easy to miss because they have ground covers for the outlets

This is a great spot to go for an afternoon drink after walking around downtown Scottsdale.   Great place to see the beautiful people of Scottsdale, if you enjoy people watching!  I loved sitting outside enjoying the wonderful weather. We had hummus and pita, which sounds boring, but it was so incredible!!   The complimentary freshly made bread with pesto was also amazing.   Their signature mule drink was light and refreshing.

This was the only restaurant that I didn't Yelp before trying it out.  My friends & I didn't make reservations at Cowboy Ciao so the wait was ridiculously long for a group of 9 hungry people.  We decided to take a walk around the bridge area until we noticed Olive & Ivy.  The music, lights, & patio was all it took to draw us in there for dinner.  My first thought?  Vegas ultra lounge.  There whole room was lit by candles & low-hanging lamps that appeared to drip from the ceiling like taper candles.    Most of the crowd was around the huge bar that encompassed the entrance of the restaurant or by their personal firepits in the patio so the restaurant area was open for my huge party to be seated promptly.  The free bread was so soft that I was surprised to find out it was foccacia.  It was accompanied by this basil/olive oil type of dipping sauce.  My end of the table had to quit after 3 refills because we wouldn't have any room for our meal.    I had the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin w/ risotto & swiss chard.  OMFG...I was at a loss for words.  The crisy bacon with the juicy pork tenderloin combined with that barley risotto in some brown sauce was all it took to numb my vocal chords to prevent from wasting all that energy on talking, rather than putting it to use to chew & savor my meal.  Although I wish I had ordered the Nero d' Avola like my friend to pair with my meal, I had instead used my white sangria to wash it all down.  It didn't pair well but it also didn't overpower my meal, which was the most important part.  I completed my meal with a 'Spanish Fly' which is a martini with raspberry sorbet, Grey Goose, & some other juice that I really can't remember at the moment.  It seems odd to see the scoop of raspberry sorbet make its way to the top when the martini is poured but just one sip will send you to paradise.    Oh & FYI...I barely noticed the 'marketplace'.

Solid food, great service.  I had the filet and it was cooked medium rare, to perfection,  This is probably the tenth time I've been here and the food has never dissapointed.  Solid menu, good service, great beverages.  If you're looking for a night out with your significant other or just a night out with friends, whether eating or just drinking, Olive & Ivy is a place to go.

We came to Olive & Ivy for my friend's bachelorette party his past weekend and we were all so pleased with the ambience, food, and amazing service!  We had a group of 9 and ordered the bacon wrapped dates (with sausage filling), artichoke hearts, and the white and red sangria for the table. Upon seeing that we were there for a bachelorette, the waiter brought us a round of shots!  Some girls in our group are pescatarian and vegan, and the waiter and chefs prepared breaking/dairy on the side for our appetizers and food. I really was impressed by the accommodations they made for us. Not to mention - they brought out cake and a scoop of sorbet for the bride-to-be!!   Highly recommend this restaurant for group events or even for a romantic dinner. Next time I'm in AZ, I'll definitely revisit!

I've frequented Olive & Ivy several times and always had a great experience, until the last time on Sunday night. Don't get me wrong, that experience was great in the moment too - until I got home and began projectile vomiting from the food poisoning I got from the seared scallops. On the plus side, I lost 4 pounds, so there's that. Two stars for previous good experiences, no stars for puking for 17 hours straight.

Sunday afternoon for "brunch." Too noisy to carry on any type of conversation. Slow service. My food was ordinary, and the portion looked more like a side dish. Offensively small and therefore very overpriced. I couldn't wait to get out of there. I see several good reviews, but I cannot understand what all the fuss is about.

Olive and Ivy gets four stars for decor, atmosphere, location and overall food. But for me, I wouldn't say Olive and Ivy has the best food in Scottsdale for the price. I been here three times, and tried appetizers, entrees and desserts.   Let's talk about the wine menu, it is expansive with various wines avialable by the bottle or glass. Also O & I does have a specialty drink menu. I think the chopped chicken salad is better than the Meditteranean.. The bread they give you is light and served with a thick pesto sauce, and is very delicious.   The patio is great. As we get to the close of the fall, spring and winter season, heading into summer, get out on that patio asap. It is on the Scottsdale Waterfront, and they have misters and nice patio decor. Very relaxing, "upscale" feeling place.  Also, they do have a small market, with food available to go, made-to-order and wine  available. I might check that out for lunch one day. I'm always tempted to raid the market before I go home, but I haven't yet.  One thing that jades my experience evertyime I've been to O & I is the hostesses. They usually have a weird attitude, and it seems like they are doing you a favor by seating you.  Waiters/Waitresses are always great, and I love their style!   This is a great place to take family or go on a special day.
Sit on the patio. The ambiance is amazing. The food and drinks were good, but the sitting on the patio made the night. They had a live DJ who was one of the best I've heard in a while.

We had a really awesome time when we came in Friday night. We had a reservation but came early and they were flexible about seating us early. We ordered some drinks and an appetizer of Bacon Wrapped dates. Highly recommend the Pomegranate Daquiri and the Evangelista. We also ordered a bruschetta board with Manchego, Mishroom and Salmon Lox. The flavor combinations were unique (manchego and quince is quite tasty). We ordered the Atlantic salmon and the Sea scallops. I definitely loved the bread that came out along with the pesto. The bread was soft and chewy and the pesto had a good subtle tang. The scallops were perfectly cooked and the creamed corn and bacon combination you would think would be a heavy addition but I enjoyed every bite and was comfortably satisfied with the portion. The dessert is definitely the best with the Peanut butter mousse with chocolate crust (high recommendation). It's light and airy and the saltiness of peanut butter complemented the chocolate crust. Our waitress (Yvonne I believe was her name) was very attentive and gave great recommendations! I would highly recommend this restaurant :)

Much needed lunch date with my good friend!  Olive and Ivy is always a great idea. The food is delicious - always consistent. The patio is very comfortable and I love the lights and trees.   My go to is  the bacon cheese burger & of course the bread and pesto . Jason was our server today. You should request him, he's very easy going and pleasant. He  provided great service and everything was wonderful.   I need to come here more often!  Wish they sold the bread and pesto in the market area!

Awesome place even for vegetarians! I m a vegetarian who takes no egg, no meat, no fish. And this place served awesome pesto and bread :) we ordered flat bread - veg, bruschetta - veg. It was all great!! The waitress here are good too, she helped us make our choices.  Fine dine, with great ambience.  A must try place :)

Overall great service I had 3 waiters come up to me and ask me if anyone had taken my order my food was delivered in a timely manner. I had the pasta which was pretty good it had slightly more lemon flavor that I would have liked but not too much where it was unbearable. Overall it was a good experience. Thanks Olive & Ivy

My mom and I came here for first time and it was awesome! We walked in and got seated right away. Our waiter (Lonnie) came up immediately and got us some drinks. The space is good, decor is pretty & food is awesome! We got the cinnamon roll and hummus to start. The cinnamon roll tasted just as good as it smelled! It's hard to find a cinnamon roll with the perfect balance and this one definitely has it! The hummus had awesome, bold flavors. I ordered the Eggs Benedict and I have to say, it's one of the best I've ever had. My mom got the egg sandwich and that was just as good!  We'll definitely be coming back here again! One of the best experiences we've had and our waiter was amazing !

I've been here a couple times for lunch, happy hour and dinner. I love the atmosphere here --whatever time of day you decide to stop by.   My favorite thing is their calamari, the dipping sauce that comes with it is so good! The bacon wrapped dates are good too. I order scallops for my entree, very tasty but other than that, everything else is good but nothing stands out for me.   I recommend going on restaurant week so you can try a 3 course meal for a good price!

We made a reservation for Olive & Ivy, since we had heard such great things. We did have to wait 20 minutes even with a reservation, which was frustrating, but it may have been that they were trying to honor our patio request. Nevertheless, it was worth the wait! The patio was a gorgeous atmosphere! The waitress was friendly and went through the favorites on the menu. We ordered wine and bruschetta to start--quite good! We thought 3 bruschetta for $11 was a fair price. They also brought bread and pesto dipping sauce.  The food was very good. The leg of lamb was excellent, as was the chicken scallopini.  It was a relaxing meal, especially sitting out on the patio with the canal in the background.  Definitely make a reservation for weekend dinners, as it is always busy.
This place gets customer service! The little details make all the difference and they notice details.  The ambiance is energetic and rejuvenating and the concept is unique.  Love their food as well!
I enjoyed my Saturday evening at Olive & Ivy's outdoor patio.  Food, wine, location are ok to me.  I will definitely go back to this place and will enjoy wine and great food at outside patio.

Destination amazing. Our server Kelley made our whole dining experience extremely grand. He explained the lunch menu thoroughly. Not sure why- the food is grand but the menu is vague. The Red Sangria and Mojito are positively refreshing. Lasagna bolognese contains fresh made noodles. I watched the chef roll those delightful starchy chains right out of the machine. We are thrilled to have ended our Labor Day at this location. Without question we will be back and we will bring our friends. Nice break from the ordinary dining experience.  Atmosphere is beautiful and unique. Peanut butter mouse-fascinating-hard chocolate, light mouse and an airy powder.

Went tonight to celebrate my niece heading off to college, and my daughter's new promotion at work.  Got there early, and went to the bar for a drink. Bartenders were not very friendly, and ignored my order. Asked for a martini on the rocks with 3 olives, and got a straight up with 2 olives. (Didn't know how to make a martini)  never asked how I was doing, and if I needed anything else.  Food was delicious, and our server was very nice.  Overall had a great time, but will never sit at the bar again. Stayed with wine the rest of the night.
We've been here several times. The happy hour is great, $5 sangria, $3 bruchettas and $8 flat bread. And they're all pretty tasty.

I absolutely love this restaurant- it's one of my favs! The kid serving icecream in the grocery area is a total jerk though. Had I not been to olive & ivy before, and enjoyed my experience every single time previously, he would have truly put a damper on my experience. I let him know how rude he was & he suddenly told me that English was hard for him, since he was from Switzerland- when he had been speaking crystal clear (and perfectly rude) English up until then. Regardless, management should be aware of his Unprofessionalism and attitude.
I would come back here. Great food, cocktail, and beer menu. A bit pricey but the food was worth it. Excellent service and ambiance.

Although the address is on Camelback it really is south off Marshall Way. There is a free underground garage immediately North of the restaurant. Very large restaurant with a lot of outside seating  The pesto they bring out to start was outstanding (see photo) Antipasto was very good also. A lot of prosciutto (see photo) Atlantic salmon was excellent Spicy shrimp was not too spicy.  Fox Restaurants 1. Olive and Ivy (Scottsdale) 2. True Foods 3. North Italia (Phoenix) 4. The Henry 5. Blanco Tacos (Phoenix) 6. Little Cleos 7. The Greene House (Scottsdale)

I love Olive and Ivy. It is a tried and true staple, always the first place I bring an out of town visitor.    The ambience inside is warm and charming, open and friendly, and classy.  I loove thier lighting it is just so inviting.  Tables are spaced nicely, the bar has great seating and not too packed in that area either.  You can order a meal at the bar without feeling like you're knocking elbows with the person next to you.  The outside of Olive and Ivy is my favorite though.  The social hour seating fills up QUICK - get there early.  There are comfy big chairs and couches right outside the waterfront.  It is my favorite sitting spot in all of scottsdale to eat drink and dine.  For food -- I've come here plenty, and here's my two cents. Skip the apps, share a salad with a friend, and enjoy an entree. I keep coming back to the veal ravioli, it is just heavenly and perfect.  There is arugula on top with a light cream sauce which isn't too heavy at all. I have to force myself to explore the menu because this dish is just so good.  Last time I was here I was trying to stick to my diet, I ordered the salmon and subbed spinach instead of thier regular side.  The dish was perfect, salmon was grilled to perfection, a real fresh piece of fish. It was generous too (more generous portion than the ravioli) - and I actually ended up taking some home. My mom ordered the Cioippino, which was flavorful, a generous portion, and very good also.  I also love their scallop entree.  I don't eat a ton of red meat, but I went with a friend one time who ordered the steak and pretty much devoured it.    As for drinks -- thier sangria is amaze! Stick with the red one.  Honestly I'm writing this right now, a warm February day in Arizona, and want to leave work to sit outside and eat my lunch in pure bliss at Olive and Ivy. I have a day off later this week and will make sure I stop by.  I simply cannot get enough of this place.

We were disappointed that we were unable to get outdoor seating but our waiter Easton made us overlook that part. We ordered drinks and bruschetta since we were walking around sampling different restaurants. Easton had personality, he was friendly and was very efficient. The bruschetta was delicious and the bread  and pesto that Easton brought out was tasty as well. Next time, I'm making reservations to sit outside.
Beautiful decor and ambiance. The bruschettas were a pleasant surprise. Waiter was friendly, knowledgeable and quick.
Management staff is great, Jimmy Rowe is our absolute favorite!!! He is always so helpful and welcoming and makes our experience so incredible! -Ems & Libs & Ali!

we happened upon Olive & Ivy while touring scottsdale yesterday, and needed a lunch spot quick (we love to eat, and when we get together, its basically an eating festival).  we took a look at the menu and decided to go for the cheaper option of the counter service were i got a $7 salad of mixed greens, two cherry tomatoes and an ice cream scoop of tuna.  it was okay. it did the trick.  my friend ate a curry chicken pita which looked excellent and which she enjoyed.    our server/cashier girl was very nice and suggested a drink that my friend tried and liked. and she was quick with the service, so all in all, a good experience. i wouldn't particularly call this place mediterranean, but it's definitely targeting rich people who care about having 8 different brands of bottled water to choose from.

Went for Sunday brunch after morning rains so the patio was closed. They should switch entrances so the restaurant comes before the market. Kinda confusing for the first time visitor.  The restaurant itself is very nicely decorated with a classy feel.  It's a varied clientele: I noticed tables that could've been from the Golden Girls to Real Housewives of Scottdale to Teen Mom, AZ.  I thought the food, while good, was not anything spectacular. Portions were pretty small for the price and there was not much by way of presentation to match the tag.  My sangria seemed a bit diluted.  Our waiter was being trained so I'll pardon his awkwardness as he tried to repeat everything he was supposed to memorize multiple times. I'd come back on a cool day to try HH out on the patio to people watch, but probably not for brunch.
I had the traditional breakfast.  It was ok, nothing really great to say about the eggs, toast and potatoes.  Now after I finished I should have got the smoothie.

Went there on a Saturday for brunch and sat on the patio, it was comfortable and the misters felt great. Besides getting pooped on by a bird from the trees overhead, the pesto was yummy and bread was nice and soft. I ordered the Rosemary potato and soft egg flatbread that was delicious! My husband really liked his eggs benedict. My niece ordered the French toast and we all agreed that it really tasted like a jelly donut, In a good way! The Bloody Mary was fresh. I hope to go back next time we are in town.

I used to eat here all the time when it first opened up but got spoiled with all the great dining in my area, central Phoenix and quit making the trip to Scottsdale.  So this past Sunday we decided to journey up to Scottsdale for Sunday brunch.  I notice that the dining area has become more formal than it used to be but the atmosphere and food are still fantastic.  Their peach bellini's are yummy and all the food super delicious!

Olive & Ivy is always packed due to their delicious food, atmosphere, and great prices. The few times that I have been there the staff has always gone out of their way to accomodate my group of friends. I highly recommend the lasagna there!

After receiving a very genuine response from Olive and Ivy, I clearly feel it's necessary to update my review I wrote when I was 'hangry' (hungry and angry).   Apparently I just need to request a certain amount of focaccia, though I truly don't need more than one piece (maybe they were just trying to prevent me from binge eating? If so, you guys are very thoughtful). I do know that in the past they were much more generous with their servings, so I was kind of hoping they would assume if I'm ordering it, that I definitely would love as much as possible ;-)   I realize I sound like a lunatic ranting about this, but just think of this bread and pesto as a drug (because it's truly addictive) and I clearly need my fix...haha  Moral of the story: their bread and pesto is so good that some people will actually freak out if they aren't given more than one serving :-) (or maybe that's just me...)
The sweet potato cannelloni is to die for. Everything about this place is so amazing. The wait is always long but for good reason. So make reservations!

The mozzarella bruschetta and Lamb meatballs were both very tastey. The dark chocolate creme brulle was an excellent finish.  The gem of this restaurant for me was the ambience out on the outside couches. I relaxed there for over an hour people watching and enjoying the April weather in Phx.
Excellent brunch, beautiful day and smart service! The focaccia pesto with a Bloody Mary chaser is a delightful start. The bird calls in the courtyard patio are annoying.

I don't really know how to start with my review of Olive & Ivy, this place is special to me because it's been where I have celebrated my friends engagement, where I rang in 2014, where I went with friends for lunch and for an outdoor brunch or two during the beautiful Arizona days. The atmosphere is spot on, the patio is fabulous and all in all they have the perfect set up here, oh and the food and drink is AWESOME!

The restaurant is really a beautiful restaurant. Beautiful views of the canal and patio lights. We were seated nexted to the window by the door and it was cold. We asked to be moved to another table and it was still cold. My husband had a sweater over a shirt and I had a thick cardigan. But we were determined to have a nice dinner. It was my birthday and our first time here. We ordered the sangria and artichoke appetizer. Which is a salad and very good. Artichoke hearts and baby field greens, light balsamic dressing. We thought it was a little strange we had to tell the waiter we were ready to order at this point. We were left a time waiting for our food.  Also the music was blaring to the point I wished I was sitting on the patio. Which had heaters at every table. I ordered half a beet salad, delicious. And the Bass with caramelized cauliflower. Also very good. My husband had lasagna and he said it was delicious. I would like to come back and eat on the beautiful patio next time. But my husband pretty much has crossed this restaurant off his list. We both agreed their food was delicious.

I really really really enjoy all of the 90. Every time I go to Phoenix I stop by this restaurant and have their amazing bruschetta, Seabass, or steak dinners. The last time we went our waitress was very accommodating and allowed us to split multiple plates. My friend and I enjoyed our surf and turf meal and also enjoyed the bruschetta.  The atmosphere and the Decour were very appealing to me and my coworkers. We are going to continue to come back to this restaurant.

Good little resturant in terminal 4, gate A. Line goes quick and while waiting you can choose your drinks in a refrigerator (not just soda; they have coconut waters, water, and others).   The menu is great!!!. Paninis, salads, pizza I think and all amazing choices to choose. I'm a vegetarian, so having those chooses on the menu immediately gives me their vote. The menu is not extravagant, which is good for a person traveling.   Also, great java choices if your not looking for food !!! Mmmmm

One of my favorite fox concepts.  Great open air restaurant and outside seating area.  The pesto with bread appetizer is really good, brunch is best here and the breakfast sandwich is off the hook.  The mushroom flat bread with truffle oil is my favorite thing at olive and ivy and service was good.

This place is amazing! You can't go wrong with Fox restaurants. The chefs really know how to pair ingredients well and the dishes are so unique.  We went there to celebrate our anniversary and our server treated us to dessert   You just can't beat free food   Not only was the food and our server amazing but the atmosphere there is always fun and cheery! Highly recommend the scallops!

I'm literally SO obsessed!!   I went there by chance on a Saturday and I had the tomato and spinach flatbread. Oh my gosh it was so good! The bread was all made fresh so the cheese just melted all over it. The staff is so sweet and friendly. The first time one of my girlfriend's and I went there we were so impressed at how sweet ( and cute ) all the waiters were... ;)  The next day we went there at 7am for breakfast and yet again the breakfast was to die for. We both had an egg and avocado kinda sandwich.  For lunch you have to try the simple green salad. I believe it was only $5 or so and it was SO BIG!   But for sure when you go you have to have to have to get the vanilla latte.. I have no idea why it is but its the best I've ever had!   Last but not least.. the atmosphere is so beautiful. The patio is amazing( fountain and trees and birds), and the inside seating is so cozy.   I feel like Im at a french cafe for breakfast but at lunch/diner I feel like I'm in Italy eating the best flatbread ever.  Must try for sure especially if you live in Scottsdale Waterfront.. just right across the street! :)
Josh and Conrad were awesome at Olive and Ivy tonight! It was our first time at this restaurant and it was awesome in every way! Thanks for the great first of many visits!!

This has to be my favorite Fox Foods Chain of Restraunts. The atmosphere is lively. Food is consistently good and they are very accomodating for food allergies. Drinks were very good and the gelato is even better.  OLIVE & IVY has a beautiful out door cafe area whether your dressed casual or putting on the Ritz you will feel comfortable. They also have a quick grab and go Bistro area  if you are in the mood for coffee latte and pastry.You will not be disappointed!

Super cool ambience! Noise level pretty high so not great for a quiet, romantic dinner. Food was good as well as the service. Kitchen made a mistake on one of the entrees and immediately credited our bill. Would definitely go back!

We usually end up here for breakfast, and they have always done a good job.  It's a small menu, but there is something for everyone.  If you want a Bloody Mary or mimosa, they can help you out.  If you're in recovery mode, the cafe has some Gatorade and other options.  The patio is beautiful, and I highly recommend getting a table there unless it's too hot outside.

Olive & Ivy offers a creative and exciting menu.  I have tried many of the items and have been pleased with all of them.  The food is fresh, the staff is very friendly and knowledgeable and the prices off a good value.  The location I decent as long as it is not during the holiday season (too much shopping traffic!).    The only thing that would make this a better rating from my perspective is the acoustics.  It can be very noisy and difficult to hear the people you are dining with.  Other than that, love this restaurant!

We got to the restaurant early but we could not be saeted for one hour . There is a beautiful lounge next to the waterfront.thecwaitress was attentive but it was cold wecrequested that the  heater get turned on but itvran out of gas. The fish we ordered was good but portion was small I had to order extra bread to get filled up. The c italian soup I ordered eas good but look warm. I akso tried their lasagna better portion but wery salty. The service was good at all times

My favorite new Restaurant! My server Josh was phenomenal...best service ever great recommendations..,the food was so fresh and amazing!! Get the Chicken Chopped Salad with the Peanut Granola so so good!  I will definitely be back when I'm in town and will recommend olive and ivy to anyone who's visiting Scottsdale for the best food and awesome service from Josh!!!!   Also sit on the patio, what a beautiful atmosphere - I felt like I was in France!  I can't wait to come back to eat here again!

I have dined here many times, and would highly recommend it.  The prices are great, the staff is friendly, and the food is amazing; I have never been served a meal that I didn't enjoy!  Overall great food, staff, prices, location, and atmosphere, please try it and you will be a regular like me in no time!

If you'd like to go on a date to be insulted by a group of hostesses, this is the place!  Rude, snobby and pretentious!  A friend recommended the place for a date night but these ladies were less than inviting upon entry and suggested we eat in the lounge area because we didn't have a reservation at 6 on a Thursday night.  We went to the area and there was nowhere to sit.  We had to come back in to yet another rude hostess, "you don't have a reservation or a name you left?", uh no we were here two seconds when you pointed us to the lounge to eat dinner!  I would not ever recommend this place even though the food was ok and server was better then the hostesses, the negative over made up ladies up front made it so awful!

If you're hear for the food you'll be taken care of but I gotta tell you that the bar area has some of the worst service.  This is the 2nd time I went in here to have a drink and both times the bartenders didn't seem aware of their customers.  I finally had to flag one down just for a drink. .this place is worth going back to however I'll skip the bar next time.

The vibe of this restaurant is definitely worth coming back for. They had a live DJ, great happy smiling service, and of course being on the Scottsdale waterfront is a plus too.   I came here with a reservation of 8. We were 30 minutes late but when we called to let them know, they were super understanding and held the table for us even though the restaurant was very busy. All food comes with unlimited bread and pesto, but you can ask for olive and vinegar too - so yummy.   I ordered the wild mushroom pappardelle because my server had recommended it. It was somewhat bland and the noodles were hard to eat, but my boyfriend ordered the chicken scallopini with mashed potatoes and that was delicious. Two of my friends ordered their bruschetta (3 for $13) but looking at the portions/toppings/prices, I'd much prefer going to postino for that instead.   Overall it was a nice experience. Nothing on the menu really stuck out to me, but the restaurant environment made up for that.
Superb simple sandwiches with FLAVOR. I was very impressed. The roast beef sandwich is to die for - the beef is shaved extra thin, bread is toasty. I was pleasantly surprised overall.

WOW!    Yesterday was my birthday and my husband told me to pick a place to go for dinner. I wanted to go somewhere that was different, that wasn't too fancy, but was also a little more upscale.  I remembered that I was sent a coupon for a free desert at any Fox Concepts Restaurants.  I was really ping-ponging between Olive & Ivy and another restaurant in Phoenix.  I'm glad that I picked Olive & Ivy because I was so impressed and the food was AMAZING!    This place has an awesome atmosphere. They had a live DJ, their windows/doors were open. It's really a "grand" space. The menu is fairly simple, which I understand changes fairly often.  I ordered the sea scallops with polenta and my husband had a salad. I was amazed at how yummy my dish was. (I've never had polenta before so I hope it all tastes like this one!) My husbands salad looked really good too, I even had to have a few bites.  After dinner I ordered the lemon pudding cake. Oh. Em. Gee!  The cake was so light and fluffy and just amazing.    I have to checkout the other restaurant that I decided against next!!!

It took us awhile to get back but we did and brought out of town guests. On another hot day the patio was comfortable. We had an excellent waiter. It was brunch again. I enjoyed my flatbread. My wife enjoyed her burger. One guest enjoyed her eggs Benedict. Another enjoyed her kale salad. The peanut butter mouse was great and the lemon gelato was too we were told.  We should return more often.

I love Olive and ivy marketplace. Great place to hang outside and have a coffee during the day or hang out at night and have gelato. The breakfast at the marketplace is very good. I usually build my own omelette.

Olive and Ivy is a trendy Scottsdale spot with tasty food, loud music and good service. The atmosphere is pretty cool - large bar up front, huge open patio and cool lanterns hanging over head. It's a bit deceiving if you enter through the dessert bar area because it looks like a little grocery store - it's definitely not.   The food tasted great and was presented nicely without being ridiculously pricey. I didn't have any ice cream, but it looked really tasty.
