The service was very good and the drinks were delish (try a raspberry mojito - mmm). We went in on a Friday night without reservations and had to wait a solid 1.5 hours - make reservations.   This is a great spot if you like to be surrounded by 30-something hipsters or older men and women trying to be hip. I liked that the tables weren't piled on top of each other, but it was still crowded. There was a pretty good vibe -- I'd definitely go back next time I'm in Scottsdale.

Olive and Ivy is such a find in the Phx airport. Great prices ($4.00 for a glass of decent Chard), good food, super friendly staff, cool music and outlets under every seat...made for a pleasant 2 hour wait.
Nice place and very friendly staff. The girl taking my order was really helpful and sweet

I came here with HIGH expectations. Just being honest! Many people have raved about this place-so I was expecting a GREAT food experience.  I waited for a friend at the bar. My Desert Blossom cocktail was pretty good. I would def order again. My friend was a tad late, so they gave away my reservation. Atleast they were nice about it, and seated us 6 minutes later. We were seated close to the open kitchen, service was good. I just didn't feel the food was so outstanding. The food arrived almost immediately, which in a way is good, but really makes me wonder if it was freshly made.  I think part of the issue is that sitting outdoors when it gets dark adds to the ambience, magical twinkling lights. I didn't feel the seating inside really had great ambience, so I might give this place another try in the fall.  Our fritto mist was OK, not great. My salad was great, but def not the best meditteranean salad i have ever had. Artichokes.. OK.....  I'll put this one on my back up list to try again.
This place is all around great! Atmosphere, food and service! I've been coming here for many years and never have been disappointed! Great for date night, girls night dinner and happy hour!

We ordered the scallops and loved them so much we went back for a second round.  We also ordered the butchers block , one night was better than the other so I would like to see some consistency with that . We also ordered bacon wrapped dates, they were good but not amazing and we loved the lamb meatballs and  enjoyed desert, peanut butter mousse.

What a wonderful place to eat!! I had company on town and we took them to olive and ivy for brunch. I had the garden flat bread and it was amazing!! My husband had the best tuna salad sandwich we have ever had!!  My guests had a Mediterranean salad which I did sneak a taste of and loved.  Our server Courtney was wonderful! I will Absoutly be back!!  Yummy!!!
Excellent food and service! Always a fun place to visit!

I really enjoy this place. The food is good, reasonable priced and they have great ambiance. The servers and hostesses are super friendly and helpful. I got the lamb gryo with a side salad and it was good. i was stuffed for the day! They also are really nice to my crazy 1 and 2 year old kids. Most restaurants are not accommodating but they were and i appreciate that.
Went for my birthday and was not let down. We had such a great time. Amazing service!!! It was so cozy and inviting, but still elegant. Thanks for making my birthday that much better!

Last minute real for 15 and they were able to accommodate us in a really nice private room. Very pretty decor and the service was on point. Food was good and very reasonable. Liked the sea bass and the flat bread. Must get the lemon tres leche cake!!

I'm a big happy hour fan and the only time I have  to make it in that window is during vacation. From 4-6pm, Olive and Ivy has $5 wine/drink specials and a small plates menu. If you happen to be there, please try the Asparagus and Wild Mushroom flatbread with truffle oil and the Italian Sausage Polenta.  To this day, I am still  dreaming about it.  As it is in the waterfront area of Scottsdale, the restaurant decor is absolutely beautiful. No matter where you sit inside a hundred hanging lamps looking at bottles of wine or the bright green outdoor space with a fountain, sipping a glass of Cab in your hands, you will feel like a million bucks! I gave it 5 stars for their bang for the buck happy hour, $25 between 2 people is a winner to me. Perfect place to end my January vacation, especially knowing I have to return to the frozen tundra or as most folks know it to be as Chicago.
The best dinner, fabulous deserts, awesome atmosphere and Daniel is soooooo adorable!  Best server I have had in my life!!!

One of the best pork dishes ever. My wife's ribeye was outstanding. All the food was top shelf. My favorite in Phoenix will go back next time I'm in town.  A little noisy but everything else was so good.

Busy lunch time crowd, noisy. Great menu & interesting coctails. Gyro was tasty, but lacked authenticity. Chopped chicken salad was very good but not remarkable. Service was good for how busy they were. The real treat was sitting @ chef's table and watching the intricate workings of the busy kitchen. Tickets spitting out in 3 feet ribbons, dealt out like cards to the staff & then reassembled as meals.
Excellent place and came highly recommended by the hotel staff. Our waitress, Micki was amazing and knew what to suggest based on our questions. The food (sea bass) and ambiance were great too.

They really knock it out of the park here. Every plate is a slide into home plate. From the chicken to the vegetarian options, you can't go wrong!  The restaurant itself is gorgeous. They have dangling lights from the ceiling. A true piece of art. On weekend nights they often have a DJ and on weeknights the area around the restaurant has events going on that are nice to walk off after dinner.   If you want a cocktail, I highly recommend the red sangria. It is out of this world. The dirty martinis are also a notable choice.   The service is just as fantastic as the food.   If you're not in the mood for a sit down meal, they also have a café/deli area that you can pop into for a quick to-go order if need be.

I enjoy coming to Olive & Ivy for the few times that I've been here. Be sure to try their complimentary bread with pesto sauce! The pesto sauce that they use is fresh and is amazing. So far for lunch I've had the Margherita flatbread and the Turkey Grinder sandwich, both were excellent. Prices are very reasonable as well considering the quality and effort that they put into their food.  The atmosphere is great as well and I loved the interior decor.

We came here in February, so the outdoor patio was lovely. The service was decent but a little slow. The appetizers were good - we especially enjoyed the brushetta selection and the bacon-wrapped dates. The lamb meatballs were pretty bland and tasteless though. We were with a large group so there were a variety of things ordered. However, I ordered the tuna and it was too salty. I didn't enjoy the flavor at all. My husband ordered the gnocchi, and while it was pretty tasty (although a little too rich for me) - it was a TINY portion and he ended up finishing up the bread to have a whole meal. For the price, the general consensus was that most meals were too small. Someone else had the chicken though, and that was good. The desserts were good overall, but again not great. Most of us had a scoop of sorbet, and for the price ($1.75) that seemed a good deal and just enough to finish the meal. The table also ordered the ice cream bar and while it was tasty it was also rock-hard and difficult to cut even with the steak knife they provided. Overall this place is decent but I would imagine that Scottsdale has better options.
Here's a tip that could improve your experience. The restaurant is very loud inside but the patio has a great ambiance. Try to eat on the canal patio!

This is a trendy restaurant. Food is ok not great, especially for the prices charged. We did have a friendly server and I always appreciate that. Lunch menu is very limited compared to the dinner menu. I would only go back for dinner.

I love their brunch and their dinner! The food is so flavorful and delicious. Most recently I had their watermelon salad, which was so refreshing for the beginning of spring in Phoenix. I love the location on the waterfront, which can be enjoyed from their large, shaded patio.

We were in town for the weekend for the Rock-n-Roll marathon, wanted a relaxing (good energy) outdoor restaurant with amazing food, and we found exactly that, it was so amazing that we had gone back 3X, twice for dinner and once for lunch on this same trip.  My favorite meal was the kale salad with caramelized pecans, bleu cheese, chopped bacon, mixed with a zesty orange/balsamic vinaigrette dressing --I added chicken the first night and ahi tuna the second night. Its a MUST have. The cannelloni with mushrooms were tasty, a bit too heavy and creamy on the sauce and the bruschettas (on the appetizer menu) were also on the top list.  The wait staff are super friendly, I couldn't forget to mention the female manager that helped us out immensely as we were in dire need of charging our iphone, she was professional and so accommodating. Thank you so very much.   I work in the service industry and appreciate a nice meal with good service and this was by far my favorite restaurant in Scottsdale. We will definitely come back.
I am thrilled Olive & Ivy is in the airport.  Delicious breakfasts, friendly staff, and good coffee drinks.  Beats the hell out of Burger King.  That stuff will kill ya.

Today I had a lunch meeting at Olive and Ivy. The atmosphere is fun and open. It was not too crowded but busy which is always a good sign.  We sat up at the bar to enjoy the taller seats and watch the world go by.  Our server / bar tender did an excellent job and I would return just to set in her section again.  I had the flat bread!  I would recommend this to anyone as it was loaded with flavor. Their opener of fresh bread and pesto is to die for ... I had a lot of carbs but it was all in the name of good food and of course business.  I look forward to my next visit.  This is another one of the Fox Restaurant Concepts and they are always a fine place to eat!
This was our first time here at Olive and Ivy. The service, food and atmosphere was amazing. The food was so good hard to put into words. Next time in town will be dropping in for more great food.

Olive & Ivy really impressed me. As I read the lower reviews and scan the pictures, I understand why my experience was so different.   I was here for a dinner celebration, but we didn't order any flatbreads or sandwiches. Instead, we had a wine and dine experience.   Rib eye - medium rare - perfectly cooked and seasoned with crisp oven potatoes. Big eye tuna - seared only - with leeks and roasted mushrooms. Pork tenderloin - wrapped in bacon. Free range chicken - with English peas and a citrus sauce. Beet salad Fresh mozzarella Fig and prosciutto bruschetta  Everything was decadent and delicious. Good wine selection, I had the Albarino.  Waiters were young and handsome; service was on point. Open kitchen, bodega aisle, and waterfront seating option. Prices were shockingly low for a beautiful restaurant.

First off, I've got to say that the location and decor of this place is awesome. Great job by whoever is responsible for that. This is a great place for a date, or for brunch with friends on the weekends. The food is excellent and the service is outstanding. I would go more often, but it is a little on the pricy side... but well worth it.

I had a fabulous lunch here on the patio with a girlfriend last week. The weather is FINALLY perfect and their patio is one of the best in the Valley! I could eat their complimentary pesto + bread for my meal and be totally satisfied. YUM! Their Mediterranean Salad with chicken is my FAVORITE! I also recommend the funghi, roasted brussels sprout, and butternut squash bruschetta. Everything is so fresh and delicious. I will absolutely be back soon. Even just for a drink on their gorgeous patio, it is worth the visit. This is also a great place to bring out of town guests so that they can get a good feel of the Scottsdale vibe!

All Style, No Substance...  For all the hype about Olive & Ivy, the food doesn't measure up.  Not sure where the 5 star reviews come from.... not the food for me, nor the service which alternated between crabbiness and nervous hovering. Our patio server didn't want to transfer our check despite the fact we never even received our drinks on the patio before being seated in the restaurant. Our dining room server lingered by our table incessantly, seeming to not know when to approach or interrupt us.   The food was... eh. Although the scallops were cooked perfectly, they had zero flavor.  The spinach was bland and pointless: not cooked, not raw, with some flavorless broth just splashed over. Could that possibly be the sherry syrup? The dish boasted wild mushrooms (two) and crisp pancetta. Is that what those three tiny chunks were? The lemon aceto on the halibut was excruciating. The tuna tartare was absolutely flavorless. Where was the Red Chile Aioli? The pesto flatbread was perhaps the most edible thing of the evening. The affogatto dessert was described as Vanilla Gelato, Stream Lined Espresso and Kahlua Cream. I didn't mind the puddle of espresso with vanilla ice cream melting in the middle but the unsweetened cream on top...? ick. Where was the Kahlua?  Sangria was tasty, but despite paying for a $6.00 large Pellegrino, it disappeared from my table and I only received half a refill. I only drank 1/4 of the bottle, wherever it was.   Cougar alert!!!  Olive & Ivy remains open for its feverish cougar bar scene and patio. It's a shame that the food doesn't merit the incredible building it is served in.

I must hand it to them at Olive and Ivy! First rate atmosphere and food. The pesto is the most flavorful I have ever had and that includes pesto I have eaten in Italy. Wine selection is terrific. The breakfast, lunch and dinners are wonderful. The bar feels a bit like a meat market but that is the only down side. It is beautiful, clean and worth returning to again and again.
Delicious! Scallops for dinner were amazing and gelato is to die for especially at that price!

Lve!!!   The patio is awesome. Occassionally the wind blows and the Waterfront doesn't produce the best of smells ... but the ambiance on the patio more than makes up for it. The wine was amazing, the mediterranean flatbread was awesome, we tried some of the bruschettas that were great. I really love the vibe inside too. We were there on a Sat night and the DJ kicked it up a notch but was not overpowering at all.   I'll def be back!

Although the  food reviews may be stellar, I could just not eat here.    I am not sure what Olive and Ivory wants to be - a restaurant  or  dance club - What I experienced was mor  like a dance club for foodies than an actual restaurant.   I could not hear a word the table server was saying about the menu, and I could not see the menu without a small torch lamp .  What I could read on the menu were not meals , but , rather , experiments in fusions of various traditional world foods.  Good if your into tapas type dining.  This place looked and felt like a snooty pick-up spot devoid of any real sustenance.

I came for the ambience but walked away with so much more.. I did not make reservation for the patio seating but my guest and I still got great table near the patio inside. FYI.. They do have open community seating on the patio if you do not mind sharing your area.   We got the chef's board with wine..It was the perfect way to end long work week and catch up. The variety of different meats/cheeses with nuts were perfect! I was pleasantly surprised by the soft spread cheese drizzled with olive oil, great compliment to hard crusted bread on the board.   If your in the mood for desert they have gelato flavors that will make you want to cheat on your diet!   Lastly they turn on music after 7ish and lower the lights perfect atmosphere to relax and enjoy dinner..

We came and ate in the cafe. The gentleman behind the counter was extremely friendly and helpful. The food was delicious. I had the turkey grinder with a fresh lemonade. My friends got the tuna and grilled cheese. The restaurant is supposed to be very good as well, but is more for someone who wants to sit down and have a nice meal. For a quick and yummy lunch, the cafe is perfect.

What a great surprise. The inside can accommodate a lot of people and yet its not noisy inside. The wait staff was very helpful and had good suggestions. Food was great - its hard deciding what to order.  Get there early because it really fills up as the evening goes on.  Great for dates, large parties or families

So your first class flight lands. You go to check into your hotel. You go back out to explore the town and do a little shopping and you find yourself hungry again. What do you do? You go to Olive & Ivy of course!   Wow, the food is scrumptious and the atmosphere is so refreshing, clean and modern. As you walk into the entrance you will be cascaded with a very light mist of H2O. Oooh, dramatics honey. It's mainly because this is Arizona and the dry heat can get a bit irritating in the summer. So I think that's a nice gesture for businesses in this area. We walked up to hostess stand and let me tell you chile. All of the hostesses looked like Victoria Secret models. Wow. Just over the top beautiful, honey. Is this common at Olive & Ivy? Because if it is, please don't fire the hiring manager. Lol. Anyways, one of the Sports Illustrated lookalikes escorted us to the bar and we were greeted by one of the  bartenders that suggested I try the Mediterranean salad (a must order) with added shrimp. I also gulped down a few tasty cocktails. I can't remember the name of them :( but honestly you can't go wrong with any of the drinks you try at the bar.   My salad was fulfilling and flavorful the added shrimp big and juicy.   Breakfast is suppose to be really good here as well. I will have to try it out for myself.  This place is gold and I will be back.

Seriously love this restaurant.  The bread they bring you with the basil pesto is amazing!  I could make a meal of that alone!  Great cocktails that offer combinations of liquors you wouldn't expect but they taste delicious. Their small plates are so uniquely done and meld such awesome flavors with the freshest ingredients.  The salads are some of the best I've experienced and the flatbreads are delicious as well.  The huge outdoor patio is so tastefully done - you feel like you are at your own comfortable outdoor abode.  I have to give a shout out to Tommy, our waiter on 10/28/14 who was the BEST!  He said he was going to "take care of us and feed us" and with his suggestions and help with choosing our small plates - he hit a home run!  His sensational personality and wit were all it took to send our memorable evening over the top.  Been patronizing this place ever since I first learned of it several years ago and hope to be for a long time to come.

Went here for my causin Travis graduation dinner with the family from California. We were served by Tommy. He was absolutely fantastic and took care of us so well. We will definitely be referring this place to all of our friends and family after the amazing service we received. Thank you Tommy for the great, friendly and perfect service!!!
I have many had many great dining experiences at Olive & Ivy. The lamb meatballs and sea scallops are amazing! Wait staff is friendly and attentive. This is defiantly one of my favorite places.

bahahahaha I love the comment about the cougars. My friend and I had the exact same observation.   I have been twice, the first time was the best. we had the perfect spot on the patio. We ordered one of their pizzas (really tasty) and the hummus (decent). It was nice to just enjoy the atmosphere and the food. We split so it wasn't very costly and was the perfect portion.  The 2nd time it was bit more costly and not really worth it. I had the bacon wrapped pork (really yum) and my friend ordered the scallops (he said they were too salty and not worth the money).  So, basically, my review is eat here when you want a great patio and view and split an appetizer and course. otherwise, it's not really worth the money.

A few of my girlfriends and I stopped here before a night out. Can't think of 1 thing they need to improve. Great atmosphere, drinks, service, ambiance and music. Looking forward to returning. If you like going out and enjoy a classier crowd, this is thee spot in old town you should check out.

Our waiter was great.  Wiped any crumb off the table, very polite, no complaints there.  This place is loud!  We went for anniversary celebration.  I felt like we were in a night club.  i think they are trying to be a hip place to appeal to 20's crowd.  Food was okay, very pricey and no value. We had chicken dish and lasagna dish.  The lasagna was a very small 17.00 served in a bowl .  Not impressed.  I make better lasagna.  My chicken dish was the natural chicken.  It was good but once again not impressive for 19.00 they charged for it.  Small portions with big prices.  Loud atmosphere.  I would go somewhere else.

Took the opportunity on this past perfect May weekend to use my Fox gift certificate and find a table outside. Bring on the O&I.   With a nod to the other yelpers, I was cautiously optimistic about the Scottsdale vibe [you know, are your boobs/car/jewelry big enough] enough to go with the Lovely. It was early and we had a reservation in which I had requested the patio. We drove up and although a bit put off by the $6 valet - um, really? used it nonetheless.   Seated right as we walked in, on the patio. Lovely night, perfect setting. Except for the choice of music - it seemed weird. I'm sorry, 'Play that Funky Music'?? With your filet and tempranillo? Not so much. Service was spot on, and actually a bit too 'on' I don't think its great to clear my plate when my dinner mate is still eating...just sayin'.   As others have noted, pesto and bread to die for. i tried the prosciutto and fig bruschetta which was yummy [not as good as Postino...] and Jeff had the margherita flatbread. Really fresh and light. He had the tenderloin, I had the tuna. Both scrumptious, lightly sauced and cooked to perfection. Dessert was a shared nutella pudding. Lovely unctuous pudding and whipped cream topped with roasted hazelnuts. Music to my tastebuds. Lovely texture and flavor. Wonderful coffee as well.   Nice wine list, very good cocktails and an atmosphere at least outdoors that was fab. Did i sound whiney? Dont mind me. Go, it'll be well worth it.

With 500+ Reviews, Most of all it has been said but I will offer this: Fox Concepts Restaurants consistently pulls off a memorable, pleasant experience that is tasty, full of quality and will, occasionally, have a memorable service experience.   All restaurants have their ups & downs, but Olive & Ivy is consistently good, innovative and the atmosphere is quite nice; inside or outside. Drinks are tasty, Scallopini and Cannelloni are both just Yum!  Never had a bad experience here.  Overall Rating: 4.5 Stars Service: 4.1 Stars Food: 4.6 Stars  Quality: 4.5 Stars Cleanliness: 4.2 Stars Value: 3.9 Stars

Unimpressed. Service was poor (except the girl who fixed my order). They put mayonnaise on my sandwich after I explicitly made it clear that I would follow her to the depths of the earth and make her pay if she even so much thought about putting the most disgusting ingredient known to mankind on my food.   Thankfully server #2 fixed my order when she realized I was waiting for someone to fix my order after three workers completely dismissed me despite the fact that it's not difficult to tell that I have a very impatient look on  my face and I am trying to enjoy something on my ay to freaking St .Louis, MO.   But even after they fixed my order, I had to shovel it down my throat in less chews than it takes John Goodman to eat Top Ramen (does that make any sense?)  Either way, I should have stood by my own established rule:  Airport bar = good  Airport restaurant = booty.   YOU PUT MAYO ON MY SANDWICH!! I SHOULD BE PERMITTED, BY LAW, TO CANE YOU.

Olive & Ivy Marketplace is a great place for lunch in the Phoenix Airport...  It is quick, tasty & has good prices!  We had a Greek salad with extra Avocado and a special order veggie sandwich.  The salad was large, fresh and delicious . The sandwich was a panini toasted to a golden tan and stuffed full of delicious, fresh vegetables .  On my return flight I plan to eat here again. It has pizza, wraps, salads and Mediterranean ... and delicious fresh baked muffins and cookies.

We really wanted to check this place out.  Went around 6pm on a Monday and were seated quickly.  Our server, Rachel, was phenomenal.  She was well-versed in the menu and knew a lot about the other Fox concept locations.  We had the lamb meatballs, lasagna and chicken scallopini.  My only gripe is that there was probably too much breading on the chicken, but overall it was very good.  Especially the sauce on the chicken.  It seemed to be a little busy with several 6-top tables all around.  Prices were reasonable and I was definitely full.  I'd come back to this place and try other menu items.  Pros=service, food quality, ambiance, proximity to other restaurants Cons=hard to find on my TomTom and iPhone maps apps.  Plus, I think I went in the wrong door (the marketplace) and some randoms asked if they could help me.  Not sure if they worked there or not.

Who put the pistachio's in the Beet Salad?  .... They are a genius!  We hit up Olive and Ivy for restaurant week on Saturday and we were more than pleased with entire experience.  They were pretty full so we took an early reservation for 5:45.  Starting at the bar, we enjoyed some  1/2 price drinks during Happy Hour.  The Pomegranate Martini is very tasty, and surprisingly not very sweet.   Once we got sat, everything at the table was spectacular starting with the hummus, then the sweet potato cannelloni and finishing with the coffee crème brulee.   I couldn't ask for a better meal.  The table agreed that the sweet potato was one of the best things they have ever eaten, it's a must!  I was in vegetarian heaven.   It was still a little hot to sit outside, but once fall kicks in, their patio at night is a romantic spot to grab a bite and enjoy some wine.

Went by this place after having dinner at a nearby restaurant and doing a short strolls. Very busy but the patio caught my eye. Told my husband "let's come here for breakfast tomorrow." Always want to try as many restaurants when visiting a new place as possible.   Good choice. Sat on the awesome patio, quiet yet nice ambience. Our waiter was funny, timely and polite. My French toast was to die for.  Regular French toast then sprinkled with sugar and cinnamon served with berry compote. Didn't even use the maple syrup.  Loved it.

We dined there the other night and absolutely loved our experience. Their food was delicious and the service fantastic. The perfect ambiance for a relaxing and fun meal. Their menu also clearly marks which items are gluten free which was very helpful. We can't wait to return!

Went for dinner on a Friday night with a girlfriend when we were visiting from out of town.  We had a res outside and when they went to seat us, someone had mistakenly sat at our seats so we had to stand around and wait less than 5 min.  Shared the sangria to start.  We then had small portions of both the beet and mediterranean salad.  Both were excellent.  I had the mushroom tortellini and my friend a seafood dish - scallops maybe?  The food was all amazing and Robert, our server, was a sweetheart.  We then asked where we could find some fruit to buy to eat before our hike in the morning.  They actually brought us a bag of fruit on them because we had to wait a few minutes for our table, after already getting a sincere apology. Awesome place!

The food was good. The service seemed to be a bit snobby. Food came quickly. We ordered 1 salad and 1 flat bread but got 2 salads. Neither of us were starved so we felt this would be plenty. Again that was the waiters fault for not paying close enough attention to the details. There are plenty of other hip places in old town to consider
Pleasant breakfast meeting. Good coffee; very good wait staff. Entree was OK - very limited meeting menu. Previous experience has convinced me that their food is better than acceptable

Have been to Olive & Ivy in small and large group settings for brunch, happy hour, and dinner with consistently good experiences. We had my Stepmom's surprise 60th birthday party here--the event space was easy to book--our event space was indoor/outdoor with great views of the Waterfront canal.

First things first, I was skeptical to try another Fox restaurant while on my Arizona trip, especially after my awful experience at arrogant butcher. But I'm so glad that I did. I visited the restaurant during happy hour and was able to get a seat at the bar with no trouble at all. The servers are extremely friendly and the food was really good.   Their complimentary pesto and bread was so good and the pesto had so much flavor. I tried the salmon lox bruschetta which was recommended and I'm so glad I did, it was so tasty and just the perfect amount. I also tried their Margherita flatbread which was so simple yet so perfect. I'm so glad that I decided to give this restaurant a shot and if you're in the area I definitely would recommend going here. Not to mention their happy hour is legit.

Here is my 10 year olds commentary   Loved the lamb meatballs and Brussel sprout bruschetta. When I got my pasta,they tried to hard to make the pasta healthier. I love pasta but it should be authentic.

Whenever I have a friend in from out of town I take them here. Visually the restaurant is really attractive and feels comfortable. The people watching is fun and it's near fantastic shopping. Anything I've ever ordered here has been really great.  The 'cafe' in the front is good too, if you're in a hurry...even for breakfast.

Love the chicken walnut salad and they can make a better latte than the peets down the terminal.   Right though,  I treated myself to their super yummy snickerdoodle cookie.  Perfect pick me up before a redeye flight.

The vibe, drinks, and service were all incredible. The drinks here might have been the best I have ever had at a brunch. Phenomenal Bloody Mary (I had two! It could have used more fun stuff in it, but the taste was amazing, spicy but not too spicy, and just went down really smoothly) and my friend had a Paloma which was also delicious (great recommendation by the waitress).   The cinnamon roll was huge and cheap and delicious! I wish I had ordered something other than the Eggs Benedict (definitely did not live up to everything else at the meal), but I still really enjoyed the overall experience at Olive and Ivy.

This is my favorite restaurant in all of Scottsdale. The sweet potato cannelloni is perfect. The food is very flavorful yet you do not walk out feeling overly full. It's a combo of great Italian and California cuisine. The staff is great and the patio is right off of the canal offering a great atmosphere.

This was one of the places that we wanted to experience. We didn't get the full effect here, but I did drop in for a latte and the classic drip! It was a perfect cup!  Holiday Special: Get $100 gift card, with a $20 gift card included! Sweet!   Excellent customer service! A fair crowd for breakfast on the patio! Gorgeous day on Black Friday!

Excellent! Loved the decor. Sat on the patio by the waterfront. It was packed on a Saturday but service was still really good. Had the sea bass and it was delicious. One of my favorite places in the area.

Got home after a fun dinner to celebrate my friend's birthday and the super nice boy who filled up our drinks was very friendly!!  He made her birthday all that much better and I'd like to thank all the staff but especially Mason for being more on top of it than our waitress!  Keep up the good work  All around good experience we were all pleased with the food and service.

What a great experience! Celebrating graduation and a birthday. The food was absolutely amazing. Hummus, bread with pesto, sea bass, lasagne bolognese, chicken salad, soup...everything was top notch. Celebratory desserts were also delicious and appreciated. Mary the server was so accommodating and attentive. This is a MUST restaurant to eat at while in Scottsdale!

Location, location, location! Right on the canal across the way from old town scottsdale. Love the outdoor seating for the evenings with the lighted palm trees behind. Brought my visitor here and my hubby was there before us. He got seated outside and when we checked in with the hostess, they didnt even try to find him for us.  Just said no one was there waiting for us BUT he was! The 2 ladies seemed a bit rude. Texted him and he said he had a table outside. Kevin was our server and thank goodness for him as he was great.  Friendly and not stuffy. Hubby had ordered bruschettas already and they were decent. Bacon wrapped dates were a little too sweet.  Liked my beet salad as it was refreshing.  Lamb meatballs were my favorite.  Sea bass was cooked well but kind of bland. Shrimp risotto was just average. Ambiance and service of Kevin was what made the night special. Food was just mediocre.

From the moment I walked in, I was blown away by how pretty and vibrant this restaurant was. When I found out that it was a Fox Restaurant, I fell in love even more. Our server was absolutely wonderful and patient with us. The wine selection was great and the drinks were delicious. The outside patio was romantic and beautiful. So why the 3 stars you ask?  I thought the food was nothing special. My expectations might have been higher than usual, due to my love for all of the other Fox Restaurants. The bruschetta was okay - we ordered the mozzarella, prosciutto and manchego. I feel like I've definitely had better bruschetta (Postinos).  The chef's board was nothing special either. I feel like I could have put together a better board. I didn't try the bacon wrapped dates but my friends liked it. My favorite out of everything we ordered were the lamb meatballs. It was sprinkled with a lot of feta cheese so it was absolutely delicious. For the flat bread, we did half short rib and half chicken pesto, and for pastas we ordered the wild mushroom papardelle. Again, I didn't think it was anything I would order again in the future.   The server was sweet and gave us a complimentary chocolate cake for our friend's birthday. The food was mediocre, but I would probably come back and try the other items on the menu.

From out of town, looked for a new place to eat with the Mrs. The food is good, not blown away, but definitely a place I'd return to. Love the staff, service, price, venue and location. Went on a Saturday morning had a mimosa with the eggs Benedict and treated ourself to a cheese Danish.

Hands down one of my favorite places in scottsdale! from the atmosphere, to the service to the food. never have any complaints .. well accept their menu varies depending on the time of day... but besides that, I'm there twice a week!

This was the pertect end to a great night.  The atmosphere is lively and the appetizers were great.  The service was excellent and I loved everything from the small beet salad to the variety of bruschetta.    I will definitely return on a future visit to Scottsdale.

Have only been here once before under too stressful of circumstances to remember, this trip to Olive and Ivy was fantastic.   Usually going to lunch in Scottsdale is hit or miss with expectations, however today we had a lunch meeting scheduled for 11:30, I got a front row parking spot in front of the valet and had no problem being seated right away.  Sticking to my lunch salad trend, I ordered the Curry Salad with Chicken and couldn't have asked for a more perfect dish on such a warm day. The portions were great, the lettuce cool and crisp and even the "handmade" bread and pesto before complimented everything perfectly.   The only gripe I would have, understanding it is a Fox Restaurant, was how almost unnatural the wait staff was with how rehearsed and methodical all interactions were. Even down to the correct usage of "I am well" versus "I am good" seemed a bit out of place, but not a big deal.

Really liked this place, spacious restaurant with an outdoor patio area. We ordered three types of bruschetta, chicken panini, Mediterranean salad, and cocktails. They bake their own bread and vegetables are super fresh, needless to say nothing went to waste that day! If we are ever in the area, we'd definitely come back. Prices are reasonable and food has good portions.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Old town. I have loved everything I ordered. They also have really good cocktails. Some favorite dishes are the bolognese, the bacon wrapped dates, and the grapefruit mojito. Enjoy!

I was in Scottsdale visiting family and it was my first time eating at Olive & Ivy. We had the pleasure of having Mason as our server. As far as first time impressions go, Mason hit the mark! His attention to detail, kind and friendly manner and menu knowledge made our experience above the bar!  Our food was delicious! From appetizers to dinner we were very happy!  If you train your entire staff to follow Masons lead, you will exceed your patrons expectations 100% of the time!!

We took some out of state friends to Scottsdale on to show them around. We decided on renting bikes to get around quicker which was awesome. Of course due to all of the activity we were very parched. We ended up at Olive & Ivy. We were greeted with a smile and seated shortly thereafter. It was a busy late afternoon on a Saturday but they were able to accommodate us on the patio. We ordered drinks and a few flatbreads with a salad to share us. The drinks came out quickly and were very thirst quenching. Our friends had white wine, my husband a beer and I the Grapefruit Mojito which was outstanding. The Braised Short Rib flabread and Pesto Chicken flatbread were a hit but I really enjoyed the Chopped Chicken Salad. We had a very pleasurable experience and would highly recommend to anyone. The only crappy thing  (literally) was that my husband was between the umbrellas and there are a lot of trees/birds. Unfortunately he was bombed twice but he was a good sport and allowed us to laugh at his expense.  I was smart and sat under the umbrella. LOL We mentioned it jokingly to our waitress in passing which we honestly wasn't  expecting anything to be done about it . However the manager came out shortly thereafter and profusely apologized. We weren't complaining about the incident to receive anything in return but they took off my husbands drink as a courtesy. It is so nice to know that there are places out there that employ individuals that really care about service. I truly appreciate  the care not only our waitress  took but management to approach our table to apologize.  Great Job!  Needless to say we will enjoy the patio again but my husband and I will probably compete with sitting under the umbrella for protection.

Came here on Friday with my Mom and two sisters after a day of shopping up Fashion Square. There was a bit of a wait (35+ minutes) which would've been okay if it wasn't 200 degrees at 8pm. In any event, once we were seating I must say everything was perfection. Everyone had some wine, our waiter/service was great, and the food was to die for. We started out with the Parmesan Truffle Fries as a starter - OMG - incredible!   I had the Free Range Chicken which was not only presented nicely but tasted even better. I wasn't a huge fan of the veggies but the mash and chicken were SO good. Everyone else had fish and since I don't eat that stuff I can't comment - but I know everyone was impressed!   We divulged and finished off the night with the Peanut Butter Torte. Again: OMG. The torte itself was amazing but the salted peanut butter gelato on the side was INCREDIBLE. Sigh. Definitely worth the wait. And if nothing else the people watching was fairly priceless...

"A steak so tender you can cut it with a butter knife...."  Ummm, yeah, me thinks not.   Here's the dealio. I am an avid red meat and steak consumer. I can't live without a good dose of meat in me each week...wait, what....yeah, so bearing that in mind, when I came to Phoenix for this work trip, I knew I wanted to have a steak and a nice glass of spicy red wine at some point and so we came here since it was right near the bar we were at earlier.   As soon as we walked in I dug the place. The decor is pretty elaborate and it's easily a million dollar design. Even the bathrooms look like spreads in design mags and with the high ceilings and intimate lighting, it's a home run visually.  After waiting about, oh 20 minutes, we were seated at a table and we all perused the menu. There were quite a few goodies that looked yummy, but my heart and stubborn mind was on steak and a medium rare one at that! I also wanted to try a salad, cuz I was starving and so I ordered the Caesar along with my Rib Eye.  The Caesar was okay at best. It definitely skimped on the dressing, so if you like your Caesar salad, Caesary, then maybe order a side of dressing as well. Then there's the rib-eye. A magnificent looking piece of meat it was, but what did they give me to devour it with?   You guessed it, a butter knife.  Really?  Really.  What in the Backstreet Boy Hell kinda bullsh*t is that? I probably wouldn't have given the tenderness factor a second thought had it not been for the struggle to cut it with the wrong utensil. And it wasn't an oversight either, this is what they intentionally give you to tackle your dinner with.  La-me.  I enjoyed my meal and the steak was tasty, but please, do yourselves a favor and upgrade to steak knives, because it's not tender enough to slice a dull blade through.

Ambience location great - then a slippery slope down hill. Service from kitchen extremely poor, 40 mins between appetizer and main! Then one meal, pork served almost defrosted raw - reheated to edible but the moment had passed. Apologies insincere. Go for atmosphere but not for service or food.
This was amazing. Went there last summer and never did a review. But I will be making a trip back.  Well worth the drive

I was very pleased with my last dining experience as I was introducing 4 new diners to the restaurant.  We were greeted at the entrance by your cheerful hostess staff and seated in the Stamp Room which was perfect for this group.   The noise level was moderate and we could converse without hearing the background noise from the bar and kitchen areas.  Yasiin was our server.  He has a welcoming smile and was very attentive to our needs throughout the dinner.  Thank you for the complimentary birthday desserts!  I do believe you will have 4 new repeat diners from this experience.

Awesome spot for brunch. The outdoor patio was so inviting. We had an array of food including the short rib flatbread,hummus plate(nothing special) fruit, bacon and pastries (which I would not pass up!) Our waitress was sweet and attentive. $6 dollar table side mimosas was a steeeal! Would definitely be back!

We went to Olive & Ivy for dinner on a Saturday night and we had an amazing time. The atmosphere was great. They had a DJ going which really gave it a fun vibe but the ambience was still very classy and open, and cozy. We had the sweet potato cannelloni and it was just spectacular. We are not from Arizona but are down there once or twice a year. Olive & Ivy is definitely on our list of must-go places when we go back.

Olive & Ivy is a great place to unwind and get some great food options with a unique setting close to Old Town Scottsdale.  I love going to their Sunday Brunch (Cinnamon French Toast is unreal) or taking friends that are visiting from out of town!  Love their Bacon Wrapped Dates and Atlantic Salmon to name a few!
Great place... Very slow service!  Wouldn't recommend for dinner.  Fun for a drink and an appetizer... Management very unapologetic for the delay...

I finally had the opportunity to try this place.  The atmosphere is fabulous...love the decor which feels sort of chic, elegant yet understated with a great mix of colors and textures...I'm very aesthetic and a beautifully decorated restuarant ususally enhances my reviews :)  We were seated in the far back room which was nice, comfortable, well lit and very quiet.  I was immediately impressed with the lunch menu which felt very comprehensive and certainly not overpriced whatsoever.  I opted for the Curry Chicken Salad ($11) which includes field greens, chicken breast, sliced almonds and golden raisens with a two dressing combination of creamy curry and a red wine vinagarette which I ordered on the side.  I ate every last bite of the salad.  She ordered the Heirloom Beet Salad ($11) which was a very nice presentation.  The focaccia bread with pesto dipping sauce edged my carb craving.  Oh, I can't forget the fabulous Black Iced Tea (with a hint of tropical flavor) which was just delicious.    The service was extremely friendly and attentive...absolutely no complaints whatsoever.  It was an extremely nice dining experience and I'm looking forward to returning soon.

Awesome food. And the ambiance is great, especially the patio. Drinks are always poured with a generous hand. Everything is delicious, breakfast lunch and dinner. Dinner prices are a bit high, but completely reasonable for the area. Great for girls brunch, healthy lunch, or anniversary dinner - a can't miss!!!

We were here for brunch.  I would recommend due to the atmosphere.  We sat outside on the patio which was quite pleasant.  Our server was absolutely amazing, top notch, didn't miss a beat.    I am giving this restaurant 4 stars mainly for the food.   The coffee is terrible, honestly not sure why restaurants of that quality would not have better coffee?  I ended up ordering a cappuccino which was very nice. The pastries were fantastic, highly recommend.  Especially cinnamon roll.   We had the breakfast burrito which was way too salty, that might sound a little picky, however, for me it was overwhelming.   The potatoes were also very salty.

We were looking for a nice place for a birthday dinner, somewhere that was new for us and had great customer feedback.  So here we went!  Made a reservation on OpenTable.com at the recommendation of other reviews and had no wait at all when we arrived.  We opted for indoor seating, but we noticed misters on the patio a lovely view if you prefer sitting outdoors.  The service was very good.  Our server was knowledgeable about the menu items and prepared to offer recommendations based on pairings, popularity, and individual taste.    The food was excellent.  It is evident that they have put much thought into their menu.  We tried 3 types of bruschetta, veal ravioli, and their chicken main course,  We tried two cocktails, both excellent, and the coconut sponge dessert.  The bill ran about $35 per person before gratuity, but the quality of the menu is totally worth it.  No complaints.   I'm sure we'll be back.

Headed to this place for drinks and appies.  The restaurant is hip, spacious and trendy.  This is a great spot for tourists.  The staff were all friendly and apparently all the food is made in-house.   We ordered the calamari and I felt the portion was small and the dish quite salty.

tl;dr: terrible bagels, terrible service, go elsewhere.   If I could give this zero stars I would because it is a sad excuse for a restaurant. They were out of cream cheese at 8AM, but they had butter and jelly which you had to put on your own bagel. That would have been fine had they not charged me for the cream cheese anyway (even though I questioned it). The cashier was super curt with us despite there being nobody else in the line.   They "toasted" my bagel in a panini press, which squished it down flat and made it taste like sliced bread. I also ordered coffee, which was below average. The worst part was probably that the lid to the cup was super flimsy (clear plastic that bent every time the cup changed shape, so that when I went to pick up the cup, coffee spilled all over my hands (and I couldn't put the lid on tighter or readjust it).   All around a thumbs down. Would not recommend.

For an airport fast food restaurant this was quick fresh tasty and reasonably priced. Had a Turkey Panini which was very good. Toasted made it outstanding. The bread was fresh and the meat tender. Not a huge turkey fan but I would purchase this again. With water bill was less than $ 10.

Dined at Olive and Ivy last Friday night (very romantical date I might add). Our reservation was at 8:30pm, we arrived about 30 minutes early and they were able to seat us right away. It was cougar central in there so I held my date close because he's a few years my junior.... they were eying us like prize winning hogs, or a coupon for 1/2 price Restylane injections. It was insane. I mean people were noticeably discussing our arrival. These women were not even trying to hide the shit talking. So, mad props "geriatric mafia" at the bar. Don't hate!  The wine alone is what warrants 3 stars. Two words: Arizona Stronghold. High five for the local support.  As far as dinner goes, we ordered the Seared Scallops and Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin with side orders of Mascarpone Polenta and Roasted Mushrooms. My date and I happen to enjoy small plate dining and the server was nice enough to split everything up for us so we didn't have to feed each other. The food was...... get ready for it......... okay. Yes, just okay. The quality of the ingredients were phenomenal but flavor wise it just didn't deliver. Don't get me wrong, I don't have anything horrible to say but sorry, not having something bad to say just isn't good enough for a $170.00 dining experience.   I will probably go back and give it another shot at some point. I'm really glad I went with my gut instinct and didn't order the Filet because I am a total fucking steak snob. I have a feeling this review would have read something completely different and dropped in rating. Maybe brunch?  P.S. The chocolate martini was sex in a glass....... like actual sex..... in a glass.  You figure it out.  :)
Every time I come here the service is terrible on the patio.  For years and years and years always same terrible patio service and rude.

Started off with a Bloody Mary at the bar. Mix is just on the cusp of tasting like cocktail sauce. I have noticed it seems like a "trend" now. I believe the horseradish added creates that flavor. Staff is always friendly. Giving KUDOS to our server Jose. He was friendly, attentive, and personable (pass this along if a superior is reading this). Had the Chicken Panini and the brea was soft and the flavors full. By the way, they do have Iced Tea Vodka, just in case you were wondering. Great brunch, with great friends, and a great atmosphere. Thanks Olive & Ivy!
Great place. Good food and fast service, even on a busy day like Sunday for brunch.
Overpriced most dishes look slopped on the plate. Typical Scottsdale.
Great place to eat. Very pleasant environment with great service. Been there many times and never a bad experience.  Perfect for both lunch and dinner. Sometimes both!
Sunday brunch was amazing. The service was fast and kind. The food was fresh and hot. The outdoor patio was super relaxing.

This place lures you in with its spacious bar area and the inviting patio of colorful lounge chairs and firepits overlooking the beauty of the Scottsdale Waterfront. It's a great spot to meet up for happy hour or drinks before venturing off to Old Town and start your shenanigans. For my singletons, I will say it is a great starting point for first dates as you can really hit any of the other restaurants once the meet and greet awkwardness wears off (speaking from experience as the lifeline/wingman).  Unfortunately, as with most things deceptively beautiful outside, the interior make up does not always match up. I am about consistency. And both food and service are spotty. They have been phenomenal when we hosted a large birthday dinner in the large room. The bar area is fun and you'll always be able to strike up a conversation with anyone as I love the diverse crowd that hangs out there. Patio service tends to be harder to gauge. I've had fantastic and attentive servers and some not. The sangria and flatbreads are incredible such that you don't realize you might have ordered twice or more times because you want that much more. They used to have a watermelon salad that my tongue craves but has been replaced by a beet salad which isn't a bad stand in. However, I've been here on a Friday night where a friend couldn't get a Coors Light. How do you run out of beer and that beer of all things on a weekend? I also love that you can just pop into the market and grab gelato that has an array of flavor I want to bathe in.  Usually for a FCR, I am generally impressed but Olive & Ivy has struggled to maintain the bar that Sam Fox sets at his other venues such as Culinary Dropout or Arrogrant Butcher. With that said, even low on Sam's radar is pretty high in the restaurant industry.

The decor is very nice.  The patio has a lot of trees which is a nice change around here.  Love the little lights all over the place.  The bread and pesto is delicious.  There is a bit of salt on the crust part of the bread so make sure you leave some fleshy bit to eat with it or it will be too salty.    For entrees we chose lasagna and pepperoni and sausage flatbread.  The lasagna is a bit too sweet for my taste and the sauce may have been too salty.  The garlic bread that comes with it was a little overladen with oil/butter.  It isn't the worst I've ever had, but nothing really to write home about.  The meat actually kind of reminded me of Chef Boyardi...  The pizza was solid.  The crust is very thin.  Nothing too special there.  Dessert was coconut cakes with blood orange gelato and the cheesecake.  The coconut cakes were 2 pieces of dense bits with a scoop of gelato in between.  It was pretty good though I wonder if vanilla ice cream would have been a better choice.  They also had a smear of something that was neither attractive nor additive in any way that I noticed.  The gelato was nice anyway with good flavor.  The cheesecake tasted not so much cakey but just like a very mild cheese.  I've never been a fan of graham cracker crustless cheesecake either.    So I imagine we'll come back here and there, but there's really nothing that will make me crave this place.  The food is solidly decent, but nothing overwhelmingly great that we've tried.  The decor is beautiful though.  Pricing is about average though some of the portions may be slightly on the small side.

Excellent place for lunch/brunch.  Trendy upscale with wonderful outdoor patio by the canal in Old Town Scottsdale.  Weekend brunch menu is large with many good items to choose.  Definitely worth a repeat visit.
Cool atmosphere. Delicious food. Had Mediterranean salad, salmon and chocolate cake. The meal and the Cabernet were both great; as was the service and the atmosphere. Good for a group dinner.

We went to Olive and Ivy just for dessert after having dinner at another restaurant with another couple.  It was a beautiful night so we had to take advantage of one of the nicest patios in Scottsdale.  We ordered the warm apple pie with a scoop of Nutella gelato.  I won't be ordering the warm apple pie again.  First of all they shouldn't call it warm, it was room temperature on the outside and cold on the inside.  It looked like a cross between a hot pocket and a apple pie you would get from McDonald's.  The Nutella gelato was amazing.  I will for sure be getting that next time I go back.  The other couple we were with had the ice cream bar and a scoop of cookies and cream gelato.  I didn't try it but they said they enjoyed it.  The hostess was great.  The service from our server was nothing special. He gave us our check after we got our dessert and never came back after that.  No "can I get you anything?" and no refill of our empty water glasses.  I've been to Olive and Ivy many times and I will go back.
Love this place. Food is always good. Service can be slow when it's busy, cause when it's busy here it's busy. Me and my friends come here a lot.

Very cool patio, could use a smidge more mood lighting, but otherwise amazing.  Good place to gawk at the "Scenesters"....Expensive menu so stop at the ATM.....food is worth it....The Arugala salad is fab.  Parking blows- pretty much valet only.....  Kinda bumbed because I told the girl 3 different times it was my husbands birthday and it went un-noticed so not a birthday place....good for a first date....  bout it.

A very nice looking place, Food it was good, the service felt under the expectations I had over this place, so trendy, and pricey.... I will like to go back during the winter time here in Phoenix, so I can enjoy better the patio seat around the chiminea.

My friends LOVE this place so I've been quite a bit.  The thing is, I can never really figure out what about it makes them keep coming back.  The food is "fine."  I've come in for breakfast and dinner.  I never had any dish that made me desire to come back without my friends suggesting it.  Usually they suggest great places, so maybe I'm missing the point, but really, I just don't crave this food.  I will say - the service is EXCELLENT.  I've never had a server I didn't like and they always try to make my experience great.  (I actually just added a star to my review because of that.)  So I guess ... try the food, and if you like it, keep comin' back, and if not, get a drink and enjoy the scenery and service.

My wife and I were out driving and we were HUNGRY could not decide where to eat when it dawned on me...Olive &Ivy!  Once again we were not disappointed.  The staff is always superb, love Christian (he's the best), and the food is delicious.  Can I please get the focaccia and basil pesto delivered to my house...daily?! Seriously, I love the food and the service. Keep up the great work, great hires and great food. Restaurant is always the busiest out of all the options in this area, that speaks volumes!!
Popped in for late night drinks and a bite to eat. Though it was busy the food was terrific and service was great! Nice atmosphere!

This space is a big, open area but not so much so that you can't hear each other, which was important to us, as we were meeting up with old friends on our recent trip to Arizona.   The waitress, in describing the menu, made our mouths water. She was excellent in her descriptions. She helped us choose a wine for the table, offering a sample of a Pinot Noir, which we didn't like so much and then steering us to a great Cabernet Sauvignon.  The bruschetta sampler appetizer was perfect for our group of 5. The range of flavors offered was nice too, since we all had different tastes.  I had an entree of scallops which was perfectly prepared, perfectly sized and accompanied by sides that paired with it nicely.  Everyone in our group was very happy with their dinner and dessert. This is definitely the type of restaurant that could be a go-to destination. The service was first class, the food was tasty, and yet the open feel to the area kept it from being stuffy.

I love the patio area of this restaurant and really like their Happy Hour menu.  Like many Scottsdale restaurants, I'm more of a fan of the Happy Hour food than the dinner menu which doesn't have much that appeals to me.  This place is especially nice if you have out of town guests. The location makes it very memorable.

Refused to give water to young teen & referred her to PF Changs.  Olive & Ivy handled this poorly, unprofessionally & pathetically.   PF Changs didn't even hesitate to give her the water.  That's why I ate there instead.

Came here for lunch. First things first I have never had pesto this good anywhere else in my life. I don't know what it is but they did it right here.   Also tried the bruschetta trio (funghi, manchego, prosciutto and fig) all three were very good.   The fritto misto was pretty standard plain rings,imo calamari should have the tentacles but still tasted good. Very lightly fried and flavorful  Felt guilty after and got the chopped chicken salad which was very light and flavorful while also being very filling. Had a very interesting peanut granola that accompanied it.  Got to try my friend's sweet potato cannelloni that was incredible as well.   Really great interior design. Would recommend for lunch or a date.

I had this restaurant bookmarked and finally got to try it. It did not disappoint. Our server was friendly and did not rush us. The restaurant has a great selection of wines and gives generous pours. My husband and I tried the bacon wrapped dates and the funghi and prosciutto/fig bruschettas. Both appetizers were really tasty and fresh but I loved the bacon wrapped dates the most. The complimentary focaccia with pesto sauce was also great! The pesto was especially good.   My husband had the chopped chicken salad and loved it. It was very hearty. I was debating between two of the flatbreads to try, and our server offered to do half and half for me. I tried the prosciutto crudo and the funghi trifolati and it was hard to pick a favorite. Both were very flavorful and perfect. My husband also really liked the Bloody Mary mix, which they make in house.  Everything about our experience was great and the prices were so reasonable for all the food we ordered! I will be sure to come back again.

We went here with our daughter for a late lunch today. The truth is I can eat anywhere from trashy to classy. I tend to sit in the middle because that is where I find the best customer service and food, usually. That being said, my partner likes the upper middle fancy to fancy places. So he made reservations to go to Olive & Ivy. It is a typical Scottsdale place. Nice, clean, usually average service. I, however, LOVE Fox Restaurant Concepts and was expecting a sharp on point presentation. We arrived to average friendly hostesses, were seated and then approached by a waitress who brought water and then my ice tea. I asked for a sugar caddy for my tea. She said, "Sure" and off she went... not to return to the table. 20 mins later we were approached by a manager, Jake, who clearly saw that we had been sitting there for that amount of time. He came over and I explained the situation thus far. He had paper in hand and was ready to try and correct this experience asap! I have to say, I was in the mindset to never return! Jake worked his magic and our food came out in under 10 mins without the quality being compromised. He took over our table and was on top of refills, making sure everything was perfect and did his best to make us go from "Never Again" to "I'll give them another chance." That was his whole goal and he succeeded with flying colors! Thank you Jake for making what easily was going to be a one star come back up to a four star. I'll give an update review the next time I visit!

This was probably my favorite spot of all the places I visited on my Scottsdale vacation. Everything from ambiance, to service, wine and food was superb. We liked it so much we came twice. The first night was a Friday night. The restaurant had so much life, attracting visitors and locals looking for a nice place to socials, dine and drink good wine. I loved the outdoor lounge area overlooking the water. Situated in the heart of old town, with the happening older nightlife.   Our intention was to just grab an appetizer and wine and head to another location for dinner but we loved the vibe so much we stayed. They had a dj inside that played a great mix of music, to keep the place lively and fun. The second night was a Monday, Halloween evening. Much more mellow, still just as enjoyable. This time around we got a bottle of red for $30 that was delicious and got a nice little buzz!  Food?! Everything looks good. Whether you're going for wine and shareables, cheese platter, main dish or dessert. We loved the mozzarella bruschetta, mushroom pasta dish and two scoops of gelato for dinner. Chop salad is also good, but had what seemed like granola on top... kinda weird! Will definitely be back on my next visit to Scottsdale.

My friends and I dined here yesterday night.  Our server Amber was great and on top of things.  We started with bruschetta which was delicious.  I really liked the mozzarella one.  I had a Caesar salad which was so good, definitely in my top 3 I've ever had.  It was very flavorful.  I had the chicken scallopini for my entree.  It was very good however it came with so much spinach it would have been nice to have something else on the plate as well (mashed potatoes would have been nice).

Olive & Ivy is still a fun place to go for HH on a Friday night.  We came last evening with some old friends and had fun time catching up. The menu has recently been updated, but all the deliciousness found on the old one is still here. Remember to make reservations if you can -- the wait list was over an hour.   We started off with light cocktails of white wine. Their spirits list is pretty impressive at Olive & Ivy, so are the mixologists behind the bar. You won't go home thirsty.   We ordered a bunch of things to nosh on.  Their flat bread pizza is still outstanding and the Scallops are delicious.  We also saved room for the Gelato machine behind the bar -- a must on your way out.  Enjoy!

The restaurant is in the heart of Old Town so the atmosphere has a great vibe!  It has a good wine list.. prices are a bit high but worth an occasional nite on the town.  It was a fun place to meet up with friends for cocktails with a live dj!  The calamari was the best I have had in awhile.  Service was a bit slow in the lounge.  Great patio with a firepit, fountain and plenty of seating with misters.

This is a good patio spot in Scottsdale. The fig and ginger mule is a great take on a moscow mule; spicy and refreshing. The corn flatbread and beet salad are my top two food choices on the menu. I would say the only downside to this restaurant is happy hour is only offered in the bar and lounge. If you go to dinner early, unfortunately this great happy hour menu can't be enjoyed. Be sure you make reservations!

Came for brunch, the service was wonderful, the bread/pesto was delicious (much better then the typical bread and butter!). I ordered the breakfast burrito and potatoes - also very tasty! Their homemade salsa was great too! The decor and ambiance is perfect for a date, hanging with friends, or taking a parent out to eat. I will definitely be back!

It's sub-freezing here in Salt Lake City today. Arctic chill, crunchy snow, frozen snot freezing. And yet just a few short days ago I had lunch on the patio of Olive & Ivy in the sunshine with a happy little breeze blowing through the place.  So perhaps I'm attaching a little more magic to the experience than is totally merited, but when we strip away the ambiance and charm of eating outside in January I'm still left with some delicious food.  I was immediately impressed with the bread and pesto. Zing! Lots of bite to it to help you remember the taste. We ordered a couple of flatbreads for the group and scarfed them down in no time. Then again, you put asparagus on just about anything and I'd eat it.  I ordered a simple turkey sandwich and was not disappointed. I'd like to try a few other menu items as well, because I'm not sure I had the best of the best, but still it hit the spot just the same and I'd eat it again.  As mentioned, our server (DeAnne?) was on top of things--totally professional, dedicated to her job, and one hundred percent darling. You heard me. I said darling.

Conveniently located near the Scottsdale Fashon, this place is great for a nice lunch before you shop 'til you drop. The restaurant doubles as a marketplace, so you can buy some goods while you're there too.  The decor is clean and fresh and simply done.    Now on to the food.  The one thing to describe their food (at least the two dishes I tried there) is lots and lots of oil.  Maybe that's why it tasted so good.  The Funghi Trifolati flatbread was recommended.  The mushroom and arugula is a wonderful pairing for the simple dish.  The tallegio cheese stretches beautiful when I took a bite.  The only thing I wished was that the thin bread was more crispy.  It was too soft for my taste.  And of course they drenched it with olive oil.    The mushroom tortelli ordered was a light classic dish that was cooked wonderfully as well.  I preferred this dish over the flatbread.  The ravioli was cooked a bit adante which was great, and the flavors blended well with the mushroom.  What I remembered of the sauce was that it was light and drenched in oil again.  See the trend? :-)  But   Overall, I would give a thumbs up for Olive & Ivy.  Happy eating in 2013!

Great food and great service - their brunch menu is fantastic. I had the sausage breakfast sandwich with the house-made English muffin - incredible. This is already a regular brunch stop for us and will continue to be one as long as they keep making food like that.

Went here last night for a family dinner and the food was great, we ordered the bacon wrapped dates, hummus with veggies , mozzarella bruschetta (which we were expecting more than a few slices but only came with 2 slices) , pesto chicken flatbread and wild mushroom papperdelle! All of these items where amazing highly recommend the bacon wrapped dates! As far as cocktails you have to try the pomegranate daiquiri or fig & ginger mule! The location is right next to the mall and near the waterfront and we sat in the patio that overlooked the water! Love this place I'll definitely be back for happy hour :)

Every single bite was delicious and the outdoor patio location on the river made for a perfect first evening out in Scottsdale. We had heard the food in Phoenix could be hit-or-miss but Olive & Ivy was surprisingly great.   We started with the artichoke appetizer with sous vid artichoke hearts, arugula, and parmesan - woah, so so good. Hubby and I split the Shrimp Scampi Risotto that was super lemony and fresh as well as the Chicken Scallopini which was like the best chicken parmesan with savory sauce EVER. We topped the meal with the Chocolate Bar; a chocolate mousse with cherry chip ice cream that was incredible.   Several people in the know recommended Olive & Ivy and they didn't steer us wrong. Would highly recommend to out of towners looking for a nice dinner in Scottsdale. $120 for drinking two before tax and tip. Service was exceptional.
Loved this place the first 2 times I went and then the same dish wasn't as good... However, the salmon is always amazing. I love the atmosphere!!!

I've been to the cafe for lunch about a dozen times (much more than my number of check-ins would suggest) and each time it was consistently good.  However, I've never had the pleasure of dining inside the actual restaurant until Friday.  The service, food, and decor are all top notch.  Although the price of my entree was ridiculous in my opinion ($26 for 3 shrimp atop risotto), everything else was excellent.  The bread and pesto they give you to start is phenomenal, the lamb meatballs are tender and delicious as was the tzatziki, and the shrimp and risotto was perfect as well.  The margherita flat bread was just ok and we should have opted for one not as basic.  Next time for sure.  My only advice is to either make a reservation or come early.  The place fills up fast around dinner time but 6:30 is a safe bet for early-birds without a reservation.  Also, the better the weather the more prime the real estate on the patio so get there super early to reserve your spot out there.

Im only giving this restaurant a five star review because the service and atmosphere were AMAZING. The food and drinks were terrible and we didn't finish anything. They were very generous and discounted our bill without us having to ask. I wish I could remember the servers name. I would come back and order another choice and hope it improved. Beautiful restaurant. I hope the kitchen can get it together.

This place is nice and upscale. If you go at night though, the music is really loud. If you're ok with that, the food is very good. Last time I went they had a smores dessert with homemade toasted marshmallow on top. Delicous.

Hey Fox concepts: Is it your concept to be consistently Rude to customers. Wake Up.  This is strike 2 for this restaurant. I will not bring my customers again. You have to have a meeting of you hostesses wait staff and management. Last Thursday I walked in with 3 peaple. I was told 3 times that is 5:00 and no happy hr on the patio  with tables  So Ok rude hostess.... fine.  The waitress...  3 times are you dinning. Wine appetizers then we shall see.  She did not like that answer and rudely sat us.  The appetizers were very Small and just Ok.  We had 2 bottles of wine but the waitress kept  on asking about food to the point where we decided to have dinner else ware. We are locals fox not Snowbirds.  Today I walked in at 11:30 we were 4 peaple. Same attitude.   Sorry their is  an 1/12/ hr wait . We only take reservations and you do not have one. Hardly anyone was on the patio at that time......  A manager walk by and asked how we were doing . I said Not Ok . And she just ignored my comment and walked on her very busy way. My 1st time customers and friends reminded me that their is Plenty of restaurants in the are that want our bussiness. So we left....   To note ... Fox . That we told this story to a neighboring restaurant and he agreed that you guys Turn Off more people and that's great for this bussness.  If you care this was at 11:30 today.. Check the time sheets .....  I doubt if I will give you a 3 rd time because My Time is valuable also ...

Nice atmosphere. Sit on the patio on a nice day.  Good service.  The ahi tuna tacos sounded great, but were so so.  The tomato and mozerella salad was good and so was the arugula with apples salad.  The free Pesto bread was great.  The sangria was not very good. All in all a nice place, but there is so much choice in that area that I would go elsewhere next time.

Like other reviewers have said, I expected a more intimate setting and was surprised to see something so large and bustling. Not a bad thing, just a mismatched expectation-reality thing.  We started with some bruschettas. All good! Especially loved the mozzarella and apple caponata ones. For my main I had the big eye tuna--gorgeously done. Nice big chunks of meat that were seared nicely, on a bed of couscous and yumminess. I tried a bit of my dad's spicy pasta. SO spicy. Impressively spicy, really.   The desserts were also great, and I have a hard time picking my favorite. Perhaps the coconut cakes in that soupy coconut sauce. I didn't get to try the chocolate cake but it looked really good.  We were in the back room which offered us *some* respite from the noise of the restaurant (a great thing when they bring in an actual DJ and you're just trying to eat dinner!), but it also offered a blast of cold air each time a server went outside to help one of the diners sitting under a heatlamp. Oh well.

Love Olive & Ivy, came here for a work dinner and I knew I had to come back on my own (wait, I can't do anything alone, so I put together a girls night out.) Don't wanna lie to you, we came here for the Happy Hour, this girl has to save some coin, I've got kids!  Happy hour selection is small but big enough to find what you want!  This is what I've tried there for happy hour, ready?  1) Bacon wrapped dates, OMG! They were delish and HELLO, there's BACON!  2) Lamb meatballs, good grief, they were tender and so delicious, total party in my mouth. Their Tzatziki sauce was on point too!  3) Their french fries, rather, their TRUFFLE FRIES, someone hold me back!!! Totally shareable. God, they were good.   4) Hummus. Who doesn't love hummus? Served with grilled pita and some veggies, it was delightful.  O.k., o.k., I get it, I pretty much ordered everything off the happy hour menu but the prices were so darn cheap.  BEVERAGES!!!  Ladies, order their Sangria, 'nuff said.

I can never go wrong with a restaurant from Fox Concepts it seems! The bar area is definitely good 'people watching' and I love the modern contemporary decor. Where did they get the lighting for the bar area? The menu is healthy mediterranean and I love sitting outside on the patio. They also feature a 'take-out market-side' - I think they have some top notch croissants too!! I haven't been there for brunch yet so that's on my list and will have to return!

"Mediterranean cuisine with a Californian flare." Well I think this is my first Yelp review, and for good reason, too!  The girlfriend and I just dined here on Valentine's Day (coincidentally the gf's birthday) and the whole experience was top notch. It all started when I called to make a reservation weeks ago and they asked if we were celebrating anything else so I mentioned the birthday and that was that. Made reservations for the beautiful patio on VDay.  Flashforward to the 14th and the experience was wonderful. Parking underground was super convenient - elevator brings you up right next to the restaurant. We were immediately seated right next to the Waterfront with a great view and phenomenal weather.  Now the food (finally, this guy got to the food): Disclaimer, the menu was a VDAY specific menu, so don't get too excited about what you read here because it might not be the usual! Cocktails were A+. I got a blood orange paloma (delicious compliments with the tequila) and the gf got a mojito, also delicious. Cocktail menu was very diverse and had interesting flavor pairings - wish I could have drank more if I wasn't driving the birthday girl around!  FOOD! We started with the hummus with vegetables appetizer. Delicious hummus, slight kick to it made it stand out compared to other bland hummuses. The pita and vegetable selection was also very fresh. For entrees, the gf got the chicken scallopini which had well-crusted (slightly crispy, not fried) chicken on top of some sauteed greens - fantastic. I got the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin, cooked medium at the chef's recommendation. Also phenomenal but there was something special about the tangy/spicy BBQ sauce on top. Will definitely dream about this dish.  Now here's the special part, free dessert (twice baked chocolate cake, amazing) with a personal birthday message written in icing! I was so pleased they went to such care for us when they had hundreds of other couples trying to make their own VDay special.  Will definitely return.

Excellent place to have a snack or late lunch in the afternoon while shopping over at the mall.  We had salads and appetizers which were delicious.  The servers and other staff were very attentive, almost too attentive at times the two of us felt initially like there was someone always coming up to our table asking to help us!  We had the beet salad and the mediterranean salad, as well as the lamb meatballs which were delicious and the calamari fritti.  All four were excellent choices.  It was not too busy.  Music is a little loud if you want to have private conversation, but the atmosphere is trendy but casual and inviting.
