Fox Restaurant Concepts did it again.   This place rocks! Fantastic offerings of wine, atmosphere & flavor.

Had a family Sunday brunch there. We all ordered our food and waited patiently for our food. When our meals were delivered the waiters told my 11 year old granddaughter they were out of what she ordered, and proceeded to give us our meals while she didn't get hers. I cannot believe he didn't come to let us know before. So while we ate she sat and watched. When she then decided to order a muffin and asked what kind they had, he read off the list. She told him which one she wanted and he came back 5 minutes later telling her they were out of those too. NEVER AGAIN WILL WE GO BACK. For a server to deliver meals and then telling someone they were out of what she ordered is totally unacceptable,  but to do it to a child is worse.

I love this place! Great atmosphere, service, and really good food! If you are a business traveler and are looking to meet others,have a drink and good food this is your place. Never disappointed by the experience

Had a very pleasant lunch here. Nice patio on the canal, comfortable, good music, not loud. Great staff, attentive, but not imposing. Food very fresh and tasty. Definitely going back to this one. Thumbs up.

I came here on a Thursday late afternoon for dinner for the first time. The atmosphere and decor was amazingly put together. The staff was great but the food was terrible. I was expecting so much more. If I'm going to pay that much for food I expect it to taste good. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to the standards of the decor and environment. I will not be coming back or recommending.
Great knowledgeable wait staff and QUICK!!! My girl fell in love with the pesto spread for the in house made focaccia and her martini! I loved my lasagna. Great warm interior too
The food is good, service is so-so, its loud. Its in a great location.

This place is my fav. Brunch or dinner...great food. My favorite is the spicy shrimp risotto! They provide the best bread with amazing pesto dip. The patio is right along the water, yet the ambiance in the dining room is delightful. Staff is always friendly- I've never had bad service and I go often.  Must check it out!!

Took the family here for dinner and it was great.   Had the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and the early reviews were right, could cut it like butter.  Great flavor.  Also, we had the bacon wrapped dates.  Everyone in my family loved their entrees.

I hate going out for valentine's day.  the prices are jacked up, and the menus are usually uninspired using the cheapest ingredients possible.    I can't speak for their normal menu, but our valentine's dinner was amazing.  lobster bisque with corn fritters, lobster ravioli, pork 3 ways...the chocolate dessert that had a small peice of 6 different desserts...simply amazing.  the patio atmosphere is great too, the waitstaff were very friendly.
Best breakfast in Old town Scottsdale! Great price and atmosphere! Their calamari shrimp tempura at lunch was amazing. I keep going back because it's consistently delicious.

I had a fantastic brunch at Olive & Ivy. The food, service, and ambience was excellent. My favorite part was watching the food being cooked and the fresh bread coming out.   For brunch, I got a mixture of savory and sweet. The Cinnamon Roll came out first and it was huge, warm, and delicious. After enjoying the pastry, I was worried the main entrees would fall short but the Lamb Gyro and the Potato Hash were also very tasty.   What I recommend for Brunch/Lunch: -- Lamb Gyro
I love to get a salad here before a flight.  The food is very fresh and always delicious.

My aunt and I came back! Thanks for the dress code you address to the woman I stating about. We took my great aunt out for lunch and it was a very lovely ladies lunch out. Food was delicious as always and our waiter was the same as the last time and again he was outstanding. Thanks
LOVED IT.   Sat in Jeremy's section, DUDE KILLED IT.  Total pro: knows his wine, nailed the service.   We'll be back and will recommend this place!

To be honest I have zero complaints. The atmosphere was very calm, from the music to the dim lighting. Our server, Clenard was very genuine and an all around caring, helpful man. It's rare to find a place that has good atmosphere, food, and a genuine staff. I'm not the best with words, but I trust if you go you won't be displeased.

Great service! We had a professional server, Clenard, who told us he's been in the business 15 years. It really showed and made our dinner a delight. (He should think of being a consultant to other restaurants which have great food but mediocre service.)  We started with the bruschetta, a trio of mushroom, fig, and mozzarella. Each was a happy mouth experience.   The chicken chopped salad was big and rich, plenty for both of us. It was topped with "peanut granola" for that salty sweet crunchy somethin-somethin. Yum!  The outdoor seating was a beautiful alternative to the blaring music inside the restaurant.   We will go again and recommend you do so as well.

We had a group dinner here in October and had a great experience.  The restaurant is always packed and the atmosphere is always lively and beckons you to stay and enjoy the surroundings.  I started with the stuffed dates, enjoyed the scallops with asparagus and corn for my entree, and shared the vanilla tart and lemon tres leches cake with our group.  The food was great, the service was attentive and the atmosphere was welcoming.  Definitely a great place to enjoy the great patio for drinks and food.

Great food and atmosphere.  Everything from a casual lunch to group parties are always fun at Olive & Ivy.  All around great place. The appetizers and drinks are spot on with plenty of share able dishes. We'll be back to O&I many more times.

Love this place. They have an awesome martini with St. Germain and Gin - love it! I also love the flatbread pizza and the wine list. The bar is large and friendly and you can always feel the warm breeze from the door - I love places that leave the doors open!  I loved this place years ago when I used to vacation here, now I live here and can go whenever I want! YAY!

I liked this place... it is owned by the same person that owns sauce, bloom and the green house...   I love the dining room... they have nice loungy couches that make it a private dinner... i can not complain about my meal (or the meals of my dinner mates)... none of us knew what to get so we asked the server what her favorites were... we ended up getting 3 of the 5... we had the scallops, ravioli and some sort of meat... all of them i would get again... check it out... it has not been opened long

My mom and I tried this place out before hitting the mall during her most recent visit to town. Our first impression was the space and decor. It's very large and open, contemporary and easy to people watch... one of our favorite sports. We came after lunch and just before dinner on a Sunday. There was a significant crowd giving the time of day and day of the week. They were only serving flatbread and dinner salads at the time and we settled on sharing two flatbreads. I ordered the Pesto and she the Fig & Prosciutto along with a  pitcher of the white sangria.   We sat in the bar area in some leather couches and sofas that line the bar. Very comfortable but we could have done with a larger table being that there were only two of us and we had a hard time managing in a space that was meant for 4.  The Pesto flatbread was my favorite of the two. Roasted garlic cloves, lots of cheese, fresh tomato... what more could one want? The pesto was very good and gave the perfect amount of flavor. It was my ideal flatbread. The fig & prosciutto was good as well. It was a very unexpected pairing with fig, prosciutto, goat cheese and spinach. Being that goat cheese is one of my favorites, I felt like it was lacking. I probably wouldn't order this again but it wasn't tragic either by any means, just not exactly my taste. The white sangria was great. Very refreshing and an interesting combination of juices and flavors. I just wish that the pitcher wasn't more ice than sangria.   Our service wasn't fantastic nor was it awful as others have described.   Although I didn't order off of it the wine list was very extensive but it was also on the pricey side.

I stuck with the prepped food and was happy with the freshness of the chopped salad--hearty and well-balanced flavored: spinach and other dark greens, feta, cherry tomatoes, bacon... Good stuff.  Also had the butcher pizza. Rich and satisfying.
This place was so good I ordered seconds.  After waiting for the pizza I ended up missing my plane!  Doesn't matter food was so good I didn't care.  5 stars.

One of the best Italian restaurants we've been to!  We didn't even bother with the apps because we were told how filling and good the pastas were. We ordered the WILD MUSHROOM PAPPARDELLE and the SWEET POTATO CANNELLONI! Both were AMAZINGGGGG! The sweet potato was our favorite which is strange because I usually find it too sweet and rather enjoy spicy pasta. But wow SO SO good!

Now I can say that I've dined here for breakfast and dinner.   We elected for grabbing breakfast in the front as the restaurant wasn't open.  You're able to sit anywhere you chose, grab a number, and they will bring your breakfast to you.  They have a small menu selection.  I went w/ the smoked salmon platter, it's a classic & you can't really go wrong.  I also had the yogurt parfait - it was really good.  All the berries in there were fresh and in season.    For dinner, I enjoyed the calamari appetizer, duck & spinach ravioli, and sangria.  The calamari was pretty oily - it would've been nice to have a piece of paper at the bottom of the serving platter.  The ravioli was good, and the bite of sea bass that I had was good too.   Surprisingly the dessert didn't catch my eye.  But the server was great.    On a last note I set up a group private dining event a couple of years ago and they absolutely enjoyed it and I want to say there's a private outdoor area as well attached to the PDR.  My group had nothing but rave reviews.    All in all it gets 5 stars for the ambiance with the seating outside by the river, and great service.
This is a beautiful and energetic restaurant food was good and drinks were amazing when we finally got them, service left a lot to be desired which was disappointing

This may be one of my favorite late breakfast spots for a Saturday morning. The outdoor patio makes me feel like I'm on vacation. The pesto and bread at the beginning is a great way to start. I also love the mimosas, breakfast sandwich with potatoes on the side and a cinnamon roll to split. If it's too hot to sit outdoors, I love sitting up at the bar.

My family and I visited Olive and Ivy for brunch. The decor of the venue was fabulous and the ingredients for the food was fresh. My chopped salad was delicious and my wife's pouched egg sandwich was light and flavorful. We are heading back soon to try their dinner menu.

Nice please! Inside was pretty up scale. The lunch prices were not bad at all. Went for lunch and had the bacon burger which was yummy! Excellent excellent service! It was busy but they had enough staff and no waiting for a table. Served bread and olive oil which also was amazing. I tried the berry gelato, pretty good. Highly recommend this place for lunch. Will have to go back and try dinner.

Went here after a college graduation and ordered the lasagna. 10/10 would order again. The lasagna was bowl based and stayed hot for the duration of the meal. The strawberry shortcake was fantastic as well.
Quality of food, atmosphere and service is always the best here (and the drinks are deliciously strong!) :)
No line for a reason. Customer service is terrible and food is mediocre. Employees there are worthless.

Wonderful restaurant!   Dined here last fall for my boyfriend's birthday. The restaurant is beautiful and has a very romantic vibe. There's patio seating outdoors, near the water.  As for food, we received complimentary bread and pesto. We ordered the fritto appetizer (deep fried calamari, zucchini, and shrimp), ahi tuna, and the mushroom truffle pappardelle). The tuna was seared and had a nice miso/teriyaki flavor. I think the pasta dish could have used a bit more cheesy flavor. For dessert we received a birthday dessert on the house-- strawberry shortcake with sorbet.  Our waiter was very attentive and hospitable.   I would definitely dine here again!

We landed at Olive and Ivy at the suggestion of our Uber driver.  Listen to your Uber drivers, folks.  We were able to score an outdoor table with the firepit in the middle.  Great ambiance with the water behind us and the rustle of the wave sculpture (don't know what it is called, but super cool).  We started with the bacon wrapped dates and the salmon, avocado and prosciutto bruschetta, all of which were fantastic.  We all ordered mixed drinks, and we all enjoyed them.  I ordered the fig & ginger mule...then I ordered another one :).  For my entree I devoured the scallops, which melted in my mouth.  Others at the table ordered the wild mushroom pappardelle and bacon wrapped tenderloin and we were all very impressed.

Sunday brunch at Olive & Ivy started with a request for a window seat. As inviting as the patio looked, we were seduced by the comforts of indoor air conditioning. So modern are the cluster of amber lights suspended above the bar & attractive upholstered booths.   Our server was super enthusiastic about describing top sellers on the menu. I found his energy addictive (it helped me wake up!), but my friend found his over-exaggerated approach to be tiresome (like, can I just have my eggs with some peace & quiet, man!)   We ordered:  -- freshly-squeezed OJ: delicious, refreshing, sweet, lots of pulp  -- egg sandwich on a brioche bun for him  -- cheddar biscuit w/ scrambled eggs & sausage gravy for me: underseasoned on all fronts; gravy could've used a bit of pepper, eggs needed to be salted, biscuit was neither buttery nor flakey (more like mushy & starchy.) Side of potatoes were also blah.   Olive & Ivy's menu reads like a brunch lover's dream (& the Mediterranean twist doesn't hurt), but their potential has yet to be unlocked. Where are the exciting flavors to match your impressive decor & animated staff?

This totally hurts my heart to write this, but I had such an awful experience at this location.   I went the other evening, and it was honestly pretty quiet. When I walked in, the hostess was gossiping so loudly with one of the servers, and I usually wouldn't care, but they were complaining about another server (I think) and it was just so nasty and it really put a bad taste in my mouth. They ignored me until they were done with their conversation, too, so it was really awkward for me.   So after my awkward/distasteful beginning, I get seated. The server comes over and asks what we would like to drink - I order a fig and ginger mule, and my friend ordered some sangria. We also order the calamari and veggies to start. The server brought me my mule, but forgot the sangria. Fifteen minutes later, the app comes out, and it is cold. Still no sign of my friends sangria. We mention that the calamari was cold to our server, who says that just happens sometimes but that it seemed pretty warm when it was brought out. We were confused by the response, but its whatever. We order dinner - Ahi tuna for me, pesto chicken for my friend. It takes forever to come out. Still no sangria for my friend, which we pretty much just give up on at this point.   The food came and it was good, which is why this is 2 stars instead of 1. It took a very long time on a very un-busy night for our food to come out, so I'm not sure if our waiter forgot to put it in or if there was just some mishap in the kitchen.   When the bill came, the sangria (which we never received) was still on there. We told our server, who seemed irritated, and another 15 minutes went by before we got the updated bill. I totally get everyone has their off days, and I love Sam Fox concepts, but I don't think I'll be returning to this location any time soon.

One of the pricier Fox restaurants but it definitely has some of my favorite food. The bruschetta is beyond delicious and all of the main courses I have ever had are amazing as well. Friendly service and really great looking place. It can be a bit of a wait so make your reservation well in advance.

Cool Place!  Loved the vibe I got from this place. The food was really good my friends and I really enjoyed it.  I ordered their pizza with a glass of coke our server "Jen" was really cool! I would recommend this place if you want something on a budget but looking for more upscale place.

The place is very cool, a very pretty atmosphere. The menu is pretty simple which is great, I don't need complicated stuff. I had the chicken chopped salad and it was very good! Very similar yet but flavorful. The waiter was great and had a great sense of humor. The only thing that bothered me was I ordered ice tea which was amazing but he never once offered to refill mine or anyone else at the table. That's the only negative. I would go again for dinner
So cute in here, clean, great service, open. I love being able to see the chefs do their thing in the kitchen. And MY Mediterranean salad with grilled chicken was delicious!
A great place to sit on the patio and enjoy the company of friends or family.  Casual and yet classy.  The food and drinks are great!

I can only speak for the morning experience as that's the only time I've been. The food is excellent and the coffee is great, much better than Starbucks. The morning staff is helpful and friendly, especially Nathan and Elle. Love coming here for breakfast. Thanks!

Sure, the food at Olive & Ivy is good, but there are plently of places, even Fox RC places, that I have been to that are better.   Whenever I go to Olive & Ivy, I feel that the service is a little snooty, even from the point where you walk in the door. I always seem to be greeted by a somewhat inconsiderate hostess, and the servers to be honest really aren't that much better. You can tell that they are completely fake when they come to take your oders/bring you food, because they're scrounging for a good tip, which they expect from this restaurant's normal clientele-- the well-off businesspeople out to lunch or the Scottsdale moms that congregate to go out to brunch.   The food, like i mentioned, is decent. I almost always get their Mediterranean Salad with some grilled salmon on top. It's usually pretty decent, but definitely overpriced. You get about 1 1/2 standard measuring-cup cups of mixed greens, some cous-cous and other fillers, with about a 3-ounce portion of salmon all for around $21. And that's just for the salad, not including drinks.   Just about the only thing that keeps Olive & Ivy from getting a two-star review is their delicious pesto and bread that they serve (upon request) before you get your meal. It's honestly really delicious, light, and the pesto isn't too garlicy or salty. It is on the smaller side, so make sure you ration it properly between yourself and any of the other guests who you're dining with.    3 stars for:   Pros:  Decent food   Cons:  Bleh service Small portions Overpriced   Bottom Line: Yeah, i'll be back, as long as I'm not the one footing the bill.

I have been coming to Olive & Ivy since it opened a few years ago on the waterfront. I love the location and i have come here consistently because I love having a latte on the patio as well as enjoying the food.  This year i have noticed that the coffee has absolutely no taste. When I question the bar staff, they tell me that it is the same and that it comes from Seattle. I consider myself a connoisseur of good coffee, having lived in Europe and South America. Something has changed and, with great reluctance, i will be looking for a new coffee place.  I hope that the manager/ owners read reviews.

It's just hard to give them anything less.  They have the best patio in Scottsdale.  They are always open.  I can usually get a table without a reservation or too long of a wait, or we figure out a spot in the non reserved patio area (which is where i want to be anyway). The food is always consistent. And these guys care...service is always awesome. There must be a no-attitude policy with their servers bc they are always pleasant.  I'm a fan of the med-salad and i add salmon and often will split if i'm there with a girlfriend.  it's the perfect meal and a bottle of cab.  The wines are priced very reasonably.  It's a great neighborhood spot.  PS: Their bloody mary's are really good too.

Love this place!! So yummy. When with friends I always get the Chef's Board and the artichoke heart salad and it is amazing. Pretty much everything I've ordered here is good. A little on the pricier side but worth it for the atmosphere. I recommend sitting outside in the lounge area on a nice afternoon.

This place was quick and really tasty! We had a little over an hour during our layover in PHX and were looking for something small - the Breakfast Club was $7.95 but was very tasty! Egg, cheese, bacon, avocado, & mayo on an english muffin was pleasantly surprising (cant expect too much from fast food, right?)  The cashier was also very efficient and friendly. They don't have hot tea (only coffee, iced tea, smoothies) - but she said if I had my own tea bag she'd happily give me a cup of hot water for free! (good thing I took the extra from the hotel the day before!)

We were visiting for Spring Training and made reservations here on a recommendation of a friend. So glad we did! We sat out on the patio for dinner and although the night was not really warm, the heaters kept the temp just right. Food was reasonably priced and absolutely delicious! Lots of different choices. Our server Kevin was very capable and knew just when to check on us without hovering! We were never wanting for anything and he seemed to just show up at the right time. Can't wait to go back when we return to Scottsdale
Our server was very pleasant and gave good recommendations. The flatbreads were great and sweet potato pasta was delicious.
Awesome restaurant to go too. Love everything about it. Can't say anything negative about this place!!  Totally go if your in Scottsdale Arizona!!

Had the Mediterranean salad to go for $7 and I was very impressed with the quality, taste and size of the salad. Lettuce cucumber tomatoes feta cheese couscous and almonds. Really tasty and filling. Loved it. And the price is right for airport food.

AMAZING!!!!!!!  I went with 4 co workers and we had such a great time.  The food was amazing and the atmosphere was really nice.  Not too casual and not too fancy.  Great spot for a date or a family.  Will definitely go again.

great place...fun atmosphere...great food...but pricey.... great date night restaurant anytime...If you wanna save money dont order alcoholic drinks nor desert... if you are craving desert, just go to their gelato store in house and have a scoop...its cheap, tasty and still keeps you in the restaurant.

YUM! This place not only has cute decor, but also great food and friendly, helpful service.  I sat at the bar since I came here alone while I'm visiting town for work. I had seen such great reviews which led me to come here as my first dining experience in the city.  The bartender was very friendly and attentive (I didn't catch his name but he had a man bun so shout out to him for management, he was great!). I started with the grapefruit mojito which both looked and tasted great.  Next I ordered a bruschetta trio: - Manchego quince & Spanish chorizo - Avocado, sweet corn, charred scallion & feta - Brussels sprout, whipped goat cheese, prosciutto & sherry gastrique   They were all delicious but my favorites were the Brussels and manchego ones. I also liked that they were pretty sizable but each piece was also cut into 3 smaller bites to make it a bit easier to eat (although still messy!).  I also ordered the lamb meatballs and omg - flavor heaven!! I typically never eat lamb but these has such amazing flavor and has an in-house made tzatziki sauce which was just *muah* The bartender who served me described these best as a type of deconstructed gyro - hey come with grilled, slices pita slices as well. Again, sizable portion as well.  This place was great and I do not have enough old things to say - glad I stopped here on my trip!
Another Sam Fox restaurant. Food is decent but the location is better. Cool vibe. Good for get togethers. Worth coming to if in the area.

Ok seriously how is it possible for one place to have top notch customer service AND amazing food!?!? I am enjoying by far the best cinnamon roll ever and dude made my mocha perfectly! Thank you Olive and Ivy you make my mornings so much better!

My boyfriend and I met a friend from out of town for brunch today. I didn't really know what this place about except for the fact that it served brunch and that it was in Scottsdale. The suite number is 195 off of Marshall Way. It was a little tricky for us to find it being that it was our first time. There are off street parking and if that's not available, there's a free parking garage just kitty corner of the restaurant.   We made reservations for 3 for 11:45, the place was packed so we were glad that we made reservations.   We started off with some brunch cocktails: OLDTOWN HOUND $9 rutte gin, st. germain, arizona grapefruit BELLINI $8 peach purée, peach liqueur, smirnoff vodka, prosecco IVY & GINGER $11 smirnoff vodka, canton ginger, pineapple, sparkling wine   I had the Ivy & Ginger, you definitely taste the pineapple - nice refreshing drink. They had the Bellini and Oldtown Hound - both of them enjoyed their drinks.  I ordered the SMOKED SALMON* (toasted bagel, tomato, caper & red onion)  for $11 on an Everything Bagel. This was not the best Lox Bagel I've ever had; the salmon was a little saltier than I'd like. The nice part is this came disassembled so you could put as much creme cheese and toppings as you'd like.   My boyfriend had the EGGS BENEDICT* (shaved ham & basil hollandaise) for $13.5. This was also not best eggs benedict I've ever tasted either. The waitress gave us a heads up about the eggs coming a little translucent which was nice. I'm assuming they have had a lot of questions about it.  The * means that it contains raw foods and may cause health hazards; ie the eggs/salmon and tomato (jk about the tomato).  Our friend had the LAMB GYRO (grilled pita, tzatziki, tomato, onion & feta) $14. He said he liked it.  I almost forgot.... I had the cinnamon roll. I ordered one and it was big enough for 3 people to share. It was delicious! It had to be the best thing I tasted there!  What I loved about this place - the decor/atmosphere/drinks, cinnamon roll and customer service. What I didn't care for - the food. Maybe I didn't order the right things but I'd be hesitant to order food there again.

I went to Scottsdale for a girls weekend and liked this place so much that I came here twice over 4 days! The outside patio is awesome and they have a great happy hour. All of the food that I tired was on point as well and everyone in our group liked their food. The first time I came here was for happy hour and we tried the bruschetta and truffle fries. All of the bruschetta's were bomb! Plus they were huge, split into 3 pieces, so it was perfs to share. To top it off they were $3 each. Steal! We each has the sangria and that was delish. I came back for Easter brunch a couple days later and we had the bread and pesto dipping sauce, wow! Everyone was talking about how good it was. I ordered the Mediterranean salad and it was soooo good! It was light, but filling. I even put a little of the pesto dipping sauce on top. My friends ordered the hummus, the Cobb salad, and the parfait. Everyone liked what they got. There literally was not a single complaint. Then to top it off we tried the cinnamon roll. This was super good. I only had a couple bites and we all passed it around. It's good if you go with a group to share with everyone. I definitely recommend this restaurant. It's right on the canal as well so it has great ambiance.

I have been a long time customer and while I used to love Olive and Ivy, I just don't enjoy it as much as I used to.  The wait staff is ok but not super friendly and the food has been just ok.  They used to bring a generous portion of bread and pesto to start and now the pieces are thin and cold...not warmed at all.
For the price, portion, quality and atmosphere this is great!  I recommend the SWEET POTATO CANNELLONI (sorry i had to copy and paste lol).

Amazing sangria and food!! Perfect spot for lunch/dinner! Especially with groups! They are very accommodating and fun! Great vibe great good great location perfect patio in the heart of old town! On the water front how could you ask for anything better from sea on to season the entire restaurant gets better and better!!!

Love this place! It has a huge space, but making reservations is still a smart move as the tables fill up fast. I kicked it off with a white sangria and trio bruschetta which were amazing! The server was attentive, knowledgeable about the wines and menu. I had the salmon which truly was outstanding - cooked medium. What flavor! Also ordered was the chicken pesto flatbread - quite tasty and big portion. I also enjoyed a great vino as I took in the crowd. Awesome experience.

Had a great business lunch there and would absolutely recommend Olive & Ivy!!  Loved the atmosphere, decor, food and most of all the service.  Our server Mark was attentive, without being obnoxious.  They serve bread with their own Pesto sauce as their version of bread/butter, it was delicious.  I had their Gyro Sandwich with a light salad and it was flavorful.  Wish I would have sat in the patio area, but was concerned that it was still too cool.  Went out afterwards to check it out, and would highly recommend it.  The interior decor is definitely inviting as well, but with the great Phoenix Spring weather the patio should be great option.  Enjoy everyone!!
Great atmosphere and service was great. The food was just ok. We had heard good things and came up disappointed.

Stopped in here quickly during a business trip and it was perhaps the most decadent lunch I've had. I love the pesto appetizer and the Cobb salad  but the real winner was the caramel marmalade dessert. I had a drink that was fig with vodka (a mixed mule) and it was divine.  I now tell people this is the place to stop at if they are in Phoenix or Scottsdale

I saw the olives, however the ivy was nowhere to be seen, just like the real value.  To put it simply you are paying for decore and location, the quality ingredients do not match the prices.  We had a Veggie Fritatta $11 and the watermelon salad $10.  While it was nice that they were able to do split plates, the Mellon on the salad was not very sweet, the mint was tasteless and the chevre cream was not viscus enough to stick to the fruit.   The veggie fritata was decent, the mushrooms were a bit rubbery but the arugula and chevre were a nice touch, but was it worth $11, not really.   I did enjoy the focaccia bread and pesto that came with the meal, but that was  the high point.   The patio looked great, but with the heat and a broken misting system that was a no go.

Always excellent food and atmosphere.  The steak with potatoes and creamed spinach is one of my favorites in the valley.  Sitting at the bar is a favorite of mine and my wife.  They have some great cocktails and a pretty good bourbon selection as well.   Scottsdale at its best.

My wife and I went there last weekend for our anniversary. We had reservations for a table on the patio at 7:45. We got there at 7:50ish and were promptly seated. It was a very busy Friday night. It was one of those very cold AZ nights, so we requested our server if we could have one of those patio heaters by our table and he was back in 5 minutes with one. I would strongly recommend a table on the patio for a nice, quiet, romantic dinner. It tends to get very loud inside on the weekends and it might be good to hang out inside with friends and drink but for a nice dinner the patio ambiance is really amazing.   Now for the food and drinks - My wife got the ivy and ginger cocktail and I got the red sangria. Before the drinks came out, our server got us warm bread with pesto sauce and it was really good. Drinks came out fairly quick and I must say I loved the vodka ginger cocktail drink!! It was HUGE and had a nice kick to it.   For the food - we are vegetarians so that really cut down our options to few. Our server Ryan G. was awesome and I would recommend to ask for a table in his area. We ordered the sweet corn, red peppers and goat cheese flat bread and Ryan recommended the sweet potato cannelloni. He said the portion was big enough to share and he can even split it and get it in two separate plates for us to share. The food was out in about 10-15 minutes and Ryan was correct...the portions for the cannelloni were perfect to share and we both absolutely loved the cannelloni and the flat-bread. The cannelloni had a nice sweet/salty taste and the spinach/almonds on the top tasted amazing.   Ryan had also asked us initially if were celebrating anything and we had told him it's our anniversary. After we were done eating, he got us a delicious looking strawberry short cake (on the house), with fresh strawberries on a white plate that had a handwritten note with chocolate icing saying "Happy Anniversary" . We did not expect this at all and it was really a very nice surprise! The cake was absolutely delicious and it was the perfect way to end the meal.   We will definitely go back!

Came here for dinner last night.  Great place for people watching, if you like watching boring people.  A very enthusiastic (though as we discovered later, inept) DJ was "spinning" near the entrance.  Got seated, ordered. Drinks came quickly, as did appetizers and entres. Everything was very good. However service was poor. Water was not refilled, we were not asked if we wanted refills or additional drinks.  We sat in a booth inside, but the outdoor seating looked great, lots of space overlooking the waterfront. B/B-

While I was in Scottsdale I had a lunch meeting at Olive and Ivy.  The food was excellent as was the service and atmosphere.  I had the hummus appetizer and the salmon Cesar salad the first day.  It was so good that I came back a second time and had the wedge salad.    If you are in the area give this place a try.  You won't be disappointed!
Ive been for Brunch a couple of times. The food is great and the staff are always friendly and personable. The space is very large with a beautiful outdoor patio as well. Nicely done!

We flew on USAir and their terminal in the airport is SEVERELY lacking in food options.  Oh sure they are working on opening a few more joints this year but at the time our options were limited so we went in here.  We paid $30 for two sandwiches, 2 sodas, and one salad.  GEEZE!!! And the sandwiches were more bread than anything else but as I said, in this terminal the options were limited.  One positive I could say for them as that they got your stuff out to you quickly.  I knew we should've eaten something in the area before going through security.

This is a very nice place to take someone you really like on a first date. The food is healthy and they are very cautious if you have allergies. They took my nut and shellfish allergies very seriously, making sure to customize my food and prevent contamination. This is definitely more on the pricey side, but worth the quality and ambiance.

I stopped by Olive and Ivy with Gabi M and Andrea R for a quick breakfast in the marketplace side. I really enjoyed the coffee house/market vibe of this place, especially for such a casual meal. We just ordered at the counter, took our number, found a seat, and they brought our food out to us.  While Olive and Ivy serve a myriad of snacks, including some very delicious looking baked goods I went for a healthier option - the egg white omelet. It was served with tomatoes, avocados and a side of mixed fruit. On the day I was there the fruit was mostly melon in case you're wondering. Gabi and I also shared an order of wheat toast to round out our meal.  Andrea raved about the smoothies, but I had to have coffee since it's my favorite thing to drink first thing in the morning. And the coffee here was good - smooth and dark just the way I like it!

Olive & Ivy sounds like the type of place that a basic bitch would go to get a salad. Well I'm confirming, it is the type of place that a basic bitch would go to get a salad. I guess that means I'm a basic bitch, because I LOVED the salad.   I got the chicken chopped and it was OMG totes delish! Seriously, the blue cheese, bacon, avocado, peanut granola, and buttermilk dressing combination was one of the better bowls of half healthy food I've had in a long while. It was only 12 bucks to boot!   The space itself was just as simple and awesome as my lunch. Filtered lighting from lofted ceilings and a red overtone on most of the furniture. Chic, yet approachable. The type of interior that would be cool for a wedding.   Wonder if they'll open one in San Diego soon :-p
Sit on the patio during the nice months, it's gorgeous right on the water. I had the sweet potato tortellini and it was amazing. Great atmosphere, food & service. I would recommend people try it.

I came here for the awesome brunch I keep hearing about. It's usually pack and I was on a mini business trip so why not!  I will say this, I brunch often in Miami so I'm pretty sure the review may be bias but I'll let you be the judge of that.  Ok so service is ok, nothing extra. I sat at the bar and all the bartenders talked to each other about each other and only addressed the people when they needed something and went back to their own world. They were direct, that's the word. Direct, no friendly smile or hey I recommend this.  The food was just ok, nothing that made it different. Brunch consists of eggs, bacon, bread, blah blah nothing that made it unique. I was expecting something different, maybe in taste or maybe in presentation. But nope it was plain Jane breakfast. I may go back to try the bakery sweets but if you are looking for a brunch spot it's not this one. But a quick breakfast and maybe a sit down Quick drink go for it. I gave it 3 stars bc service was ok and the place is in a cute spot. That's it!

This place is awesome! The food and drinks were delicious. Reservations are recommended since the place is super popular and always packed. The restaurant is centrally located in a beautiful area with lots of fun shopping.

I frequent Olive & Ivy quite often -- almost once a weekend, in fact, since I love their brunch menu.  The food is definitely not the best, or the most exotic that can be available, but I find it very good nonetheless.    The normal routine I find most in tune with my taste is to walk in mid-morning and put my name in (I always end up waiting, though it's normally only 5 minutes, so its completely negligible), which gives me just enough time to grab a mimosa for my brunch mate and I.  The mimosa's are somewhat of a hit-and-miss, meaning the ratio of ingredients ranges depending on which bartender does the job.  Really though, they never are bad, and much better than countless other establishments I've patronized.  The food is very good in my opinion, and the pastry basket is a nice addition to any brunch, though it's definitely not for those on any sort of diet!  I usually order the mushroom omelet, which works great for any sort of low carb diet, and I am always happy with it.  The atmosphere is pretty good for weekend mornings, though I haven't yet tried a dinner here yet.  I've heard fairly good things from everyone I know that has gone, though.  The outdoor patio is somewhat of a rarity in the Valley of the Sun, which is a shame since the 8 or so months out of the year when the weather is enjoyable (they have portable heaters during the winter), the spacious patio is very nice.  There are expansive sofas surrounding a fountain, and arranged tables throughout the outdoor area.  The wait staff has been generally good, though sometimes they have forgotten to bring us water, which is honestly no problem.  If you remind them, they almost come running back with it.  Overall, I continue to come when I'm available, and definitely recommend it to anyone going into the area.
Another great outdoors meal at Olive and Ivy. We probably overate as we split and appetizers, flatbread AND ordered entrees. Great service and nice ambiance make this a consistent choice.

Atmosphere... Environment...ambiance!! It's beautiful!!! Such a chic but comforting place to dine. The menu changes and updates but I had the goat cheese pumpkin ravioli ... Very delicious. Great choice of wines. When I'm in Scottsdale I will def enjoy this restaurant .

This is by far my favorite place to come eat brunch and sit on a patio. I've been here 4 times and this place has not let me down once with food or service. Today we ordered the Mediterranean salad and bruschetta. The bruschetta choice we picked were the Brussels sprouts, avocado, and tomato/basil. The Brussels sprouts was my favorite but they are all very good. We ate our meal with a Fig Mule to sip on. That was also tasteful and not to sweet. Can't wait to come back again, don't know why I always wait to long to.

Loved the pesto and great flavors from the bruschetta as well.  I ordered an off menu item - green chile chicken and white bean soup. It was very tasty but very little chicken. Equivalent of maybe half a tender - somewhat of a let down.  My wife ordered the gnocchi pomodoro- which was really good.  Friendly staff and great ambiance. For Dessert we shared an awesome lemon tres leches cake - definitely recommend this.

I've had some very good meals at Olive & Ivy. I've had two dinners and a lunch here. This is one of my girlfriend's favorite FRCs but for me it falls closer to the bottom for some reason.   It might be the menu options not being quite up my alley quite as much as some of the others but don't get me wrong it's still a great spot. The Patio is amazing, I had my favorite dinner out there.   For an appetizer we got the artichoke hearts which were well done. Our waitress made a good recommendation on wine. I had the sea scallops which were cooked perfectly.   The inside is very impressive as well. They have a market attached which has some good stuff in it. All in all a solid restaurant.

Couldn't be happier when I found this place where they serve great tasting freshly prepared restaurant quality food without the wait ... at an airport!  Great selection of salad, panini and pizza at very reasonable price for a great tasting quick bite while waiting for your flight in a relaxing setting.  Plenty of seating with nice comfy benches with electric outlet underneath your seat  Free wifi  Great friendly service and helpful staff  Also serves freshly made coffee but unfortunately they're not serving it for some reason last time I was here around 7pm  It doesn't get any better than this for an airport eatery!  You can count on me otherwise your next meal here is on me!

Be Careful !!    Went Thursday Late afternoon Nice Atmosphere Our Server was Angela My wife asked for a glass of house red  wine Angela said " We don't have house wines" She suggested the featured wine, To our surprise it was $15 for a very small glass all the wines on the menu were $7-$8 dollars  She never mentioned "the Drink special wines at $5 at glass available We got hustled We also had the Fritto Misto To call it Very Average is being generous WE wisely didn't stay for Dinner

One of my favorite restaurants!! Their FREE (and unlimited) pesto dip and bread is amazing, as well as their appetizers and main dishes. The atmosphere is also a plus, with indoor and outdoor patio seating, both of which are cozy.   They also have an outside patio seating area which is first come first serve, however we sometimes prefer that over sitting at the tables because it is more relaxing with comfy patio furniture.  The only reason this place is getting 4 stars as opposed to 5 is because the past 3 times I have been there with girlfriends to grab some happy hour and/or dinner we have had girl waiters who were horrible (not bringing us water, having to ask multiple times for menus and bread, forgetting our food, adding things to the bill at the end which weren't ours, and then giving us attitude when we politely would tell them what we had and what the bill shows doesn't match, etc). We even had one waitress leave for the evening without closing us out, and without having anyone take over!! The busboy took care of us, and that is also to whom we left our tip with. Management needs to work on training their staff better!

Olive & Ivy is a comfortable restaurant that is absolutely perfect for lunch/brunch. The food is good, not particularly great, but I'm still a fan because of its decor and atmosphere. On a sunny day, I'd recommend a relaxing boozy brunch outside.  The prosciutto flatbread, bloody mary, and biscuits were all tolerable, but I probably wouldn't order them again.  The staff is fantastic. They really go out of their way to make sure that you have a fantastic experience.
The breakfast club was really good, but they didn't have any iced coffee when I ordered

First of all I must say the Ambiance is amazing the place has a great vibe and the crowd is great. Although it might feel as if your wallet will be empty as u walk in I must say that the food is very well priced. The staff is very helpful and sweet and the food is delicious. This probably my new favorite place to dine

Great place for any occasion. Classy environment with a delicious menu. Can't get enough of their pesto! Also, if you have room for dessert you must try their strawberry shortcake bar (something along those lines). Amazing!

I talk to a lot of people who really love Olive and Ivy.  It has a lot going for it that works really well:  I love the ambience.  The booths are super comfy and I like that, depending on where you're sitting, you can see the chefs cooking up something awesome with flames licking the air like you're in the most awesome depths of hell (not as punishment, more like a 1980's heavy metal fantasy).  While there are items on the menu that are pretty goddamned expensive, there's always something there that's within your price range.    I like how on the other side of the restaurant you can just order something to go deli-style and grab a bottled beverage and run in and out really quick if you've got a tight time-restraint on your lunch break.  However, considering how highly the restaurant obviously thinks of itself (it really does), the food isn't that good.  Now, don't get me wrong, it's not disgusting by any means and it's certainly not even bad.  It's good.  It is definitely good, but... I mean with the lush interiors and all the fake Scottsdale noses you see around, I'd think their food would be... better?  I'm trying not to sound like a picky little bitch, but man, when you get the fries with the burger, the fries just aren't very good, man.  The burger is kind of a standard, kind of hard to fuck up, but, y'know, it could be better.  I had their short rib sandwich and just wasn't into it.  The pasta I got another time was good, I liked it, but it seemed to me like something I would probably make myself super bored staying at home.  It's altogether an alright place.  Their drinks are usually pretty good and the service is awesome.  Three stars.
Love love love!!! Having no expectations I fell in love immediately, loved our waiter Tommy - he should own the place, we felt at home, relaxed and ready to eat and drink - HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

This was the first good restaurant my fiance and I had been to since moving to Scottsdale from Seattle. I had a great time and the service was great. We enjoyed a bottle of wine, appetizers, and I absolutely loved their Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin. I highly recommend them for fine dining.

This was probably my 4th time here and I normally really like this place. The food was great - I ordered a Chopped Chicken Salad. It was delicious and the portion size was huge. However, as I was about to leave, I gave my waitress my debit card to pay for my $13 salad, and while she was processing my payment, I received an email from my bank saying that a $274 charge was put on my account from Olive & Ivy. Of course I was very concerned. The waitress came back and handed me my card saying that she accidentally slid my card for another table's order. She apologized and said she fixed it, but acted like it wasn't a big deal at all. She didn't even bother to void my $13 dollar salad, but slid my card AGAIN to charge me for that. So I had paid almost $300 for a salad. The waitress's ignorance/lack of paying attention was a huge inconvenience. I had to call my bank a couple days later to put in a claim to dispute the charges, and had to wait a couple more days to get that money back in my account.   That being said, this place could definitely use some better service. The only reason I'd ever come back here is for the food alone.
What can I say, Great Food, Great Service, Amazing "waterfront" location.  Love it and go back often.

Had dinner there the other day. Again - I love the design and atmosphere. Service was good but the food... not worth the $$$ they are asking for. Starting with the kids option - I ordered the pasta with marinara sauce which the server told me will have short noodles for easy pick up by a small toddler, it was made of long wide noddle, even after cutting it was not fit for a child. I ordered the grilled cheese which was okay, really not tasty as it should be.  My friend and I shared the rock shrimp which was awful, tasteless and the shrimp was not cleaned through so we had some crunchy sand like experience. Then we shared the corn flat bread which looked and tasted like airport food.  We decided to leave and got our check - for what we got paying that much was a big disappointment. They didn't even take the kid pasta dish off... $5 people... really?  I will not go back unless it is for drinks only. The two stars rating is for design, location and an okay service. Food deserve ONE.

I've eastern here 3-4 times and each time has been spot on. Today, I ordered a turkey sandwich on focaccia roll- outstanding   The bread was fresh and moist, meats, veggies and dressing were very tasty and not overwhelming.   Getting food in an airport can be a challenging experience - this is a reliable, we'll run and friendly place.   I travel all over the country and Olive and Ivy is as good or better than any restaurant in any airport I've been to.  Try it!

After eating the fabulous sandwich at the airport, my wife and I decided to try the sit down at the Scottsdale Waterfront. Amazing in every respect. Service by Mason was attentive, helpful but not overbearing. Bruschetta had many different flavor options (we tried them all) and the bread was the cosmos tame theme holding the flavor together - outstanding  Mediterranean salad- order it! Tossed lightly and very fresh and flavorful. Salmon was cooked to perfection with delicious roasted potatoes and my wife's veal ravioli was very rich and fresh  Sorbet for dessert was a trio of delight   All in all a vibrant place to dine and enjoy a great dining experience !

Someone let Sam Fox know what exactly he has with this gem right here! Over the last couple weeks I have planned a night out for my wife and I for celebrating our 6 month wedding anniversary and our first baby boy on the way in the end of October, and I must say I am extremely satisfied with Making Olive & Ivy part of the plan! My wife and I originally walked into the Marketplace side door but a worker there was happy to lead us to the hostess stand and then we were led to our table. We were greeted by our waiter Josh P. who congratulated us on our 6 Month and our son on the way. This impressed me and took me by surprise as the waiter who I have never spoken to in my life congratulated us right off the bat. He gave us time to look over the menu but never left us stranded. He filled our drinks without a hitch, never reaching over us or interrupting our conversation. Josh then brought out this amazing bread with this sauce they didn't look good off the bat but was out of this world! My wife ordered the lasagna and I ordered these awesome little pasta raviolis' filled with cheesy/creamy awesomeness. From appetizer to entree then from entree to dessert, Josh wiped down the table and made everything fresh and clean. Also during our stay one of the managers, Kim, stopped by and somehow beat Josh to the punch with filling up our drinks. I'm not sure how others feel but for me it's awesome to see a manager work on the floor and see the managment team working alongside the waiters. I wish I had pics of all of the good because it was awesome, I will make sure to return ASAP as the food, staff and environment is great, thanks Josh for helping us celebrate on a special night out! Hope to see you guys again soon and will make sure to sit where Josh will be our waiter!!!

I have been coming to Olive & Ivy for almost two years now. I bring family and friends here from out of town. The food is consistently fantastic and you can't beat that free bread with the pesto. I took my mom, brother, grandma, and 2yr old daughter yesterday for lunch. We started with the Tuna Tar Tar Tacos. My mother and brother LOVED them. My daughter ate at least two big pieces of bread and tore up the pesto. How many 2yr olds are eating pesto? really. The general consensus was that they loved the food and wished I would've brought them when they first got into town.  I ordered my favorite chicken panini w/fries. It's just too good to get anything else. Don't get me wrong, I still take a taste of everyone else's food so I know what to recommend to my future guests. That panini with the cheese, zucchini, roasted tomatoes, roasted chicken........mmmmmmmmm......so good. They also have great fries, sorry to say but second to Gordon Biersch Brewery's.  Olive & Ivy never lets me down. Great location, great seating whether inside or outside. Can't wait to go back.

Really nice place and good food. Happy hour is really good just a little weird the patio division for happy hour and non happy hour. And yes regular section had a more better service as far as attention. I enjoy my self just wish services was a little more attentive I got the wrong bill for my table and then my to go meal was giving to another table. but over all is a nice spot.

Been here twice.  First time they were out of everything I wanted on the menu.  Granola on the yogurt parfait was soggy.  The staff is so grumpy... they need some sleep.  Skip this place if you want some food at PHX.

On a whim I showed up last Saturday night without reservations and waited 45 minutes for a table outside on the patio. Well worth the wait to enjoy al fresco dining on a beautiful patio. I thought the menu items overall were a tad pricey. So I decided to order the Hummus ($6) as an appetizer and the Italian Flatbread ($12) as an entree.  The Hummus had tomatoes, onions and I believe cucumber (it was really dark outside so I'm not sure about the cucumber) on top of the Hummus. An excellent combination of flavors. The best Hummus I have ever had. The Italian Sausage and Goat Cheese Flatbread was serviceable but I can't see myself ever ordering that again. The Sausage had a little kick to it but really didn't taste too great.  I'm a little fuzzy as to whether the bread that the server asked if we wanted was free. Why would you ask a diner if you wanted free bread? So that kind of rubbed me the wrong way since it seemed like some covert upselling to me. That's why we decided to order the Hummus instead of getting the bread. BTW - I only noticed one other table in our vicinty had the bread.

So many great meals at Olive & Ivy, but tonight was the best!  Jacob was an amazing server, went out of his way to ensure our dual anniversary dinner was a memory we will never forget.  The food is incredible, amazing ambiance, and the service is top notch.  The mushroom pappardelle was delicious, killer salmon with beets and potatoes, fresh baked focaccia with house made pesto is a must to start with. Various bruschetta appetizers are a great start.  Desserts all made in house are amazing, had lemon cake, strawberry shortcake were insanely good.  Wine list is really strong as well and we loved the bottle of Sangiovese we had.  We will be back anytime we visit Scottsdale!  An unforgettable dining experience!

Everything was perfect at lunch today. The food, service & ambiance is spot-on!   We enjoyed the  Mediterranean Salad. I had a perfectly prepared piece of Salmon that was a very generous portion; my friend asked for 1/2 chicken 1/2 lamb and we devoured every bite we could.   Their bread is delicious along with the tasty basil dipping sauce as long as you don't  mind a hefty portion of olive oil.
Great atmosphere great food.  The wine list was the best in town.  Try the pork loin wrapped in Bacon.... yum delish.

I absolutely LOVE this restaurant. We went there for an office party and the food was SO good!  The waitstaff was courteous and prompt. I love that they have the little pastry cafe for quick bites attached as well. The outside patio is great this time of year when it's so nice out. Night time ambiance is great for date night and it's not too expensive.

Great atmosphere, even better food. The fig and apple bruschetta were both fantastic, and the filet of beef was cooked to perfection. The wife didn't really like her gnocchi, but this is my review, not her's, so 5 stars it is.

My husband and I shared bruschetta to start.  We enjoyed all three, but he particularly liked the Fresh Mozzarella (delicious fresh basil!!) and I liked the Prosciutto and Fig (rich, sweet, delicious!).  I had the Lasagna Bolognese with garlic bread.  The drizzle on top of the bread was so creamy with the perfect hint of garlic.  The lasagna itself was also very flavorful.  Fresh bread and pasta make a difference.  There was a lot of energy in restaurant with the lots of little groups of people chatting and enjoying dinner.  The service was also great.  Our server was very helpful with tips to help us make decisions on what to order.  We had a fun evening and a delicious meal.

I love this place!  You can always find something great eat.  I recently went for a friends birthday.  I would recommend their outdoor dining area.  It's a pretty decent size and you will have to wait if you don't make reservations even during the week for lunch.  We had my favorite appetizer, the bacon wrapped dates.  I love the arugula salad that comes under the dates.  They also give you bread and olive oil pesto dip.  That's a meal in itself.  We ordered the chicken chopped salad which was delicious!  We told the waiter that all four of us were going to share so he brought it out already divided in four bowls.  We also had the margarita flat bread and the sweet potato cannelloni that was to die for!  We also ordered the cheeseburger that was cut into four as well.  The server also brought out a chocolate cake with ice cream for our friends birthday.  We experienced great customer service!  We will be back soon.  Probably for happy hour since it's a good one!

Came here for brunch with a few friends before a Spring Training game! The food is sooo good! Huge portion for a decent price - especially given the high quality of food! I definitely recommend grabbing a bite and some drinks if you're on the fence about going there! This place never disappoints. Close to the waterfront and right by the main OT Scottsdale area. Be prepared for an hour+ wait if you didn't make a reservation, otherwise try and grab a seat by the bar or at he open tables outside (the ones with the fire pits on the southwest side of the patio)!

I absolutely love the patio at Olive and Ivy.  It's the perfect spot on the canal for a glass of wine and bruschetta. The ambience here is great, the staff is friendly, and their homemade bread and pesto dip is soooo addicting.  One of our favorite Scottsdale spots!

Ate in the restaurant part. Had reservations.  Service was excellent. Server made many great recommendations  I particularly enjoyed the white peach and hibiscus margarita! YUM  I had the fish special, my man had the braised short ribs.   We also shared the antipasto appetizer platter, and really enjoyed it.  So yeah We really enjoyed this place.   I'm not a HUGE fan of their menu selections (they don't have any entree salads... the salads are all in the appetizer section of the menu and there are only two to choose from)  All in all, I like.

The crowd here was very mixed: I saw twenty-somethings all the way up to retired people. I think that goes to show that there is something for everyone here. If you can, try to sit outside; the view of the river is so pretty, and there are plenty of heat lamps if you're feeling cold. Shared a salad, flatbread, and a crostini which was more than enough food for two. The salad was awesome and the short rib flatbread was delicious. The ambiance outside is very serene and great for conversation.

This is a great place for breakfast/brunch.  We came here after climbing Camelback Mountain; needless to say we were very hungry.   The food didn't disappoint. We ordered off the brunch menu and shared our dishes. My wife had cinnamon french toast; since she is not a big fan of cinnamon, they were kind enough to keep the topping off. It was still a great french toast, especially with the fruit compote on top. I ordered the Homestyle Cheddar Biscuit (with scrambled eggs and sausage gravy). It was a home run - I highly recommend it.  The interior space is amazing. Also, this place is right by the Scottsdale waterfront, so it's a very nice setting. Go here!

This is pretty simple!  Cute looking girls working there. = 1- * Food is really good, especially breakfast, = 1 - * Has a decent selection to choose from, = 1 - * Since the location is in a airport terminal, its going to be busy. However the line goes pretty fast, = 1 - *  With the size of this place, they really try to have enough seats, = 1 - * Now the negative, price us to high. I can only imagine what their lease is. And they are going to take advantage of TSA taking away your 99¢ water, only to charge you about three dollars for the same bottle of water. Biggest scam around. = -2 - * Understand the reason for the prices, still doesn't mean it's right.

Loved the food, location and service. At reception desk we arrived and announced we needed a table for 2 - hostess said do you have reservations (2:00 in the afternoon), we said no, she said will be about 30 minute wait for inside seating or we could sit outside we choose outside seating and it was just lovely out on the patio actually best seats from my point of view. Overall nice place, decent food and drink good vibe.

Apologies for the delay, but I was here the Thursday before Super Bowl weekend.  I came here with a group of 10+ people and immediately gathered at the bar.  Considered a table but thought we were better off at the bar, since we weren't sure if our party would grow as the afternoon, evening and night wore on.  That was smart of us, since the group did grow substantially in number.  Drinks were pricey, but for the venue it was to be expected.  Atmosphere was fun, we did what we wanted, the hostess staff was absolutely adorable and sweet.  Around 5 they started charging cover ($25 a head!), so one of our friends (whose wife had been with us all afternoon) would have had to pay the cover to get in, but luckily I was able to (drunkenly, I might add) persuasively slur my magic to build a valid case, and my friend got in without having to pay.  We had a great time and had front row seats to the 50cent party entering the 944 village right across the way.

I have a soft spot for Olive and Ivy just because I have had a fantastic time here, every time I have come. With my fiancé, girl friends, and solo when I'm taking myself out to a fancy date :P. The ambiance is everything- I really like the music, the lighting, the décor. They have a nice bar with two TVs,and across from it,little community tables which are all open seating. The restaurant is quite large and there's plenty of seating inside and outside as well. The view whilst sitting outside is really pretty- they often have lights, you can see the bridge and canal, etc. The crowd is all ages- I love that everyone dresses up and makes an effort- whether it's families with toddlers, first dates or a group of friends. On weekends I think they have a DJ. I typically always get the all natural chicken and lamb meatballs- they're delicious. I've tried the flatbreads, and other chicken (can't remember the name) those were all good too. Their deserts change but all have been really delicious. The wine selection is ok, beer not so much, but the cocktails are pretty tasty. They also have a bakery/market at the other end with gelato. The bathrooms are always clean and the service is good. My only complaint is that they've started being a little stingy on their portions- dining in and take away. The wine pour is also small! But overall, still my top few places in Scottsdale.

Been here a few times now and while I have never been overly impressed I have always been satisfied. Came recently with my family for breakfast/brunch and got the eggs benedict (my favorite breakfast). The eggs came out perfectly cooked with just the right amount of hollandaise sauce. The flavors were good if not spectacular. I did really enjoy the potatoes as they were a bit more flavorful then normal breakfast potatoes.   I also had a bloody mary (little hair of the dog from the previous night). It was not as spicy as i liked but well flavored and had plenty of vodka to do the trick.  If you are looking for something in the area stop by and try it out. Like I said you won't be blown away but odds are you won't be let down either. Also sit on the patio if you can it's pretty nice out there.

I was here last Sunday and I enjoyed it so much I decided to come back a week later. Last week our server was kind and attentive, fun and informative about the menu. Her name wast Nicki. This week not so much..... Our server is cold and distant and a little bit rude. He didn't even say hello he just stared at me until I ordered a drink. When he cleared our carafes, he just stuck his hand out so we'd hand it to him. I didnt even want to order anymore food because he was so short with his responses and his attitude made me uncomfortable. I would mention his name but he never bothered to give it to me.   Hopefully if I come back I get to sit with Nicki again, because she was absolutely wonderful.

We sat at the bar on a Tuesday night.  Bartenders were simply not attentive in the least--it was not busy.  We had an open tab and wanted to drink and eat!  It was like pulling teeth to get their attention and get an order in.  Had to ask for utensils and coasters for drinks.  Just not what I expected.
Overall, wonderful!  Great food.  Loved the sangria.  Amazing outdoor seating by the water when the weather is nice!

I went here for the first time for my birthday. My gosh was I surprised. It was lovely there.   They have indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor part has benches and lounge chairs. So it is a casual Atmosphere right along the waterfront.   Pesto and bread to start is amazing. We asked for more servings. It is addictive.   Got two big meals that we couldn't finish. But the food was excellent!!  Then some gelato for dessert. Absurdly fantastic.   I have zero complaints about this place. It is one of my favorite places in Scottsdale. I'm going to take family here soon.   Just make sure you make a reservation because it gets busy!
Stopped in after shopping for a drink and snack.  What a great place good food and wine. Our server Marissa made the visit great!!!

Amazing breakfast sandwich (the breakfast club) probably the best I've had in awhile. The oatmeal we could do without, it was too mushy with no texture... Taste was good though.  blueberry muffin was delicious! We do recommend this place :)
Beautiful place in Scottsdale. Quite a busy place. Waiter was very nice and helpful in ordering. Had several small plates and wine. Good selection of wine.
Always great food and a fun atmosphere!  Wonderful outdoor area, when the weather permits.  Great cocktails and appetizers.  Also have been there for lunch and it is also great!
A nice fox restaurant in a great location. The food and service is fine, atmosphere is great. No stellar dishes but no clunkers either. Overall, it is a fun time out.
Super! My 1st good meal in Phoenix ! Sigh ...come with family so Chinese food everyday..sucks...  Good as it said ..highly recommend...  The braised short rib pizza PB&J smoothie
Been here several times, and enjoyed it every time.  They have a very good pesto sauce.  Last time I had the veal ravioli, and it was very good.  Great atmosphere and happy hour.
Food and wine were amazing!  My fiancé and I were on a Saturday night .. it was really full so it took a long time to get our order

We went to Oliver &ivy for a late Sunday brunch. The place was spacious and airy with lot of sunlight. They have beautiful patio seating as well. We ordered Bloody Mary and peach Bellini for cocktails which were top notch. They give you bread and pesto sauce to go along which I really liked. The bread literally melts in your mouth. My husband and I ordered pesto flatbread and lamb gyro. The flat bread was delicious and lamb gyro was okay, which we could have passed it on. This place was a recommendation and surely didn't disappoint

The atmosphere is awesome - beautiful! Food is very good but not great. Service can be a tad slow since there's a lot of real estate to cover - it's a very large restaurant. Parking can be challenging so allow time during peak hours.

My sister and I are GF vegan and vegetarian respectively. The menu had a pretty broad selection of foods that catered to both of our dietary restrictions and was AH-mazing. We sat on the patio - which was beautiful - had excellent service and a very delightful evening. Highly recommend to anyone checking out Scottsdale waterfront for the first time or looking to try a new restaurant  We had the charred artichoke hearts w goat cheese and the asparagus bruschetta for an appetizer. She had the beet salad and I had the sweet potato cannelloni for dinner and we shared the PB mousse for dessert. Literally nothing we ate was even the least bit dissatisfying. In fact it was beyond delicious. Every last bite.

Stopped by while scrambling to look at all the options for a quick cold sandwich.  Saw this place had a pastrami sandwich and that went out the window.  Accepted them to warm it up on the panini press.  The guy I ordered from seemed more interested in going back to train his coworker than me, but I don't need to be coddled so that's fine.  A young lady picked up where he left off and I told her I wanted a potato salad and let her know about the sandwich order. Add a water and it was 15.75.  It's the airport I knew I wasn't getting off cheap.  To the food.  When they brought out the pastrami it felt warm, but they just warmed the bread the meat was still cold.  Still tasted good.  I've had Grocery store potato salad that tasted better.  So for food and service it's 2 stars but at an airport it's 3 .
Delicious food and a wonderful patio. Many items to choose from on the menu. Great service

We visited this joint.  He ambiance was nice.  The food is good but not great. Service was excellent.  We had a burger that was charred , my wife complained even though we had eaten most of it. Next thing we know the manager is over and asking how they can fix it.  We said it was fine since we had eaten most of it. They gave us a free desert because of the charred meat patty.

First time here and cant wait to come back! My friend and I sat on the patio and enjoyed some sangria's. Loved the atmosphere and the little touches, the place is beautifully designed and very relaxing as it over looks the soleri bridge. The service was excellent and the bacon wrapped dates are a must try!

Made a reservation for 7:15pm. Got there at 7:20. Was super loud!!!! Was told I could be seated and then given a pager and told it would be a 5 minute wait. 30 minutes later I still wasn't seated and I gave back the pager and left. WTF?  Why make a reservation if it is meaningless??? I'm over overrated noisey overpriced Fox restaurants. Bye bye

Nice open restaurant with large patio - not exactly as billed (more like Southern France than southern Scottsdale) but still not too bad.  Casual crowd, good sized bar and area, inside/outside dining, noise level was average.  Staff was attentive to our needs, so much so that the manager checked in to see all was well - NO ISSUES on service.  Wine list is not bad, has room for some expansion.  My margarita was good my colleagues enjoyed the sangria.  Food, again good.  Not top notch but no issue.  To me Olive & Ivy is a nice everyday restaurant.  I would go back in a heart beat.
I doubt that I'm cool enough to be a regular but that doesn't stop me from frequenting the place so that I can enjoy their date/bacon appetizer.  God bless happy hour specials.

Private room dining was nice, Mediterranean salad was great super fresh and flavorful; roast chicken in wine reduction was perfectly done, service was attentive. It was loud in the main dining room so this is probably not the spot for intimate conversations etc.

Olive & Ivy, though somewhat hidden in the mix of Old Town Scottsdale and Scottsdale Fashion Square, is a popular restaurant frequented by 50-somethings trying to look like 30-somethings and 20-somethings showing off all of their 20-somethingness. The sunglasses are big, the shopping bags more expensive than I can afford over a lifetime and the tans as dark as they come.   The atmosphere is swanky and there is often a Jason Mraz wannabe playing his music just inside the door. I've been seated, at one point or another, in each room of the restaurant. The red room in the rear near the pizza oven can be a bit tight but is a nice choice if you want to hear each other from across the table. The main dining area can get pretty loud - but it makes for great people watching. The white room has a lot of appeal with its large chairs and high cloth-draped walls. The problem is, as I was seated here for a client dinner, is that the humongous circular table creates a yelling match across the tables. Don't make any important business deals here. Maybe it would be better for a bridal shower. Eh. It's cool looking.  The waitresses are attentive and deliver drinks and pesto and bread dip in a timely manner. The bread/dip combo is delicious! I would go just for that if I could. I usually order the flatbreads. My favorite is the prosciutto with arugala. Delicious!   Olive & Ivy also has a cafe/market that is great for lunch. If I'm feeling simple I get the grilled cheese which is always satisfying or I get one of their delicious sandwiches.  Overall a great place to eat and be seen, a perfect combo for Scottsdale!

Had brunch here today and asked for an indoor seat. We were seated very quickly at a very nice table. Ambience in this restaurant is really nice and the decor is really classy. The food was very tasty; however, I have to say the best part of the whole dining experience was our server, Josh. He was super friendly and very attentive to detail.  He gave us the best sellers and answered all the questions we had about the menu.  I will definitely come back to Olive and Ivy when back in town and I hope I am able to request Josh as our server!!! He is definitely an asset to the restaurant!

By far one of my favourite restaurants in Scottsdale. I come every time I'm in the area for a meal. On a warm evening, it's lovely to sit outside in the garden along the canal. A great place for groups or a romantic meal. I've always enjoyed great service and food at Olive and Ivy. My personal faves are their pesto sauce and truffle fries.

This place is fantastic! Today was my second time here. The first was a dinner meal and it was one of the best dining experiences in a long time. Today was happy hour, with drinks and appetizers and it was equally as lovely. Love it. And definitely recommend.

One of My Favorites!! Olive & Ivy always offers great service, fresh ingredients and delicious ways of preparation that impress the palette!! I love the patio at night with the twinkle lights. My daughter, husband and I throughly enjoyed her last evening in town dining while enjoying the canal views! We shared nibbles and also shared desserts so we wouldn't over indulge. All our choices were fantastic and the desserts were out of this world ! Our server was attentive and made the evening enjoyable with helpful suggestions as well!

I discovered this place while living in Phoenix. And now it's a staple every time I'm back for a visit. In fact, it's the only place my girl's and I go for brunch when I'm back. There's not a bad word I could think to say about this place.   I love sitting out on the patio during the summer and sipping one of their Mimosas. Nothing bad about it.

If this review was about the ambiance, service and the margarita it would rate higher.  Al 3 were great. But I was pretty disappointed in the menu selections.  Didn't match up to what we found online which is what ultimately drew us here.  Like I said the décor and ambiance are fantastic.  Really beautiful place.  Nice outdoor area but it was all reserved when we came.  Busy place.  My margarita was very good.  I had a hard time picking from the menu because honestly nothing really appealed to me.  And the few items that did kind of get my attention were way too pricey (I was on per diem).  I didn't feel like flatbread so I ordered the chicken which had mashed potatoes and mushrooms.  Chicken was OK and was a pretty large portion.  Mashed potatoes were pureed so very creamy and delicious.  The best part of the meal.  My friend went with the Margarita pizza which she found tasty enough but really settled for because she couldn't find anything else on the menu.  I will be traveling a lot to Scottsdale for work in the near future and I may return for a drink and maybe an appetizer.  Just not wowed by the dinner selection.
My son thought his pastrami sandwich was awesome and, most importantly, they were ridiculously nice to us at this airport location on Christmas Eve.
Sat at the bar.  Food was fine. Service was lame and nonattentive.  The outdoor patio are is nice overlookimg the river and crowded.

The service was incredible and the food was good. While the dinner selections were under portioned and over priced everything tasted fine. I sampled the lamb meatballs, beet salad and a variety of their bruschetta. Olive and Ivy makes a delectable apple martini that was strong yet refreshing. Unfortunately I cannot recommend their cactus blossom cocktail, it was too sweet and had the flavor profile of a mikes hard lemonade.   Lastly I have to say bravo to the front of the house staff working on the night of my visit.
