Fox Restaurant Concepts have mastered the art of customer service and for that reason I'll be returning here.  I'll be back again soon and am looking forward to  trying their breakfast menu.

Had a lovely lunch at olive and ivy at the bar. The blood orange Paloma and it was delicious. I also had the chicken sandwich with fries with no peppers. It was not super flavorful but it was still pretty good. Overall a good experience
Love the atmosphere! The food is yummy too. Not the five star dining experience but fun!

Actually tried to hit this place up twice, once for drinks and then again the next day for breakfast. Drinks were a failed attempt. It gets super busy, I would suggest making reservations or getting there early. Breakfast was awesome. We had no reservations but you can actually self seat on the right hand side of the restaurant as you walk in. Awesome view of the canal. No real tables, but I was so excited to get a seat, I didn't really care. Breakfast sandwiches are great and nothing can beat a pitcher of white sangria for brunch.
I love everything about this concept. And the flatbreads are so good. My only complaint is the bacon cheeseburger lacks flavor all around. But other than that.. Perfecto !

Very good service. We had a party of 8, including an infant, and someone who is allergic to eggs and dairy - it was no problem. The food was wonderful. Modern looking inside. Had a gelato bar inside, which we didn't try because we brought cupcakes for someone's birthday. And I kept hearing how cool the women's restroom was. The one cocktail I had, ginger-something, wasn't my cup of tea, but food, etc. was great. I'd recommend to anyone, and we'll be back.
Bruschetta (pumpkin and kale) = excellent Bruschetta (mozzarella) = excellent. Lamb gyro = so so  Misto frito = good but not great  Service = so so

This place was just okay. I'm giving it three stars even though the food was disappointing for a few reasons: Busy, buzzy atmosphere in the oh-so- trendy Scottsdale waterfront area. Good service. Our waiter was on top of everything and just a good guy.   This is full of rosé-swilling, avocado-toast eating, romper-clad millennials. I actually like a good rosé and avocado toast, but it wasn't our scene. Lots of bachelorette parties the night we went.   This is a good place for people watching, fun to go with a group. Not great for a date, I wouldn't think. Menu is mostly unremarkable flatbread pizzas and salads.   I might go back for lunch sometime?

The Olive & Ivy is a really cool and lively place set at the Scottsdale Waterfront.  There is a huge shopping center with trendy shops and restaurants all around.  My party of nine started with a round of drinks out in the Patio area which is beautiful with comfortable big chairs. The place was packed Thursday night and happy hour in full force. After a round of drinks our large party made it to the table and onto the food, we sample different apps like the fritto misto and bruschettas which were pretty good. I had the Piccante flatbread which was delicious and filling. Everyone else also seemed to enjoy their food as well.  For dessert, it was the raspberry sorbet which was good.   The service was great, our server handled the large party very well. Loved the atmosphere and vibe here, I would return.

This is a 3 1/2 rating really.  I have been here a number of time for drinks and dinner.  It's a fun place, busy on weekends, and good people watching.  The beet salad and filet medium were what I order this last time around.  Both tasty and above average.  The others ordered the steak and bruschetta I believe.  Everyone seemed happy with what they ordered.  Not the best meal of all time but good food, nice decor, healthy ambiance, and decent service.  The patio is nice any time of the year.  Although funny, because they consider the water behind it to be water front as though it's a river.  I don't think so.  I looks like all of the typical SRP water tributaries in the area.  It doesn't hurt certainly but water front - NOT.  Anyways, go there for a late happy hour and you won't be disappointed.

Olive and ivy has always been one of my go to spots. The bread they give you with pesto and olive oil is a great way to start your meal.  If you're feeling really good,  get the bacon- wrapped dates.  I have yet to have a bad meal here whether lunch hour or dinner and they even have a nice market inside making it quick and easy to pick up something on the go.

We came here on Valentine's Day weekend. I love how open this restaurant is! Their patio is adorable and it has nice views of the canal at the waterfront.  The bruschetta and our entrees were delicious. We got 3 different kinds of bruschetta as an appetizer, I got the scallops as my meal and my boyfriend got a chicken dish. I wasn't crazy about the smores dessert though.  I think this is a great place for people watching if you sit on the patio. Great place for people visiting from out of town too!

While in Phoenix during thanksgiving, my friends and I decided to try this place for lunch. This places is in a cute neighborhood in Scottsdale just overlooking the water. Also, there's a lot of free parking in the garage next to it.  As we were on vacation, I decided to go with a pretty strong drink (whiskey sour smash) during lunch. My friend got the red wine sangria but sadly it did not taste fresh and she switched it with the strawberry and thyme cocktail and that was pretty good. We got the hummus to share and it was very tasty and I got the sweet potato cannelloni for my mains. The pasta was very thin and cooked perfectly and the sweet potato stuffing complimented the buttery sauce extremely well.  I think this place is definitely worth checking out if you like an extensive menu which is diverse and a great place that overlooks the water!!

Visited here two times during our two day stay in the area!  The atmosphere is amazing.  I don't think there could be a better place to hang out.  The restaurant is beautiful, inside and out.  The staff was very professional.  The first time, I had a gyro.  I can't tell you that it was the best that I've ever had because I'm not sure why there was humus on it, but it was good.  The pesto is amazing that they give you for the wonderful bread.  The lamb meatballs are worth going back for too!.  They were awesome.  My husband had a pasta dish that he loved.  I need to come back and try the gelato!

Sometimes I really wish I could live in Scottsdale. I met up with two girlfriends there and we had a great time! This visit was a solid 3-4. We went in to take advantage of their happy hour (if you don't the prices seem wayyyy to steep for me). Anyway, if you take advantage of their happy hour you must sit either in the outside patio or the lounge. Now the outdoor patio was beautiful! Prettiest outdoor seating I have seen ever. But not when it is 104 out. (and there are no misters). Why did we sit outside do you ask? Because the bar area (which is tiny) filled up super fast (duh. its yummy!) The indoor ambiance is beautiful. (a little dark) The most awesome lights ever are in there. The service was good and the location is nice (right next to the free parking too!)  I tried the featured white wine, and whatever it was (sorry I forgot) was good! My friend tried the sangria, but I was not a fan. Weird flavor compared to most sangrias that I can't describe.   Now onto the food. People who raved about the flatbread pizzas...I have no idea what you are talking about.  I had the margharita and it was just not good. Soggy and flavorless. The hummus was very yummy. Needed more pita with it. Now onto the star of the show: the bruschetta. The vine ripe tomato is yummy. The apple caponata is just as yummier, and the prosciutto and fig was also excellent! Ohhhh so yummy! This is the place to get bruscetta and wine after a long day.

It has been years since I set foot at Olive & Ivy mainly because I had been distracted by life's other attractions.  A friend reintroduced me to O & I this past weekend and I couldn't believe how much I had been missing out.  It's just an authentic, large but quaint space.  From inside to the outdoor patio, all you can see is happiness and tastiness.  We were a rather surprising, large group of chatty women but Mark, our patient waiter, served us graciously.  Olive & Ivy, go there for a happy time.

Best meal experience in Scottsdale. The service, the flavors, the quality, the portions and the overall ambiance was outstanding. We will certainly dine at this gem if we happen to pass by Scottsdale again..

I will definitely return!  -great location (across from Nordstrom at Scottsdale Fashion Square) -lovely atmosphere with great outdoor dining area  -pesto/bread dip was great -cheese platter app was delicious -scallops were perfect -good service
Really cool atmosphere. The small plates are delicious and they have a great selection of wine. Perfect for a date night.

This place was a huge disappointment. I went here because of all the stellar reviews on Yelp. Yelpers-- you steered me wrong.   I ordered the eggs Benedict. The description said it had shaved ham and basil hollandaise sauce. The waitress made a point of telling me that the "over easy" eggs would be very runny. Ok...Well I thought it was odd that they weren't poached, but went with it since I know Benedict includes a runny egg--It is part of what makes then delicious. I was also eager to try the bread since they made a point of mentioning that all their bread was baked in house. Boy, was I in for a big disappointment!  The Benedict arrived. It was two Thomas' English muffins with deli meat ham and the basil hollandaise was just sauce garnished with basil. The eggs were not runny--they were raw. I mean the egg whites were raw!  The waitress seemed startled when I sent it back, but was truly great about it. But...I think you can guess what happened next...It came back with over-cooked eggs...think hard boiled! At this point, I was starving, so I just went with it. The waitress noticed that I wasn't eating much so she didn't charge me.  So...I give them 5 stars for service, but 1 star for food.  I will say that it is a nice setting and I would go back for a drink, but not much more.  Thank you to the stellar wait staff for somewhat redeeming the experience!  That being said, I was just visiting the area so I won't likely be back.

Visiting Scottsdale for the first time, who knew it's a foodie mecca!  Yay, I was thrilled!  My good friend Teri recommended this spot.  We walked in and were impressed by the gorgeous lighting and spaciious layout.  But my eyes were drawn to their ultra chic patio!  Too bad it was freezing outside, but we were seated in a nice warm spot.  They do have a great happy hour menu, I wish I had grabbed a drink at the bar first to take advantage of those prices.  I ordered the Butternut Squash and it was rich and fabulous.  Their focaccia bread as a starter was the bomb, we asked for a second serving!  I heard this was part of some Fox restarurants, so I definitely want to check out ther other restaurants.

We came here for a late dinner. The hummus was wonderful...tasty, creamy, and full of delicious flavor. Service was wonderful as it always is in Scottsdale.  The beers on tap were also great..we had the Sedona hefe and Santan porter. A little on the pricy side but good food nonetheless

We went here at the suggestion of our son to celebrate his 21st birthday last December.  We were a little disappointed that they didn't accept reservations and that we had to sit hear the entrance and lounge but other than that everything was just fine.  The service was very good as was the food and drink.  We all had a memorable time.  I would like to return again sometime soon.

After strolling along the Canal Convergence Light Exhibit, we were ready for our 8:15 dinner reservation a little early but they graciously were able to sit us at 8pm.   The bustling bar with the staggered Edison style glass lighting hanging from the chic adorned ceilings and a DJ to my right reminded me of being in Vegas. I nudged my hubby with surprise, "Wow! The music sounds just like the playlist I listen to when running!" It was pop hits remixed with house and dance music. So lively and energetic. Ladies were dressed to the nines in high heels and beautiful dresses. Couples snuggled in close at booths and at the bar. The older crowd appeared to coincidentally find themselves enjoying the inviting patio where the music was still present but not as loud.  Our table was nestled between the patio and the main room. It felt like the best of both worlds because we were so close to the patio with the open glass doors yet behind another glass wall away from the "bustling" main area.   Although my hubs did not want to go exactly with what the waiter recommended, we ordered the exact bruschettas that he talked about, because hey, apparently we all share the same taste in food!! Prosciutto and fig. Manchego and Spanish Chorizo. Butternut squash, goat cheese, and pistachio.   Bry ordered the bouillabaisse. The broth was amazing. What can I say? I managed to taste a clam with some broth but he basically devoured the rest of the seafood mix before my very eyes.  The Prosciutto and Marscapone Tortelli was what my eyes fancied since I first looked at the menu online for some reason. After tasting it, my taste buds were so happy. It could be because I'm partial prosciutto but when matched with Marscapone. That's just ridiculous. Butternut squash and pearl onions added varying textures and complemented the tortelli.   We didn't need dessert, but we ordered it. Bry enjoyed the thin mint gelato which of course was inspired by the season of Girl Scout Cookies. Awesome gelato. My sweet Apple dessert had super red apples glazed in sweet thick syrup, so evil, it was. I was a moo and slowly battled eating those apples, spongy type cake and vanilla bean gelato.   Don't worry. I was able to wash it all down with a pitcher of red sangria.   Our waiter was super attentive, friendly, and informative. The food was great. Another Sam Fox restaurant has won me over. Darn it!

I have been here twice now and had the same thing both times. First of all, the decor is really awesome and although it's a pretty big building, it's not crowded and they don't put in unnecessary tables. I had the buttermilk pancakes with caramelized bananas and it was amazing. Before your meal they bring out a focaccia bread with a pesto dip. The service has been very attentive both times and I would love for them to expand and open more locations.

Make a reservation!  We knew this place was good, because as we darted over to the only available lounge table, we saw Charles Barkley walk out!  I tried to be cool about it, but failed.  I also failed being cool about the complimentary fresh focaccia bread and pesto they bring out, because the waitress brought us another round.  I ordered the gnocchi with duck confit, and it was absolutely stunning.  I tried telling my husband it was terrible, but my face betrayed me...he ate half.  Which was OK, because I got to eat half of his dish, which I remember as some sort of seafood with risotto, and the best-tasting cherry tomatoes I have had, outside of my grandmother's back yard.  Then, we ordered three scoops of very good gelato from their counter (for only $5!).  Oreo cheesecake gelato?  Yes.  Excellent food, top to bottom, and not as expensive as it could be.  Please go, but again, make a reservation.

The environment is great.  I love their food.  The mushroom flatbread is delicious! White sangria is good and strong. My server was nice and kind. She checked on us every 5 minutes. My glass of water was always full. Great service, great food. Great place to go.

Agree very hard to locate, but keep looking so worth the hunt. Food is fabulous and so are the drinks. I wanted everything on the menu. No doubt every trip I make to Scottsdale there will have to be a visit to this place.

Had the pleasure of going to O&I for brunch recently with the gang... O&I has mimosa specials, but not bottomless like some of the other spots in town, and I'm guessing that's how our group of 6 didn't have to wait for a table at 11am on a Sunday.   I was in a breakfasty kind of mood and after MUCH debate, I decided upon their buttermilk pancakes which came topped with caramelized bananas and sliced almonds. The bananas and caramel were so good, I didn't even need the syrup on them... I used it on my breakfast potatoes instead!  hehe ... I ate every last morsel of my food, drank my specialty cocktail (something with gin and grapefruit juice, yum) and all for $25 including tip.  All in all, O&I is a solid joint. It's not overly crowded and is a nice spot to catch up with friends on the patio or enjoy drinks with your special someone.  Note: O&I does have a happy hour, but I have not yet taken advantage of it. I'll put that on my list!

I stumbled on to this place while rushing to my next flight, I didn't have too much time but needed to eat something, so I tried this place.  I ordered the French Dip and a salad, I have to say it was pretty good.  They also have a great selection of pastries that I didn't try but they looked pretty tasty.  Next time for sure :-)

The location is first class being located on the Scottsdale Waterfront and directly south of Fashion Square Mall. I also like the fact that I can walk around the corner to see my buddy who is the GM at the #Scottsdalewaterfronttowers.   The ambiance is good and you can tell that this is a tourist hub for those catching the AZ during the discounted summer months. My meal was good and the wine we selected fit perfectly into the mix. I was only there for lunch with friends from Napa, so I need to come back with Twyla and catch this place at dinner. There is a full bar for those who wish to get their IV drip of alcohol moving into the infused direction; you know who you are...  Once your meal is completed, you can take a romantic stroll along the waterway and then venture around to the many various shops for coffee or dessert. Not that Olive and Ivy doesn't have a good one. However, I could use a good walk to burn the many calories I take in on a regular basis. There are so many things to see and do in this area. I do recommend checking it out with the whole family.   #vino2 #vino2ultimate  #vinosquared

The food is trendy and the drinks are cold and strong! Great location, great staff. I have been there three times and have always eaten on the patio-there is usually an art show or something going on, and you can put your name in and they will text you when your table is ready. I plan to go again soon!
Just got a free meal tonite because the manager thought I waited to long ... appreciate the initiative!   Sandwiches were great!

This was my second time dining there and my third time there altogether (the other visit, I had cocktails.)  I have to say, when I went 4 years ago, I was very unimpressed with the eatery. I felt like it was overpriced for the small portions served and way too dark. You might think that's romantic, but judging by how loud it gets, it was a weird dynamic for me.  This dining experience was far better (despite our server taking more than 10 minutes to greet us.) He made up for it by suggesting items on the menu and being diligent the rest of the night, and the atmosphere was a little more relaxed than I remember. What stands out most to me about the decor is the sprawling wine bottle display that goes up to the ceiling. I also like the pretty hanging lights and big bar that greets you as soon as you walk in.  For my first course of my meal, I had the hummus and pita bread. I wasn't a huge fan of the pickled onion on top of the hummus, but the hummus itself was good. The pita bread was a little dry, but it was nice to have a healthy option for a starter, and overall, I enjoyed it.  For my second course, I had handmade pasta, and instead of the veal ragu, I got a butter parmesan sauce to make it vegetarian. The sauce was so, so good, and you should request it, too.  For dessert, I had a coffee creme brulee with hazlenut biscotti. I really liked the taste of it, and it was so creamy, but I found it sort of odd that our table sampled many desserts, and they all came out in perfect circle shapes. It made me think they were all pre-made, and that was a turn-off.  Overall, though, I was very satisfied with the meal, though Olive & Ivy can get pretty pricey for average-quality food.

Great for meeting up with friends and family, or celebrating birthdays. I enjoyed it when I went there, but the price is high... Like appetizers are double digits price. The food quality does justify the price because the food was good. I had the ziti... I think. I was definitely stuffed when I left there.

I'm adding one more update to my review. As I've mentioned before, the Mediterranean Chicken Salad is my favorite salad on the menu but while dining with my Mom I learned a helpful tip that makes the salad even better. Yes it is possible to make it better! Instead of having the salad with the cold chicken, ask them to substitute it with the hot grilled chicken sliced on top. It changes the salad completely and makes it an even better meal!

OI has the best patio in town.  I love their sweet potato ravioli.  It has a different name, but that's what I called them.  I love their GM, she has come by our table almost every time we were there.  This place is a great place to relax, and it is very well ran.
What a great place, the atmosphere was wonderful and the staff was informative about the food options and substitutions available due to my good allergies. Very helpful!

I really liked the ambiance and the setting for dinner. I thought that food was just average. I ordered the lasagna for dinner and I thought it was a little flat....and kind of dry. I ordered the hummus dish with vegetables and that was really good! It had a little kick to it, but I liked that! The "Mediterranean" inspiration was a little hit or miss in my opinion. My friend got the bruschetta, and it was good but not the best I've ever had. There was a lot of bread!!

My co-worker took me here because we were in the neighborhood and she knew that I really like the Fox Concept restaurants.  The place exudes a fun atmosphere.  The food was fantastic as well.  I started out with the beet salad which was really good.  The dressing was tasty, they provided an good amount of beets, and I appreciated the pistacchios for the textural contrast.  The beet salad was almost as good as the one at the Arrogant Butcher.  We also partook in the lamb meatballs which were yummy as well.    For the entrée, I chose the scallops at the recommendation of my server,  The scallops were of good size and seared on one side, but I would appreciated it more if they were seared on both sides, however.  The scallops were accompanied with scallops and sweet corn polenta which went well with the protein.  I ended the night with the chocolate mousse with cherries which was absolutely divine.  My server was friendly and attentive and it was a great overall experience.

This place is great if you can handle waits. First on a waterfront in AZ. Ok it's only a canal but gives you atmosphere. Second you eat with your eyes first so peruse the deli while you wait. Third decor was very eclectic. A lot  of ideas for the home.  Let's get to the good stuff. Menu drinks did not impress. If you have a fav I'd order it. Next the bacon wrapped dates were yummy! Salads we delivered quickly. Our meals comprised of the spicy shrimp risotto and big eye tuna was excellent. The dessert menu was simply, but I'd head back to the deli for a pastry and to people watch.
Food is amazing. I love their salads... so good. This place is awesome for brunch. Grab a seat outside and enjoy the view.

Great happy hour specials with all wines at half price, appetizers at half price and flatbreads at half price.  The wine list was a full page and included all the wines; not just house wines at some places.  I have had better bruschetta at Postino's but the flatbreads were good for sharing.  If a lot of people showed up there would be a definite space problem on the inside. There is a half booth and three half booths with two chairs each in the bar area.  The bar itself is square with more than a dozen cushioned bar chairs.    One could eat on the outside but who in his "right" mind would want to sit on the patio very long in the never ending summer heat,,, yeah sure, it is a dry heat but not for long...

Poor rating is for phone service. I work on the waterfront and eat at olive and ivy almost every day. And I've never felt the need to complain. However it seems to take almost 10 minutes to put in a phone order anymore. I was left on hold today for 7 minutes before I hung up. I called back only to be asked to hold for another few minutes. I briefly explained I had already been left on hold and I only have so long on my lunch break to eat. I was finally given a person to take my order, and they let me know it was too late to order from the lunch menu. It wouldn't have been, had it not taken so long to get someone to take my order! They stopped serving lunch 10 minutes before I was given someone on the phone. Absolutely ridiculous.

Really glad we made a reservation here when we visited Scottsdale a few months ago.  The restaurant is really beautiful!  Great place for a nice dinner with good friends or on a date.  Would have loved to have been able to eat out on the lovely patio, but inside was just as nice.  We went on a Friday night, and there was an awesome house DJ spinning...which automatically gets you points in my book!  Wine and cocktails were good and most of the food was as well.  They have a fantastic caprese salad with avocado that I dreamed about for days, but the fish that I ordered (the special of the night) left a lot to be desired.  Overall great place.  I'd definitely go back if I was in the area again.
This place is awesome! I'm so excited to have found them reminds me of back home!!! everything is delish!!!!

Loved it! Brandon was wonderful on bar. Creative,  friendly,  patient.  Server was fantastic,  very knowledgeable,  able to make suggestions. Seabass salmon and ahi were amazing.... as was the gelato. We had a great time, party of 5.

Decided to stop in for dinner while we had a friend in town. We had about a 30 minute wait for an inside table so we decided to grab a seat at the bar and get a drink. My girlfriend ordered a glass of wine, my boyfriend ordered a vodka/tonic and our friend ordered another pretty easy drink. I ordered the white sangria and the first sip was off-putting a bit. It tasted like sweet and sour mix was added. I had a few other sips as well as my girlfriend and boyfriend and they both agreed it wasn't right. We asked the bartender to just make me a vodka/water. Much better.   We were seated right at the 30 minute mark. Since we were not too hungry for all of us to get entrees we decided on some small plates to share. We decided on the Lamb Meatballs, Bacon wrapped Dates (two orders of those), an order of 3 different bruschetta, (Prosciutto & Fog, Fresh Mozzarella & Manchego), and our friend ordered the chicken Cesar salad. Everything was great! The service was also great! Friendly waiter and came at the correct times during our meal. We will be back for sure.

Cool Atmosphere, Good Service, OK Flavors, High Price For Serving Sizes..   So we decided to. check this place out last minute for a little treat thinking it was the same as IVY down in Chandler. We got there to realize this is a different place.  atmosphere is cool, and the location is nice. Overall vibe is good.   We ordered One of the flatbreads and it was good, but kind of high priced for the almost nothing that was on it...   We ordered next the 3 piece bruschetta and were surprised at how small the serving size was. The salmon lox was more of a patte/paste rather than tasty salmon on top. It was not bad, but its only a couple tiny bites and it is gone. We order this type of food often and there is usually a bit more for serving size.   The complimentary bread and pesto is the best part as it is actually DELICIOUS! But nobody every brought us refills for it so most of the tasty goodness was lost to the garbage due to no more bread....   All in all there is nothing exceptional about our experience here other than the atmosphere. Meager portions of the bruschetta are pretty unappealing and the flatbread just didn't have much going on...

I love this place as it's very beautiful on the inside and outside. There an outdoor patio that overlooks the canal. The big bar inside serves delicious happy hour bites and drinks. I love everything I order every time I go. My go to it their Mediterranean chicken salad. Definitely a must if you're in old town!

The servers here can vary from great to not so much. One time we went for brunch and got our coffee AFTER our food which was about total 25 minutes. The coffee of course was cold and the waiter never took it off the bill. Brunch is seems the wait service is not so good. Lunch however the servers have been great and the multi colored beet salad with goat cheese is hands down my favorite. Get it every time. He sweet potato cannolini is to die for. So delicious as is the ravioli ---   Oh and the lemon pudding cake with burnt honey ice cream. A++++. Never thought burnt and ice cream together would work but it's melt in your mouth amazing. I Haven't tried the gelato in the market yet but that's on my list for next time. The outdoor patio seating here is the best atmosphere and right along the canal too adds too it.

This restaurant was suggested to us by the gal at the Roaring Fork, as they were not open for lunch. I had the turkey sandwich, it was like having Thanksgiving between two slices of bread! It was awesome! The staff was engaging, not taking offense to our preoccupation with trying to figure out why some people got white napkins and some got black napkins. Turns out their white napkins are "linty" and they have had people complain, so they give out black napkins to anyone with dark pants on. Why anyone would complain to a restaurant  about lint on their trousers is an entirely different question. This place has great ambiance too. Check it out!

The atmosphere here is very nice, and the waiters & waitresses and super friendly and attentive. Great food. The focaccia bread they give you when you're seated is outstanding. I thought the food was quite good, although the portions were a bit small (even though I did not order for the small plates menu). I ordered the grilled scallops with asparagus. When it came, I was a bit shocked to see 3 scallops and the equivalent of one asparagus sliced into 6 long strips on the plate. Not what I was expecting, but still quite good. I didn't need all the food anyway, because I stuffed myself on the focaccia bread earlier.

Very hip place right on the waterway on #stetsonRoad in the very cool town of #scottsdale. Large open space. Big bar. Both Indoor/outdoor areas are enticing. Good music playing. Beautiful people popping in and out.    Good sizes for salads and entrees.  We had the Cesar salad with salmon and ravioli. Both good. Split for no fee.

Had lunch here today ( a hectic day it was ) and eating here was just the pick me up i needed .  Service was friendly,  and my chopped chicken salad was delicious. I was pleasantly surprised that i liked the buttermilk dressing as i am usually not a fan, it really complimented the avocado, blue cheese ,bacon,  and chicken.  it is a very nice spot for lunch.

I can't say enough. These guys are fantastic and very consistent. It's probably my favorite spot for lunch. Yesterday, my wife and I went in and our server noticed we are having a baby very soon. Our experience was already great but I was impressed when he bought us an incredible desert just to say congratulations.
We shared the Kale salad and tuna sandwich and they were both amazing!  Service was great and patio was perfect on this day!
Their brunch is outstanding! I love the mimosas, the cinnamon toast, the croissant sandwich and want to try more! I cannot wait to go back. It is a classy establishment that has a great enviornment!

This is my ideal dining experience and favorite Fox restaurant, hands down. O&I is absolutely wonderful. Even after a scorching summer day, the patio offers a gorgeous tuscan ambiance with a canopy of well groomed trees, expertly placed misters, strung Edison bulbs, and an overall understated elegance. So dreamy.  That's all you really  need to know, but I'll humor you since you're reading reviews for a reason, hm?   Bruschetta sampler: Prosciutto/fig, Manchego/chorizo, Apple/Brie All of them were delicious, though the prosciutto one was hard to eat due to the meat not having been cut...the bread was cut into thirds prior to the meat being added so we had to remove all the arugula and cut the meat, then re-build the app. That was weird. But the flavor was A+  We drank the white wine sangria, which packs a punch thanks to the brandy, and the cactus blossom cocktail. Both were great on a warm summer evening.   Seabass: though I did enjoy it, I wouldn't order it again. It was well prepared but I prefer fish without the gray meat as it tastes a little gamey...Again, just my preference. The sides it came with were small, but good. The few pieces of "caramelized" cauliflower left something to be desired as it was closer to just roasted cauli, but the candied grapefruit and snap peas were perfect with the mild white fish.   Filet Mignon: served with horseradish potatoes & red wine shallots--stole the show, without a doubt. Nothing to complain about here. My husband ordered it rare, and it came out with a lovely charred crust and warm red center. Beautiful. Plate envy for sure.  Cheesecake w/ stewed peaches: Decadent and delicious, and certainly enough for two after all the food we'd already had.   Roll me out and valet the car, dear. I am deliriously happy.    PS - the bathrooms are rad.

Just overpriced bland airport food. Nothing special to eat here. Had the Italian grinder, took them 10mins to toast a premade sandwich. It tasted ok. Tried the meat pizza, was all dough and dried out meat chunks on top. Maybe the salads are better here?

Sweet Potato Cannelloni...literally the best item on the menu. Second is the Mediterranean salad. Order both. This place is amazing. The atmosphere and service are always great! Ask for Josh P when you go, he's native to MI and has always taken care of us. I'm serious about the sweet potato cannelloni. It's heavenly.

this place has been on the list for years, and finally after getting our act together, we met another couple for a dinner at Olive and Ivy.  the decor, in traditional Fox style, is perfect. from the lights to the tile to the bathroom...even the servers are perfect looking. speaking of service, our waitress had this very laid back, comfortable air about her, but with confidence. she made some suggestions as we were ordering which were helpful. we had to ask a few times for water glass refills though.   the drinks were splendid. i had a rum honey martini and it went down way too easily. the sorbet in the drink was fantastic. for dinner, i had the sweet potato cannelloni. the pasta was soft, the sweet potato just a tad softer....it was seasoned perfectly and the sauce drizzled was a mix of sweet and savory. my wife had the mushroom tortelli and i tasted a bite and i love that earthy smell/taste of well done mushroom dishes.   i couldn't bare desert but they all sounded delicious. the only other dish tried was the salmon and i thought it might have come from a picture cutout is was so beautiful.   a great evening out with some great food!

The pesto was GREAT! The rest of the food was Meh and the service was the same. My girlfriend and I went here. We are both in our 20's. They seemed to not want to help us. We asked for ketchup when our food came and they didn't bring it for 20 minutes. We were finished eating at this point.   If I ever go again, it would be for happy hour and pesto but I won't be buying more plates.
The manchego bruschetta was amazing! Would definitely go back to try more if their dishes.

This place is perfect for brunch and dinner but if you're looking for a nice brunch spot with great prices and not insane wait times, go here. It doesn't open until 10 on the weekend so there is usually a short wait because every other Scottsdale native is waiting 40 minutes for breakfast club or some long line down the street. I highly recommend their mimosas ($6) they're huge and they actually fill your glass with good champagne, not just orange juice. The Mediterranean salad is my favorite dish and their hummus is my favorite starter. If you're looking for a quick breakfast, check out their market next door! Dinner is a bit more expensive and I don't recommend the paella only Because the rice was undercooked last time that I was there. Park at Nordstrom's lot across the street.
Underwhelming!  Not even 1/2 the lamb in gyro for $15!  Crazy silly to cheat on the meat.

We came to Olive & Ivy on the last day of my boyfriend's vacation and it made for the perfect ending. I can't compliment our server, Tim, enough for his excellent customer service. We went with lamb meatballs, hummus, and the fritto mizzo (sp) appetizers and were blown away! My boyfriend owns restaurants in California and it takes excellent flavors, textures and quality of food to make him happy. He was so impressed with everything (especially their beer) and we couldn't thank Tim enough for his wonderful attitude and lovely approach. We would have stayed to thank his manager but his flight was leaving in an hour (we got way too caught up with enjoying our dinner). I'm hoping the manager will see this review and thank Tim for his selection in food, beer and being the best waiter we had this weekend!

Our server, Amanda, made the experience great.  She was very conscience of our needs and had a glowing personality.  The beet salad, cauliflower cheddar soup and chicken scallopini were tasty. The pasta used for the veal ravioli was too thick.
Average chain... really nice outdoor area - really average food.

Pizza and sandwiches are VERY overpriced. A lot of bread but not much else.    This place is just average airport food.  Salads are on the high side of airport food prices but not outrageous like the pizza.... Salads are also nothing special.

Enjoyed our dinner. I read some reviews about this place, and with another positive encouragement from a local, we checked it out. Cool vibe both inside and out. We sat outside near one of the fire pits close to the river  The staff was fantastic and accommodating especially our server Taylor! We were there on Easter Sunday, so they had a limited menu for the late afternoon while they switched from bunch to dinner. We asked Taylor if she could ask the Chef if he could fire up a steak for us even though it was an hour before the regular dinner menu started. She asked and came through for us. The steak was a perfect medium rare. We substituted the standard veggies for mixed veggies and they are cooked perfect as well. Taylor's service along with the food made a fantastic ending to the last day of our vacation.   The wine list is a medium size, but they have a nice selection.  Thanks again to Taylor and the staff for a great meal!

Olive and Ivy is one of the best low key places in Scottsdale! I've been here probably 8-10 times and it never disappoints. To start off with, you get fluffy bread and their homemade pesto which is amazing. I could probably just eat the pesto with a spoon and call it a night! Lol the bruschetta is also phenomenal! They have a choose 3 for $11 (I think) and all the options are great. My favorite is the prosciutto and fig, sweet but salty. Least favorite is the asparagus, just not as flavorful as the rest. For the entree I usually get either the Mediterranean salad or the natural chicken. The chicken is so moist (yeah I said it!) and delicious! I've eaten here with other people who said the flatbreads, lasagna, bacon wrapped dates, and porkchop were delicious. I should also mention this sweet potato dessert I had once. I HATE sweet potatoes but our waiter got to talking about how good it was so my sister ordered it and OMG, the best dessert I've ever had. I think it was seasonal . The ambiance and decorations here are also very inviting! Last but not least, you can dress up or down and blend in. Not your typical downtown Scottsdale 6 inch heels and mini skirt place so everyone can feel welcome!   I'm salivating typing this! Just made reservations here for din tonight :)

Very busy place, but so worth the wait! Sam Fox has done it again! Wonderful service,  food is excellent and the wine menu is epic! Beautiful wine cellar over looking the bar, such a nice place to chill at the bar or have a full dining experience. One of my favorite spots!

Me and my girlfriend went to try Olive and Ivy for our anniversary dinner. Let me warn you that both me and my girlfriend woke up with upset stomachs after dining here. We ordered three different types of bruschetta and a duck tortelli plate. I am not too sure how this restaurant has almost five stars as this restaurant served the worst tasting mediterranean food I have ever tasted before. Olive and Ivy is a sad excuse for a high end restaurant with inexperienced chefs that do not even know how to cook food the right way.  Apart from the food horrible tasting food, the restaurant staff was very nice and friendly. If you are looking for good mediterranean food, save your money and go to Pita Jungle. Try to avoid restaurants owned or managed by Fox Restaurant Concepts. This is the second restaurant that I had been to managed by Fox Restaurant Concepts leaving me unsatisfied and with an upset stomach the day after. It seems that management tries to cut costs by hiring young inexperienced chefs serving low quality food.

For the record we did not eat here but I cannot wait to try it out!   As we were walking back to our car from strolling through Old Town we stopped at Olive and Ivy for a beverage and bathroom break.  I went with the tropical ice tea and it was AMAZING and unsweetened!   While poking around the market side I decided I needed to use the restroom. Okay so the next time you go, you HAVE to check them out! They are so unique! Huge doors dark woods and a really cool sink! No worries, I am not one to make a big deal about restrooms at all (unless we are talking about the freaky doors that fog up at TAO in the Venetian in Vegas) but they are just really cool and add quite a bit of character!

AWESOME atmosphere and great food, but a bit of advice to the wait staff and bar staff...Enjoy your job or find another... TWO glasses of ice tea sent to me with lipstick on the glass...EWE.... I am in the industry for too many years myself and know that this is an on going pain in the but issue, but it is not going away anytime soon so JUST CHECK THE GLASSES ESPECIALLY AFTER THE FIRST ONE WAS SENT BACK!    DISGUSTING and So disappointing the way the help did not seem to care!  C'MON!  Take pride in your role!!!

First time at Olive and Ivy, second time in Scottsdale. I visited a year ago for a dirty ass bachelor party that did not entail beautiful brunches and extravagant dinners haha.   Great ambiance, attentive service, trendy, and a great effin food. We had the prosciutto cudo flatbread which had the obvious, Rosemary mashed- like potato, basil, and a sunny-side egg on top. We also had the lamb gyro which was really really tasty and the portions were extremely generous. We are both fatties and walked away more than satisfied. I highly recommend both dishes. As for the drinks, we had the bloody and the greyhound. Both were super good and strong. Check it out!

It is decorated beautifully inside and has a cool ambience. They give you an amazing pesto sauce with bread as the "free" appetizer while you check out the menu and wait for your meal. I went for brunch and ordered the egg sandwich with the egg cooked over easy as the waiter told me the egg could be cooked any way I like. I don't eat meat, so instead of the bacon I asked for more avocado (which the sandwich already comes with). When my sandwich came, the egg was not cooked over easy, it had ONE LITTLE sliver of avocado, and way too much mayonnaise. My sister couldn't decide between ordering a margherita flatbread or the Funghi Trifolati flatbread so our waiter suggested she do both. The Funghi Trifolati was the best part of the meal, and I wish we just ordered a whole one. We had the chocolate cake with the toasted marshmallow for dessert, which sounds yummy, but is actually just more of a challenge to eat the "hard-to-cut" marshmallow.

Amazing place, a friend suggested and we loved it, not only was the food delicious but we were very impressed with the server, was very attentative and very helpful.  The spinach ravioli was delicious and the scallops dish was excellent.  Had the chocolate cake for dessert and unfortunately it did not match the quality of the place would not reccomend.

My girlfriend suggested that we come here for brunch and I'm glad we did. The whole layout of the restaurant is nice and they did a great job with the decor.  It was a bit odd starting with bread and pesto and then eating breakfast but that's what you get when you sit down and the pesto was just so good! As for my meal, I had the french toast which came with delicious compote and warm syrup. This was probably the best french toast I've ever had that wasn't home made. Add a side of crispy applewood smoked bacon and I was in heaven. If I only come back to Olive & Ivy for brunch I'll be happy but I hope to make it back for lunch or dinner sometime as well.
Is my favorite patio in scottsdale!! Great ambiance. Nice servers. The Mediterranean salad is delicious!

Review for BRUNCH only:   I thought this place was a great brunch spot.  Dined here with 11 other girls and we all enjoyed it.  Great ambiance, relaxing, inviting, and open.  Service was wonderful too.  The homemade foccaccia with pesto was scrumptious!  I think a lot of us filled up on that before our entrees were served.  Some of the dishes ordered: cinnamon french toast (yummyy!!); flatbreads (tasty); frittata (not too heavy, eggs cooked right); egg sandwich (pretty good); steak and eggs (wonderful!).  A few people also ordered drinks and I didn't hear any complaints.  In the front of the restaurant you can also order pastries and they have gelato too.  We were too stuffed to try any but everything looked good.

Absolutely delicious. I always order the veal raviolis OMG TO DIE For. And the bread is so dam good. All the drinks are yummy yummy. I also had their brunch and it's good too. Especially the breakfast burrito.   I love the patio area and how it over looks the canal. Such a beautiful restaurant. It's a total Date night place. Customer service is awesome. Always.

food turnaround was very, very fast.  as for the breakfast food here...best airport grub that ive had in some time...  selection of pastries and breakfast items was impressive...price wise...well, its an airport...so we wont judge based on that...BUT the food made up for it...  they happened to botch one of our orders and brought us out a new one shortly...the customer service here is very good...very good management...very well organized  best breakfast i had in arizona during my trip was the breakfast sandwich i had at the airport...how awesome is that?

We went here for dinner on Saturday. This place gets busy so definitely use Opentable to book reservations. There was a DJ serving up jams. The ambiance was nice & the restaurant is definitely posh. We had a bottle of Prosecco which was crisp & smooth. We ordered the lasagna...AMAZING! Every bite was fresh & flavorful. The bread & pesto they offer the table is also tasty. I can't wait to try other options on my next visit to Scottsdale.

I was disappointed in Olive and Ivy. I ordered the chicken salad and about halfway through I noticed that there was not any chicken in it. I was eating at the bar and mentioned it to the bar tender and she just seemed to shrug it off. She did not offer to bring me a new one or at least some chicken.

I've been eating here on and off for years, and always enjoy returning to see the menu changes. The patio is my go to, every time.   I don't usually write reviews (see all of the one review I've written previously), but the service tonight justified the effort. Brandon was, without a doubt, worth the time put into this. He recommended great options, and answered all of our questions thoughtfully and thoroughly. We were incredibly indecisive on wine, and he made great suggestions - in several different price ranges. He was even quite patient waiting for us to make our final decisions in both wine and food.  Bruschetta was yummy, as always, and the scallops were tender and delicious. Finished off with the (well recommended) blood orange sorbet.   What a wonderful night, and thank you to Brandon for making it so.

Definitely sit on the patio. Creamed cauliflower soup was excellent and the bruschetta is so good. The bread is slightly toasted but not enough to make it difficult to eat. Lasagna was excellent. We will go back again before we leave Scottsdale.

This review is solely for their marketplace in the entrance:  I have frequented the marketplace during lunch many, many times when my work bring me to Scottsdale. You can't go wrong with their pastries (chocolate croissant, cupcakes, cake) and their salads are to die for. Every single salad is delicious, even the simple green salad which I like to order with tuna salad on top. And the additional grilled chicken breast you can get as well is fantastic!
Had a great lunch here. Love the look and feel for this place. They have a nice patio, so its open. The food is mouth watering. I would recommend this place.

Went to Olive & Ivy on a Saturday night.  Had a reservation and wanted to push it back by 90 minutes to enjoy a long walk on a beautiful evening, and they were very accommodating.  The place is very spacious, both the indoor and outdoor patio, so don't think it would ever be a long wait for a table.  Ambience outside is great.  Close to the "water" in Scottsdale, and in the spring it wasn't too hot to sit outside.  Service was very good and the menu is outstanding.  Kind of a tapas place with many entrees as well.  We had the bacon wrapped dates, lamb meatballs and kale salad with bacon.  All very good.  Want to go back to try the Spicy Shrimp Risotto.  Very good drink menu as well.  I had the Whiskey Sour Smash which was very good (though on the strong side, so if you order it, make sure you like the taste of whiskey).  Will be going back to try other dishes, menu was very appealing.

Olive & Ivy is hands down one of the best restaurant experiences I have ever had. The staff there is totally synced and on top of everything. THE FOOD... is amazing. Especially the bruschetta! The drinks are also all amazing and I enjoyed their selectively crafted menu. On top of that the decor and music and energy of the inside and outside is beautiful and perfection. This is seriously a can't-miss destination.   (Shout out to the best bartender ever Jameca)
I like the patio more than inside .. The wine menu is really good .. This place is nice for breakfast and dinner.

My husband and I went here for our 10th anniversary. Every single thing we ordered was amazingly delicious! The server was so nice, and made it a special evening for us. They even gave us free dessert to celebrate our special night, with 'Happy 10th anniversary" written in white chocolate on the plate. We loved sitting out on their beautiful patio, but the inside is just as beautiful too. If we are in the area again, we will definitely be back!

So glad I finally had the chance to try Olive & Ivy! I have had it bookmarked for forever it feels like ha. Was looking for a place to eat brunch in downtown Scottsdale that wouldn't be super crowded on a Saturday morning, and this was the perfect spot!  When we got there, the front area was like a little cafe, you could get quick food there, and they had some tasty looking pastries and gelato up front, yum! Loved the look of the place too, and how you can see them making the food and all the fresh ingredients and everything. We kinda had to look around for where the hostess was, but someone helped direct us. We were seated quickly, and everyone working there was super nice! I usually never order anything other than water, but the cinnamon roll latte totally caught my eye and I had to give it a try! Also they brought out bread and pesto for us to start and it was so so delicious. Everything tastes super fresh. My latte was a little rich so I couldn't drink too much, but I shared it with my mom and sister and all three of us were obsessing over how amazing it tasted.  The brunch menu is pretty small, but there's definitely something for everyone on there! I got the vegetable scramble. It was pretty good. Vegetables in the scramble were cut chunky which I like. The potatoes were phenomenal. My sister got the burrito and liked it. My dad got the sandwich, and my mom got the two egg plate. She asked for spinach to be added and our waiter said yes but for some reason they put it on the side! Our waiter thought that was strange and offered to have it fixed, but it wasn't an issue. Wasn't too crazy pricey either. I would love to come back to try lunch or dinner here, it was great!

If you ever find yourself walking into Olive and Ivy, especially if you're on a first date with a pretty young lady; by God you better hope Clenard Hardy walks into your life. Let me briefly tell you about my evening on June, 30th 2016 as its one I sincerely appreciate and won't forget! It's started with an off menu personal creation of his own, which you have to ask him about if you have the pleasure of his service. It was one heck of a recommendation that I'd gladly wheel my grandmother to the side to enjoy again. Also, I assume he has some sort of magic crystal ball in his pocket because his timing was impeccable. The entire experience was effortlessly enjoyable. Thank you Clenard for aiding me in a fantastic evening with a beautiful lady.

Love the ambiance here, and love the food. The staff is super friendly. If you come here for brunch on a weekend, be sure to make a reservation in advance, as the wait may take hours. Seating is open in the patio area, but it's definitely hard to find seating for a large group, given the awesome view of the Scottsdale Waterfront, and the appealing atmosphere. I always make sure to come here everytime I'm in town.

A friend told me about this location and we just had to check it out. In terminal 4 near the A gates, we walked over from the southwest side of the terminal, thankfully all the gates are connected once you get through security. We caught breakfast before an early flight. Everything was super fast and efficient, and about as pricey as anything at the airport. Two breakfasts with coffees for $20. For airport food I was pleasantly surprised, just don't expect a typical O&I breakfast. The key to airport restaurants with the high volume and people in a hurry has to be premade and an assembly line. Despite that, it was worth to to have a non fast food breakfast in an upbeat atmosphere.

The Olive and Ivy... yum!  Just before I came to eat dinner here I happen to be Yelping and Jessica F. quick tipped trying the sangria.  I was late meeting my party of 6 so as I sat down and the waiter took my order I knew I already wanted the sangria - red.  It reminded me of a Framboise I tried at Carly's Bistro, very tasty and fruity, I had two.  The décor was amazing!  The window coverings were plush and the light fixtures were industrial.  There wasn't uniformity to it but it all came together so well.    Upon recommendation from one of the attorneys I was dinning with, I ordered the braised short rib with mascarpone polenta & baby vegetables.  Before the meal arrived the server gave us steak knives but they were useless.  The meat melted like butter and tasted even better.  I had never had polenta before but when I tried it I realized it was basically grits.  I don't particularly care for the texture but I couldn't stop eating them.  And the vegetables were two baby onions and two baby celery, meh, they didn't add anything to the meal.  For dessert I tried the blueberry gelato and it was typical gelato, a great way to end a meal.  Another one of the attorneys had ordered the stuffed ricotta balls and they reminded me of the doughnut holes from Dunkin' Donuts.  All in all, it was a fabulous meal and great company makes the dining experience that much better.  As for the service, I wasn't impressed.  Our server had all of the decorum of someone who worked in fine dining but we rarely saw him.  The dinner lasted two and a half hours and that was mostly because we had to wait so long - wait for drinks, to have our order taken, to get our meal, to order coffee and then dessert, waiting for the check.  Then when we did receive our meals, three people had ordered the same meal but one ordered it with pureed potatoes instead of the polenta.  When the server didn't know which was which he asked them to take a bite and then he switched their plates!  They of course insisted their $26 meals were taken back to the kitchen and corrected.  I wanted to give four stars based on the food but the service lead me to knock off a star.

A definite favourite. Incredible food (in particular the sweet potato cannelloni), perfect atmosphere, wonderful service, and probably my favourite outdoor patio to date. It's great for all occasions whether it's date night or dinner with the girls. Highly recommend this place - I rarely give 5 stars. I've been here multiple times and have never had a bad experience.

Great place! Make sure to make a reservation as they fill up super fast. I really enjoy their bruschetta, you can order one or multiple of the different choices. My favorite is the avocado one. Their shrimp risotto is amazing! I've tried recreating at home and can't quite get the flavor down. The gelato is ok, I've had way better. Great service.

This rating is based on first experience on a Saturday around 8:30 pm. We did not have a reservation. There were four of us in our party. They use the OpenTable system. If you're planning on a weekend night, I suggest you use it. This was a very busy night.  We're not taking into account the 50 minute wait for a table. That was completely our bad for not making reservations (it was a last minute thing) and our desire to sit outside (even longer wait) as it was very loud and crowded (this seems to be another regular occurrence with Fox restaurants: they don't architect enough sound dampening to handle their capacity and they encourage standing room only at the bar with very loud/upbeat music (there was a DJ). I believe this is within their control, but they merely wish it this way.  Fox Restaurant concepts has a knack for creating restaurants with a 'hip' atmosphere and a certain kind of clientele in mind. This was my first time here but my fifth Fox Restaurant visit. I'm starting to notice the ingredients/entrees are 'shared' across Fox menus. This can be a good thing as mainly these items are fresh and of high quality.  We ordered 3 rounds of drinks, appetizers, entrees, and desserts. We kept a lively mood as we were good friends who hadn't seen each other in a while. Three of us had previous restaurant experience.  Sam Fox stresses "outstanding hospitality every time". There are little things good and bad not worth noting. They're just what you'd expect on a busy Friday night at a popular place. That being said it would have been 'outstanding' if that kind of thing you expect everywhere else didn't apply here.  Overall the food was very good (the sweet potato canneloni was noteworthy as well as mushroom soup du jour). However the service and pacing are what killed the experience for all of us.    When disappointment was expressed in an item he was not apologetic, in fact he was downright combative: "Oh, I know I said there would be 10 meatballs, but these were the last ones for the night. (there were six small ones). There was no offer to replace them with something else.  "It's a Sicilian tirimasu I TOLD you it would have citrus flavors (there were overriding orange flavors). Again, no offer to replace the item. Then of course the strange insistence he had on setting items directly in front of someone who was speaking, obscuring their view of others (a simple wait of 30 seconds would not have been disruptive), but the lack of urgency to clear the table end of meal when he was nowhere to be found and empty dessert plate sat until even after the bill was taken.  How can I write this in such detail? Because while we all tried to converse, catch up and ignore his faux pas it became harder and harder to do so until we burst out in nervous laughter. We ended up poking fun at his strange actions to keep things light. As I mentioned we'd all worked as servers so we just shrugged it off, gave him his 20% and chalked it up to a poor luck of the draw. We didn't complain to the manager or give him a hard time because he's just trying to make a living (and we didn't want the night to end on THAT note), we just all shook our heads and pondered if he knew why he probably wasn't do so well as a waiter.  I know Fox concepts wants a guest to have a great time, come back and recommend their places, but it also takes friendly service. Hospitality as Sam Fox defines it.  Even if there were a bunch of mistakes, friendliness, humility and a desire to please would have gone a long way with this group. He would do well to have more training, better quality control (why would an item go out less than promised/) and to retain employees of greater dedication and character.  We'll probably come back, but if we see this guy again, we'll definitely request someone else.

Went with my friend on a Sunday night. It was really easy to make a reservation on their website through Open Table the night before, but we didn't even need one. The place is huge, and we were seated right away.  The service was beyond 5 stars. The server was very nice and attentive. Food came out very timely and they kept filling our water even though we stayed there for a while to chat. They never complained or seemed like they were pushing us out. On top of all that, the waiter brought us 2 separate checks without us even asking!  I got the scallops and I was obsessed with every part of the dish. Some of the best food I've had in a while.  Would highly, highly recommend!

YUM! I always love coming here.  Breakfast is fantastic (HIGHLY recommend their Yogurt and Granola Bowl), Lunch is wonderful (Try the sea bass w ravioli) and Dinner is great as well (sangria anyone?).  This restaurant makes you feel like your not even in AZ with it's gorgeous patio on the canal and plush sofas.  This is by far one of my favorite places to come with my girlfriends or alone and enjoy the atmosphere.  The service is always top notch and knowledgeable.  I highly recommend this place for drinks, dinner, chatting, munching, wine, breakfast, deserts, people watching, lunch and atmosphere; amongst other things...Enjoy yourself whatever you choose to do. Cheers!
Awesome place. Great service, superb food, and fun drinks. What more could you ask for?

My second visit to Olive & Ivy is what convinced me. Not that my first experience wasn't spectacular. It was, but I really steeped in it my fiance this weekend for brunch, and it isn't that our meals were just perfect, it's that the service was very friendly and attentive, as well.   My fiance ordered the Eggs Benedict with breakfast potatoes, and I had the Bacon Cheeseburger with a side salad. He cleaned his plate, and ate whatever he could of the half burger I couldn't finish. His only comment was that he preferred the hollandaise a different way, but that's because we make it ourselves at home.   The Bacon Cheeseburger was amazing, I order it medium. If I could have finished the entire thing I would, and the red wine vinaigrette on the side of greens is the best I've had in a while. I'd love to be able to make that one at home!  We ended the meal with the strawberry shortcake dessert that was interesting...not what either of us was expecting, then again, not sure what we were expecting. It was good. I'm sure there are better choices.   Our waiter really made sure we were comfortable, enjoying our brunch and our experience. We walked out of there smiling, stopping by the marketplace to order the large Cactus Blossom iced tea on the way out.

I went here for the first time to have dinner with my girl friends and I have to say it is  such an amazing experience. The place was lovely decorated on the inside and a nice patio area . Lights are dimly lit that set a warm romantic feel. Matt was our waiter, he was so welcoming and so attentive. Was very helpful when asked for opinion on what we should order since it was our first time there. Their flatbread was so delicious and couldn't have had enough of it. All the entrees tasted delightful, even the desserts were awesome . They even had a ice cream bar with many different and cool flavors! Prices was reasonable I totally recommend this place and would for sure be coming back for more date nights with my girls!!!:)

A MUST!!  The patio seating is so comfortable and cool and shady.  What a wonderful place to relax on a Sunday afternoon .... or any afternoon!  The food was very good as well.  Try the "Prosciutto Flatbread"!  It's amazing!

Great place to come have a drink or lunch/dinner!  They have a big outdoor patio along the river w/ heat lamps. Offer a happy hour menu.  Bartenders do a nice job making drinks.  Menu has lots of choices for all types of eaters.  There is a DJ in the evenings..not sure if it's all evenings but for sure Friday and Saturdays.

Right on the river near the fashion district in Scottsdale. The outdoor seating is pleasant but the river view is block by a wall and vegetation. Midday they give you a limited menu then tell you no meat or fish is being severed. We got an appetizer plater it was OK but a lot of bread and nothing was special. There is a lot of unique dining options in this area, I don't see any reason to return.

Had a fantastic experience here a couple of weeks ago.  We sat at the bar for lunch, as the restaurant was crowded during Spring Training, and tried all of the dishes our bartender recommended.  Everything was delicious!  I will definitely be returning here again soon, probably for dinner next time.

This place used to have a pretty good atmosphere and fun crowd. However the last two times I've visited, my experiences were pretty bad.    A couple of months ago I had a rude bartender too busy chatting up some guys to take my drink order, it was like she intentionally refused to take her eye off her dude and acknowledge me in the hopes we would give up and go away.  When she finally asked if we needed anything she got my drink wrong.  I ordered a vodka & soda with a splash of grenadine and she gave me a vodka & 7up.  Of course it was SUCH a hassle to remake it the way I asked that I got the bitchy eye roll and sigh.  The last time I was there a few weeks ago, my friend and I were told we had to leave the couches we'd been sitting at for over 30 minutes because all the tables outside were reserved. We stayed at the bar inside for at least 30 more minutes and never saw the patio get even half full.  In addition, the flat bread we'd ordered outside got "lost" when the waitress couldn't find us so we had to order again.  We finally got our appetizer about 45 minutes after we first ordered and it came out burned.  Gee, thanks.  It's a great space, I love the decor, and I really wish I liked it as much as I used to.  But the food, the service, the crowd are all just "Meh" now; what a waste.

We met some friends who just moved to the Valley at Olive and Ivy last Tuesday night for some drinks and food. For a Tuesday night it was really crowded, but I attribute that to the Insight Bowl being the next day which prompted an event nearby that brought many people to the SFS area. We were the last in our group to arrive and we were at a small table near the bar area - definitely if you have more than three to four people, get a larger table! It was still cozy and chic...loved the ambiance and feel of Olive and Ivy. One negative is that it does get very loud, so hearing the person across the table from you can be a challenge at some points.  Our server was very nice and helped us make some drink selections. The sauvignon blanc she recommended I get was excellent. I had the pesto flatbread which was delicious...it was the perfect size I thought. Chris had the proscutto and fig flatbread and he liked it, although he said he could have preferred a little more goat cheese and a little less fig. I also had a caesar salad, which was average - nothing to rave over. Our other dining companions enjoyed their flatbreads as well. Our group's only complaint was that the timing of the service of the food was off...our friends had ordered the calamari appetizer and I asked for my salad to be brought out first and our flatbreads arrived first! A minute later, the calamari and salad were brought out...it was entirely too much food for our little table, but due to our ingenuity we made it work. Our group of five's bill came to about $160 which included four flatbreads, a salad, calamari and a handful of drinks.  They do offer valet, but with the parking garage at Nordstrom's so close as well as the Waterfront parking garage, I am not sure what the point is of the valet. Olive and Ivy is definitely a place I see myself returning to meet some girlfriends for drinks or a place to eat lunch while out shopping at SFS.
The best date night restaurant you can ever go to! The bread and pesto are so damn good and if you go for dinner you have to try the chicken scallopini! I love this place.
What a great restaurant.  I had the chicken panini and my friend had a salad.  Wonderful.  We had the Coconut cake for dessert.  YUMMOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO Great service.
I love love this place. Everything about it is perfect. The food, the service, and the food...again!!! The veil and spinach ravioli was excellent as is the bruschetta

Everyone knows Olive & Ivy has the best patio in the area! Even in the summer heat I like to sit out for the views and the people watching is excellent! I love their brunch menu for the eggs Benedict (I'm obsessed) and I've always heard that the smoked salmon bagel is great as well. Drinks are always good- I prefer their whiskey sour smash personally. They also have a decent wine list including some of my favorite budget Napa wines (Tangley Oaks Merlot for one example). The atmosphere is always trendy without being pretentious and it's a great date spot!
This place was great! Some friends took us out to eat there & the food was amazing. Brandon & woman behind the bar did an amazing job & they took great care of us!

5 stars for the GELATO!!!!!!!!  Market and swanky dining room.  Everything I ate was delicious and thoughtful.  My heirloom tomato salad was kind of funny, though.  There were multi colored hunks of tomato (which were superbly fresh and flavorful), chunks of avocado, big thick wedges of lettuce, and 2 bacon strips placed on top.  lol.  It was all amazingly fresh and tasty, but it was just funny.  It looked like they had forgotten to chop everything up and put it into a salad. I still loved it.  My friend's potatoe-y soup (cannot remember what it actually was) tasted flavorful and hearty.  All the bruschettas and breads with pesto were out of this world.  Great wines.  AND THEN.  $1.75 humongous cups of gelato.  With 3 flavors all tucked in there. And a shortbread cookie that made me weep tears of joy.  Seriously.  You can't even get the same amount of crappy froyo for $1.75.  Go eat the gelato.  Especially the PB&J flavor!!! AAAAHHH!!! SO TASTY!!!!

People have been telling me about this place for a while and I should have listened earlier.   Food, service and ambience were all great. I made some substitutions to my meal and they nailed all of them.   I will be going back.

We ended up at Olive & Ivy as a 2nd - or 3rd choice due to our lateness in making a reservation for a party of 8 during the month of March.  We made the reservation about 9 days in advance.  We ended up with a primo indoor table on a Saturday night (a full house).  We were extremely pleased with the location, ambiance, service, wine list, and the food.  The dishes were spectacular.  I had the best sea scallops (with sweet polenta) that I have ever eaten.
Great Salads and Bakery treats. Coffee is outstanding as well. Snack area items are a bit on the pricer side.

So the first time I visited Olive and Ivy was a few years back (probably a month after it first opened) I was not a fan at all. However, recently I had heard a few of my friends talking about how good this place was, so I figured it was probably just getting established when I visited before.   Last Saturday I decided to give it another go. And I am so glad I did! I am a fan of all fox restaurants - but this one might take the cake! The atmosphere and decor was perfect for a Saturday afternoon. They had the restaurant opened to the patio and the weather was absolutely gorgeous! Also they had a small band playing music, which was great!  The waitress was a little uneducated about the food and forgot to put in our order for flatbread, but she was nice - so I'll only take off one star. And the food - oh. my. god. The grilled chicken salad was the best I've had so far and the pasta was delicious!  I plan on returning soon. I think this might be a new favorite brunch/lunch spot.
Quite possibly the best restaurant I've ever been to. Fabulous food, amazing service and great ambiance. I can't stop thinking about the hummus and bacon wrapped dates. I'm going back for sure!

Really enjoyed our meal at Olive & Ivy. We tried the sangria, which was good but not great. I'd definitely try something else if I went again but it was totally drinkable. Bacon wrapped dates were amazing...so good. The bread/pesto dip is as good as everyone else on Yelp says. I had the sea bass which was delish, and my husband's scallops were great too - his corn mixture under the scallops was the best part I think! To finish we had the ice cream bar dessert...how can you go wrong with caramel ice cream, marshmallow, peanut butter and magic shell topping??? So tasty. The atmosphere was great, very classy and hip but casual at the same time. Our server was great, fabulous sense of humor and made us feel very welcome there. Overall a great experience!

Perfect atmosphere! There's nothing better than eating outside on a lovely evening on a beautiful patio with lights. Great food and good service. I wish I lived here year round so I could go back often, but alas, was only visiting.

It's one of the Fox restaurants on the waterfront in Scottsdale. It has a modern Mediterranean feel, with a great open kitchen. The patio is amazing, as you can see the river and the historic Scottsdale area. The waitress was very attentive yet not intrusive at all. Like all of the Fox restaurants, she was very well trained.  Their homemade bread with pesto is amazing. It's fresh and the pesto had excellent flavor.  We started with the mushroom bruschetta, served with garlic and cheese. Every element was done well, and it had the perfect amount of garlic.  The salmon entree was a great choice for lunch. It had a great crust, was done medium exactly as requested, and served with beets and fingerling potatoes.

Good food just like their Scottsdale location. It's quick-service - for lunch, they offered an assortment of paninis, pizza and salads. The line moved quickly (maybe too quickly, I forgot to order a drink and the girl behind the counter forgot to ask if I wanted one - nbd, I had water with me and was getting coffee before I flew out) and my panini came out to my table pretty fast as well. The roast beef panini was super filling and really good. Pizza also smelled and looked tempting. I also grabbed some snacks to go and everything was reasonably priced for the airport - the panini itself was under $10. If you need to plug in, there were power outlets at the bar that faces out into the airport.   Location - in terminal 4 really close to security checkpoint A, in the A1-A14 hall.

Strolling around and found this cute place. Started the afternoon with a friend and a nice glass of Chardonnay. Highly recommend the lamb meatballs and roasted Brussel sprout bruschetta. The service was friendly and fun.

We went for a drink and to relax before dinner.  We were made to feel welcome and were not rushed to have another drink or order more.  We were in their outdoor lounge area, on a perfect day.  It is nice to be able to sit, talk  and not be rushed.  The sangria is light and fresh, the vibe great.  We love this place.

Great brunch! We came here to recover and refuel after our hike up Camelback Mountain, selecting the restaurant on a combination of personal recommendations & Yelp reviews. The ambiance is great and has an expansive Mediterranean feel, yet at the same time our booth felt cozy. It also gave us a bit of a waterfront view (the patio, cooled by mist, would've been very tempting if not for my post-hike state).   Cinnamon is my mortal enemy but I really wanted to try their French toast anyhow. They happily accommodated my request for a non-cinnamon version and recommended I do the compote on the side too. Our server also recommended the homestyle cheddar biscuit, topped with sausage gravy. I am glad he did because it was amazing.

This place is still going strong after all these years.  The decor is beautiful and the bar area is a fun place to hang out.  This last visit I just had a cup of coffee and an  OK butter or olive oil cake for dessert.

Olive and Ivy is a must do for brunch or lunch in Scottsdale!  Fresh ingredients, attentive service, varied menu, awesome patio and gelato made on site! What more could a person ask for.   We had the hummus appetizer and it was amazing! Get the fresh veggies with it because they are, well, fresh!   I had the turkey grinder and she had the tuna salad sandwich. Both served on house made bread. Both very delicious!   They brought out a plate of fresh foccacia and house made pesto. It was superb!  She finished with snicker doodle gelato and I had chocolate/raspberry we weren't disappointed!

We went with a rather large group around 5pm on a Wednesday night. It wasn't too busy at the bar so we were all able to gather around one side of the bar pretty comfortably. The bartenders are pretty inattentive to ordering a drink/food at the bar was difficult. They barely looked up to make eye contact with anyone! We tried their red sangria and funghi flatbread pizza which were both really yummy.

Came to Olive & Ivy on a Wednesday night and sat at the bar.  Ordered a glass of Pinot Grigio, a green salad, and the sea scallops.  The green salad was basic, but good with the perfect amount of dressing.  However, it took forever for me to get and wasn't able to get half way through it when the entree came out.
