The sea scallop entree was not great, as the featured scallops were small and over-cooked.  They were served on a sweet corn polenta that was actually very good.  This was my one and only time here, but I expected much much better.

This was one of my favorite restaurants during my visit to Arizona. Don't skip the mouthwatering lamb meatballs and bacon wrapped dates (loved the fresh bread and sauce with the meatballs).  For entrees we shared the sea bass and sweet potato cannelloni. Both were delicious but I preferred the cannelloni-- the pasta had both wonderful flavor and texture. We were stuffed but had to try the house made gelato and the peanut butter pudding. I loved the dark chocolate gelato and the coconut- the espresso was just ok and didn't have the best texture.  The peanut butter pudding was tasty but very rich and heavy.  Be sure to make a reservation as it can get quite crowded on weekends. We came a hoping to be seated a bit early and there was no space at the bar. Servers were quick and attentive. I was impressed by how quickly food came out even though it was so busy.

My wife and I had a fantastic meal! Our waitress was awesome (Nicole D). The food was perfectly prepared and delicious. The ambiance capped the experience.  We sat outside on a chilly evening. The heaters kept us warm. Great view and beautiful furnishings!  We will definitely be back... again and again!  The Bruschetta was amazing - You will come back just for this.  The steak and bacon wrapped tenderloins were also delectable!  Did I mention that we will come again?

Amazing! This place easily became my favorite restaurant. Very enjoyable whether I'm there to get gelato after shopping, on a date night, or sitting on the patio for lunch. The food and the staff are amazing. I've brought about 4 people to this place, each of them loved it as well.  My last visit was the best. I was surprised to see they have a Dj on Friday nights. It was a nice touch to the atmosphere. My waitress was very knowledgeable and even split our entrees without us even asking for it. We ordered the scallops and lasagna! Both choices I recommend.   Very clean Great service Entertaining atmosphere AMAZING appetizers and entrees
Awesome food! Small portions for the price, but high quality. The decor is amazing and loved being right by the canal! Great date spot.

It's a great venue -- and unlike many other places in downtown Scottsdale parking isn't too bad because the free underground parking is right next door. The atmosphere is very nice and the outside dining area is very romantic.  I had the scallops which were as good as I ever had. My partner had the salmon which was good but not enough to earn a 5 star.  Service was professional.   The coffee creme brulee was somewhat ordinary. It seemed to be from one of those mass production dessert places.
We had a wonderful dinner there this evening. The chicken scollopine with  Spinach was fantastic.  Cheese cake Also excellent and view was delightful.
Always a reliable and delicious meal. I crave the Caesar salad and the lasagna bolognese. The sangria hits the spot too. Lovely ambience. Great place to bring visitor as the menu appeals to everyone.

I wouldn't go out of my way to visit this place but I had a lovely evening.  My boyfriend and I came here after dinner for some cocktails and we cozied right up to a fire pit on the patio.  I really thought the patio was charming and definitely not overcrowded.  The drinks were reasonably priced for Scottsdale in my opinion.  My main dislike of this place was the music.  Olive and ivy is a classy establishment and I would have liked the music to reflect that; instead we had club songs being spun by a DJ.  Call me crazy but I think a little Frank Sinatra would have been more appropriate and fitting.  Oh well.

I'm from Dallas Texas and was visiting Arizona for a quick vacation. We heard a lot about Scottsdale and we looked up places to eat, Olive & Ivy was one of the first things to pop up on yelp. The 2 stars I'm giving are only for the aesthetic of the place. The seating area outside on the patio is very appealing. We sat outside around a fire place and the patio was decorated with lights. Now let me get to the part that really made me disappointed. The food was terrible. First off the price is not cheap, so therefore if I'm paying for something expensive I expect it to be good. I came with 3 other people and only one thing out of all our orders was alright. We ordered the rib eye steak which is what they promote highly, we asked for it medium well. The steak was $45 and it comes with one side which is 2 small pieces of finger potatoes and that's all. The steak came out bleeding and pretty much Raw. It was very rare and red. Second the chicken in the Mediterranean salad was burned and tasteless. The waitress only appeared a few times. She did not ask for us how our food was at all, even after seeing that it was barley touched.  Only recommend coming here strictly for drinks and a cute place to sit with friends.

The food was simply delicious! We started with the homemade hummus. This was no ordinary hummus. It was filled with yummy veggies and goat cheese. We were then given the focaccia with a pesto spread. Very tasty, but the best was for last. The sweet potato cannelloni was one of the best dishes I have ever had. We also had the goat cheese and duck tortellini. This was very good as well. Great combination of flavors. The atmosphere was fun with open air seating.

Being delayed at the airport sucks... but with some decent dining options at PHX nowaday, it could be much, much worse!  I'm a fan of Olive & Ivy and the Marketplace in Old Town, and while the airport version isn't exactly the same, it's a big step up from what our airport used to offer!  Whether you're on a delay, in between flights, or running to catch a flight, this Olive & Ivy delivers.  Breakfast options include pastries, coffee, smoothies, eggs, oatmeal, and yogurt parfaits.  Lunch and dinner selections are salads, paninis and pizza.    The staff is friendly and almost all of the food is ready or will be ready for  you within minutes.  Thanks FRC for adding this and several other concepts to the airport!

Time for an update only because I was invited to a dinner party last night at O&I that was absolutely perfect!  We sat in their beautiful private room, and it almost felt like we were at someone's house in their dining room.  Joel was our waiter and took fantastic care of our group.  As usual the food was delicious!  Last night I had the scallop entree (with bacon, salsify & yellow corn purée) and a side of spinach.  Jared had the salmon (with roasted beets, fingerling potatoes & horseradish vinaigrette).  We were pleased with both, as well as the bread and pesto, antipasti plate, and hummus starters.  I enjoyed a glass of Gewürztraminer while a variety of libations went down easy around the table as well including mojitos and beer.    After dinner, we moved the party outside and thankfully, the misters on the patio made this crazy AZ heat bearable!  The evening flew by (a reflection of the fine group of peeps I was with), and as midnight approached, I noticed the bar and most of the restaurant were empty... the DJ was packing up and our party moved on as well.  In usual Gabi manner, I headed home to get some beauty sleep.  Thanks again, O&I, for another wonderful meal!

I was honestly blown away with the many flavors I experienced  here. First there was the freshly baked bread and pesto dipping sauce. By far the most flavorful pesto dipping sauce I've ever tasted. The bread melts in your mouth and the garlic pesto pairing is to die for. Then there was the spicy shrimp risotto and bone in ribeye that my wife and I shared. I'll start with the risotto. Flavor A+ however the consistency of the risotto was B-. It was a tad bit runny, but I still would highly recommend it as it was still a stellar dish. The ribeye, on the other hand, A++. I ordered it medium and it was cooked to perfection. Honestly I would recommend having the risotto as a side option. Lastly, the service was great and the drinks were great. Over all experience excellent.

I really love the original Olive and Ivy so I was excited to see a restaurant addition but this satellite location just disappoints. Stopped in for breakfast and they clearly have the most extensive breakfast menu off the restaurants in the A wing.   Ordered the Oatmeal (was missing the apples) which I said would be okay. But the oatmeal itself was way rich with the mousse and yet still very bland despite the fact that I added cinnamon and brown sugars. It's pretty much an overcooked sticky blob before the brown sugar. I could only eat about a third of it before I had to through it out.   Ordered and Ice Tea which and then had to order another because the Ice Tea Container was filled with coffee. Fortunately, I had time to get a new drink but in a airport restaurant most wouldn't. This place just isn't on their game.   My cinnamon roll was stale and tasted like it was 2 days old.   $12 and I left hungry. Meh.

Recommendation from an acquaintance.  Made OT dinner reservations.  We walked in from the Marketplace entrance that we were confused as to where the hostess was.  It turns out it was around the bar.  Both of the hostesses were friendly and one even complimented my dress.  We were quickly seated and was greeted by our happy server.  I started the night with a red sangria.  Pretty punchy, not super fruity which I liked.  For starters, we had the Manchego Bruschetta which came with chorizo and the Mediterranean Salad.  One bruschetta is a good bite for 2 people.  The Mediterranean salad was fresh and tasty.  The dressing was a little tangy that at one point, it went down the wrong pipe and I started coughing.  For dinner, I had the English Pea Tortellini which apparently is made in-house.  The sauce was delicious with bacon and mushrooms.  MMMMmmm, I still remember the taste of it.  My husband had the Natural Chicken with potato puree.  The chicken was juicy and although it was a simple dish, it was made well.  The portions for both were just right.  Not huge, but good individual portions.    I had a paper cut and needed a band-aid so I asked the server for one.  He went to go check and never came back so I figured he forgot, but then a lady came by and offered me different types of bandaid.  Perhaps she was the GM.  I picked the one with hearts.  That was nice of them.  They did not forget.  We asked more about the restaurant and the Fox Restaurant Concepts company and our server was knowledgeable and helpful in answering questions.  The server even brought out the list of all the other restaurants that are owned by FRC.  Overall, great food, friendly staff, tasty drinks, live DJ.  Great place to go with a group.

I went to Olive and Ivy 3 times while in Scottsdale over the past summer. It has an amazing atmosphere, cool vibes and great food! The drinks were always good, and the recommendations from the wait staff never disappointed.  They were also super helpful with my dairy restriction.  We were able to order the delicious bruschetta sampler and they made sure to keep all of the cheeses on the side for me.  I enjoyed every meal and will definitely be back!

I enjoyed myself when I dined at Olive and Ivy for the first time this past weekend.  The food was good as well as the service. They have many wines to choose from if that is your thing. My only compliant is that I was told on the phone that reservations were not needed so when I arrived there was only seating in the marketplace area of the restaurant.  I believe this took away from my entire experience.  Next time, I will be sure to make a reservation in order to secure better seating.

Great dinner here.  Nice view of waterfront, ask for a window seat.  Did not dine on patio as wind was whipping out there but those that did said the fire pits provided adequate warmth to do so. Food was delicious, tried the bruschetta appetizer and the combination of manchego, quince and spanish chorizo was unique and tasty.  Splitting each a beet and kale salad was a great way to taste two different salads, both excellent and not to be missed. Husband had the steak, bone-in rib-eye (huge portion - enough for lunch next day!) with potatoes and spinach done perfectly.  The sea bass was beautiful presentation and very good, but small serving size.  Server was professional and knowledgeable.
Ambience was nice, not too loud so you couldn't have a conversation, service was friendly and attentive,  and while I only had a salad, it was delicious! Will definitely go back & try more things.

I have never been disappointed in this place. It is right by the parking garage for the Fashion Square mall so parking is never an issue. They also do valet on certain nights I believe. The bacon-wrapped dates are so tasty and the pasta dish I had (can't remember the name) with the peas and bacon was seriously the best pasta I have ever eaten. My sister's finally told me to stop saying "oh my god that is so good" after hearing about it after every bite.
Ordered our food server got it wrong but offered us a free pastry to make up for it! Didn't matter everything was absolutely fantastic! Good Buisness!

Fantastic experience for lunch here today.  Their sandwiches and flatbreads were amazing.  To be honest though, it was the amazing customer service that was provided that made the experience 5 star worthy.  My drink was never empty, and they were extremely acomodating.  I will be going back 100 more times because of how pleased I am.

First time trying Olive and Ivy last night for my birthday, recommendation from my sister. First of all, this restaurant is beautiful! I recommended sitting outside if it's not too cold. The ambiance is so nice!  We ordered a little bit of everything. 3 types of bruchetta, butter lettuce salad and the pesto flat bread, all to share. Everything was delicious! Fresh with good ingredients. Our server could not have been nicer. She made sure the meal was spaced out so we could have a nice relaxed evening. And the complimentary dessert at the end was extra special!   Great place. I can't wait to come back!

Back again for a girls day lunch, again it was great.  We ordered bruschetta this time and a Charcuterie plate, also the artichoke hearts and dates.  Everything was great, the three bruschettas we has were amazing! The manchego and chorizo was my fav, but they were all great.  The artichokes were so yummy, they were garlicy and I loved it.  The charcuterie were so amazing, the prosciutto was out of this world.

I've been here twice now..once for my birthday years ago and once for brunch more recently. Here are my opinions:  - nice atmosphere...I especially enjoy the counter where you can order brunch items - interesting people-watching (can you say "Scottsdale"?) - decent food options, but nothing that really excites me - great service on both visits - comfortable patio with lots of lounging areas - cool location being close to Fashion Square and Old Town - nothing bad to say, but nothing outstanding either  Will I be back? Maybe, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

I haven't been here in a while and came with a friend for dinner.  We spilt the trio of bruschetta's which probably paired with a salad could be a full meal.  I also had the veal ravioli and thought once the cheese melted it was a little on the salty side.  My favorite part of the meal was the chocolate molten cake with ice cream...chocolate lover heaven.  Nice ambiance along the canal..with lots of outdoor seating.

BACKGROUND   My girlfriend and business partner recommended we meet at Olive & Ivy for lunch and drinks for our meeting.  Olive & Ivy is a little hard to find at first, as it is tucked away in the Waterfront Camelback and Scottsdale restaurants in the back and looks like a tiny café from the street.  Once you finally find parking, (the best place is to use the parking garage across the street), find the restaurant.   The entrance is pretty unassuming, but it has a super chic and very impressive layout and vibe when you walk in.  There is a central bar with little couches around for a bit more causal seating, as well as a formal dining room.   There is also a cute central wine cellar in the front which makes a great selection for the wine menu.   The lighting is very modern and edgy.  We ordered the Mediterranean salad with shrimp as our add protein and hummus appetizer plate to share. The food was terrific.  I ordered the grapefruit mohito which was delicious.  The only complaint was that we weren't served water after asking for it over and over before we were able to get even got one glass. I kept asking for water refills, but never got more.   I did get all the refills on all of the expensive grapefruit mohitos though.  There are many different menus, including: Market Menu Brunch Menu Lunch Menu Dinner Menu Dessert Menu Happy Hour Menu  If you want to check out the food selection ahead of time, the best idea is to go to their website. Or, just be pleasantly surprised when you get there!  Hours: Brunch: Sat/Sun 10am - 3pm Lunch: Mon - Fri 11am - 3pm Happy Hour: Mon - Fri 3pm - 6pm Dinner: Sun - Thur 5pm - 10pm Fri/Sat 5pm - 11pm  Market Opens 7am Breakfast: 7am - 3pm  For more information: OliveandIvyRestaurant.com   I 4/5 highly recommend Olive & Ivy!

Sam Fox hits the mark again! I had dinner with some friends and we were all impressed. Presentation was well executed and flavor was just as excellent. I had the Parmesan risotto as my entree. I liked the roasted cloves of garlic that gave bursts of flavor. The shrimp was cooked just right, not rubbery. Drinks were not watered down, and were very well priced for dining in and around Old Town and the Waterfront. The atmosphere/decor is spot on as well and the staff was very attentive. Can't wait to go back!

At Olive & Ivy, the quality of the food and atmosphere is not a question. The question is, "Why isn't there more of this on my plate?"  We had a group of 7 of us at a long table and our service was relatively swift. The place was relatively quiet, granted it was the middle of the week.   My qualms about portion size are with the flat breads and the veal ravioli dish. My brother in-law and I both finished the ravioli saying, "OK, I wish there was more of this, I'm still starving".  The server said that the portions were *big* and I felt that it was misleading. I should note that this entire family isn't full of extreme appetites either. The portions were just weren't entree sized in my opinion.  Would I come back here?  For appetizers and drinks, sure. But if I'm in the mood for dinner, I would order something else or go elsewhere to fill up.

Ok, the atmosphere here is great, noise is medium, but over all solid ... i has the salmon - cooked perfectly medium - great presentation- friendly authentic staff...  I'm a tough critic too... the calamari veggie app was $13.50 and small, only complaint. Besides that there is something for everyone ...

Came in here tonight with my girlfriend and grandma are waiter Josh was extremely friendly and courteous specially he took the time with my elderly grandma which you don't see a lot anymore he also knew the menu like the back of his hand and pointed us in the direction of some extremely delicious dishes I will definitely be coming back to this place great atmosphere great food and great and great people thanks a lot Josh

We sat at the bar for lunch. I'm vegan and have other special dietary restrictions. Sad to say that our server wasn't open to any suggestions for me. My husband had a cesar salad with salmon and it was "just ok".  The Pinot Grigio was the house choice and no other. The house choice was not good. I opted for water. I tried the sangria and that was tasty but served in a small glass with ice to the brim. We spent $60 just to leave and go eat lunch somewhere else.  Very disappointing lunch experience. Thankfully I was able to eat a delicious lunch elsewhere.
Great service and very interested in making sure customers are satisfied. Grilled Cheese Sandwich was fantastic but big enough for 2. A good stopping off place to grab a snack before your flight.

Marvelous, great ambiance, service and food selection. Our servers were top notch on the patio and in the restaurant. I felt the price was reasonable for a Scottsdale location.  If I were to return I'd probably just do appetizers and cocktails on the patio, it is really cool.

Good food, great service.  Went for lunch   Very interesting decor.  Hip Place to be.  However it was so loud in there we found ourselves practically yelling to be heard.   Not an intimate place for conversation.
Lovely upscale niche to lounge outside while enjoying a cocktail, desert and conversation. If you came solo, the community spaces are wonderful for meeting new people!
This is a great little place!  My girlfriends planned a meetup there, and we were so  surprised.  The food was delicious and the service was very good.  Will definitely go back.

I went to olive and ivy to celebrate a friend's engagement. It was a bridesmaids brunch and we had to sit outdoors because the place was so busy. Although it was hot out, Josh P made our brunch absolutely incredible. I couldn't have asked for a more attentive server. He was very in tune with what each of us wanted, and he made the bride to be feel pampered. Josh truly went above and beyond to provide excellent service. If you go to olive and ivy, ask for Josh P if you want to best service in Phoenix!!!!

Came for brunch and I LOVED it....  Super cool and nice place.  The service was absolutely freaking top notch.  Food was very good.    IVY SAUSAGE SANDWICH:  scrambled eggs, american cheese & housemade english muffin - Delicious  The breakfast potatoes were great.  CHOCOLATE CROISSANT:  Melted me... So flaky and great

We really liked this place.  I had the shrimp risotto and the rest of my party ordered the margherita flat bread, lasagna and the bacon wrapped pork.  Everyone must've liked their dishes because we all finished our food; except for my husband who loaded up on the yummy bread and pesto dipping sauce beforehand.   My dish was perfectly cooked and the portion sizes are just right.  All around good food with great ambiance.  It's also a fun place to people watch!

The food is very blah, small portions, over priced. the atmosphere is really nice to bad the $30,000.00 a year millionaire crowd likes to frequent the place as do the gold diggers. I say save your time and money and try someplace else unless of course this is the kind of place you are looking for.

Wow amazing food and service! We didn't even have a reservation and they got us in within 10 minutes.   After sitting, we received drinks promptly and ordered. Food came super quick. We ordered the kale salad with shrimp and the salmon plate. Also ordered an appetizer of bruschetta.   We will be back. Good service. Delicious healthy food. Couldn't ask for much more!!!

Went for a B-Day dinner.... Good times, great food.  Even had a Moscow Mule (not even on the menu) at the bar.  Good times, but with all great times comes the part with the bill.  A bit pricey, but it was my B-Day and I had alligator arms.  Will be coming back, especially to have a loaf of bread with pesto.....

On a recent early morning flight out of Sky Harbor, I ate breakfast at Olive & Ivy and picked up a salad for my long flight. I was not impressed with the breakfast options, but the salad was great.   The bagel and cream cheese ($3) was not tasty and definitely not worth the price! I wish I had picked up a muffin instead because those looked freshly baked, whereas the bagel was not.   I was glad to have a fresh salad on my flight - much better than buying an expensive packaged meal from the airline! The Mediterranean Salad ($7) was made with spring mix, cherry tomatoes, diced cucumbers, Israeli couscous, toasted almonds, feta cheese and oregano dressing. The salad was hearty and the person behind the counter confirmed the salad had been freshly chopped and made that morning.   I'll return to Olive & Ivy at Sky Harbor next time I need lunch before my flight and save the breakfast and brunch dining for the original restaurant location  in Scottsdale.

Guys? Do you want to impress your date with a fancy treat? This is IT!!  Nice place, nice atmosphere, kinda of romantic I should say too because of the lights, but definitely a good options for girls nights or even family dinner. You make it your own. I really like the food, but honestly here are my favorite: ready?? The Lasagna Bolognese with a Belvedere Blue Martini. Honestly this lasagna is so tiny/small that you will eat it in one or two bites (and so overpriced) but it is DELICIOSO!!! And the martini... well, it is Belvedere... you don't need more explanations, hello?? Haha. (please do not have more than 2, especially if it is your first date). Oh yeah, back to the subject. Last time I was there, we had a large group, 45 minute wait, but it was a Saturday night in Scottsdale, so nothing out of the normal... Oh, there is a DJ on Saturday nights, it is not obnoxious, so do not get intimidated if you do not like clubs, you can still hear what people say (well not at the bar) but the rest. If the weather is nice, I highly recommend to eat in the patio, all those lights make it so peaceful and romantic ... awwee... I need a boyfriend haha. Enjoy!!!

This place is ok. The portions are a little small and the cocktails are not as great as they sound. A good place to pop in for a quick drink if you're out and about, but I don't think I'd have a full dinner here.

I just love this place. The vibe and food here is always just the right mix of excellence, deliciousness, and coolness.  If vibes can be bottled, capture the vibe here to enhance your own personality, home, or business.  Will sure to turn it into a winner!

Looovvveee this place the view is amazing and the food is even better and the service! Wow! Best service out there! My sister brought me here for dinner a couple weeks ago and we loved it told our server it was our first time there & she told her manager and they gave us a free desert! We loved he environment so much that we decided to go back & we came back with our hubbys as a double date and again great time great service! Highly recommend this place!

I love this place, it evolves in simple elegant ways.  It's been a little more than a year since I've last been there.  I booked the reservation on line and was able to get a reservation 45 minutes earlier than quoted by phone.  On-line is where its at.  New addition since I've been there a cosmo dj spinning some old school tunes.  Love it, love it.  Took the parents, they are a little afraid of change but they give this a passing grade the last time we were here.  The sangria is very tasty and got two pitchers.  Order the lamb meatballs; pass on them, they need more flavor.  The stuffed dates are a sure hit though.  Entrees were pork tenderloin and chicken.  These were all perfect and flavorful.   Wait staff is perfect.  I finished off with the Hazelnut pudding.  The pudding was great, the pastry that was on the side, had mystery flavors that I would pass on.  I wish there was a location arond the Biltmore area.  Fox restaurants this place is a hit!

One of my top choices for late night dinners, drinks and a good time with my friends. Service was excellent, the drinks were marvellous and them bruschettas were fantastic. Jeez, their margherite pizza was lit! That cheese, fresh basil and tomatoes on flat bread was probably the best I've ever tasted. I was filled up just on appetizers. Will definitely be back soon.

Terrible bar service. I love this place and brought my wedding party here in 2013. Came here Mar 13 2014, sat at the bar and got served drinks right away. Then the bartenders proceeded to ignore us for nearly 15 min despite us having food menus waiting to order dinner. The bar was 60% full so it wasn't super busy. Very unfortunate, and we had to ask the hostess for a manager. Manager came by and acknowledged the poor service, paid our tab, and we left. Disappointing and we will no longer promote this place, as there are plenty of great places to eat/drink in old town.

Great find in the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport. I had a few minutes to pick up lunch during a layover and my nose led me to Olive & Ivy (Terminal A across from A2). I got a sausage hash from the breakfast menu (ends at 11am IIRC) for $8.  While it was being prepared, one of the chefs told me that if I could finish the entire thing, it'd be on him, haha. It was enormous! Definitely no chance of finishing it. Tasty, though - LAX could definitely use a few restaurants like this for quick healthy bites en route to destinations.

This was such an amazing experience. The thought process if making the menu selections was beyond my expectations. I had the goat cheese and beet salad (half portion is perfect before dinner). Followed by Sweet Potato Cannelloni:roasted mushroom, toasted almond..oooomygoodness!! Delicious!!! Perfect portion and so delicious.  Probably going back before I head home!

My friend was in town from Colrado and she wanted to do brunch somewhere. So I suggested Olive & Ivy.  The 1st thing I asked about(and the ENTIRE reason I suggested this place ) was the AMAZING Cherry Bread pudding dessert I had the first time I went. They don't have it anymore. I was so entirely distressed by that answer I wanted to walk out. But alas, we stayed. I rodered the sausage scramble with a side of toast and it had the perfect kick of spice. I also had the rasberry mojito and it aimed to please. My friend ordered the flatbread on my suggestion and it was also excellent. The food is great, above average, prices are well.. it's pricey but you'll defintiely have leftovers, portions are more than decent. So I can't say you don't get your money's worth However, if you're looking for "dive" prices for brunch..in a not so "Scottsdale" atmosphere...head to Giligins.

I came here last Saturday night with my family and I'm not sure what we were thinking but we didn't try to make a reservation until 2:00pm. That left us with 2 options- 5:15 and 9:15. Neither were appealing, but I really wanted to try this restaurant, so we went with the 5:15 sitting. It certainly felt strange eating that early, but I quickly got over that once I started to taste the food.  The first problem I had with this restaurant was that everything looked so good. My family and I must have spent a good 10 minutes optimizing our order. We coordinated a strategic attack on the menu making sure that we got to try at least one thing form every part of the menu.  We started with a Bruschetta and the Pesto Flatbread. The bruschetta was alright, a little small in terms of portions but our waiter did try to tell us. It was the Pesto Flatbread was what everyone at our table fought over. It was much larger than the bruschetta and had the creamiest, most delicious goat cheese on top.   We then had a mixture of salads and entrees. I wasn't feeling all that hungry (remember- it was 5:15) so I just got a simple green salad. Let me tell you for $5 that was a pretty reasonable sized salad and their simple vinaigrette was very flavorful.  My family members were all very happy with their dishes as well (sweet potato cannelloni, big eyed tuna, and the natural chicken), but the real winner of the evening was the Sangria.  We ordered a pitcher of Red Sangria (tempranillo, cassis, blackberry, raspberry, strawberry) to start with and even considered ordering more. It had a lovely sweetness to it that came from the fruits and it was very addicting. I will definitely be ordering that again.  I can definitely see myself coming here again and trying their other salads and their white sangria too.

beautiful outside patio on the waterfront with excellent food and service... the bacon wrapped dates, bruschetta and scallop entree were all delicious!  everyone from the host staff to wait staff to mgmt were all friendly and accomodating, will definitely return. the only (minor) issues we had were the iron patio chairs could use padding they were a bit cold and hard, and we thought it would've been easier if they had cut the bruschetta in half instead of thirds for our table of two...but other than those minor things def an A+ evening!

Ordered the lamb gyro and red sangria.  The food was fresh and the drinks did not disappoint.  I sat at the bar where you can watch the chef in action.  Love the vibe and will have to make another trip out here!
Everything we had here was great, from the service of the drinks to the food. Many things looked good and would love to return.

My husband and I finally tried O & I a couple of months ago and we enjoyed it so much that we returned last weekend and asked for the same server, who was excellent! The patio is gorgeous. Service impeccable. Food is great too. I really love their Focaccia Bread with Pesto that comes FREE when you get your drinks. Yum. We've tried a large sampling of their flatbreads, salads and appies and all were delish. My favorite was the bacon-wrapped dates and the butternut squash soup (I think it was a special). The server recommended a dessert on our first visit, which was exquisite, but I can't remember what it was...I just know we vowed to come back soon, which is always a good feeling when you leave a restaurant.
Really cool venue and my food is always delicious. Service can sometimes be an issue as this place is so large.

I took a client there hoping for a great meal and to conduct some business.  The hostess wanted to seat us next to a table that was about 8" away.....I had to request a different table.   I don't want to hear their business nor do I want them to hear mine.   The next table offered sufficient privacy.    It took about 5 minutes before we were greated by a wait staff or even offered any water.  The music was that repetitive club type of annoying beat and rather loud, again, hard to conduct business, or really any conversation. The food was great....but I probably won't return with a client in the future.   It's about the whole experience.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED: Located along the "Scottsdale waterfront" (i.e. canal) this is among one of my favorites.  This is by far one of my favorite patio locations in Scottsdale. Whether you are there on business or pleasure, it's hard to go wrong with Olive & Ivy. The wait staff is very attentive and accommodating.    The menu at Olive and Ivy is simple and straightforward.  Their small bite offerings allow a solid taste of several different flavors.  Most of the dishes appear pleasant to both the eye and the palette.  Do yourself and your stomach a huge favor...  enjoy their weekend brunch sometime sooner than later.  Seasonal warning: when I was there last week, the noise on the patio was pretty bad.  I believe they are prepping along the waterfront for the NFL Super Bowl, at least according to the waiter.  Just outside of Olive and Ivy's patio was a very loud, BEEPING front-end loader making all kinds of noise.  We hardly noticed...  I SAID, WE HARDLY NOTICED :) Regardless, I'll still go back time and time again!
Absolutely love this joint!  Great food, great service and a unique and fun atmosphere!

Bad coffee. Never seen that kind is machine before but it's definitely not doing it for me. Dunno, I guess I'm not in this airport much, so who I am to say how this place is compared to the competition?  Still, the coffee was really, really bad. The $10 sandwiches looked good, but that's all I know about them. If I find myself in Phoenix airport again, who knows, maybe I'll be in the mood for a muffin and be in the same terminal. Maybe not.  Thanks for listening!
Super trendy  Great vibe Good service Just overall awesome And great ice cream   Has a nice front patio over the creek And the staff is super awesome
This restaurant was not a disappointment. We had an awesome waiter who was very attentive and the food we had was awesome! Make sure to start with the artichoke salad. Soooooo good!

So this place is pretty fabulous!  I've been here on several occasions; for both lunch and dinner.  The food is remarkable and I want to decorate my home like this restaurant!  From the wall of wine bottles to the rustic atmosphere, this place has all the decor eye candy you could ask for.    Lunch time here is so nice, especially when they have the wall of windows opened towards the canal and the patio.  I ordered some bruschetta and the Margherita flatbread.  To start, we were brought some bread with house pesto.  I need to have this recipe, it was amazingly flavorful.  The service here is impeccable as well, our glasses were never emptied and there was always someone nearby that would check on us throughout.  The food I ordered was so tasty and you could tell they use fresh ingredients.  Will of course back for more!  Dinner time was to celebrate a birthday.  Our reservation was for 930pm.  Once we arrived we were promptly seated and brought out water.  Once the rest of our party arrived, we were immediately taken care of and ordered our food.  The restaurant at this point was pretty busy, but they had the windows open so the sound just flowed right out and made the already spacious space feel that much bigger.  I ordered the Potato Gnocchi Pomodoro.  Oh. my. goodness.  This was so crazy good.  I love gnocchi and could eat it all day, and this just hit the spot.  So perfectly seasoned and cooked, definitely comfort food in my book!  Everyone loved what they ordered and had no complaints.  Overall, this place is amazing and you can't go wrong going here for any occasion or time of day.  **Love it!**

Visiting tourist.  The ambiance is really cute, service was a little bit slower but I think that's just common for Scottsdale. Good for large groups.   Highlight of my night was eating their house made pesto, I'm pretty sure I ate a jar's worth! LOL  Things I ate: Bread + pesto: 5 Lasagna: 3 Seabass: 4.5 Scallops: 3.5  Ambiance: 5 Service: 4 Food: 4 for Scottsdale

Always great service with smile, and great food.  This is much better service than Fox's "Training Restaurant" called the Henry.  Very satisfied every time we dine here.  The Hostess, and front desk area people were so nice, and with smiles, smiles, and more smiles....the way i't supposed to be at Fox concept eateries.  We were very dissatisfied with the Henry, and will probably not go there again.  Olive and Ivy is a model of great service, and food.

I stopped in at Olive & Ivy for breakfast and decided on the oatmeal, which was served with warm apples and cinammon, and brown sugar.  It would've been really good had the oatmeal not been gooey, as if it'd been stirred too much before boiling.  Service was excellent.  Contemporary decor.  Price was high for oatmeal, but to be expected at an airport, unfortunately.

Stopped here for a sandwich during my layover. I ordered the roast beef hot with everything on it. I waited a good 15 minutes for my sandwich that was already made when I ordered it and just had to be put on the panini press. By the time it got to me it was already cold. Pretty disappointing. Especially since I paid $10 for just the sandwich and NOTHING else. No sides, no drink. Not sure what happened but I'm thinking they just forgot about it/me because I was sitting at a table with my number waiting patiently. There were maybe two additional customers in line at this time.    Other than that the place itself is cute and the staff was friendly.

Chocolate chip cookies are delicious. White chocolates and milk chocolates!! Yumm Yumm. Get the little ones served in the brown bag...they're much softer than the big ones.  Adorable little fast casual stop to get a quick salad or sandwich before heading on your way wherever that could be within terminal 4. Probably one of the healthier choices in the area.  Pricey $$$ but you're in an airport...what can you expect.   At least the food is good and won't make you sick, because nothing is worse than sitting on a flight with stomach problems.

Customer service was great!!!!!  Friendly staff (wish I caught our cashiers name to mention it), the food came out really really fast, and the guy that dropped it off was really helpful and nice too.  The bread and pesto is complimentary in the restaurant and $2 to add to a deli item in the "market" half of this place...get it...it's delicious!!!!   We enjoyed our Greek gyro lamb sandwich very much, and added a $2 side salad which was simple and delicious.  We should had gotten two salads.  Highly recommended!

My first visit to Phoenix and this was the first place Danielle took me after getting off the plane!  What a great place!  Great wine room and the space was absolutely beautiful.  We took a seat at the large bar and started with a glass of tea, which was pretty good!  We ordered two flatbreads: the italian sausage and goat cheese and the mozzarella and basil.  Both came out rather quickly and both were pretty good!  Oh and one more thing. the fresh baked bread and pesto dip is worth the carbs and extra calories!  Service is very good and everyone was really friendly.  I'd definitely come here again!

So I just got back to LA from Scottsdale, was there for a friends bachelor party. And me being me, IM HUNGRY. So I checked this place out from the yelp reviews and moved our squad there. And, MY GAWDDDDDDD IT WAS AMAZING.   This place was so freaking good we came for both brunch and dinner. The bomb!!!  Ok dinner I ordered the scallops and bruschetta. Excellent. Brunch I split with others and got the breakfast burrito, cinnamon roll latte and cinnamon roll french toast, shortrib flatbread. My lorddddd  Best way I can relate this to people is if you've ever had republique in La, this is scottsdales republique. Which basically is an amazing compliment. A MUST GO. TOP 20 restaurant of my life
Pretty much every time I come here it's a wonderful, relaxing, and yummy experience! Very friendly customer service and they can accommodate specifics with no hassle. Definitely recommend!
4 stars based on the sangria alone.  Order this motherfucker by the PITCHER, without apology.  If you can sit out on the patio, so much the better. if not, grab a comfortable booth near the bar.

I would like to start out by saying that I haven't eaten a full meal here...Only a croissant and iced latte.  The croissant was good!  The latte on the other hand was by far, the best I've ever had.  If you want a change from Starbucks, definitely check them out!

My wife and I came to Scottsdale for April vacation/our "babymoon" and were given Olive and Ivy as a recommendation. It was all we wanted...Great food, great drinks and great staff. We came for lunch one afternoon and my wife decided it had to be our final dinner also. It was even better the second time around, made all the better by our server Jeremy. He was very attentive, gave great suggestions and was overall so pleasant we would come back here and ask to sit in his section. Definitely a must on a visit to Scottsdale.

Love this place! We went to Olive and Ivy for our anniversary. The waiter was very nice and pleasant! Food was delicious. After finishing our meals the waiter said since it's our anniversary desert is on the house. We got strawberry shortcake and it was absolutely delicious!! Had an awesome time!

First things first, how cool is that FRC (Fox Restaurant Concepts) has opened up a few spots at the airport? AZ locals....you know what I'm talking about. I enjoy lunch at Olive and Ivy in Old Town, so this was a super pleasant surprise! I went with the ready to go items. The Mediterranean salad, a banana, a small bag of pirates booty an a shot of espresso all for $15.00! Now that's an airport deal if I've ever seen one! The salad wasn't as satisfying as I hoped, the portion size was great, just not as filling. Ingredients are fresh and it's an AZ establishment! Terminal 4 is the place to be.

It's been two years since my last visit and now I've finally had dinner here. The outdoor seating is lovely especially on a fall night. The.mm menu remind the same but I ventured to entrees instead of my usually Mediterranean salad. I ordered the salmon with fingerling potatoes and subbed it for cauliflower. The dish was a-ok. I was really hungry so I ate it all but found the cauliflower to we on the dry side and the sauce was quite sweet. Overall a satisfactory dish. Our server was 5-stars all the way. I wish I could remember his name but he was on top it- he'd make Sam Fox proud.

Great spot for groups, all of my experiences included slow service so be mentally prepared.   The bread with the pesto dip is worth the calories! Great selection of wine and "good" pasta for Arizona.   Typical fox restaurant.
My friends and I went here for the first time. The food is good and the our server was nice.
Great ambiance. Food good but nothing to brag about for sure. Quality, service, decor all trendy and awesome.  They had a cool outdoor space that looked great for private events.

This place has some truly unique flavors in their dishes. First of all, I don't think I've ever had pesto this good. I'm not usually a big bread eater at dinner, but it was hard not to have a whole loaf just to eat the pesto. I also got the prosciutto bruschetta with a drizzle of honey which was heavenly. My husband isn't the most eclectic of eaters and he was head over heals for it. The salmon entree was perfectly cooked, but I will say that some of the other entrees at the table were a little small. My suggestion to avoid leaving still hungry is to make sure that you get an appetizer or two first if you are getting any of the meat entrees. We all had gelato to finish, I chose the honey flavor. Even though I was stuffed by this point I was glad I made room because it was the perfect finish to dinner.

Great food. Great service. The cute blonde cashier even got me limes from next door for my Modelo. Beer inside only. Chop salad was delicious and fresh 2 death even at 9pm on a Tuesday, in an airport. BEST AIRPORT SALAD EVER and I've had scores of airport salads.

Wow! One of the best meals we've had ever in our travels! Everyone in our group of 4 LOVED their meal.  We recommend bacon wrapped dates, the Tortellini, chicken scaloppine, bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and the butternut squash cannelloni.  All amazing flavor s and perfectly prepared. Table on patio overlooking waterfront with beautiful outdoor lighting. Impeccable service --- REALLY. Thank you Sarah for making or evening so special. Nice wine list by the glass.

Hands down one of the best breakfast and brunch places in Arizona. Every time I come into town I have to go to Olive and Ivy as I used to live in old town and would go here on the regular. Now the items you have to order if you are a first timer or even a regular during brunch:  A pitcher of sangria (red is better than white but you can get them mixed). The sangria here is delicious and I have gone through pitchers of it here so be careful you will get a buzz without tasting the alcohol.  THE Breakfast Sandwich: I call it THE breakfast sandwich because it is THE BEST breakfast sandwich you can get in Arizona. It is on a crispy croissant and has avocado, mayo, bacon, and egg. I don't know how they do it but it is delicious no matter how many times I order it.  Appetizer: The trufulga flatbread. It's a flat bread with mushrooms and I believe truffles, and it is tasty, also their margarita flat bread is good too and even the sausage one is delicious.  Mediterranean Salad: This salad was also delicious, and although not as good as an original chop salad it is still delicious.  Also if you don't get bread REQUEST it before your meal arrives, their bread is fresh baked and comes with pesto and is delicious to just munch on just don't fill up. You can also ask for balsamic vinegar and oil as well but the pesto sauce is tastier to dip your bread in.  Again this is for brunch and honestly I have never had anything that was bad at this place.. EVER and I came here at least once a week for 5 years at one point.

Nice atmosphere, great food.  This is a great place for everything. Date? Yes. Family dinner? Yes. Grab a bite with friends or a good drink? Yes.  All of their food is made fresh from scratch. Small menus are always a good sign.  You want top notch service- ask for Tommy. Pure professional.
Don't sit at the bar. This the second time I have sat at the bar and all the bartender wants to do flirt with the girls. I just want to order my dinner and I tip well. Very disappointing.

I've walked by this place countless times and finally made the time to stop in! Came for happy hour on a Friday afternoon and sat by the bar. Inside is nicely decorated, they also have outdoor seating but a storm was coming in so we didn't sit out there. On a nice day, you would get a lovely view of the canal! It's right on the waterfront. Hubby and I got some drinks and apps. The happy hour menu is decent. The apps we got were the lamb meatballs and then their bruschetta. The on meatballs was just a tiny serving and then the bruschetta was pretty good, but honestly not the best I've had. Our server was nice, but that's about it. We had to find her or just stop another server every time we needed something. It was an okay experience, but not 5 stars. I might be back for the Sangria!

We took some guests with us to have dinner on January 8 The service was excellent,ambiance very good and most importantly our food was very good The bone in ribeye was served on a bed of cream spinach,,,,excellent!!!! Will go back again

This is my go to place for dinner on Friday night. The live dj creates a fun and inviting atmosphere. You have to start with an order of the mozzarella bruschetta. Phenomenal. A few of my other favorite dishes are the Mediterranean salad and the sweet potato cannelloni. Both of these are great vegetarian options and are signatures at Olive and Ivy. Oh, and cannot forget about the Ivy and Ginger drink. Just order it- you will not regret it.

I decided to visit Olive and Ivy this past weekend, when the weather was nice.  We decided to sit in the patio, which I do highly recommend if you want especially before it starts getting chilly.  The service was lacking.  However, the restaurant is so cute.  We decided to start off with the bruschetta - prosciutto & fig, funghi, and manchego.  My favorite was the funghi, but I love mushrooms.  If you are not a muschroom fan, then I recommend the manchego.  That was good.  There wasn't alot of bruschetta - I think it was 3 slices each. I then ordered the goat cheese tortelli.  One Word - "YUMMMMMM!" It was so good.  I love goat cheese. - the goat cheese, sauce, and duck was a great combination.  I practically ate my whole meal.  If licking your bowl wasn't inappropriate, I definitely would of done it.   We finished with gelato at the gelato bar.  Pretty good too.    .

Recently had lunch with friends here and ordered a Margherita Flatbread, $12.  The flatbread is really a Pizza....I don't know why restaurants name Pizza different things, just call it what it is!  Anyway, the Pizza was very good.  It had a nice Garlicky kick to it and the Sauce was very light.....delish!  I had an Iced Tea to wash it down and it was very refreshing....I must have drank 5 or 6 glasses.  The service was great too, nice place to grab some lunch.  Return Factor - 90%

This is a very nice looking restaurant...but it is in Scottsdale so I expect nothing less in term of appearance and decor.  My friends and I dine outside on a nice day in May so we could still tolerate the weather despite flies hovering over our table because we had the smoked salmon and halibut.    I heard about Olive & Ivy so so I was expecting superb dishes but it could be what we ordered because it certainly did not meet my expectations.    Smoked Salmon flatbread- I highly reccommend the flatbreads because it is delicious!  You know what else is delicious? Their homemade bread with pesto dip!!!!   I can eat this ALL DAY!   Marinated Hanger Certified Angus Beef Steak- it was ok, nothing really special about this dish.  Alaskan Halibut - this dish did not stand out at all. Cavatelli Pasta- this was a disappointment, I ask the waiter for suggestion and this was what he suggested.  Maybe i'm not a Cavatelli fan, but it was like eating dough with minimal spiced ground pork.   Go ahead and try- see if you agree with me?   So go for the atmosphere, drinks, and bread! :)  I highly reccommend that!    If you dine outside- you can see a little canal running through- so it is river side like dining.  Boojie ;)

Malibu Rum Barbie has to alternate this place with the Sangria Slut. Somehow, she found out the White Sangria comes in a Tang-rimmed glass and that floozy loves to lick anything.   But again, I digress people. I have frequented O&I nearly three dozen times in the past couple years. Always enjoy myself as I usually go with a group of friends ready to drink.   Appetizers are delish. Hummus. Yummus. Flatbreads are tasty and you can still get the Pesto off menu. Just ask. They'll do it. Brunch is Fab!!! Unfortunately, my wallet takes a hit here. Their prices are a bit high but I'm sure it's the Waterfront rents that make them do it.

Visiting Arizona. A friend took us here for dinner. Ambiance very modern romantic, nice outdoor patio. Waiter was very friendly. I ordered the fig and ginger mule and wild mushroom pappardelle with added shrimp. Both of which were delicious! 9/10. Highly recommend, and I wish they had more locations outside Arizona!!!

Cool place but awful service, for me at least. I was there with my wife yesterday for our anniversary. We had an awesome table on the patio but our server (John) was sooo slow and disinterested it was insane. He walked by our table 5-6 times to go over chat with his two friends at a table next to us but he kept ignoring us. It took him almost 30 minuets just to bring me a soda...honestly he was kinda creepy too.  I typically don't like writing bad reviews but man this guy has no business of being a server at all.  The restaurant is cool and the food is pretty solid too. Reasonably priced too. But crappy service will turn me to go elsewhere next time.

Happy hour!! $3 bruschetta!! Delish~    Wasn't very busy for happy hour on Wednesday. This was my first time here. Love the decor and the bathroom is just medieval. Friendly staff and delicious food. Their bruschetta is awesome. Lots of variety to choose from.   Also got some gelato. So many yummy flavors and they didn't mind us sampling each and everyone of them. I ended up getting the white chocolate mint. OMG the mint punches you in the face, it's so good.  Would've love to come back for dinner.

Have to eat, right?  Lay over in Phoenix in terminal A, great breakfast sandwiches.  We shared a breakfast club and the breakfast sandwich- both were great but I think the breakfast sandwich ruled the day

5 stars for extremely passionate service and Chad.  We ordered takeout dinner for a family reunion of 12 on the Tuesday before Thanksgiving (we're not from the area).  We ordered a TON of dishes, mostly salads, appetizers and flatbreads for sharing.  One in our party has an allergy to garlic, so we requested that garlic dishes be flagged.     When we arrived, the kitchen was finishing up our order with  "Garlic" written on all applicable boxes.  In fact, just about every box.  Chad, who was running the kitchen, pointed this out and then suggested a risotto specialty that was garlic free.  While his staff whipped it up immediately (the restaurant was medium busy at the time), Chad went about retrieving breads and sauces to make our meal even more enjoyable, more stuff than we deserved.  He stayed with us until everything was complete and triple-checked.    The food was very good, though judging takeout -- without proper heat and presentation -- is hard.  But we will be back when we are in Scottsdale because Chad and the rest of his staff are true hosts and restauranteurs.

Walking into Olive & Ivy, I knew I was going to love it. The ambiance is trendy with high ceilings, unique fixturing, and a large patio.   The menu is gluten free friendly, with notations on the primary menu. To start we got the hummus with veggies. The hummus was not too creamy and not too oily. It came with cucumbers, tomatoes, and onions on top. We really enjoyed it.   For my dinner, I got the sea scallops with sweet polenta and Brussel sprouts. The scallops were perfectly cooked and the polenta was a sweet and flavorful addition. It was a pretty light and flavorful dish.   I would definitely come back if I'm in the area. The menu has many healthy options to try!

For some reason this place is my all time favorite restaurant right now. I go here for lunch every time i visit my sister in Scottsdale.  It is adorable inside and I love the little market so you can get the HUMMUS TO GO! I am obsessed with the hummus. It has tomatoes onians and feta on top, YUM! I also like the grilled artichokes, which are not what you'd expect, its more like a salad, but a delicious one at that. The drinks are always good and the service is always friendly and attentive. I also save room and stop in the market to get some yummy gelato afterwards, perfection i must say.
Quality, if overpriced food.  Nice decor.  Good service.

Really delicious dinner spot.  Trendy, so wear your outfit to be seen in Only one complaint, it was very loud!   RESERVATIONS: They do take them on Open Table. It's gets busy so make a reservation. We didn't have a reservation however they do have some lounge seating so we were able to sit there with full menu   OUTDOOR SEATING AND BAR: They have a nice large patio with misters There are some stools around around the bar. I couldn't tell if people were just drinking there or also eating   SERVICE:  Excellent service, food was timed perfectly and they even split the dishes on separate plates (a friend and I shared a salad and entree) without us having to ask   FOOD:  The portions were quite large, even the small plates section.  The trio of bruschetta is a great way to start the meal. The Mozzarella was a favorite of the group  The BEST part of the meal was the Sweet Potato Cannelloni. Very flavorful and well seasoned.   PARKING: There are spaces in the area and a parking garage

Excellent Service!  This is one of my go to places to meet friends for happy hour.  I have to say they did not disappoint when I took my cousin for her birthday.  The bartender was great.  She made sure we knew there was less than 30 left for happy hour, then again 5 mins prior, she made sure we had our drinks and food order by 6pm.  Great Atmosphere and great service.  We really appreciate the extra attention.

Even tho this is a fairly large restaurant - I would recommend making reservations. Also, if you want to sit on the patio you need to tell them when you make your reservations. We didn't know that, but wish we had known because the patio was so charming & delightful. The inside was quite noisy, but we did enjoy watching the chefs at work in the open kitchen. But it was our server that made our whole experience at the restaurant a wonderful evening. Nikki was the kind of person that is full of personality, wit and charm - someone you would love to have sit down and join you for dinner!! Efficient, knew the menu backwards & forwards and we loved all of her suggestions. The Chefs are amazing! Watching them work in the open kitchen was both fascinating and inspiring - and the food was fabulous! Everything is made in house and was delicious. There were several different kinds of Bruschetta and we enjoyed each of the three that we ordered. The beet salad was wonderful as was the Mediterranean salad. The flavors in the sweet potato cannelloni were both unique and wonderfully seasoned & delicious. The mushroom pasta was equally as good, and my husband throughly enjoyed his natural chicken & mashed potatoes. At the suggestion of our server we ordered the lemon pudding cake for dessert ......yes.... it was wonderful. We definitely will come back on our next trip!

Went today for our office holiday party.   Everyone was very happy with both the service and the food. Our server Alfred was very attentive and incredibly knowledgable about the menu, both food and cocktails.   We started with the bread and pesto, which is complementary and also ordered the hummus, charcuterie plate, and bacon wrapped dates.  Hummus was flavorful with garlic and lemon and diced cucumber on top.  Dates were wonderfully sweet and soft and wrapped in thick salty bacon with a red pepper remoulade. The chef's charcuterie plate had nice thick bread, goat cheese spread, several different meats and olives.  The pesto was alright, not as much flavor as I usually expect,  but fresh and bright.  Entrees were the lasagna with bolognase, chicken panini,  sweet potato canneloni and veal and spinach raviloi.  The pasta is made in house.   I didn't try everything,  but all our party was happy.   I can say the veal and spinach raviolI was amazing!   Fresh pasta, tiny chunks of tender veal and fresh spinach in a butter sauce and pesto oil to finish.   It was amazingly rich and delicious. Dessert was lemon pudding with salted butter gelato and a spongy chocolate cake with chocolate ganache "kisses" piped on the plate and a ginger gelato.  They make 20 flavors of gelato in house.   I usually dislike gelato because it has a lower butterfat content than ice cream,  but theirs was creamy, smooth and delicious. Overall,   our experience was wonderful!

Love this place, one of my favorites but I have noticed it isn't always consistent with the excellent taste.  over all the atmosphere is top notch!! sit on the patio if you can! great service always! recommend making reservations :)

Terminal 4 of the airport. Popular bit quick. Order and go and wait for the food to be brought to you. Only been here twice but had a great experience both times. Yummy vittles for my tummy -if you have time, check them out!

Went here thanks to the gift cards I got for xmas because costco was selling Fox Restaurants gift card packages.  I have been to one other Fox restaurant, the arrogant butcher and it was yummy.  Olive and Ivy was really great, the service was awesome and I honestly believe the food was the best I have ever had.  The bacon wrapped dates were so rich with flavor it defies description.  My shrimp risotto was awesome.  The 3 types of bruschetta we had were all great.  2 other people in my party had 2 of the different pastas and they were both amazing.    The signature cocktail I had was great although $12 is steep.  I would eat here every day if I could afford it.  It came out to about $45 per person with food and drinks and it was worth it.

My girlfriend and I were walking around Fashion Square and we decided to have dinner at Olive and Ivy. We were told there was about a 45 minute wait so we had a seat on the patio. After at least 45 minutes of waiting (and watching several patrons put their names on the list after us and get seated well before us) I went in and asked about how much longer until we could be seated, and was told about 15 minutes. 20 minutes later we were finally seated. I mean it was busy, but not that busy so needless to say we were a little frustrated. Now, all of that being said, dinner was amazing. I had the sea bass and my girlfriend had the ahi tuna. We thought both were outstanding. The service (once we got in) was great and our food came surprisingly quickly. I highly recommend this place, but you should definitely make a reservation.

Tiffany, our server, was FANTASTIC! She was very helpful in deciding what to order. She was so cheerful and positive. Her attitude and knowledge really made our experience just that much better. I love Olive & Ivy!!
Visited from Canada a few years ago, and still haven't found a restaurant I enjoy more than here. Superb food and ambience. Will be back sometime in the future.

I don't live in this area, but my brother and his girlfriend do. My parents had visited and they all came here for dinner. Ever since they raved highly of this place and made it a must try when we came to visit.  We called the day before to reserve a table. When we arrived we were immediately sat at our all ready table. Our server was nice throughout the dinner. We started with a mozzarella appetizer and the bacon wrapped dates. Both were so satisfying. We loved the bacon wrapped dates so much we ordered a second plate of them. We ordered a bottle of the Riesling Champagne which was very smooth. Easy to sip and offered so many taste elements.   I ordered the chicken scallopini. It was lightly breaded and cooked perfectly. The chicken laid on top of a bed of flavored spinach which complimented the chicken nicely. My girls both got the mac n cheese which was very cheesy and perfect for both my girls. My hubby ordered the sea scallops which is definitely out of his normal ordering. My dad raved about it so he got it and said it was the best scallops he has ever had. They were really good! They knew how to perfectly season and cook them.  Their complimentary bread was a hit as well!

This is a great place to come for Happy Hour!  The Manchego was a fun starter for me!  It was bread topped with fresh ingredients and a little on the sweet side.  The best thing here to me are their flat breads.  I've had the Prosciutto Crudo (potatoes), Margherita, and the Piccante (sausage and salami).  If I had to pick a favorite, I would go with the piccante as the best only since it had a lot of kick to it, and I don't want to go with the boring route.  The service is good and the view of the water is nice.  This place has a nice vibe and I would definitely go back!
Be prepared for a low key but high level feast.
From making the reservation to our server and our wonderful food and beautiful patio. Everything was perfect will be back.
I love their outside seating! plenty of shady areas. I love the hummus! great vibe, perfect for date night. and unlike other places nearby, not overly expensive.
Business lunch early December 2016.  Very good.  Table was a little cramped for our group of 8 but we managed just fine.  Recommend.
A great meal of sea scallops and wine. The service was even better.  A table of 4 enjoyed the venue and food.    Desert was along good, mine some gelato, others trees leches...

"Old World meets new at Olive & Ivy Restaurant & Marketplace, which blends the flavors and timeless elegance of the Mediterranean with contemporary California chic. Olive & Ivy brings a slice of a bustling Mediterranean neighborhood market to the Scottsdale Waterfront." - Fox Restaurant Concepts.  A great location for a romantic dinner, swilling late night with your friends, or stopping in for some gelatto.  What makes this restaurant unique is the marketplace where one can order fresh baked breads, purchase wine, or delight in their gelatto.  In the dining room await an array of contemporary mediterranean dishes.  I will come here again and again for three things: the Parmesan truffle fries ($5) the red sangria ($7 for a nearly orgasmic bevy of tempranillo, cassis, blackberry, raspberry, and strawberry) and patio seating.  As with virtually 90% of Scottsdale establishments, there is ambiance, beautiful people, groovy downtempo beats, and a great view of the canal  (lol) on the outside patio.  The rack of lamb with beech mushrooms, fava beans, and piquillo pepper marmelade is one of my favorite dishes here.   It is quite succulent, and has a wonderful smoky grilled taste.  The free range chicken with wild mushrooms, English peas, and citrus jus is also another delectable dish. Though these ingredients are so simple, I smiled inwardly as suddenly I was transported back to my grandmothers kitchen. Ahhh! Food nostalgia, it's why I eat.  Cons: No happy hour  Prices are the usual for a moderate upscale restaurant in Scottsdale.   Appetizers: $6-$12 Entrees: $17-36 Salads: $8-$10

The ambiance is great!  They have a lovely patio with a bit of a retro feel.  Their happy hour menu is plentiful so keep the food and drinks coming!  If you like brussel sprouts, you can't go wrong with the brussel bruschetta.
Food is ok . It has nice patio and decor, friendly stuff. I do not understand  why it's so busy all the time......

This was one of my best dining experiences in Scottsdale .It is in a great location  directly across the street from Fashion Square and on the Scottsdale Canal  which is a wonderful place to walk after dinner .The service was very good , we were seated almost immediately as we had a reservation . The server explained that everything is made in house .I was with my wife and 27 yr. old son .My wife had salmon cooked exactly how she wanted it , both my son and I had a pasta dish and a appy . The deserts were all $5 and I had Neapolitan ice cream cake which was one of my favourite desert I have ever had . . All in all an eatery you should definitely pencil in on your next trip to the Valley of the sun
Came all the way from south Phoenix to eat here for my birthday and there was a sign out front that the whole place was closed for a private event. Not on their website. Uncool

It was my first time visiting Scottsdale area. I was very excited to find Olive & Ivy for Sunday Brunch. I saw excellent reviews and beautiful photos on Yelp and decided to check it out. This place is huge!!! It has multiple sections, outdoor shaded patio, full bar with TVs, event rooms, dinning area, and open kitchen. It's modernly designed and decorated. Initially I was worried about not having the reservation and might have to wait for a seat. Nope! We were able to be seated right the way. Their brunch menu is pretty simple. Few items on traditional breakfast and few items for sandwiches and flatbread. They also have a desert and coffee section so they offer full espresso bar items. I decided to go with plain orange juice for a hot day and my friend had latte. Excellent start for our brunch. They served complimentary bread, which was okay. I had their LAMB GYRO, which is a wrapped in a large pita bread with tomatoes, lettuce. It was wonderful!! It looks plain at the first sight but don't let it fool you. The flavors are excellent! The lamb gyro was well reasoned, juice, just perfect for the wrap. I had a side salad to balance the dish. It was really good. I loved the vibe of this restaurant. It's beautiful, it's casual, it's serving good food.

This is my favorite place to eat in Scottsdale whenever I go to Fashion Square. I think it is way better than eating in the food court inside the mall. It's a fun and great atmosphere to have lunch or even dinner and to go for drinks.  I really enjoy the Fox restaurants.

I got the turkey bacon and avocado sandwich. It was good not great. Great to eat because your at the airport. They have a television and a nice  area to sit while you charge your electronic devices. Prices are OK its basically salads sandwiches pizza. They also have some alcohol selections.

Olive and Ivy has a beautiful location in downtown Scottsdale right on the waterfront. The salad I had there was nothing special, but it was good, and the fun atmosphere made it worth it. If you're looking for a place near old town Scottsdale that's not too busy, I would say this is a safe bet.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!!!  Every time I go to Scottsdale I have to go to this place, I'm obsessed. I with they had a location in San Diego where I live.  To start, the location itself is beautiful, upscale, and very cool. I enjoy people watching here too. They have a gorgeous outdoor area to eat as well. The service is always wonderful, attentive, and explain the dishes very well.   The food. They start you off with Pesto and bread. Probably the best pesto I have had in my life, including my time in Italy. I secretly go here the pesto alone. This past visit, I tried the salmon caesar salad which was delicious. The salmon was cooked medium and was very tender and light. The salad itself was quite good as well. My friend ordered the burger which looked heavenly.  Looking forward to my next visit here!!

This place is wonderful. Great service. Very nice staff. Food was great. Highly recommend the filet and also the lamb meatballs as well.  Only thing is considering this place has a whole room just for wine the fact that they don't carry a single moscato was disappointing.

Traveling through PHX is always a terrible experience, as you have to hoof it the 3 miles from one terminal to the other, but at least the food is good, right? Not so much.  The "traditional breakfast" at Olive & Ivy was one of the worst breakfasts I've ever had, airport or otherwise. The bacon was so greasy that it was literally coated in a thick layer of slime. The eggs were even greasy! Seriously, how do you manage to make scrambled eggs oily & gross? The potatoes were cooked to the point of being on the verge of burnt.  The one saving grace was an English muffin, which was warmed, though not toasted. It's not like they can take credit for "making" that, though...  The extra star is for the employees, who were nice.  I wouldn't recommend this place for breakfast to anyone...

I was immediately impressed with how stylish Olive and Ivy was, and then shortly thereafter completely let down by the food.   I was in a large group that had convened for lunch there, and the consensus was a resounding "Bleh." I ordered some raviolis that weren't bad to the taste, but three or four average sized raviolis aren't gonna do much for a brother who wants to leave somewhere not hungry anymore.   As soon as we left I was already looking for a second lunch spot. I have a big appetite, in fairness, but if you're paying eight or nine or ten bucks for a plate, it shouldn't feel like "pre-eating."

Delicious!!! This place had excellent customer service with every employee we walked by either smiling or saying hello, a great ambience & terrific food. I had the lamb gyro and my husband had the chicken panini, both were tasty. The pesto was to die for!!! Very affordable, we will definitely be back!!

Amazing food and ambiance in Downtown Scottsdale!  This restaurant is a little oasis where you can enjoy the outdoors without feeling like the heat is draining the life from you (I'm not local to this place If you can't tell).  Being from Denver where we've admittedly become spoiled with a great restaurant scene, I found this place to meet and exceed my high expectations.  The bruschetta are all amazing (def try the prosciutto) and the drinks were spot-in with generous pours and unique options.  Bacon wrapped dates are not to be missed as a starter as well.  Go ahead, sit on the patio and enjoy the umbrella of shade provided by the trees while listening to the fountains.  It's like free therapy while you eat good food!  Enjoy!
Food was tasty. Not amazing but was a good dinner. Didn't like their Merlot or Cabernet selection for the glass but I enjoyed the dinner.

Sugar rush!  Went back for the breakfast items (pastries to be specific).  I ordered two cinnamon roll "centers."  I'm not sure why they call the rolls centers, but I do know that they are really big and really good and really gooey.  If you want your morning sugar rush, get one...or two.  I also got a raisin croissant.  It's called something fancier, but I have no idea what.  It is $3, but the thing is the size of two regular croissants.  It didn't have quite as much raisins as I would have liked, but it was flaky, buttery, and had a nice sugary glaze on top.    FRC, you all need to open a joint or two in Vegas!

I had the most delicious turkey panini with avocado! They use quality ingredients and their food tastes so fresh! I so got their fresh baked cookies that only have like 5 ingredients!!! I love wholesome unrefined foods and this restaurant is a great place for real food! I hope to see one around where I love soon!

We stopped in here for a nice lunch after viewing the art installation along the canal.  They are a larger place catering to an affluent crowd and serve what they described as California Mediterranean cuisine.  The lunch menu featured sandwiches, flat breads, salads and bruschettas and almost every table seemed to be enjoying a glass of wine with lunch.  The dress code seemed a bit fancy and I did feel a bit under dressed in my jeans but it didn't seem to affect our service.  We opted for the chicken chopped salad and got the half size at the recommendation of our fine server, which was still plenty big for lunch.  We also shared a cup (really a small bowl) of the daily soup special, beer cheese-thin but good.  Fresh focaccia and pesto also come with your meal and, we decided to join the crowd and have some wine too.  Service was attentive with water glasses kept full and the salads arrived without delay.  This place seems well run.  Hopefully on a future visit it would be warm enough to sit outside on their large shady patio.  Recommended

Olive & Ivy has quickly become one of my favorites! The patio is gorgeous and has a beautiful garden patio feel. The servers are friendly and attentive. The food, drinks and desserts are on point. The Chopped Chicken salad is my favorite if you enjoy salad and the  Prosciutto Mascarpone Tortelli is to die. The Lemon Tres Leches Cake is perfection and the Tangerine  Cheesecake is a real treat! Make sure to try the Red Sangria, it's perfect on any day.

Came here for brunch, we made a reservation for noon and got seated right away! Definitely make a reservation, there weren't any seats left on the patio and the inside was starting to fill up. Love the ambiance, it is so open and the patio garden look fantastic! The sangria is super refreshing and tastes amazing, I tried the red one yummy! They make all their bread in house so it's always fresh, you get a complimentary plate of bread with their signature pesto sauce and we scraped that thing dry. I love pesto though :) I ordered the mediterranean salad and added chicken ($14.50) it was very fresh and they put in just the right amount of dressing. Now for the not so good plate.... the Ivy Sausage Sandwich ($11) It looked and tasted like McDonalds sausage sandwich, super oily but what do you expect when it's sausage. I was expecting something a little more tasteful and classy for the price of the sandwich. Even the eggs looked like McD's eggs and it was under flavored, very disappointed with that dish. But overall, it was still a great experience, our server was knowledgeable and really nice.

I've gone to Olive & Ivy a couple of times and I love everything about it. The atmosphere, the friendliness of the waiters, and the food make the entire restaurant wonderful. It's not the best food I've ever had, but it is good and everything else combined just really make me like this restaurant.   The lamb gyro is really good for lunch. It was not too heavy and the lamb flavor wasn't too overpowering. Their flatbreads are also really good, I think we got the Mediterranean one and, honestly, anything with olives automatically boosts my liking for the dish.  It's a great place to just sit and talk and have a glass of wine with your food. Whether you sit inside or outside, it's beautiful.  Also, don't miss out on the gelato! I get it every time. I am completely addicted, but I also have a huge sweet tooth. Every flavor is delicious and they are really nice even when I ask for a ton of samples because I can't make up my mind. :)
