Great patio, cool decor but for a Fox concept I was disappointed in the service.  I have been to almost all the other concepts Fox owns and brag to my Chicago friends how great they are but we didn't make it past drinks and went for dinner at another place.  The service was just bad. It was not just our server (so it wasn't like 1 person was having a bad day) we had 3 people that were boarding rude to us in a half an hour on a Monday at 5:30p when they were not busy. I'd go back for the $5 wine at happy hour but not waisting my money on dinner.
Their bruschetta is to die for and I had this Italian dish that had cheese and sweet potatoe inside that I can't remember the name of but it was seriously so good!

Where do I start? Our waiter's name was Timothy. Had to of been one of the best, most professional waiters I have ever seen. Great guy, very knowledgable and helps you chose, without any negative opinion. I highly recommend when you go here, you specifically ask to have this guy wait on you. Next, the atmosphere. What a great place! Very romantic. As my wife(laura) stated below, we fell back in love and just focused on ourselves and not anything else around us. Glad I made reservations, because it seemed dead when we first got there (6pm) and filled up shortly after we sat down. The wife and I both commented on how cool the bathrooms were. You don't see that every day,lol. Every time we left our table, any worker walking by, would re-fold our napkin. That was really nice, and we loved it. Onto the food. We ordered the Bruschetta Trio as the appetizer. WOW, what a great start out. Very good. We really got full off this so we ordered a salad and Chicken Scallopini. They split both for us, which was very nice of them. Salad was very fresh and good. I highly recommend the chicken meal we had. Very very good and seats well with your stomach and a glass of wine. We ordered a bottle of Ramon_B wich was $40. It was a limited bottle, but worth every penny for the meal and atmosphere. Then we ordered the peanut butter Ice-cream bar for dessert. The marshmellow did not taste good. Seemed still frozen, but was still too much and just didn't go with the whole dessert. We told Tim about it and he said he would pass it on. The best bonus of this was when we came in, we told Tim we were Yelpers and were looking up what to get. Tim remembered this, told the manager, and gave us our Dessert for FREE, without even mentioning it to us. Guys, if you want to wooo your wife, and have one of the best romantic nights, even for just visiting one night, this is the place!! Great job Tim and Olive & Ivy!!
Holy smokes is that free focaccia bread delicious. Great food, great location, great space. What's not to love?
I've been here a couple times and it's always on point. The wife had the pork tenderloin, I had the tuna. Both were fantastic.
Had a bigger breakfast and not just a sandwich after the redetermination back from Hawaii.  Great replenishing spot in the airport.

Very gorgeous restaurant with amazing atmosphere--it's really large and yet not too noisy when its full of people. Really nice surrounding area filled with restaurants. The cafe section of the restaurant opens earlier and yet I cannot find the exact time online.   The brunch menu was a little uninspiring and pretty limited compared to their regular menu? Pretty regular items, and from the photos on Yelp, sadly they don't match the beautiful decor either :( Despite of this, the food was fine. The potatoes that came with scrambles were the best! I also love the complimentary bread, which went really well with the pesto!  Otherwise, I would come at a non-brunch time, or just ordered from the cafe with pastries...

this is the place to go! the inside of this place, the outside, the bathrooms, just amazing. this is where you go on a first date (which was happening next to us btw), this is the place to wowster someone! my husband didn't need to wow me and I picked this place but whatever lol.   the bread served here with that pesto stuff is just omg. I'd have to say it was my favorite thing we ate on the whole trip. I literally couldn't stop eating it, or talking about it. the pizza was great, so was the fried calamari/shrimp etc that we had.
Awesome ambience and amazing food. The staff is all kind and accommodating. Will definitely go back!
This place is so amazing, took my dad for Father's Day, and needless to say It was a great Father's Day

Can you say celebrity hot-spot? This is Scottsdale not LA so our "celebrity's are mostly ball players.    When I was young and single (boo hoo) I remember seeing Charles Barkley, Mark West, Kevin Johnson "KJ" and other Phoenix Suns basketball players out and about-everywhere, waaay before Olive and Ivy.   However, looks like ballplayers have found a new place. Last time I was here I saw Dan Majerle-and I heard a European soccer team was here...single ladies?!    The restaurant is dimly lit and modern but elegant and romantic.  Since this is Scottsdale, you could wear jeans and some high heels or shorts and sandals. I've seen men in here with Hawaiian shirts or golf shirts and shorts. Later in the evening I've seen the high heels and tight mini skirts and men with some dinner jackets so it depends on the time of day.  I've been here a few times and if you come for an early dinner you'll see family's.  In the evening, the bar has some standing room around it and on the weekends it can be standing room only.  I've been here a few times and it's hit or miss depending on what's going on in town (convention, golf tournament, etc.)  Dinner is on mark, since my review is a bit overdue, I can't elaborate but I remember thinking it was fabulous! It is a "Italian" restaurant but not the typical menu-more Mediterranean.  A huge outdoor patio is wonderful too.  I saw a few smokers out there so during dinner you could walk out for a smokey.    Drinks were a hit too, I had champagne-so you could plan for a Kir Royal and nice appetizer at the bar or stay for dinner.  A live DJ playing some great tunes has been here on the weekends when I was here.   Located next to Scottsdale Fashion Square across from Nordstroms. Don't miss it!
Good service, no wait. Food was good. Love the ambiance and the patio is inciting and cozy. Great place for a brunch and glass of wine.

Always love the food here. The server today was friendly and accommodating with our toddler. Try the salmon or sea bass. Just watch out for the construction of the courtyard. It might be noisy and no view. Manager didn't apologize and instead acted like it wasn't a big deal upon arrival. Sometimes a little empathy helps. Overall it wasn't bad since the food was amazing! Just heads up if you're planning an occasion before September.

The service is amazing here. The staff is friendly and genuine. I often pop in to grab a pastry or croissant to go. It's easy and always fresh and delicious. It's reasonable as well...under 5 bucks and I'm satisfied.

I ordered a slice of pizza they call "the Butcher". It's a deep dish style pizza with pepperoni, sausage and bacon- delicious. The bread was super soft and it had a lot of meat and cheese. The place is small but spacious. You don't have to worry about bumping your carry-on with the chairs and tables, or with other guests. They have space where you can charge your electronic devices, which is the main reason why I decided to stop by in the first place. What I liked the most about this place was that the manager walks around asking people how their food is. He also helps clean up, which I thought shows a lot. Great customer service! Next time I stop at PHX I will definitely stop at Olive & Ivy again.

30 minutes til my flight leaves.  I'm returning from a vacation filled with throwing down fat, sugar, and the worst kind of calories.  Thank you Olive & Ivy for providing me a quick and healthy option.  I got a basic salad, but opted to pay $2 to add grilled chicken.    The line went quickly, so I was able to sit down at a table and inhale my salad.  Protein, greens, I didn't feel as sick at myself as I was previously.  Far from great food, but I was satisfied.  More importantly, my body was happier with me for the time being.  At just about $9, It did not pack too much of a punch to my wallet either, for airport food pricing.  Meh, pretty standard.  The sandwiches looked decent, but a little thin on the meats.  So I'm glad I went with the salad and added the chicken - maybe about 6 oz worth.  I was able to plug in my phone charger here and get a little more juice before jumping on the plane too.
Very trendy place. Interesting combination of flavors and textures. They have private rooms for parties or larger groups. Knowledgeable wine suggestions. Service was great.
Amazing!!! Service, atmosphere, food, all was wonderful. Probably one of the best meals I've had in the past month.

Very good food, small portions for entrees. I went yesterday along with 3 friends at 7:30pm and put our name down for a table (yes there was a wait on a Tuesday, good sign huh? lol) after about 15/20 minutes we were seated and immediately asked for our drink orders (prompt!) Now I really love the service and the ambience (& my Mediterranean salad!) but this place can only receive 3 stars from me. The chef that night had a bit of a heavy hand when it came to the salt because my friend commented on how salty the bread was and then when I received my entree (veal and spinach ravioli) I was taken aback by how salty and small the portion was. Luckily we ordered lamb meatballs as a small plate and I had a half salad during the meal or else I would have left unsatisfied by the cost related to portion size. But I MUST marvel about the Mediterranean salad, it's been a while since I've had a really good fresh salad and Olive & Ivy's Mediterranean salad + shrimp did the job for me but everything else I ate (meatballs and ravioli) plus my red wine sangria were just like my review states, a 2.5/3. I won't write them off completely though, I'm going to say that was just a freak one time incident (so I can go back and get my salad!) haha

Recently had both dinner and Sunday brunch there.  The bread & pesto is soft, salty and delicious and while I had the lasagna which wasn't anything to write home about, the risotto was to.die.for  Sunday brunch we sat at the bar and were served by Nick the bartender. The bloody Mary's are made with fresh vegetable juice and lots of horseradish. Not for the faint of heart but clearly a popular beverage there.  My dining companions and I all had the gyro for lunch which was quite tasty.  Looking forward to dining there again next time I'm in town.

In love.  Olive and Ivy is a fantastic little place tucked in the waterfront at Scottsdale. They have two sides to choose from, the take out side where it's more of a bistro style, offering sandwiches and salads for a quick meal...and then the elegantly decorated dine in side that has TONS of outdoor seating. This place is gorgeous.  The bar is a great place for happy hour after work or to meet up with friends before a night out...and the restaurant itself offers AMAZING table side mimosas and brunch on the weekends. Delish. Absolutely delish.  If you haven't been here, get here quickly and enjoy every bite and minute of your visit.

I popped into this spot with a small group of people for their "after dinner hours" bar set-up.  The interior is very chic and they open up the side doors so that you can enjoy the amazing weather both from the inside or the outdoor patio.  I can imagine the dining experience is wonderful but I have yet to return because the chaos surrounding the bar did turn me off.  It took us about 30 minutes to even got close enough to the bar to start a drink order.  Granted, it was a weekend but with an establishment this large they need more servers (maybe some called in sick that night).   The next thing that turned me off was the overabundance of the pretentious patrons.  I am told that  Britney Spears has dined here in the past.  I guess I was supposed to be impressed by that but all it did was make me wanna throw up a little in my mouth.    I should actually come here for a meal once and see how I like it .  Maybe the bar thing just isn't my scene.  However, I do give them kudos for the outdoor seating area.
Two stars for atmosphere only. Food is truly subpar. Lots of breaded crap. Save your money and hit up The Olive Garden.

Olive and Ivy never disappoints.  The outdoor patio is the perfect meeting point for girlfriends or that special someone.  The Happy Hour with the bruchetta ( I recommend the one with fig) is always good and the people watching provides built in entertainment.  They are serious about their food here and I would recommend the brunch as well as dinner.  Definitely a "go to" spot.

Truly a  memorable meal! Chicken flat bread, Mediterranean salad, salmon roasted potato and beet molasses glazed and the show stopper, peanut butter mouse enveloped in a chocolate shell. Even the iced tea was nuanced. We sat on the patio under shade trees overlooking the canal and were served by a congenial attentive waiter, Edward Chugerman. A lovely experience all around!

One of my favorite brunch places in old town Scottsdale. The mimosas are perfect -- almost all champagne with a splash of OJ (just the way I like it). They also give you complimentary focaccia & pesto -- so good! My personal favorite brunch items are the Mediterranean salad w/ chicken ; the Gyro ; and the breakfast sandwich.   Side note: I only come here for brunch because once I came for dinner & was pretty disappointed.. got the sea bass (~$25) & it was not very good. instead of a whole piece of fish it was like little spears of it with very little flavor :/ if I did come for dinner again I would probably stick with a salad or flatbread.

I'm a fan, but doesn't mean I will be back anytime soon. I better not.  This place could be dangerous for my health.   Olive and Ivy is located in Phoenix' Sky Harbor Airport.  Most airport restaurants lack quality, taste, portions, and good prices.  The menu here consist of Italian food mainly pizza's and sandwiches.  Here's what makes me a fan, the prices are pretty good and the portions are fairly big.  This place gets busy and because everything is cooked to order, there's usually a line of impatient people catching a flight.   As for the food, I ended up getting their pepperoni and sausage pizza.  This was so good, thick deep dish, and very tasty.  Probably one of the better fast food type pizzas I have had in a very long time.  Pepperoni and Sausage:   http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/olive-and-ivy-marketplace-phoenix?select=UQi6AYXvTrxBFRBG0Axt3w#UQi6AYXvTrxBFRBG0Axt3w
Great food, excellent service, reasonable prices, convenient parking. Don't forget a scoop of gelato for dessert.

I can't rave enough about Olive & Ivy. At the recommendation from my broker, my mother and I went out to celebrate my move to Scottsdale. We walked up and were in awe of the high ceilings, the open floor plan, marketplace area, and really modern decor. We had made a reservation and headed out to the patio. The patio is sectioned off in to two sections: one as more of a lounge with big chairs and couches, while the other is more dining-appropriate. As we were seated the overhead lightbulb strands lit up along the waterfront, I was in absolute heaven. If I had been nervous about my move, this little setting put me completely at ease.       Our waiter (which I shall call the Lord of all Waiters) came to bring us water and ask if we wanted anything to drink, we had both decided on Sangria, and he encouraged us to get a pitcher--I always enjoy an enabler. While he brought back our pitcher and delicious, but not Too sweet Sangria, we ordered the Artichoke heart appetizer. He even had this split for us so we didn't have to portion the starter ourselves. The hand grated Parmesan, Artichoke hearts and arugula were outstanding. Both my mother and I had already started commenting on the greatness of the flavor combinations.        The Lord of Waiters stopped by frequently, asking about my trip, checking on our waters, refilling our Sangria as it got low, talking about Downtown Scottsdale....he really knew how to make us feel special. He then brought us house-made pesto and bread; I could've eaten the pesto as a meal in and of itself it was so fresh.         Finally, our entrees came out. My mother got the Sweet Potato Cannelloni while I opted to try the Sea Bass. As I ate my snow peas, sea bass and grapefruit combo in absolute contentment, I caught myself humming along to The Notorious B.I.G. this is when the greatest waiter of all time told us they have a DJ every night that spins great mixes (which I can attest to, I was constantly saying "I love this song!")      To top off our extravagant meal, we had a scoop of Vanilla Bean gelato to split. The Vanilla Bean was upfront, not overpowering but just right. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect meal (or waiter). I can't wait to start getting visitors so I can take them here and show this place off!

I really love this place. Great flatbreads, awesome happy hour. Go for brunch and get their delicious spicy bloody mary.  I've been here more than I've actually checked in via Yelp. Service has always been top notch and the food is consistently good. Did I say they have good flatbreads? They're awesome. Large portions, so don't order too much or you'll be going home with lots of leftovers.  Hummus is good, and oh I forgot to mention the baked items. Fresh breads and the cinnamon rolls are TO DIE FOR. Get there early and get them warmed up. The rolls go pretty fast so don't be surprised if they sell out.  This place is a little hard to find, but definitely worth looking for.

I first came to Olive and Ivy back in 2006. I have come back consistently several times every year, and it never fails to impress. Great service, cool vibe, superb food, and a beautiful setting. Such a good place to go and one of the best restaurants in Scottsdale. Keep doing what you are doing and you will always have my custom! Thanks team.

Great ambiance, great food and great service, loved it and will come back soon.  Thank you for a delicious FREE desert ( double bake chocolate cake) it was perfect they way I like it ( not to sweet).  I loved the bread and the pesto spread, yum!  The veal ravioli was excellent, but a bit to salty for my taste. The beet salad was perfect, the lasagna was excellent and the red sangria was good but not great.

Found out the DJ there on Saturdays spins trip hop! RJD2, Pretty Lights, Bonobo, Kill Paris, Layo & Bushwacka and so much more. If you don't know what I'm talking about, go check it out. You will kick yourself for not knowing about this genre of music earlier.
Salads, sandwiches and soups even.  This isn't mind blowing but darn good.  Wish I could add more but honestly I see this as a staple, noting special or out of ordinary in any other way.

This is one of our favorite restaurant in Scottsdale. Everytime we went here, we had a awesome time. Their food is one of the top class. I only had one bad service when our server disappeared for a while. Considering we visit here more than 20times, it is just small mistake. It is well over-priced but the quality is excellent. The indoor and outdoor seats r also very great. They even have small room that accomodate 20 plus people. If u want to try many things out, come after 5pm so that u can enjoy many delicious main dishes. Personally, i love their steak. Will be back soon.

A great place to celebrate my birthday! Great food snd s fun drink menu.  If you want to be on their hugh patio be sure to make that known when you make reservations.  Inside was nice but the DJ makes sure you can't hear anything!  Very loud. Food great.  Loved the wild mushroom pappardelle and the lasagna was flavorful. Stu took good care of us.  If you're a lemon lover try the lemon pudding cake with burnt honey gelato.  It was worth the 30 min. Drive.

This place has great customer service. They have delicious cactus tea and iced americanos. Their parfait are so yummy too but I do wish they made them a bit smaller. Their food was delicious. The side potatoes are very soft with enough crisp to them. Breakfast burrito was a bit too much for me, but it was still tasty.

Food is OK, but it has a distinct chain restaurant feel that you might expect from a Fox restaurant, which has about 50 location in Arizona and a few other Western states. The service was good, and the food wasn't bad, but if you don't want to feel like you're at a Cheesecake Factory, I wouldn't recommend it.
The atmosphere here is fabulous, but the food can be hit or miss! I had my graduation party here and the food was just ok. However, I've eaten here before and the food was very good!

Great place and friendly service made for a great anniversary dinner. Zach was phenomenal and very professional and the food tasted incredible. I also enjoyed the casual atmosphere as well as how the place was lit. I'm not a fan of bright rooms. Awesome experience overall. Kudos!

Beautiful ambiance, wonderful service, decent wine list, and flavorful dishes.  The salmon and mashed potatoes are to die for!  There sangria is also very good... this is one of the few places I have found that doesn't over-sugar or water down the drink. Solid choice for a romantic date or to catch up with friends.   Our favorite waiter remembers to bring out separate dishes for the pesto dip (delish!).  It really is the little things that make a place stand out!  Only downside is the drink orders can take +10 minutes.  If you are in a hurry don't eat here.  Live a little, relax, and enjoy the meal.  It is worth the wait!

Stopped into Olive and Ivy for the first time yesterday and one of the first things I said to my boyfriend was "why haven't we been here before?"  Since we were there early, we decided to sit in the bar section of the patio and order off the happy hour menu. The food menu consists of a few different bruschettas, flatbreads and a couple other small bites.   We chose two bruschettas, bacon wrapped dates and a flatbread pizza with sausage. Everything was really tasty.  The pizza was the perfect size for two people to share. And the dates, stuffed with sausage, were fantastic! I highly recommend those! All in all it made for a great light(ish) dinner.  Everything from the atmosphere to the food to the service was great. The only weird thing was that they have an air freshener on the tree we were sitting under that squirts out air freshener at times. My boyfriend got sprayed quite heavily at one point - yuck! But regardless, we will be back!

This place kinda surprised me.  Took my daughter last night Sunday for her 25thbday dinner. party of 15. The waiter was not on the ball at all   first off he dropped a beer on my back/chair and purse. We had to ask twice to start w bread and pesto. We had to refill our own water glasses. And to top all off charged me for her bday cookie & ice-cream. (not slice of cake)  I was expecting some compensation or free dessert or even a gesture from the manager.  Not so much.
Such a fun place for a date night or out with the girlfriends! The food is good and the atmosphere is fun. I love Olive and Ivy! Trendy and a little pricy but a fun night out.
Went here for my bday dinner bc I had some ppl in town. Service is horrible. Food was good. If the service was better the food wouldn't have been a big deal ! Has a cute look/vibe though!

I came here for restaurant week. I paid less than 50 bucks for an appetizer, main course, dessert and a glass of chardonnay. That's such a good deal.   As far as the food goes, it was very fresh. I ordered a Mediterranean salad with a serving of chicken. The chicken did not come with the restaurant week deal. However, it was just a small extra charge on my bill. It's worth it. The chicken on the salad was so tender.  For my main course I ordered the salmon. It was so tender and so juicy. I got my salmon medium. As far as dessert, I ordered their peanut butter mousse. It was like eating a peanut butter cup! Yum!   I'm addition, I ordered the beet salad. I liked the beet salad way better than their Mediterranean salad. The beet was so fresh and so juicy. The arugula was peppery and crisp. The dressing was creamy and sweet.  I recommend this restaurant! It serves great food with great service!

Met a business associate here for happy hour.  Although the place was busy, our server was very attentive and nice.  The appetizers we sampled were quite tasty and the wine smooth and silky.  Enjoyed sitting out on the patio on a beautiful Arizona afternoon
I love the atmosphere but the food is so so. Drinks are good tho! If you can get a spot on to patio it's so worth it. Bruschetta is my fav food and their pesto bread dip!

Looking for a perfect spot in old town for great atmosphere, good service and a hip menu. This is it! We always try to sit on the water side patio. Just a favorite spot for any occasion. We have had company dinners, family brunch, late nite hot cocoa. Love this place!

Olive & Ivy EQUALS utter bliss.   Highlights for Erin on Saturday evening:  1. Door immediately held open for me and a nice, warm welcome 2. Immediate seating (sans servervations) at Chef's Table - which held my attention quite nicely w/my adult onset ADD 3. Pleasant server who sincerely looked like she loved her job 4. Frequent check-ins without being a pestering fly 5. GREAT food (I had the chopped salad w/chicken) and smooth champs served in a gorgeous flute 6. Fab ppl watching 7. Packed restaurant, but acoustics worked well as I could still maintain a good volley of conversation w/my friend.
My favorite place for any meal! I always take anyone who comes in town to this place. Love breakfast, brunch, lunch AND dinner here.

I was not all that impressed with dinner.  For me it's a more enjoyable spot for happy hour, drinks & a few appetizers.  The White Peach & Hibiscus margarita is absolutely delicious.  Go during happy hour, get 50% off, then you won't feel like it was such a waste/rip-off!

I really dig this place.  Awesome decor, great mood lighting, really tasty menu, expansive wine list.  It's kind of an upscale take on mediterrenean food.  i had the chicken (which was perfectly juicy & tasty) with parmesan risotto & asparagus.  pretty good all the way around.  i'd definitely eat here again.

Great food service and atmosphere. Reasonable pricing.  Wanted to find a nice local restaurant w atmosphere for our last night in Scottsdale. Made reservations for 6:15 on a Thursday and arrived early-- no problem. It did become more crowded quickly.we sat outside on a very pleasant large patio. Service was great. Menu was not huge but food was very good. Especially notable was the Mediterranean salad and the sweet potato cannelloni. Cannelloni was rich and unique. Though my hubby thought it was too sweet. He had mushroom flatbread he thought was awesome. Two in our party had great filling lasagna. We had gelato and brown butter almond cake for dessert. All five in our party gave this place high reviews.

Been here many times due to location and great patio.  First the good: Location, location, location. Right in the middle of Old Town Scottsdale by Fashion Square and the Canal. The restaurant looks the part, has an amazing patio covered by massive shade trees alongside the canal. There are cleverly hidden scent sprayers in the event the canal or the many birds in the neighborhood emanate a less desirable scent.   Service is fairly good. Young, good looking people are cast to fulfill the part of waiters and most play their part well. Our waitress for lunch yesterday was super, the one we had a few weeks go would have rather been elsewhere and we left early.   Now the mediocre: I would call it the food. If you have been to one Fox Restaurant Concept eatery you've been to all. In a sense it brings a certain level of comfort knowing that you'll have similar food in the different restaurants of the company; I wish however that each restaurant did a better job differentiating itself by offering more varied food choices.  And last but not least, the bad: The restaurant, and all of the company's restaurants really, are build for turning tables in their dining rooms. It is virtually impossible to have a conversation because it is so loud inside. The patio is more forgiving.   Basically, Olive and Ivy looks the part, has decent service with run of the mill food. If you want to see an be seen in this neighborhood its the place to be.

Pros: service was quick. Takes credit cards.   Cons: not as good as the actual restaurant! At the actual restaurant, I usually get the bacon wrapped dates and ravioli. Nothing like that here. I wasn't a huge fan of the roast beef sandwich. Hard and dry.

Pros: My favorite restaurant in AZ. I have never ordered anything that I haven't enjoyed. Nothing tops their pesto sauce. The best part is, it comes free with the bread at the beginning of the meal. Last night, I ordered the sweet potato cannelloni. It's very rich. My friend described it as, "Like eating a dessert." Since I have a sweet tooth, I loved it. My sister order the pork tenderloin. Her friend ordered the chicken scallopine. It paired perfectly with my past. My BFF ordered scallops. Cooked to perfection. Like eating light puffy clouds of air.   Cons: Price

Incredible service and incredible food. Artisan drinks. I asked the manager where I could get aloe Vera for our burnt 10 year old that just finished mermaid school at the Phoenician and they went to the store and brought us aloe Vera! I was incredibly impressed that Melissa Conti went out of her way for us. I was hoping to Postmates aloe to us before we left. Once Melissa said it was on the way it allowed me to relax and enjoy my first night off in a month. I will be back and will definitely recommend this place to others.

We stopped in here for brunch on Sunday and it was amazing. Everything is made from scratch and it shows. I had the breakfast sandwich (egg, bacon, cheese, avocado,  add tomato) and it was fantastic. Add the bottomless mimosas and charmingly attentive waiter and I could have sat and chatted all morning. We'll be back for certain.

The sweet potato cannelloni was SO delicious! It might as well have been a dessert with how sweet it was! We also had three bruschetta: the strawberry and apple, prosciutto and fig, and the fresh mozzarella. They were all yummy but the fresh mozzarella was magical! The tomato jam on it was the best tomato jam I have ever had. Loved this place and I will definitely be going back! :)

Spent our first night in Scottsdale enjoying a great meal at Olive and Ivy.  Our waiter ranked up there with some of the best we've ever had.   He was extremely friendly and attentive.  The wine selection was top notch and we actually found some of our favorite Italian wines.   A few of us had the Bouillabaisse which was amazing and I highly recommend.   The place was very busy on a very nice AZ night but we were well taken care of.

Well??? Let's see???? Where to start??? Had a reservation for 3, myself, my girl, and my mom (she was celebrating her birthday), So, Sat, 6:15 reservation, we show up prompt at 6:14. They seat us right away, and I'm excited, as is Kiri my girlfriend as we have already read the menu. The place is way tricked out cool, in décor!!! but strike #1 very high celling's, making for an extremely loud dinning experience. However the booths are nice, the lightings very cool, but oh yeah strike #2, my eyes are pretty good as far as sight & I'm somber, but even w/readers & my led smart phone flashlight, it's still very hard to read the menu??? Now you must understand that I have an onion allergy and if you do??? listen UP!: Starting with the apps, everyone of them contains onions of some sort & can not... I repeat CAN NOT BE PREPARED WITH OUT? WTF??? On do second course salads: every dressing is made with onions and your ONLY options is oil & vinegar??? Oh yeah!!! YIPPIE!!! I'm having a blast! strike ###3, but it got better, now I digress, Assuming now that our sever knows the allergy exist, we attempt to move on to main course: first up chicken scaloppini I order, Kiri orders scallops, and my mom, like me, chicken scaloppini, 10 mins pass, server comes back, and states that my dish has onions in the sauce, I say ok....what can we do??? she shrugs... IDK???? I ask her to please go back and ask the Chef what they can do??? 5min later, she comes back and says: "the chef say's all the sauces, puree's/grays have onion", but still no word on what we can do??? I ask again, she say's IDK??? I'm like WTF??? please get me a menu so I can try and make another selection??? DuH! Now the table has been held up at least 30 mins??? Finally, she tells me I can have the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin on a bed of spaghetti squash!!!! YUM!!!! I ORDER! YES!!! 10mins later the manager walks up and says "hi I guess there was a problem??? I say, no we got it worked out. I'm allergic to onions, but the server got me on track with the pork tenderloin!!! He said "NO" It has onions in the squash???? WTF!!!! many mins go by, he gets it straight w/a potato puree instead, which I was told had onions, GEEZZZZ anyone still keeping up? Because only now does everything go down hill. Plates all come, my tenderloin that I ordered mid well (that slightly pink about 160deg internal temp inside, is all pink and bloody juice on plate....NO! Kiri's scallops are4 tiny scallops the size of a .50cent piece three seared only on one side and one not seared on either side and chilly cold in the middle???? WTF!!! we have to send our two plates back for do over.... "RE-FIRE" meanwhile, they leave my moms on the table for 15min and she waits for our food to return, only to have her's go cold....WTF! YOU THINK A PLACE LIKE THAT WOULD HAVE PULLED ALL THREE PLATES AND RETURNED THEM ALL HOT TOGETHER? I'm in the business and just call them as I see them???? SAVE YOUR MONEY!

We went to this beautiful restaurant on Mother's Day to have brunch.  Not only did the manager call another restaurant to get a high chair for our 6 month old son, but also carried an umbrella to keep him out of the 88 degree sunshine.  The outdoor seating, amazing beverages and tasty menu is just the cherry on top of this classy restaurant.  Management= 5* Service = 5* Ambiance = 5* Food = 5* Experience = 5*

The food here is exceptional. I love the vibe in the people. The waitress was so nice and spot-on when she recommend the food to us. We will be back again this is the third time that we've been here. Might be the best restaurant we've been to in Phoenix. Don't forget to order dessert!!

I have been to Olive & Ivy a couple times now, and the food is great.  from the ambiance of the restaurant to the smiling and helpful service, this place cant be beat if you want to try something "out of the norm" and tantalize your taste-buds.  This is a great place to have happy hour with tomato cheese flatbread or hummus, or a romantic date.
Had the best risotto of my life.  Must try the shrimp risotto!  Great atmosphere, people that work there are amazing.
The restaurant has more options, of course. This was good for a late night pizza snack. Service was fast and friendly.
Cool vibe with excellent service. Food is fancy and the price reflects it. SamFox Restaurants are generally better than this though. Meh.

TL;DR - great food, beautiful interior.   On a recent trip to Arizona, Olive & Ivy was on my bucket list. (As any respectable Yelp Elite would, I did my homework.)  We had two plates of bruschetta trios, and three of the six arrived wrong; one was a completely different toast that we didn't order, the salmon Lox one had no Lox (hello...! Haha), etc. Errors aside, they were incredibly good. We agreed we could have easily just had those for our meal and been fine.   We also got two salads - Caesar and Mediterranean with chicken - and they were good.   The house bread never came, although we were told it was coming, so I can't comment on that.  Our waiter was quick and attentive, but there were plenty of mistakes in a small number of dishes.   Even still, we'd be back. We could have stayed here for hours!
The food is great. The service is great. The atmosphere is great. Oh yeah, the wine list is good too. Sit outside if it's under 100.

this place is great!  it has a marketplace, gelato stand, and a wonderfully large restaurant with an open kitchen. there were 6 of us that dined for brunch and we all ordered different entrees.  everyone loved their meals (Benedict, French toast, flatbreads, biscuits & gravy); I personally had the tuna salad sandwich with potato salad which was super delicious!   bloody mary's & service were good as well!

I always have a good time here with good service! Seating outside is fabulous by the fire but unless you have a big party then you may be sitting with people you don't know! Since its open seating. Great food presentation and I enjoy the interior decor. This is one of my favorite places in Scottsdale to eat because of the vibe! Will keep coming back!! Trendy and fun.
Olive and Ivy is my favorite Fox Restaurant. I absolutely love their salmon. Although I must say, everything I've had there is delicious. Moreover, the atmosphere is great, especially the patio.
Wow what a great brunch.  Great wait staff. The design and ambiance was brilliant. Damn good bloody marry.  All and all it was a great start to a day with my family. Eggs benedict FTW!

This is a hipster place with great atmosphere and pretty good food. The service was good considering they were really busy, all the employees were extremely friendly. I got the fungi trifoliate flatbread with a glass of red wine and my aunt got the duck confit flatbread with the red sangria. She raves about the sangria which has a nice tartness to it. Our flatbreads would have been amazing if they hadn't been so burned. You expect flatbread to be a little black around the edges, but I'm talking completely burnt around the entire edges. Bummer. If not for that I would've given the place five stars.

Another Happy Hour...headed to the waterfront to shop and ended up here. Right near the other Fox restaurant, Culinary Dropout, but menu totally different. Not so special specials, beer was $5. We also got hummus to share and also ordered a salad off the regular menu, which were good. I like the cleanliness and service of these restaurants. Not my fave but nothing wrong with that.

I'm so excited about this place and I couldn't even wait to write a review... I'm still eating!!    My daughter and I are waiting for the mall to open so we decided to find a breakfast spot nearby.  Came across this place and gave it a shot.  At 10:30am on a Sunday I expected a long wait but was surprised that we were seated right away in a great spot outside along the water.    Waiter was great, friendly and knowledgeable but perhaps had a bit of ADD, he kept getting distracted but it was okay because he was still great.    After listening to our waiters explanation of the menu, I opted for the breakfast sandwich with a side of hollandaise sauce and my daughter got the cheddar biscuits and gravy.    We got the complimentary bread and pesto, which was to die for!  My sandwich was amazing!  The bread was a buttery flaky goodness and everything was cooked to perfection!  The biscuits and gravy were unique and amazing too!  And to top it off, as we were finishing up our meal, our waiter brought out refills and had them in to go cups.  Awesome!  He knew we were going shopping and thought we needed some refreshments for the mall.    This is going on my list of favorites!  Beautiful atmosphere, superb food and friendly people.  What more could you ask for???
This place was amazing! Our waiter was named donavon and he was on point. I ate way to much but it was so good i couldn't help myself. Definitely coming back again!

text.text: Beautiful location & great for breakfast or brunch. The bread served with freshly made pesto is a bonus, and the patio is lovely when the weather isn't too hot (not much shade). It gets busy during spring/spring training/weekends/etc. Good to make a reservation. The decor is really neat.

Amazing place! Not only is the atmosphere and decor amazing and beautiful, but the food is to die for! I had the salmon and I am dead serious when I say it was the best salmon I've had in my life! I also had the coconut sponge cake as dessert and it was delicious!

We had our work holiday party here and we can't wait to come back and enjoy it again. We were greeted with a large wine selection and some appetizers on a back patio. The appetizers were mini pizza/bruschetta - some had mushrooms and some has tomatoes with cheese. Both were delicious. Another appetizer was a date wrapped in bacon - this was super delicious and easy to eat. I ordered a pineapple mojito and at first our server was confused, saying they don't have a blender but could make us a raspberry mojito. (I've had bartenders tell me they don't have blenders when I've ordered mojitos before, so I was used to this.) Luckily, our server came back later telling me she was confused and viola a delicious pineapple mojito was placed in my hands with a large slice of pineapple on the rim. It was amazing! So good, the husband had to order one for himself. Our party moved inside to a private room where we were given tiny menus with simple selections. The husband ordered the beef entree, steak with horseradish mashed potatoes and I ordered the scallops with corn polenta. While the scallops were delicious, the steak was super tender and moist! (Better than a fillet we had the night before!) For desert, I ordered the chocolate cake with coffee crema inside and the husband ordered the cheesecake. The cheesecake came in a cute mason jar and was amazing. I really liked my chocolate cake but the cheesecake was better. For once everything the husband ordered was better than what I had ordered! It was a fantastic party and such a great venue. Can't wait to come back!

Olive and Ivy-great location and the food is amazing. i am a vegeterian and requested something from the chef that he could make and a summer squash medley came out and it was great. Really great and friendly staff. I love the enviroment as well, dim lighting and great conversation seating.

Been wanting to try Olive and Ivy for years but never made it there - finally the opportunity to meet a girlfriend for lunch today arose and it was finally time!  We shared the bruschetta to start, a trio that you choose from a list. We chose the sautéed mushrooms, butternut squash with brussel sprouts and the third was a fresh mozzarella with tomato jam. All three were great and soooo flavorful. I LOVE Postinos but this was a nice change and new flavors.  For my meal I had the Mediterranean salad and added grilled shrimp. Again a delicious choice that I was happy with.   I'd definitely recommend Olive and Ivy to anyone :)

I came here for lunch with my mother and we had the most amazing experience! We sat on the patio which was such a pleasant environment. The serve was great and the food outstanding. Their complimentary bread and pesto dip is so delicious to start with. We also got flatbread and the Melo salad - both fresh and (believe it or not) refreshing!  A little pricey so I can't come too often, but will be back for special occasions!

Atmosphere, food and drinks!! This place was my favorite in Scottsdale.   Definitely sit outside.   Friendly and knowledgeable wait staff.  We shared the Mediterranean salad...delicious!!   I had the mushroom pappardelle and my boyfriend had the bacon wrapped pork.   Both were excellent.  Don't forget your drinks!! We had white sangria and Mediterranean mule.  Cannot wait to visit AZ again and eat here!!!
Good was great but the people working there were so rude and unpleasant....their attitudes ruined my experience.

If you have a thing for Italian and Mediterranean then this is your place! Come hungry, this place oozes freshness in all that they offer from the Fresh Baked Focaccia with Pesto to their flatbreads and pasta options.  Ambiance: Hip trendy vibes. Service staff is extremely helpful and nice. If it's not too hot, sit outside on the patio it's a beautiful view.  Recommendations: Bruchetta (Mushroom and Roasted Garlic- Finger Licking good, I mean it!) and Prosciutto and Fig, Molte Bene! Pesto Chicken Flatbread is packed with flavor and not too heavy. Pasta: You must get the Wild Mushroom Pappardelle- It's amazing, it has truffle, herbs and Parmesan cheese (sorry folks it has no meat, but a well done dish) highly recommend it. It's pack with flavor, and if you are a truffle fan this is a must.  I can't go back soon enough! Make a trip to Camelback Rd to check this place out!

Solid cafe style option when you've dropped from all the shopping nearby.  My only complaint is that lamb gyro featured lamb sausage patties instead of the long strips you expect in a gyro.  Nice taste but I wish this had been advertised.  Breakfast potatoes were very good.  The salads are huge; like maybe a whole bag that you buy at the grocery store in a bowl.

I am so sad that I have to give this restaurant a bad rating. I took my mom here to have a fabulous Mother's day dinner and to have a delightful finale to our mother-daughter trip. The food and the service were fabulous. We started with three different bruschetta (you can mix). They were all amazing. We then had the house salad which had a wonderful light dressing, all very fresh. We split the salad and the portions were still huge! For dinner I had the sweet potato cannelloni and my mom had fish (I can't remember which one and I can't view the menu).   Why the bad review you might ask? My mom woke up at 6am with HORRIFIC FOOD POISONING. I felt so awful, we even had to fly out that day. She was miserable. Some might say that food poisoning can happen even when cooking in your own home and that its not their fault but I find it inexcusable. Keeping ingredients fresh, the kitchen clean and correct cooking temps should avoid all food poisoning. We ate and shared the same dishes all day for breakfast and lunch so I know that it was from Olive and Ivy. Could have been the fish or the lettuce. We were skeptical about getting fish in Arizona in the first place but my mom decided to go for it....bad choice :(
I didn't try any food but I did enjoy the fire pit and the s'more latte.  Great date spot and friendly staff.

After a lukewarm visit a bit ago, this visit was much better.  This eatery fills up fast so there are a few options for those on the go.  Sit at the bar or order from the take out.  The watermelon salad should not be missed.  Sandwiches have unique and delicious assembled layers and sauces.  Many salads are a tasteful choice for the Paleo diet--add salmon on the side.

The food is amazing, why can't they fix the service?  ...and yet, I keep returning to torture my guests and me.  One would think that at 3:00 in the afternoon, there would be no issues.  We had a business meeting and decided to sit on the patio which was, despite being a perfect day in the valley, empty.  Once seated, it took 25 minutes for 3 ice teas, another 30 minutes for the prosciutto and chevre flat bread (which, oops, had no chevre), and another 30 minutes for the bill.  Our business meeting was only an hour in an attempt to avoid rush hour traffic home...we failed miserably at the task.  Anyway, Olive and Ivy still receives 4 stars from me because of their food and ambiance.  Just be prepared to wait and be served something you didn't order.  Sam Fox, fix this place before you open another.

We have been to Olive & Ivy many times. The bar is great at lunchtime and the patio is our favorite at night. The wine list is very adequate and the food selections are fresh and attractively presented. Our favorite appetizer is the hummus with veggies. Dinner selections are all good. I am partial to the chicken offerings and I can't fail to mention the bread and pesto.  Servers have always been great, very attentive and efficient.

Good food in Terminal 4, right inside the gate. Seating is normally a problem, it's limited and there isn't a lot of extra seating at the gates so folks linger in the restaurants and use their electronics.  The coffee and pastries are terrific and the breakfast food looks marvelous.

Treated  Mom to an early Mother's day celebration at Olive & Ivy. We enjoyed the ambience and decor of the restaurant. Everything is well spread out, so you don't feel isolated, or crammed in at your table. The food was good, and tasted fresh. Our server was efficient, and attentive to us through the whole meal. Over all a GREAT experience.

Terrible experience. Would never recommend.   Background: I was here as part of a bridal party, and the problems began right away. We had enough people coming that we were not allowed to place a reservation outside. Fine. We'd just make do with open seating on the patio. There were 4 of us in our late 20s/early 30s that arrived first. I guess we made a mistake and had too many seats around our table. Rather than just politely explain it to us, our server snapped at us and kicked the chair out of her way. After we apologized, moved things, and fixed it, it took 15 minutes before she'd come back to take our drink order despite standing nearby. When we placed our order for our first round of drinks, we started by asking if we could please split our check. We were told we were only allowed to split our check for food and drinks if she took all of our credit cards, but combined with other comments she made, it was meant to ensure we'd actually pay (to be clear, we'd just asked to split our 4 orders into 2 sets of 2). By this point, more of the group was showing up, primarily some of the older relatives who proceeded to sit at a different table; we later found out that she had no problem splitting the check at this other table (perhaps trying to guarantee she gets at least one automatic gratuity?). She proceeded to completely ignore us and wouldn't bring any more water or anything except to the older members of our party. When we all ultimately ordered our food, we also ordered another round of drinks, yet somehow our drinks only came out at the same time as our food (as in, much later). My food was also a little on the cold side. To be perfectly honest, we suspected at the time that she was irritated that us younger couples were splitting meals and not each ordering one. We still had to flag down anyone that passed by just to be given water.   In the sake of fairness, here are some positives about the place. The décor, particularly outside, was gorgeous. If you told them you were splitting food, it comes out pre-split (hopefully you were planning on splitting all parts 50-50). The food itself was also pretty good (albeit with small portion sizes).  Overall, spend your money elsewhere, particularly if you look younger. If you still choose to go here, prepare to be treated poorly and ignored while paying too much for small portions.

I have a couple of issues with this place, so I will start with the food first. Myself and my wife met a couple friends here for brunch last weekend. I made the mistake of ordering the "Potato Hash", which turned out to be one of the worst things I've ever eaten period. It's a simple breakfast of eggs over easy, sausage gravy and hash brown potato's. My plate came out with two eggs that had been cooked so long that they were both hard and dry. There wasn't a lick of moisture left in them. The server noticed that the eggs were ruined, and promptly had more made for me. The sausage gravy was terrible. It was some weird super oily concoction that neither resembled gravy nor sausage, which made my burnt potato's even worse. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this dish. My second issue was my reservation. I made a reservation three days in advance for 11:30am on the patio through "OpenTable". The day before my reservation the restaurant called to confirm everything for the next day. When we arrived, the hostess quickly seated us inside. I explained that my reservation was for the patio. She told us to wait and she would go find out. Several minutes later she came back and informed me that since I made my reservation through "OpenTable", that my request couldn't be honored. WTH? I was told that if you want to sit on the patio, you need to call the restaurant direct, even though on OpenTable there is a box for, wait for it, special requests! Fortunately since I have no desire to return to this typical chain restaurant, I wont need to call the restaurant direct. P.S. I only gave it two stars because of the speed at which the server saw the two hockey pucks on my plate and corrected it.

Just got back from spending the weekend in Scottsdale with my girl friend. We dined at Olive and Ivy on Saturday night and just had an amazing time! It was packed and we didn't have reservation so waited at the bar and enjoyed few cocktails for 30 minutes and then our table was ready.   Located on the 'river' aka waterfront near Scottsdale Fashion SC, Olive & Ivy combines a lively, animated atmosphere and retro and trendy look with comfort of old, nostalgic Arizona dinning.   Fresh Creative food, Great Service and there are multiple Seating Areas; One can seat themselves inside the restaurant in booth, tables or at the bar or outside seating is available as well.   My dinner was fantastic...I ordered the Sea bass with caramelized cauliflower, snap peas & preserved grapefruit. DELICIOUS....My mouth is watering just thinking about it... lol   If you haven't been here, put it on your list and enjoy every bite and minute of your visit.

You order at the counter, and they have a good amount of seating.   I was planning to be healthy and just get a salad, but the squares of pizza sitting under the warming lamp called out to me. I ended up with a pine nut and chicken salad (mixed greens, Gorgonzola, lots of pulled roasted chicken, cherry tomatoes, and toasted pine nuts) and a piece of the Mediterranean pizza.  The salad was fresh and had a good amount of chicken, and the pizza had lots of toppings and good flavor (they also warmed it up for me).  As far as airport food goes, it wasn't crazy expensive (around $18 for the above).

I see you brought back the mushroom and asparagus flatbread without the asparagus. The service of the staff raised you up, but dude, get rid of the ridiculously tight outfits. The "fungi" named flatbread was great though. Bring back the salmon flatbread , get rid of the howdy doody outfits, and I'll give you another star.

Wonderful place for lunch/brunch. They were very accommodating with my active 2-year-old and got his food out within 10 minutes. The food was all excellent and the service was perfect. We will definitely be back soon!

Great location!  Been here for dinner twice, brunch once.  Dinner is very good.  The espresso poured over ice cream dessert is very unique, and a must try.  For brunch, the vanilla yogurt is AMAZING!  And I hate yogurt.  It is the only yogurt I will eat.  The potato flat bread is only meh.  Long wait times.  Crazy Scottsdale clubbers fill the bar area on weekend nights too; its distracting when trying to have a nice dinner.

Okay, so this review is long overdue!  My husband and I came here as we were spending our day in scottsdale. So we had lunch here for our anniversary in March.  Our waiter was Stephen.  He was very friendly.  We told him that we were celebrating our anniversary and he joked that we looked too young to be married. Haha. Anyway, we both ordered the same thing. I can't recall the exact name but it was a bacon cheeseburger with fries.  We also had margaritas. The waiter said the beef would be cooked meduim. I thought it'll be meduim close to well done but it was meduim rare. I never eat my burgers that way, but didn't think anything of it at the time. Fast forward three, four hours later,  it caused food poisoning.  Maybe it was my fault for eating meduim rare when I never do, but just be cautious if you are like me. The food poisoning was really bad. It caused several days of vomiting and diarrhea.  Apart from that, the waiter was super nice and got us a cake as an anniversary gift (on his tab). We were seated on the verge of outdoors and indoors, so the best of both worlds. We really had a good time so it sucked that I got sick! We will be returning,  though.  It wasn't their fault.
Best place to be outdoors and chat with your Tribe of Women Friends and chat about what to do on girlie Vacation.  Great Breakfast and Brunch.

We came here with some new friends today for brunch after church, I was very impressed with the quality of food, service and atmosphere. The perfect type of place to go for brunch or lunch. I had the breakfast burrito which was great and topped it off with a couple of fresh mimosas!

The BFF and I decided to have a fancy date night and get dressed up to go to dinner and a movie.  We decided on Olive & Ivy because it was centrally located for us and had a nice ambience.  I made reservations for us because it made it feel more "date-like" and also I was going to be coming straight from work and knew I'd be starving.  I got there just about exactly when my reservation was made for and was told to have a seat and my table would be ready shortly.  Now, the place wasn't packed by any means, sure there was a good number of people in the restaurant but there wasn't like a huge group of people waiting around to be seated.  For some reason though, despite the fact that I'd made a reservation, I waited for 15-20 minutes for my table.  So what's the point of making a reservation?  I could have walked in off the street and had the same thing.  Once we got to our table the server came over right away and introduced himself and offered us drinks.  Since my friend is pregnant she was asking about non-alcoholic options but they really didn't have many selections so she stuck with water as did I so as not to feel like I was teasing her by dangling a martini in her face.  We decided to get the 3 bruschetta for $11 deal as an appetizer to tide us over to our main course.  They were all delicious but pretty small, only 3 pieces per slice.  We both decided on the Mediterranean Salad, with hers she asked for it with no feta and a side of olives though.  They were good but not outstanding.  Our server was friendly the whole time and did an awesome job making sure our water was full and we had whatever we needed.  I ended my meal with the passion fruit sorbet which was good at first but the flavor got to be a bit too much after a few bites.

Wonderful Italian cuisine on the river in Scottsdale.  Enjoyed bruschetta sampler and bacon wrapped dates for appetizers.  Both the lasagne and the papardelle with mushrooms dishes were delicious and would be ordered again. Finished with two desserts. The lemon pudding cake was not to our liking, but the cherry pecan danish with orange marmalade and ice cream was terrific. Very good service by the waiter and food runners. Next time we visit Scottsdale will go again.

This was our first stop on our maiden vaca to Scottsdale! We enjoyed the outdoor patio area and seemed to get there right on time as the lunch hour on a beautiful day seemed to fill in quickly. We enjoyed mimosas, a charcuterie board, and 3 bruschettas (goat and fig, salmon lox, + 1 more). Service was great, prices fair, but can't beat the location and ambiance!

What a delightful atmosphere! Unique, flavorful food and dessert options with attentive yet not overbearing service. This was our first time dining with Olive & Ivy. We will certainly return as well as refer it to our friends.
The Sweet Potato Cannelloni is crazy good! Service was excellent. Their soda machine was down and the server went to their market place and got me a coca cola to make up for it. Really impressed!

I've been a few times and every time is great!  The flat breads, bruschetta, and salads are great!   Although the best dish they have is the Chopped Chicken Salad.  The peanut butter granola just makes it!!!

A huge fan of this place.  The patio is by far the most beautiful here.  Actual grass, beautiful fountains, fire pits for chilly nights, and overlooks the waterfront.  Very pretty. But even better is their Happy Hour.  Great drink specials and the bruschetta is cheap for HH as well. While not as fantastic as Postino's bruschetta, it is still delicious.  I've also eaten here for dinner and it's outstanding.  The seafood risotto is unbelievably rich and filling and I wanted to lick my bowl clean.  The little cafe also serves delicious gelato and my favorite thus far is the graham cracker gelato. Wow.  Get there early for HH because the patio fills up FAST.
Always a great place for brunch or lunch! Food is good, the service is always on point.
Still blown away every time I come here! My new favorite is the kale salad with added salmon. Seriously... Look at this picture. Have you ever seen anything more beautiful?!?

Breakfast club sandwich on an English muffin?! So good!  Had a 2 hour layover here and decided to grab some breakfast. They have what's called the Breakfast club sandwich which consists of avocado, bacon, egg, and cheese all on an english muffin! WOW such a simple combination, but they made it taste so freaking good! http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Eszx9mddqS-rZd1AK6rGFw&userid=pmKnNkGVgzhMkwJaTU5apA The colors in my picture are so prettty!    The bacon was perfectly crisp and really pink too! It wasn't burnt and shriveled up like I've seen some places do it. This place is always packed because they offer breakfast foods as well as great lunch sandwiches! Everything here was so appealing to me I wanted to try it all! There is even an area where they have already made yogurt parfaits and tons of baked goodies to choose from.   I also decided to get a bag of chocolate chip cookies and those were so addicting I ate the whole bag by the time I landed in CA.....Felt like a fatty. Their cookies had white chocolate chips and regular chocolate chips. SO GOOD! The cookies are thin but just capture the sweet sugary flavors so well.   The workers are friendly too!  Olive & Ivy is also a restaurant in Arizona! Makes me want to take a trip there and just try out that restaurant!

I like the fact, as opposed to Culinary Dropout, that every dude at Olive and Ivy does NOT have a beard! Good job guys Not over the top trendy And good old fashioneds too We went for happy hour and wanted to try all the specials

It's always busy here. Been around a while and still does a good job. Food overall is good and the atmosphere is very pleasant. I've frequented everything from the dining to the small grocery style counter and enjoyed most of it. Today was pretty busy so we managed to squeeze a spot on the couch next to the bar. Service was a bit off and negatives included: eggs Benedict was way too soggy, brought our cappuccinos with no sugar or spoon and server vanished after taking the order.  But despite these issues I have to say I would try this place again because the food was previously pretty good. I've never thought anything was excellent or very memorable here but it is convenient and the patio areas are nice.  Still recommended.

I have patronized many of the Fox restaurants and so far this one is the worst. I found the prices to be quite high, although I guess it is expected for the area. The service was very good, but the food just mediocre. I tasted the artichoke appetizer which was no more than some canned artichokes on top of arugula dressed with balsamic and oil sprinkled with parm, nothing above average. For the entree I ordered the veal and spinach ravioli. The pasta was chewy, the filling was strange, it had what I think was raisins mixed into it and strangely no spinach. The sauce was very rich yet had little flavor. All I can say was I gave the place a try, I think once is enough.

A stylish and delicious option for lunch! We were lucky enough to be able to take advantage of their patio, complete with a little fountain, on a beautiful sunny day, and the yummy food and lovely service added up to a great experience. At first glance this place strikes me as a bit corporate, but at the end of it I felt that they really provided a unique experience.   Two highlights of the meal: the delicious pesto that comes out with their free foccacia bread, which must have a wheel of parmesan in each bowl, because it's so rich and wonderful. I also adored the asparagus, mushroom and white truffle oil flatbread, which I shared with the table and immediately wished I had gotten just for myself.   I also had the chopped chicken salad, which I found to be disappointing. First of all, there was WAY too much dressing on it, so everything felt drenched and a little wilted. Also, I was initially really curious about the granola that comes in it but I actually didn't feel that it added very much to the flavor and found myself picking around it.   I'd definitely suggest this place to anyone who wants some pretty classic salads, sandwiches and flatbreads with a little fancied-up twist!

Great service and even greater food! They were very accommodating in regards to splitting plates between two people and having a high knowledge of the ingredients in their plates. I would definitely recommend this place to those who have never been before.

Disapointing after all the hype around this place. I had to return the frito misto (fried calamari, zucchinis and shrimp) as it was way too salty and had too much cheap batter. The staff was great and took it back and offered me to try something else on the menu, and did not charge me the plate. That is great customer service. The bacon wrapped dates were delicious and so was the seabass. But the sweet potato gnocchis were way too buttery. The menu is short and simple and as such I think they simply need to make a few adjustements for it to be better. However, I wont be going back.

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here last night and had an exceptional experience.  The location is wonderful-quiet and even though it was 105 degrees at 7:30 at night the combination of misters and waterfront location made for a very cool and enjoyable evening on the patio.  Speaking of which, the patio is ridiculously gorgeous.  Seriously, if they are trying for a European feel they nailed it.  Absolutely in love with the patio and the vibe.  The interior is gorgeous as well-just a bit on the loud side.  All depends on what mood you're in.    Our service was outstanding as well-from the time we were greeted, to the drinks at the bar and of course our table service all night was wonderful.  We felt spoiled.  And now on to the food..delicious.  The pesto and bread to start was amazing-some of the best pesto I've had (and it's one of my absolute favorite things).  We also had the fritto misto for an app which was very good.  Main dishes were the bacon wrapped pork and the sweet potato cannelloni-both full of flavor and quality.  We shared the lemon pudding cake for dessert, which was light and refreshing on a hot June night!    All in all, Olive and Ivy exceeded my expectations and we will without a doubt return.  Thank you for making our anniversary special.

The restaurant is absolutely gorgeous. Very nice outdoor seating. It is loud and very busy on weekend nights. I recommend making a reservation. Very nice date place  It is a little pricey. Most entrees about $20, but some around $15. Bread with pesto sauce is given to everyone. Their desserts are amazing!  Rated it down because the taste of the entree (flatbread) wasn't very good. And it is very slow service. Maybe slightly overpriced.

Maybe I'm a little partial because I helped open the coffee/gelato area way back when but after a few years hiatus, I'm glad to say Olive & Ivy is still spot on, if not, better.   My family & I came here for my birthday dinner & the hostesses were friendly and had no problem seating my mother & I even though the rest of the party wasn't with us (I know that some places are really finicky about that so it was nice to just be seated with no hassle).   Our waitress was great from the get go. Her name was Andrea I believe? She was very friendly without being too over the top & paid attention to details even going so far as to offer to have my niece & nephew's spoon & fork that they have with them whenever they go out rinsed off in the back (I know of places far less nice than Olive & Ivy who wouldn't even do that so it was major points).  We started off with the hummus with veggies that had a kick to it...pretty damn good. The bread with pesto is ah-mazing!! I probably (definitely) should have refrained from having as much as I did as I was stuffed by the time my meal arrived. After the hummus, I had the half portion of the beet salad with goat cheese and pistachios...pretty solid trio of ingredients on top of the arugula and it was yummy!  Following that, I ordered the flatbread; half Margherita half prosciutto/egg/potato and while I wasn't sure how that latter half would taste, it was good. I'm a sucker for prosciutto and theirs is no joke! I couldn't finish it (surprise surprise) but I still ordered desert...it's my birthday, what better day to treat yourself?! The ice cream bar that's been previously mentioned is SO good...coffee ice cream with marshmellow and a chocolate coating with some peanut butter thrown in for good measure.   I have to say, as well, that the cappuccino was amazing   Well done, O & I. I will definitely return sooner for happy hour!

I never equate this as a place I think of when wanting to go out to eat.  Do not get me wrong, their menu is great BUT it is not anything like any of his other concepts ((Fox) in my opinion) since it seems a lil too simple and small....you can great an amazing meal (their scallops are awesome) here just for me it has been for the great patio, restaurant, bar ambiance for a few apps and drinks before heading out or somewhere for a quick drop in.  Great people watching and a great view of what the Waterfront architects were trying to create. Service is always just OK but this place always is busy so I guess that is to be sometimes expected.

Although our waitress was super nice, over all disappointing. We had a birthday celebration and had a few extra add ons including a few significant others in which we called well over 8 hours in advanced and apparently they could not even accolade one extra chair which was crap. Through out our meal there was multiple tables and extra chairs all around our party. Also I had a decent pizza and ate a slice packed up the rest to go and left it on the table- no one even had the curtesy to ring us or even let us know when we walked out and left an entire pizza on the table. Customer service below average with sub par food. Wouldn't recommend.
Delicious red sangria, amazing food, and outstanding ambiance.

Gorgeous patio area.  We've been here once before and sat inside just for drinks.  But outside is where it's at!!  We started off we the lamb meatballs.  With the bread and pesto that was already part of the night, it was a great way to start.  We split the lasagna.  Both portions were reasonably sized and tasted great!  We tried the chocolate cake and lemon tres leches cakes.  The chocolate seemed a bit dry, and the lemon was very dominant in flavor.  I'd like to see more cocktails added to the drink menus.

I was visiting on business, and a  work colleague took me here (their favorite restaurant); it's located in an upscale outdoor retail and residence complex, Scottsdale Fashion Square, so on the plus side, they're situated in a good, vibrant location - suitable for people-watching!   It's a newer, larger-size restaurant, and kind of reminded me of something one might find here in the Bay Area - high ceilings, large open-air windows, well-dressed (yet casual) people, large bar, patio, animated conversations, etc. I liked the ambience - it wasn't too crowded, yet not deserted, either!  There was actually no wait, we were seated outdoors, and our server promptly took our drink order and also, served up some bread.  I opted for the Seared Ahi Tuna Salad - ($15) Mizuna Greens, Fresh Avocado, Mushrooms, Soy Caramel  ...extra avocado, of course!  The food was good, and my salad tasted really fresh - even the  tuna. I was not disappointed at all.   ...however, what I *was* disappointed in was the service. The food came out slowly, and after it was delivered, the server disappeared, and it was quite the effort for us to flag her down for drinks, etc. We were in a slight hurry, yet it was difficult to try to catch her for the bill.  After we finished eating, it was a good 20-minute wait before we took off. Had it not been for this point, I prob would've given this place four stars!
We had a pre-Thanksgiving lunch with the family. Loved the new seasonal menu. The Kale Salad was delicious with the addition of Ahi Tuna - perfectly seered! Never disappoints!

Simple and delicious. Yes, it's a little pricey and you can taste the difference in the food. I had the prosciutto and fig bruschetta to start. The thin sliced, salty prosciutto, slightly sweet pop of dog and peppery arugula combine for extraordinary flavor. When I ordered the kale salad for an appetizer my server suggested a 1/2 size - perfect!   The Chenin Blanc is a must try. The forward flavor is a bit sweeter than I normally like but the finish is a bit spicy. Lovely!  For dinner I ordered the natural chicken. Chicken thigh is on point. Potatoes are creamy as advertised. The mushrooms give the citrus jus an umami essence. It's maybe a touch sweet. Just a touch.   Sadly, I'm going to have to pass on dessert. Next time.   I know I sound picky but the large screen with football ruins the mood every time I look over. It's the only reason I've given the place 4 stars instead of 5.
This place is consistently one of the best at PHX.  Very good hot sandwiches and fresh salads.   Prompt friendly service.   I will walk out of my way to come here.
I could spend all day here! Grizzly Claws are amazing! The patio is so relaxing! And their white wine sangria is delicious!

Long-time friends invited us to dinner this past Saturday to Olive & Ivy. We've enjoyed meals there before and looked forward to dinner.  Service was certainly prompt and friendly... We ordered the Chef's Plate, Bacon-wrapped Dates, and one other appetizer to share. Tasted great, but the dishes came without serving forks or spoons. Fresh pesto and bread were excellent.  Bone-in Ribeye cooked medium was very good. Scallops...meh Sea Bass - very thin and dry due to being overlooked  Mediterranean Salad was ok...shrimp were way overcooked and rubbery  Nice atmosphere, not too crowded. Food was only 'ok'

This place was meh. The place has way too much staff on the floor, makes it feel very busy and opposite of intimate. The menu during the weekend is limited to the brunch menu, which is disappointing, both with options and taste. Don't believe I'll be coming here again.

After discussing for a while different cuisines  and restaurants in Phoenix area, our niece's friend suggested olive&ivy for dinner. we made the reservation and found the restaurant after circling the shopping center couple of times (restaurant not visible from the street) we parked in the public parking and walked in the restaurant. As soon as we walked in we were awed, beautiful, spacey modern decor. we dined in the patio and it is beautiful there right by the canal, all the strings of lights felt like Christmas time. Ot was absolutely a delightful ambience.  Now unfortunately I have to comment about the food which needs much to be desired.  The appetizer, bruschetta, were ok, salad was pretty good but the main dishes were  disappointing.My spicy shrimp risotto was unflavorful, the risotto was like a paste and the shrimps had no taste. My niece ordered scallops and they had no taste either. same thing with the chicken dish my brother-in-law ordered and the sea bass my daughter had. We ordered lemon tres leches cake for dessert and unfortunately the have no idea what tres leches cake should taste like. it was too lemony and dry (it should be really moist with 3 kinds of milk). over all 5 stars for the decor and ambience, 2 star for the food, and 4 star for the waitress who was very knowledgeable and attentive and  patient. So it was mixed feeling but the sad thing is this restaurant has the potential to get 5 stars if they only improve their food quality. Oh, I forgot, my brother-in-law loved his entree (scotch with soda), no complaints from him.

Very gorgeous restaurant. The hummus and veggies we ordered before our meal was amazing and so was the bread and pesto provided. You can tell how fresh everything is. I ordered the chopped chicken salad and, while it was delicious, the blue cheese was completely overwhelming. There are so many delicious pieces to the salad that I was looking forward to- the peanut granola being one- and I could not taste any of them but the cheese! I will definitely try them out again though, a drink, appetizer and salad for around $30 was not bad. The coffee bar was amazing too. Got a little latte to go!
I loved this place! Super friendly servers, great ambiance, I love the food and decor!

We had a reservation inside on. Friday evening. I had a half Caesar salad and lasagna bologna see. My husband had chicken piccata. Both were good, but the lasagna was the better of the two. Our server (who was great!) recommended a lemon blueberry cake for dessert. It was light a delicious! As we left, we made a reservation for the following weekend on the patio. The vibe out there looks great!

Airport food has always been kinda... meh.  Traveling home to Flagstaff on Christmas we had a 4 hour layover in PHX. We found that most of the restaurants we're closed but Olive and Ivy came through with some really good wood fired pizza that was made that much better by a young man working there named Casey.   He took a shift so a coworker could have Christmas off. Just a nice kid.

Great trendy ambiance and outstanding service.  We ordered bruschetta to start off and enjoyed it.  Nothing spectacular, but yummy nevertheless.  Ordered kale salad and loved it.  Ordered sea bass and it was good as well.  DJ in the house playing variety of music to  set the mood.  Will return and try something new.
One of my favorite patios in Old Town Scottsdale. It's inviting, comfortable and they offer great food as well.

Definitely one of my old town favorites  love their salads; entrées are very tasty  always have enjoyed their dinner time atmosphere  drinks are very good A bit on the pricey side but you get what you pay for Great service and food!

Early morning travel rush and each person here greets you with a smile and looks you in the eye like you are a real person. I got the O&I it was delicious they put tomatoes on it! No one ever puts tomatoes on breakfast sandwiches...pretty freaking good.  As I'm enjoying this delicious sammy one of the staff walks by, looks like the manager and asks if I like everything and how was my service??? Holy Crap is this a hidden gem mom and pops bistro or an airport meal.  As I'm typing this email the manager is now walking around busing tables.  i would give the food a 4/5, the service a 10/5! Well done Olive & Ivy, well done.
