Overall, this is a great date spot. My main attraction to this restaurant is the patio seating, especially this time of year.  The bruchetta is hit or miss.  I find the bread to be too crunchy sometimes where it hurts your gums to chew the bread, but the funghi has notably rich flavors. The prosciutto is average, and although the apple caponata was visually appealing, it was also average in taste.  The kale salad was refreshing and the serving size was large enough to split in two, but it could use more of the candied pecans. My favorite main dish so far is the veal and spinach ravioli.  I normally do not enjoy pasta, but the meat was flavorful and was complemented nicely with the light sauce.  The Seabass was poorly prepared.  Sea bass must be cooked properly, and this one was overcooked, giving it a dry texture throughout, but apparently that's the way the want it.  Next, they mask the flavor of the fish with a slice of bacon on top of the fish. I love bacon, but it does not belong on everything.  The sauce was also too tangy. Sea bass has a subtle natural flavor that should not be overwhelmed by a greasy chunk of pig.  Service was average for the FRC.  I'll be going back to olive and ivy for the ambiance, but I'll stick with the dishes that are easier for them to make.
The patio is the best! The environment is welcoming. And the service is nice. We wish the waiters/waitresses had to taste everything on the menu.
Just wonderful.  Food has yet to disappoint & service is impeccable.  Happy hour has great prices. LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!

Wow!  If being trendy equated to a five star MEAL experience then this place would have been off the charts!!  I agree the bread and pesto were great, as was the bacon wrapped dates but a neighboring table ordered the fish, sea bass which I normally love, and it stunk so bad it turned my stomach.  I had ordered the prawns in risotto and was hoping they wouldn't smell, but alas, they did. I couldn't eat them so I tried my honey's lasagna but it was greasy. So....not real impressed. The decor was amazing, the music was bumping but I was there to eat and it didn't happen.  Yelp...you swung and missed. Maybe next time.
Love this place! The atmosphere and service is top notch, and I've never had a bad meal here. I'll be back for sure.

Mediterranean salad, sweet potato canoli and chocolate cake. Everything was good. The canoli was different but I tend to like savory. It felt like a desert. I tried the salmon and it was good as well. Salad was lightly dressed and it was good.

I have had several nice lunches at this restaurant but went there for dinner for the first time a couple of days ago.  The restaurant is large, and tends to be a bit noisy.  We were seated at a small table in the middle of the restaurant traffic even though the place was not busy. The noise made it hard to converse. Both the hostess and server seemed bored and indifferent.  The brushetta was very good.  The scallops were tasty, but the portion was very small for the price.  The chocolate cake was pretty bland.  Another time, I think I will just have appetizers and wine on the patio and go elsewhere for dinner.

I came to Olive & Ivy on Memorial Day and it was a wonderful experience! I was really feeling wine, so I started with a glass of the resiling. Don't get me wrong it was really good, but after trying my friend's sangria I could't help but wish I had gotten it! Safe to say, I will be getting it the next time I come in.... So yummy.   Please note: if you've never been to Olive & Ivy, the one thing you HAVE to ask for is the bread and their fresh made pesto. It will change your life - I swear! It pairs so wonderfully with all the other entrees and a glass of wine! For my entree, I ordered the veal ravioli. I will say... For the price, I was a little disappointed in the portion size. But it was so tasty it didn't matter much to me! It's smothered in this buttery sauce with parmesan. INSANELY good, people! Our server was also great in every way! Come to Olive & Ivy for any occasion!
Great place to hang out with family and friends.  The back patio a Can be a quiet place to relax of have meetings during the week.  Keep the free pesto and bread coming.

12/2/10  2.5 stars.  Took my young cousin w/ me for happy hour and sat at the bar; This was her first time at O&I.  While I really like the look and the feel of the island layout of O&I's bar, I always feel like a fish out of water when I sit there.  (I've actually tried sitting there a few times when I've walked in solo, but always ended up moving to a table.  If it weren't for my cousin at my side, I probably would've moved to a table again, or, worse yet, walked out of the resto, which I've done before, too.)  Despite a few attempts at getting her to try a cocktail, she declined, and thus I proceeded to just order a glass of wine.  Why it's so hard to get a sampling of a couple of wines before settling on one to order here, I'll never know.  (Just a few nights ago, while at Beckett's Table, my server offered to have me try sips of the two wines I was having trouble choosing!)  Tsk, tsk, tsk!  We decided to try the Italian Sausage flatbread and the hummus app.  The flatbread, w/ its tasty and spicy Italian sausage chunks, consisted of a crispy crust w/ vibrant red piquillo peppers and creamy goat cheese-- I'd order this again, even though peppers and I don't exactly get along.  The hummus was equally delightful, w/ house-made pita bread and a "petite Greek salad," which actually consisted of only sliced red grape tomatoes and chopped cucumbers (a no-no for me!) and a ton of feta on top.  Why the salad was piled ON TOP of the hummus, and not on the side, I don't know.  I suppose for the price of the app, I shouldn't expect more veggies used (a bit of lettuce, perhaps?), but it would've been nice to be able to pick the cukes out.  Served as it was, on top of the hummus, which looked like it was baked for a few minutes before getting the salad treatment, spooning the cukes off would've entailed major loss of delicious baked hummus goodness.  And we wouldn't have any of that!  I really wished we could've stayed past 6p to check out the celebrity guest bartender, but we had other appointments to keep.  My cousin really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere here, and I'd have given this review another 4 stars if it weren't for the fact that our bartender gave us such an attitude when I asked to sample the two wines first before ordering.    FYI, the happy hour menu changed, drastically reduced to only maybe 8 items or less, down from practically all of the apps and half of the flatbreads and a couple of salads that the old HH menu contained.  Recalling this, plus the wine and salad/hummus incidents, I may just have to say goodbye to O&I for a long, long time...
Had to wait 10 minutes for them to warm up the soup. It was as still cold and what a nasty taste ! I bet it was frozen or canned soup ! Salad was ok

Forgot to add a review when I went a few weeks ago.   A group of gals met here for a lunch meeting. The food was pretty good, I don't recall what I ate. Probably because I was distracted by the noise round me.  High noise level. They wouldn't let us have the back room because we couldn't guarantee that we'd spend their $250 minimum for the room.  We may go back as a group, but probably only if we can use their back room.

We love this place! Each time we visit, it's one place we are sure to have a great experience at! Another one of Fox concepts restaurant! Which to me means healthy and good! I first discovered their True Foods restaurant . Service is excellent and food is fabulous! Call for reservations. You won't be sorry!

Olive & Ivy.  This was my 2nd time to have a meal at this establishment.  It had been years since my first trip, because I had dinner on my first visit and wasn't head over heels for the place.  On this occasion, friends of mine chose Olive & Ivy for a Sunday brunch.  The weather was beautiful in Scottsdale so there was a 30 minute wait to eat outside.  We were not in a waiting mood so we sat inside.  The ambiance of this restaurant is very cool and the service is good.  My frittata was eh.  It was not a meal I would rave about, which is why Olive & Ivy only gets 3 stars from me.  However, my friends really enjoyed their meals.  My friend Jess ordered the Margherita flatbread and commented that she would order it again without hesitation.  My friend Mollie enjoyed her Chicken Panini.  I almost gave Olive & Ivy 4 stars because it does have a fantastic brunch menu. Also, the pine nut pesto and bread that they bring to the table is scrumptious! I will return to Olive & Ivy again with a strategy.  I will order the vanilla buttermilk pancakes (saw them on another table and was super jealous!).  If I go for lunch, I will order a flatbread (because so many of those looked so fantastic).  I'm looking forward to my next trip!

This place was excellent,  walk past culinary drop out and head over here. Everything was excellent. I had the chicken it was a sooo good. Great service. The corn chowder soup was excellent. You will enjoy sitting by the river walk.  Perfect evening.

Was here the past week for a private event, got to say, not very many establishments have the feel Olive&Ivy has. The ambiance is PRICELESS. What a great time of year to relax on the patio with a glass of wine and a flatbread! Dined with larger groups here as well, VERY accommodating staff. Great menu, great wine.   All and all, an awesome place. Will definitely be back soon for a date night!

Great place to check out when in downtown Scottsdale. It can get loud at peak hours - so if your down for soft conversation forget it ...go off peak hours . I've been here several times and have never been disappointed. I've ordered the bruschetta (you can't go wrong with any of them) , the hummus ( all good) and the meat and cheese board . Drinks were great with a few unique twists .   This time we had artichoke hearts( delicious ) . The dressing made the dish . We had a Margherita flatbread that was great - the ends had some crust , like a pizza . The sea bass had a cauliflower purée that was caramelized and some grapefruit that was preserved, wow !  If your a fan of mushrooms you'll love the wild mushroom pappardelle . Pasta dish - cleaned the plate .   The sangria was also great - chose the white over the red , tasted a little sweeter with the berry taste - both were very good though .   It's a no brainer - we'll go back time and time again . Any of the Fox Concepts restaurants give an all class experience.

Olive and Ivy is my go-to place when I can't decide where to eat! I have never had a bad experience here. The sweet potato canneloni with shrimp is my FAVORITE!!!! Salmon plate as well as the scallops and potatoes are to die for. Try the red and the white house made sangria, it's nice, light and refreshing. Just what you need in Arizona! Nice staff, great environment. I also reserved a table for 12 for my birthday and they were very accommodating.

I have been to Olive & Ivy many times for happy hour and dinner, but my first time for brunch.  I went with some girlfriends and it was a perfect spring-time girls get-together.  I had the Cinnamon French Toast, which was amazing and my friends had the mixed berries with yogurt, also delish!   I was surprised at the portions (large) and the price (reasonable).  Would love to go back for brunch and try something new.

The food was pretty good, the location is excellent and the atmosphere is excellent.  I want more of a reason to come back. Location, atmosphere, and decent food all positive, I'm just left wanting more, I can't put my finger on it.  The weather in Scottsdale is awesome and olive and ivy is on the water front, which is actually a concrete aqueduct.

I've been here a couple of times but last night really was a disappointment. The food, as always, is very good and always very flavorful and nicely presented. Our issue last night was with our server. She started out okay, a little slow to come check on us or to get our order. Never refilled our drinks or waters. We ordered appetizers and they were long gone by the time she ever came around to take our dinner order.   Once dinner was delivered we NEVER saw her again. We never had our waters refilled once, were never checked on to see if the food came out okay, nothing. We waited an hour before I had to flag down another server just so we could get our bill. The other server was quick to see we had been sitting there with dirty plates and empty glasses and were clearly irritated and she helped us quickly. It was pretty clear that our waitress had left for the night without telling us or any of the other staff to check in at our table.   What was planned to be a quick meal ended up lasting over 3 hours due to the extremely long time we spent waiting. I was just surprised that a restaurant of this caliber would have such poor service. It's unlikely we'll return.

Nice vibe! Lots of cool interior design. We sat at the bar and only order cocktails and appetizers because we couldn't get a table on the patio. So a tip is to call ahead and advance to get a reservation if you likes on the patio because it's absolutely not going to happen if you are walking in on a busy night. My bad! One really interesting appetizer was the trio of bruschetta and you were able to pick which ones you wanted. They were very good and a real fun appetizer to share with my husband. I highly recommend Oil & Ivy if you really want to get a feel for modern Scottsdale culinary landscape.

Although some of the items are a bit on the pricey side for takeaway food, Olive & Ivy does great coffee and pizzas.  $1.73 for a single banana?  They have it Fry's for .19 cents, so that's a huge markup.  Not too good for a budget traveler for sure. They do redeem themselves for having great breakfast items with prices comparable to other eateries in the airport.  Great Irish oats with apples! Their airport menu is not that extensive though but as a jet setter. I can honestly say that this is one of the best places to get your on-board meals before getting on the airplane. Service is friendly, and the line moves pretty quick!  AIRPORT: PHX  T4- A SIDE

Visiting from Washington State.  I heard this place was good, so I took my mom to Olive and Ivy for lunch.  I ordered the turkey grinder and she ordered a salad.  The salad looked good, but I immediately distrusted the grinder they made for me.  The taste was all wrong.  It was very sour, like someone had dumped a ton of vinaigrette all over it.  The bread was way too hard, almost comically so, making it impossible for anyone to eat the damned thing without exerting a reasonable amount of effort.  After a few bites, I became astutely aware that my mouth was bleeding from the razor-like bread slicing into my gums.  I refused to eat anymore and sent my lunch back.  The manager graciously offered to pay for our lunch, due to the fact that their food had actually made me bleed.  Receiving a free lunch was nice, even though I left the establishment hungry and bleeding.  Although, I'm certain my mother enjoyed her experience, I certainly didn't.  I will not be returning to Olive and Ivy, due to the obvious lack of common sense exhibited by the people making the food, the people checking the food for abnormalities (like dangerously hard breads), and the management for their lack of oversight and ability to properly analyze their product.  Serving the right bread should be easy.  Unfortunately, Olive and Ivy made it look very difficult.  Any restaurant that fails so heavily on such mediocre and simple issues should be shunned and avoided.

Processed Cheese?!?  I went to Olive and Ivy with some friends for a birthday brunch - the waiter made it a point to say everything is made from scratch, homemade, the bakers got up at 4am to bake, etc.  Super - sounds great.  I ordered the Ivy Sausage sandwich, which is egg, sausage and cheese on a homemade english muffin.  One bite and I get that odd, familiar flavor of my childhood and realize they had put two slices of Kraft American Processed cheese slices on the sandwich.  What?? Are you telling me that Sam Fox can't have a hunk of cheddar cheese in the back for this?  It ruined an already mediocre sandwich that tasted like it came from a Jimmy Dean freezer box.  I scraped the cheese off the other half and tried to move on, but I'm still angry.  The two stars are for the good cup of cappuccino and the free dessert the waiter brought my friend, which was amazing.  Oh, and for using Open Table so we could make reservations and not have to wait.  None of my friends were terribly impressed with their meal either.

The vibe is super cool. Although trendy and somewhat posh, there's a cozy feel about the restaurant. I've enjoyed patio dining on a few occasions now and it's super cute. The patio is along the canal which gives a relaxed feel to things. Although a bit pricey, you are paying for the location and experience and I'd say it was definitely worth it.
Have only been here twice, but if I lived in the neighborhood, would be dine here often!  Delicious, inventive food and pleasant staff.  Indoors is chic, but the patio is heaven!

Came here for a desert date and to get a couple drinks, we got the sorbet (they make it fresh daily so ask what flavors they have, this time they had lemon and strawberry) YUM it was amazing, it was very refreshing and light ans not to overpowering. I had one of their sangrias and boy was it sure powerful, kinda on the pricy side but that's okay it was expected. The customer service wasn't great the hostess was pretty rude and had an attitude when asking us where we wanted to sit and our waiter was pretty foul too...look I know we aren't eating a full meal but a lot of people WONT jip you on a tip if you are helpful be a dbag  get a dbag tip..coming from someone who knows how the tip system works I won't be the one to dock you money for us nit ordering a full meal..get over it.   So do I recommend here:YES (didn't try regular food but desert won me over that I will go try it again.)  I hope that maybe they both were just having a bad day otherwise I hope you don't get the service we did.

I have been here 5 times and I have never been disappointed. The bread and pesto is to die for. I had the chicken salad this time.  Very nice and a large portion. My favorite is the bruschetta, sadly it wasn't on the weekend brunch/lunch menu so I will have to return on a weekday. The ambiance and location is very nice. Service is always great.

I have only been here for brunch on the weekend so my review is for brunch.  There is a great large area for the restaurant. It is a big open space with lots of seating. Not only that but there is also an outside space that has heaters too next to the water. The brunch is pretty good! The food has a Mediterranean and SoCal feel to it. Very tasty and not too much or too little. Not too shabby for a brunch! I'd recommend a try!

Let me start off by saying the ambience is A+. The service was below average, with the server only appearing once in a blue moon. Thumbs down. I'm honestly shocked the food got such great reviews. It's overpriced for subpar food. I asked for my steak to be cooked medium well (although I prefer my meat more on the medium rare side but I was splitting with my sister) and when it arrived, I could clearly see the bright red meat clearly in the dark, looking inedible. I went with friends and we only deemed one dish acceptable. Do not be fooled by these reviews. Only recommend coming with friends if you want drinks and a cute place for pictures. Disappointing.
Ive had like 5 birthdays here and their food is good as well as drinks. Good service and really nice atmosphere (inside outside patio) which is really romantic at night with their lights.

I always have the best experience at Olive & Ivy. All of the food is delicious but beware the menu is seasonal.. so if you really like something, just know it may not be there next time!  Other than that, I love it here. The service is always phenomenal and everyone is very professional and super nice. The last time I went to olive and ivy was for Mother's Day last year.. and guess where I'm taking my mom this year, yep olive & Ivy. :)

Mason is amazing. Butternut squash items were amazing!  A must. Staff was very attentive to our larger group of ladies. Wait was a bit, but the restaurant was packed. Took a while for food to come out. But the staff kept coming by to tell us this, so no worries. We truly enjoyed all the different courses! Def going to be coming back!

Nice place with a great patio area. I really liked the creativeness of the menu and the overall styling of the bistro.  The combination of the classic and contemporary is very evident at Olive and Ivy.  I would recommended this to anyone looking for an upscale setting but still wanting to be relaxed.  I like to enjoy a nice mojito out on the waterfront. Very nice in the hot Arizona heat. AHHHHH

We reserved a private room for a bachelorette party dinner and it was AMAZING! The restaurant is beautiful, and being in the Stamp room was extra special.  The food was delicious and the service was first class. Lauren and Kevin took amazing care of our party! The room has a minimum and we were going to be short, so instead of just paying the difference, Lauren recommended a champagne toast for our guest of honor which allowed us to use our funds and made the night extra special! It was a dinner we won't soon forget. I would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a special night out and we will be back next time we are in town!

What a fantastic place for a girl's night out! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is both lively and private. On weekends they have a DJ.  Their appetizer and small plates selections make for a perfect tapas experience. As far as entrees, the scallops with polenta are amazing. Check out the hummus and bacon wrap dates for appetizers. Looking forward to another fun night at Olive and Ivy!

Alissa our server was beyond INCREDIBLE. We had a reservation for a group of 6 of us who were in town for a bachelorette dinner party. She was thorough, courteous, prompt, sweet, and provided such an special "experience" for all of us that we won't forget. We had a couple bottles of wine, and her bottle service was perfect. The bruschetta was to die for. She even delivered some shots for our table in honor of the bachelorette! She also delivered a second surprise... a dessert platter! We didn't have to ask for her to do anything "special" for our bachelorette... she automatically did it! That has never happened to me before at a restaurant.   She happily provided us some recommendations of places we should go to continue our evening, and I really can't say enough good things about her, the restaurant, and the service/experience that we were provided.  Thanks ALISSA!

Came here for a business dinner and had a wonderful time! The service was perfect, very attentive but not annoying.  The bartenders we also great and the food was delicious.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated and cooler than the outside even when it is hot and the walls are open.  We will come back for personal when we are in town next time.

The place is beautiful and the small plates quite well done, but how can the offer a lasagne Bolognese that is closer to chili with a few pieces do pasta arranged in a bowl? And since when is cannelloni a rectangular ravioli? And although the waitress was attentive, our water glasses were never refilled! Too bad because we had high hopes after we read most reviews.
3.5 On the pricey side (then again it is the airport) but the Mediterranean salad was fresh, and it did taste good.

Beautiful ambiance. The first time I dined here, I had ordered several plates (bruschetta, flatbreads, which were all pretty good). This time we had come for a late night dinner and wanted something light. The hummus was delicious and one of the best ones I had in Arizona. The San Tan porter and Sedona hefe were refreshing. Hummus was delicious. San tan porter and Sedona hefe were refreshing. Great place for a date or  to catch up with friends while munching on good food.

Is it a get your drink on and flirt your a$$ off, because you look damn good tonight or is it a fine dining establishment...?  Well, it is definitely the former but fine dining, mmmm, not so much.   On the bar, seen and be seen crowd, it is awesome. Dress to the nines because it feels like Vegas ladies. People look fabulous and you can people watch all night and not be bored. The drinks are stiff, damn expensive and well worth it.   The food...Denny's sous chef was cooking the night I was eating and was doing a less than slamfastic job. We had the calamari and it was deep fried and resembled calamari in shape only. I had the bacon wrapped pork and was extremely unimpressed. The bacon was thin and slim. The sauce was dark, syrupy and had no particular taste. The ceasar salad was pure Denny's. Cut pieces of iceberg lettuce with a mayo dressing and big croutons.  Strangly, marscapone cheese was  a common ingredient in many dishes, the sauces and the soup. Given marscapone's bland taste, I didn't find adding it to entrees that innovative or interesting. So, get dressed up, get your drink on, but given the location, the Scottsdale restaurant scene is your oyster, so dine elsewhere.

Olive and Ivy serves up refreshing salads and sandwiches, perfect for a lunchtime meal.  Portions are big, and you will leave satisfied and very full.  Service here is cheerful and attentive.  I would definitely like to go again to try their weekend brunch!

This is place has an incredible patio view in downtown Scottsdale. The food was delicious and the view from the patio is awesome. It's one of the busiest places in the area, so there's something to be said about that. We saw lots of people waiting to be seated so a reservation is merited.

Worst experience I have had. Their manager had no concept of how to work with customers. There was a misunderstanding about our reservation time and all he would say is "read the contract" . He had no authority to address the issue. We will never go to this restaurant again.

You walk in to impressive decor and a friendly hostess. Server was also friendly and helpful.   My appetizer was tasty and arrived quickly. .    The Caesar salad was too cheesy for my taste and the lasagna was more sauce than noodles.   I did like the cherry sorbet...

The food was fantastic and came out quickly. I had the Mediterranean salad w/ grilled chicken. The drinks were delicious. Its a big open space with a huge bar and a cool vibe. Our server was friendly but we had to ask him SEVERAL times for things like ketchup, hot sauce, water, etc. because he kept forgetting to bring it over to us. Other than that we had a great time! I would definitely recommend checking this place out.
This place was simply amazing! The food, drinks and service were delightful!   I had the smoked salmon bagel and it's legit one of the best I've ever had!

A wonderful, fairly new restaurant addition to the newly added local food spots at the airport terminal 4.   They offer delicious breakfast sandwiches and homemade flavorful muffins. During lunch a fresh variety of deli sandwiches are served on ciabatta bread. The homemade Sicilian style pizza is a must.   The seating area is comfortable and modern.
I have only ever eaten the breakfast (egg and avocado sandwich) and pastries (cupcakes and bear claws) here, and both are very good!! The staff is very friendly and efficient.

One of my favorite go-to spots! It never gets old. Food recommendation: the bouillabaisse. So good!   Bottom line- the food is delicious and you honestly can't beat the fun, chic atmosphere. They have a gorgeous outdoor patio for lounging with a drink plus plenty of bar space and indoor and outdoor seating.   Highly recommend!

I like the scene of the restaurant and the food was decent. The service was commendable and very friendly. The only disappointment was that for the price of the food I was just hoping for better. I would come here again but it just wouldn't be my first choice.

I had never been to Olive and Ivy, I chose to take my mother there for Mother's Day. We usually try to avoid eating out on a holiday, but this special menu looked good on line, and we thought "what the heck".  Boy, are we glad we did!!  Service was superb! We had Mark Anthony as our waiter - yes, that is his name! In fact, he was so good that I said he must be a trainer - yes, he is!!  Food was EXCELLENT!! I'm making a reservation for Friday evening. I look forward to experiencing it non-holiday!  The only issue was the table situation. They sat us at a table for two that - no kidding, was in the middle of the walk way! We moved it a bit over and it made it a little better.  One of the hostesses came over and asked if we wouldn't mind moving over so they could fit a 4-top next to us - yes, we would mind moving over - we just moved from there because we were in the middle of the walk area - what did they do? They moved the 4-top around us to where they wanted us to move to and what do you suppose happened?  The table of 3 (very gracious ladies because they didn't say anything) were forced to sit in the middle of the walkway and were literally in the way of the waiters and busboys trying to get around them!! One woman was scrunched over by me to try to get out of the way! They are better people than I for not saying something!  Mr. Fox runs his restaurants like a well oiled machine, it would surprise me if he knew they were trying to fit in tables where they don't belong - especially since it truly hinders the guest experience! I'm not dinging them a star though, I chalk it up to a holiday.  Everyone knows not to eat out on a holiday!!  When we go this Friday and those tables are no where to be found, that will confirm my hunch!  I hope Mark Anthony is working on Friday night!!

The short rib sandwich was uber delicious, as was the bread, salmon flatbread, and the coffee! We all know how much I love coffee, and I loved it, including the glass.  I also love how they flavor their water every day in a different way.  Another thumbs up for Fox Restaurant Concepts!

When for brunch... Solid food, good service, and the interior is beautiful.  There is a grab-and-go market with sandwiches and pastries.  Good wine, beer and drink menu.  You pay a little extra for being at Scottsdale Fashion Square.

Have been to Olive and Ivy in Scottsdale twice now; both times when visiting my daughter who lives here.  It is in a great location, near the Fashion  Square mall and old-town Scottsdale, and right on the river, where you can sit outside.  Incredibly comfortable seating outside, and it is pretty well shaded, so you are out of the Arizona sun mostly.   This time was for lunch, and the three of us enjoyed a chopped salad, a mediterranean salad, and a chicken grinder.  There were no complaints. The service was fast, friendly and professional.  It is a good be if you are in that neighborhood!

We were given a gift card for Olive & Ivy. We were thrilled to go back for a second visit.  We got Bouillabaisse which, she is still raving about and overjoyed that she has some left over for tomorrow. (That is not over exaggerated at all!)  We also got the Bacon wrapped tenderloin, which was nothing short of perfect! Juicy and tender and wonderful flavor!  The desserts were just as good as the entrées. The Caramelized cake is dangerous! Stuffed, and yet we could not put down our spoons and let any of this go without being eaten!  To top it off the ambiance is open and welcoming. There is plenty of outdoor seating if you want to enjoy the Arizona weather. And better yet, Mason, our waiter, was very attentive and helpful! We were very impressed by him.  Olive & Ivy will definitely be a go-to eatery for us! We highly recommend!

We came for dinner just before 6 on a Thursday. I had noticed they had happy hour until 6, but the hostess informed us this was only at the bar. We could have saved a few $$ if we had just done that, but honestly the food was so good I didn't feel bad paying more.   Bread was brought to our table and served with a pesto dipping sauce - I ate the remainder of the sauce with my hands it was so good.  We ordered the Mediterranean salad and piccante flatbread. I also ordered a red sangria - which was different from normal sangria since it had crushed berries it it - but it was one of the best sangrias I've ever had. The salad and flatbread were delicious. The salad was big and worth the price - flatbread was good but maybe a better deal on the happy hour menu since it was smaller than expected.   The food was the perfect portion so we still had room for dessert. We decided on the coconut cakes with blood orange sorbet. This is probably gross but I honestly did not want to swallow my cake - I kept it in my mouth like a fine red wine and savored every last piece.   This restaurant needs to come to Chicago - I would be all over it like white on rice.

Excellent service from our waiter Kalei!!  Atmosphere was good but the music was a bit too loud out in the patio for conversation.  Brussel sprout bruschetta was exceptionally delicious.  Sea Bass was a tad overcooked but the caramelized cauliflower accompaniment was tender and tasty.  The lemon flavored dessert was a little tangy and the cake just melts in your mouth.  The coconut cake served with blood orange sorbet was average, couldn't taste any orange in the sorbet.  Definitely request to sit in Kalei's section again.

I really, really enjoy this place. I think they have such a cool atmosphere going on and their food is just to die for.   We always make a reservation when we come and the service is always wonderful.   I usually get the Filet that comes in a horseradish sauce that is amazing! Not what you would think, and not spicy. Just flavorful and savory. My mouth waters just thinking about it!  The wine list and desert list are also great. Great place for date night or just to grab dinner with friends.   They also sell gift cards at Costco that are $100 in food for only $70! Great deals and great food. One of the best!

The decor is fantastic, great location, and the food is good! The wait was 1.45 hours but we got a table by the bar within 5 min. I got the Tuna salad sandwich w/bacon (great) because this is American and it was the right thing to do.

One of many in a line of interesting restaurants by this restaurant group. The decor is really impressive, great for dates or social groups. Everyone in my party loved the lighting, staff, and service.   The menu is hit or miss, we had quite a few misses in the appetizers / starters. A lot of things lacked seasoning, other things were just unoriginal.   The meal was going downhill until we hit our entrees which were absolute home runs. The pasta was amazing, executed really well, delicate but flavorful. For desert the outstanding dish was the homemade ice cream bar, the salt was a great touch, it was original and a perfect closer.   I'd recommend this place if you have money to spend figuring out whats good for yourself otherwise I'd stick to some of the recommendations made on yelp without a thought of straying.

This place was a surprise.  We were at the mall nearby and saw the reviews.  Will keep this review short.  Waiter wasn't that great, the person who was shadowing him was actually much better and friendlier.  He also poured our alcoholic beverages at brunch (only one per person) as a much lower level then any table around us, by about half.    Food, pretty decent.  One person ordered the Margherita pizza.  good crust, right about of tomato, the mozz did NOT taste fresh whatsoever, but the weird thing, my sister asked for some Ricotta cheese to be added, and it made the dish!  Another person ordered the egg sandwich which was just okay, when it's mostly bun/roll versus inside, it's never a good thing.  And lastly I had the grilled chicken panini.  There was not a lot of chicken on this at all, but the aioli made up for the sandwich as a whole.  Is it worth going, yeah.  The atmosphere is awesome, place is stunning, food, average.

Took my parents here for our traditional weekly dinner and it was lovely! I thought I had made reservations through the automated system but my age must be showing because they didn't have us on the list and thus no outside seating and wow, they have some lovely outside seating among these great heavily leafed trees but still, seated in less than 15 minutes.  Instead of full meals we shared a series of appetizers. I wasn't crazy ab out the Bruschetta but the lamb meatballs were good. My parents also enjoyed the hummus and I guess my overall favorite was the fresh sliced bread with the pesto sauce amazing. I did have a cocktail, the Cactus Blossom and the server did warn me it was on the sweet side but honestly, taste reminded me somewhat of cough syrup so I won't order that one again. However, you get your money's worth as I definitely felt the cocktail when it was done.  I guess I thought the food was good but what I especially liked was that the place had that operational hum of excellence which I've come to expect from the Fox Restaurants Concepts group. They know how to run eating establishments with a high end focus  and it shows. I look forward to coming back here again, though I have to try that outside seating when the weather is nice, looks wonderful. :-)
Always great food, small portions and pricey. I try not to babble on and such, but yelp does not like short reviews.

My husband took me here for my 30th birthday! YAH! I was not disappointed! I thought the decor here was out of this world and it takes so much talent to design like this....As some of you are food snobs I am a food and ambiance snob. We had the pita chips and hummus to start which was so good. A great feature added to the hummus was cucumbers which added a nice crunch. I also enjoyed tomato bisque soup which was out of this world. I think the waiter we had was nice but did not seem to have much of a personality which I do look for in my dining experience. I would go back here but not too soon as I have a whole list of places I would like to try now that I just moved here!
This place is good but the plates were small. The food was good but a little pricey.  But it is Scottsdale so that is to be expected.

Very nice restraunt, the menu is very complicated and I don't know what have of the foods even are! I just simply order bruschetta or kids pasta due to the face that I don't know anything else on the menu, and everything is quite pricey.

Came here for Happy Hour on a Wednesday and grabbed a seat in the lounge. This place has a really nice ambience with great lighting and friendly staff. Had the Mediterranean salad with shrimp (not on happy hour) and shared 3 of the bruschettas- avocado, salmon, and prosciutto (3 for $10 on HH). Also had a glass of Pinot Noir ($5 on HH). Everything was really delicious and not too heavy- will definitely be back to try some of their other menu options. The mall also offers plenty of free and easy parking.

This place has a fun and welcoming atmosphere. The food is good too. I had a fish dish that was fresh and tasty.  I've been here a few times, so it must be pretty good. I love the outside seating as well as the bar area. There is always activity around.

We came here for a casual Sunday brunch and really loved the ambiance of the outdoor patio area. While service was a a bit slow, the food was delicious! There is an amazing coffee and gelato bar that your can carry out but I really loved the lattes and baked goods. Plenty of vegetarian options and a great place for big groups. The complimentary bread and fresh pesto was delicious and definitely made our salads a bit yummier!

Unfortunately I spend my fair share of time down concourse A of Sky Harbor's Terminal 4. Fortunately this Olive & Ivy location opens early, closes late, has good food, and seems to hire friendly, kind, caring people. I've been here multiple times and have never had a negative experience. Now folks will complain about the prices but it's an airport restaurant so you must have reasonable expectations. Average panini will run you ten bucks and a side is a couple of bucks.
I really love this place. We had our company christmas dinner there, and numerous dinners among friends. Each time the food was good and service was prompt.

O&I is the bees knees - face down (ass up) one of my favorite restaurants in Scottsdale/Phoenix, for sure!  My significant lover and I stumbled upon this place by accident, we were actually trying to find Culinary Dropout but my (retarded) GPS led us astray but lo and behold - Olive & Ivy stared at us...and we stared right back into its glorious face.  It's a huge restaurant and has a very upscale/classy vibe, but still maintains a romantically casual mood.  There's plenty of outdoor seating but what really takes the cake is the private dining in the back, which you typically need to reserve in advance unless you're lucky.  Service is always friendly and spot on but, of course, what really shines is the food.  Allow me to plan out your entire meal for you (you're welcome):  1. Start with the trifecta order of bruschetta and pick: prosciutto & fig, manchego, and fresh mozzarella.  You have not truly enjoyed bruschetta until you eat the aforementioned ones.  2. Prosciutto & mascarpone tortelli for sure.  3. Chicken scallopini - so tender, so juicy, so flavorful, AND it has prosciutto and mozzarella.  What more could you ask for?  4. If you're feeling baller I say it's justified to spend $38 on the Filet of beef.  You will not regret your choice...unless you accidentally forget and order the bone-in ribeye instead (I warned you).  5. I'm not big on getting dessert here since Gelato Spot is just down the street, but if you're up for it - try the peanut butter pudding.  Bonus Tip: Go to Costco (or visit the website) and pick up the Fox Restaurant Concepts gifit cards.  You can buy two $50 giftcards for only $79.99, so that's 20% savings right there.  And there you have it.  Get your gift cards from Costco, make your reservation on opentable, book the private dining area, experience heavenly flavors, and get ready to fall in love with Olive & Ivy.
Gorgeous outdoor patio. Tasty sangria. Server indicated all food made fresh on the daily (including pasta, flat bread crusts, pesto, etc) .... Heavenly :)

The pasta has great taste and is prepared fantastically. The only down side is the portion side. They served very small portions for an entree. The environment and atmosphere is fantastic and sheik, I loved it.

My friend told me that this would be the perfect first date spot and he was correct! The atmosphere was amazing and the weather was great so requested to sit on the patio. Our server was very knowledgable about all the menu items as well as the wine list.  Will definitely be coming back here soon!

This is my wife and my favorite date night location. The filet is reasonably priced and amazingly seasoned. I always get one of the fish dishes and wow. He bruschetta is also to die for. Definitely get a reservation as this place can get quite busy but it's worth planning ahead. Yum!!

Had dinner and drinks at the bar last night... the female bartender never smiled once... she looked pissed every time we asked for another drink or a water refill.  Never asked if we needed anything, how was our meal etc.  Back in 2007 - 2010... they had truly professional bartenders.  They knew your name, they'd anticipate your needs etc.  They've moved down market with the current staff... last nights bartender belongs at Zipps.
Bruschetta and drinks are good. Food is definitely mediocre. I would only go here for happy hour. Not worth full price. Service ok.
High prices, salad is bitter. Service is just okay. Changing my star from 2 to 1. The waitress places the silverware directly on the table.  Very unsanitary!

I hosted a large work event on the patio with heavy appetizers and drinks for about 40 people. Our main server, Daniel, as an absolute ROCK STAR - he took care of our whole group swiftly with a smile. Daniel has the ability to take drink and food orders for about 20 people at a time, all in his head, without missing a thing. I cannot say enough good about Daniel - ask for him, he will take care of you.  Otherwise, the food was really good - bacon wrapped dates, flatbreads, ravioli served family style, beet salad and hummus. They also have interesting cocktails, sangria and a great wine/beer selection.   We will be back for future events - thank you!

Had dinner here this evening with some family from out of town. Stellar. Split the Fresh Mozzarella, Fig & Prosciutto and Manchego Bruschetta. All wonderful. The guys both ordered the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin, sister-in-law ordered the scallops and I ordered the spicy shrimp risotto. I had a bite of each and believe me when I say you can't go wrong with any of those entrees! Our server was friendly and made lots of recommendations and my boyfriend and sister-in-law both agreed the bartender made a mean Dirty Martini:) Overall a solid experience. Atmosphere feels upscale while still being casual, we'll definitely be back!

I visited Olive and Ivy last night with a few of my friends and I have to say that the service we received from Thomas Mann was outstanding! !!  He was attentive to our table while having to serve several other tables.  The food was excellent.   The portions were just right Just as a suggestion when serving the lamb meatballs,  is it possible to have mint jelly as a compliment to this tasty dish? I will be back in the near future.  I thought the restaurant was absolutely beautiful with the lights all around.

I stopped here for a quick breakfast on my way home, while I was at the Phoenix International Airport. It was a good choice. The breakfast sandwich I had was hot, fresh and quick to go. The cinnamon bun I indulged in was a good-bad life decision (good because it was tasty and fresh, bad because, well, it's a big ol' cinnamon bun that I really didn't need, but impulse bought). If on the off chance I'm in the region again, I would stop in here for a bite again.

Extremely disappointed in my experience at Olive & Ivy. I went for a dinner with a few friends who, like me, had flew in from out of state and made reservations to dine. The service was absolutely horrifying. We were seated by a hostess who didn't do so much as to smile or make eye contact once with our group. She was cold and uninviting which was surprising considering there wasn't a crowd or any reason for her to be so distant. When we were seated, it took about ten minutes before we were given a menu. I had a Caesar salad which was unfortunately so horrible I had trouble getting beyond a few forks. The bruschetta's were okay at best.  The only appeal this restaurant provided was aesthetic. It is beautiful. If you are looking for a great dinner, drive past Olive & Ivy. However, if you're after a gorgeous dining decor, this is your place to go.

I LOVED the service!  We had a car issue and had to push our reservations 30 minutes.  Even though they were completely booked because of Mothers Day and Prom...they were willing to work with us.  I told them we would leave when the next reservation for our table arrived.  They were awesome...attentive, quick, efficient and so professional without being pushy.  The manager even sent us over a free appetizer to help ease our earlier evening stresses I guess...how nice is that!   No only was the service amazing...but the food was EXCELLENT!!  This is when spending the money is worth it!  The white sangria was wonderful, the bacon wrapped dates were amazing and the butter salad and chicken with prosciutto were worth every bite!    Would highly recommend this particular area for out-of-town guests.  We walked over the bridge and enjoyed looking over the water and the beautiful grounds.  Very trendy area with at least a dozen restaurants/lounges/patios to hang out in.  Or, take an extended golf cart to old town Scottsdale to listen to some country music.

Went here with some out-of-town friends on Sat night.  Their pick - so glad they made this choice.    Excellent service with a top notch, well informed waiter.  Between 4 of us, we ordered a variety of items including the hummus appetizer (just spicy enough), sweet potato cannelloni, veal & spinach ravioli, some new tortellini dish and a rib eye steak dinner.  I tried bites of everything and all I can say is WOW!  It was all I could do the stop myself from jumping into the dish and rolling around in the sauce.  Very fresh and sauces were light, not the heavy pasta thing you might expect.    The only minor criticism is the house salad.  People, it's just a bowl of lettuce - NO enhancements, not even a lone crouton.  The vinaigrette dressing helped make up for the lack in the bowl but I think they really need to consider perking up the lonely lettuce.  It's kind of a loud atmosphere indoors.  We were seated in a cozy booth that faced the patio so some of the noise was blocked.  They had some kind of dj-something playing music and a few people dancing (??) behind us.  Still it was quiet enough for conversation at our booth.  The patio looked very inviting, that could be a good location for next time (yes, there will be a next time).  I highly recommend reservations here.  Fortunately we did have them and were seated right away.  Just in front of us were 4 people who were walk-ins and were apparently told it was a 3 hour wait??  Needless to say, they were walk outs after that news.    Anyway, I'm a new fan here.  Looking forward to more culinary experiences with Olive & Ivy.

My mothers birthday is on NYE so I wantged to treat her to a nice meal with nice ambience early in the evening before things got crazy. I unfortunately waited until just days prior to NYE to request a reservation and Olive & Ivy was already full so I had them put me on a wait list. Id never been to O&I but the Waterfront view is what I was looking for and the NYE Menu sounded amazing, I was elated that they called me early afternoon NYE to tell me they could make our reservation.  Our waiter Stew was polite, attentive, efficient. The complimentary pesto dipping sauce was delish and I would have been content eating just that. I ordered scallops, which were good. I havent had scallops that I liked that much in a long time. I also got a small portion steak with the scallops. My mother ordered salmon which she was enjoyed. After I told Stew it was my mothers birthday he brought her a slice of chocolate cake and candle on him which made my mother feel special.  I was very happy that we were able to get our reservation and it will be my first choice for lunch or dinner when Im in the area again
We had a girls dinner here for a special occasion. Love the ambiance of this place and the open air with indoor/outdoor seating. House-made pasta and bread, yum! Our server Mark Anthony was amazing.

NOTE: This is a review of Olive and Ivy during the day, not at night when the douche bags of Scottsdale invade!  The atmosphere is impressive--the patio is relaxing (I just have to laugh every time I think of the "waterfront" scam that Scottsdale is using to fool property owners--it is a big ditch!!)  Anyway, I love the variety of their weekend brunch, unique egg dishes, yogurt, and  cinnamon french toast.  They also have pastries, juices and even gelato!    I love taking a break from shopping for O&I brunch on the weekends, but I would be fine to never go there again after dark.  It is a classic Scottsdale experience in which the women are competing for most makeup and least clothes and the men are all wearing the same rhinestone Ed Hardy or 7 Diamonds shirt and way too much of whatever cologne is the 2008 equivalent of Drakkar Noir.  Anyway, the brunch is fantastic!

I have been here many times for lunch and it's great - 'an old reliable'.  The pesto and fresh bread is delicious.. I nearly always have the Salmon for my lunch....always excellent. This place gets really busy, but it's always good.
For the airport in Phoenix:  Good food. Fast and reasonably priced.   Loved the snickerdoodle cookies.

We recently had a very short layover in Phoenix and decided to stop by Olive & Ivy for a quick dinner. We were really impressed with the quality and freshness of the food but we were even more impressed with their customer service! The staff was super friendly and even offered to clear our togo containers when we were finished with our meals.   Even beyond the restaurant setting their staff went above and beyond. As soon as we boarded our flight my husband realized he was missing his wallet. We knew he couldn't get off the plane but he wanted to go talk to the flight attendant about what he could do to try and get it back. Before he could even make it up to the front of the plane the flight attendant was heading down the isle with his wallet in hand. Someone from the restaurant had found it, gone to AA to find out what flight we were on, what seat we were in, and had it delivered safely to us.   We are so incredibly thankful and will make sure to stop by Olive & Ivy every time we pass through Phoenix from now on! Thank you so much for such good food and service!

I was at Scottsdale, Arizona for a week long work conference when I stumbled upon this restaurant as one my hotel's "food recommendations" I love Mediterranean food so I decided why not! Since I was alone, I didn't wait too long to be seated and sat in front of the servers/chefs bar. I did feel a little uncomfortable because I came alone (definitely a place to go with significant others or a group of people) but gladly enjoyed the opportunity to watch the servers/chefs work. My waitress was really nice too (unfortunately forgot the name) and kept me company when she had downtime.   I ordered the shrimp scampi risotto, the Mediterranean salad, and a glass of white wine. I absolutely loved every single part of my meal. The Mediterranean salad was a great palette cleanser (huge portions) and the shrimp risotto was perfectly cooked. -1 star because it was a little too salty that I needed lemon to wash it down. I was still impressed because the risotto consistency was great and in my opinion hard to perfect. The complimentary bread was pretty tasty too!   I absolutely adored the romantic ambiance.. wish my boyfriend was able to join me :(

Olive & Ivy has been a business lunch place of choice on three occasions. I originally had an amazing salad, which continues to produce a drooling pair of lips. Can a salad merit 5-stars? Yes. Yes, because I do not enjoy salads 99/100 times. Unfortunately, I don't see it on their menu and I've only been back once since I first ordered it here. If I return, it's the chopped chicken salad (+corn) for me!  They also have delicious mac'n'cheese, pizza, and WINE! Who doesn't enjoy a personal-sized carafe of wine during lunch? There's nothing like jumping into the office with a few of your worries thrown down the hatch like a chilled white in the early afternoon!

If you want to get your 'swank' on, this place is for you.  It's a fun spot to meet friends for a drink and appetizers.  I love the tapas plate which has olives, fruit, cheese, pita bread, etc.  It's delicious and well priced.

Moderate pricing and gourmet type comfort food. This is one of the places we like to take our guests because the have one of the best patios in Scottsdale. A staple alongside the water district, the setting is comfortable and welcoming. Sit on the patio if the weather is right but the indoors is good too. Recommend!

My mom and I came here for a nice little ladies night out and it was very enjoyable. We sat on the patio which was beautiful! It was hot outside, but there were misters and the trees provided great shade and added a bit of coolness. The pesto and focaccia was delicious. We tried the bruschetta trio...the goat cheese and asparagus, manchego and another one. All were good. The funghi flatbread was good, and the beet salad was great! Overall the atmosphere was very nice.

I've been to a handful of the FRC restaurants out in the real world and they seem to have taken over this portion of the terminal. Had the breakfast sandwich which was solid and an iced coffee which was meh.   Definitely a good food option in the airport. 4 (airport) stars.

We loved this place. Came in with a big group of 13 for a nice dinner.  Great food, appetizers main courses and desserts good wine list.  Love the decor and location, and the staff is hot.    Easy walk to bars from dinner.  Check it out.

If you're in Scottsdale with a big group you should book a table at Olive & Ivy. We were in town for a bachelorette weekend and came for dinner on Saturday night. It was my favorite part of the weekend! The atmosphere is fun and upbeat and the restaurant itself is beautiful! We had a reservation and were seated in a corner of the patio immediately on arrival.  The servers were attentive but not overbearing. They gave us free lemon drop shots for the group at the end of our meal in honor of the bachelorette!  The food and drinks were good - we tried every bruschetta for the table! My favorites were the prosciutto, manchego, and avocado! I got the shrimp risotto for my meal and it was delicious but a little heavy. My strawberry and thyme cocktail was very refreshing without being too sweet.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

Poor service =no service tonight. Waited over 15 minutes, waiters, busboys, people with pitchers of water walked past us several times and not one person spoke to us.  Told manager and he offered us a free meal and coupons to other restaurants. We declined. He continued to follow us out side.  Had to tell him several times NO.    Guess they did not like that we were dressed for bike riding, even the hostess turned her nose up at us  Hey management- bike riders are local!   Can you afford such bad word of mouth from us?
This place is super cool and hip. I love the patio and the food and service was good.

Great place to grab a quick bite at the Scottsdale "Waterfront," and I loved that they could accommodate our big party on short notice right before the major Stanford pep rally across the street.   We had fantastic service, I loved the proprietary wine selection (the pinot noir was especially good), and the food was delicious.  My only complaint is that the portions were just way too small for the prices being charged. Salads were nice and big, but the $25 fish entree was maybe 4 oz of fish, and the scallops only came with 3 smallish scallops on the plate. Definitely not enough of a meal for any of our men! We wound up needing to stop for fast food after the pep rally because they were all starving again an hour and a half later.

I am giving Olive & Ivy only 1 star because the employees have no idea how to run a restaurant or deal with customers.  We went there to celebrate a Birthday which did not go too well.  First when we made the reservation we were told to come in before 3pm on a Sunday so we could order from 3 menus well when we arrived, we were told a different story about the menus and told something else by another person and the story kept changing depending on who you spoke with.  Well this restaurant should be closed between 3-5pm on weekends as the only items are flatbreads, a select few salads and apps but no one tells you this when you call.  So we had planned to order dinner but were told we could not something to do with the kitchen, but we were also told we could not order from the brunch or lunch menu either so we were stuck as to what to order, well it was terrible - the flat breads were terrible, dry and way to salty. The bacon burger was not worth $12.00 and it was just a real bad time and the manager would not comp anything for all the bad information and did not seem to care we could not find anything good to eat on the menu.  We had told the waitress we could not handle anything spicy as to let us know if we ordered something which was spicy well do not order the hummus, we were not told it had jalapenos in it even though we asked, they did not take it off the bill even though 5 of the 6 people at the table did not eat it.  We will not visit again, very bad experience, bad manager, bad customer service.  not a good fox restaurant, plus the uniforms looked like construction workers.  The food, was well not worth the money and have had much better elsewhere.

We came here for my bachelorette party dinner.  We had a reservation for 6 and were seated right away.  We ordered some appetizers, like the variety of brushetta.  They were all very good.  For my meal I had a small cesar salad and a flatbread.  The flatbread was ok but the salad was very good.  We all had drinks.  The service was great and the food was awesome.  They even brought me a special dessert since it was for my bachelorette party.
Unbelievable ahi. Service was adequate.  Mood and ambiance was good. Background music was nice. Will go again sometime.

We went to Olive & Ivy for our third time a couple weeks ago with friends.  Each experience has been different, and I must say that this place needs to make up its mind.  Is it a trendy nighttime dining establishment or a casual grocery cafe?  I prefer the latter, although the restaurant seems to punish me for it.  Granted there are great menu selections and the food has been reliably good.  But the prices are high, the service mediocre, and the interior design more fitting of a Vegas night club.  I would never make this a first choice, although I also try not to complain if dragged there.

I had an awesome time here. This place is rocking after 8:00 p.m. The bar and restaurant was packed and the DJ kept the atmosphere upbeat and festive. The bread and pesto was amazing. I couldn't stop eating it.  I ended up having the ravioli and veal and it was delicious. When the food came my initial thought was that the serving size was a bit small however once I began eating I realized how thick and rich the ravioli was. I ended up being completely full after that entree. I also had the apricot and cheesecake for desert. It was an interesting combination that I've never had before so I wanted to try it. That was just ok in my opinion. I would've enjoyed just plain cheesecake better. All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed my visit here and will definitely return.
Good spot.  Food is good, service is good, and vibe is good.  Love the patio here.  Another great Sam Fox restaurant.  Food: 3 Service: 4 Ambiance: 4.5
Excellent food and the waitress was so nice. The place itself is fun too. I came on a Friday evening and they had a DJ. Awesome patio and just a fun evening. I will be back again. Lib this place!

Olive and ivy remains my favorite restaurant. Their menu changes with the season, but the ahi with snap peas and the cannelloni sweet potato pasta ..my mouth is watering as I type. Their bread and pesto is incredible. They have a few cocktails I really love, and the view is killer.
Great place to get a quick bite to eat before your flight.

I am giving them 3 stars because we made advance reservations for a table of 12 to celebrate my best friends MBA. Upon arrival, they only had a table of 8 set-up for us. We addressed this and they said to go ahead and sit down and they would find a solution. We had to inquire several more times and we even offered a couple of solutions to push together available tables we saw.   In the end, they sat us at two separate tables because they could not accommodate a table of 12. If that is the case, they should have mentioned this very important fact when we called to make the reservation. There were available tables and space to push tables together so I still don't understand why they didn't do it.   The food was good. The service was good. But this one very important detail marred our experience because half of our friends had to sit at an entirely different table and it was very awkward.

I absolutely love this place. The ambience inside is swanky, classy, and unique with wonderful friendly service. Our waiter was fantastic.  I was pleasantly astounded by how amazingly delicous the bruschetta was. Definitely pick 3 for $11 to try as many as possible! We got the proscuitto &fig, manchego, and butternut squash. I was in culinary heaven. I'm not even that interested in bruschetta, but these are an absolute must-get here. They were each an explosion of impressively creative flavors.  From the Small Plates menu we had the Artichoke Hearts, which was a fresh and yummy arugula salad. I was initially most excited about the Lamb meatballs- but this dish was the least tasty and we could've passed on it.   We had the Kale Salad from the Greens section which was very good as well. I liked that they allow half order of salads when you order an entree since when forced to decide between getting a salad and a hearty meal, my vegetable serving of the meal normally loses the battle.  From the Pasta section... omg the Sweet Potato Cannelloni... disclaimer: I love most things made of sweet potato, but this was truly a delicious dish with soft sweet potato center wrapped in pasta, with a creamy mushroom and spinach sauce. We couldn't finish it since we had ordered so much, and I very happily finished the rest as breakfast in bed as my first agenda of the next day.  Overall, one of the best meals I've had of late. Compliments to the chef for a creative and delicious menu.

There is absolutely nothing bad I can say about Olive & Ivy. Of course it's my first time, but the whole experience was gratifying.   We ordered the lamb meatballs which were wonderful, and the focaccia and pesto were to die for... Seriously. People, I am not exaggerating when I say the pesto is amazing. For dinner, my husband ordered the Mediterranean flat bread and I ordered the chicken scaloppini. I loved them both and would highly recommend them.   The place and the ambiance is so fabulous. It's an open kitchen which is so welcoming. The music is spot on, and the patio complements the indoor seating perfect. Overall, the Scottsdale waterfront scene is a must go to, and Olive and Ivy is the perfect place to start.

Love the rest - my oatmeal however this am is basically a bowl of beige mush who knows how long that's over cooked to become that non food like... And no hot tea!  I know it's hard to believe, but not everyone drinks coffee.

only been a couple times, but had Gluten Free options, had healthy options and they were good.  Lastly, they had an organic wine on the menu which was also good.  Love the outside.  Pretty place in general.  Now, the one at the airport... lets just say they need a little work.

Like it they have good coffee and I'm pretty sure their food is good. Nice restaurant and nice staff. The remodeling looks great. I recommend it to anyone more than likely you'll like it for whatever occasion. Very busy.

Been here many times, and also just had our work holiday party here. Classy establishment, excellent food, and nice wines. I love the patio, it's nice and doesn't even seem like you are in AZ anymore. Only knock on this place is that the waiter thought he had free reign during our holiday party and kept refilling our wine like he was replenishing water. Endless wine with no idea how many you have had? You can derive your own results for how that nigh ended up for a few people.
I love the ambiance and atmosphere of this place! The food was excellent. The only slight downfall is the limited menu options. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and will revisit!

Totally love this place. Friend and I on vacation dressed up to hit up some bars and came here for dinner. Everything was good and service was amazing. Lamb meatballs. Margarita pizza and veal + spinach ravioli. Very trendy place for sure.

Just had lunch here and it was delish, I had the salmon Caesar salad and my brother had the turkey pastrami sandwich...YUM YUM...Service was great too..Look forward to going back here when I'm in Scottsdale!

My mother and I ate there last week, and everything was fantastic!  The homemade pasta dishes were incredible, and we also loved our bacon wrapped dates and the bread and pesto.  To top it off, our server was very friendly and made a lot of good recommendations.  Finally, the patio is nice and has a good view of the canal.  I can't wait to go back!
Fancy place. Amazing food made right in front of your eyes. We had a blast and enjoyed the food.

This place rocks.  Great atmosphere.  Amazing food and super personable friendly staff.  Everything I've had so far has been incredible; from the humus plate to the bacon cheese burger and my favorite, the beat salad.  A must try!

Loved this place. Really good Mediterranean salad (w/ grilled chicken) and the atmosphere overall was classy and nice. Drinks were just OK; white sangria was pretty meh  Apparently they don't take big party walk-ins so make sure to book ahead if you have 8 people.

We came to Olive & Ivy while in town checking out Old Town Scottsdale. A great spot along the water with an adorable outside patio!  We didn't get a patio seat but the doors open all the way up so even sitting inside, so even sitting inside feels like outdoor seating. There are fireplaces outside, and groups sit together around the fireplaces.   Ambience of restaurant was cozy with great warm lighting and a high-end atmosphere.   Red sangria was delicious!  Scallops on creamy polenta was delicious. Perfectly cooked. Sea bass was also delicious, but I felt that the plate was a little too light on other things. Two pieces of cauliflower and a quarter of a grapefruit left me hungry.  We got the peanut butter mousse for dessert, and that was the highlight for us! Tasted like a peanut butter cup--yum!  Prices are certainly not cheap, so I'd recommend coming to happy hour here, unless you're looking to blow some cash. Overall, great eats in Scottsdale.

My friends and I were visiting for the first time for our annual girls trip.  The ambience and decor was beautiful.  Service was amazing.  Location was very nice.  I had the kale salad (delicious), sea scallops (cooked perfectly), and sangria (yummy).  My one friend had shrimp risotto (she said was ok) and my other friend had tortelli (she said was very good).  The dates wrapped in bacon appetizer was really tasty, but the appetizers on crostini were okay.  They serve dinner with fresh baked bread and a basil spread.  So crazy delicious!  We had chocolate cake with marshmallow topping and graham cracker crumble.  It was about a 7 out of 10 for me.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends.

Party of seven; catching up with good old school co-workers. The atmosphere was ideal for a classy casual restaurant near Fashion Square. To start off I'd like to fill you in on the bread and oil, I could not stop feasting on. From the breakfast menu I ordered the two eggs any style (poached) with bacon, potatoes and wheat toast. Of course I had to join the crew on the morning booze choosing of bloody Mary. All-in-all I give this place five stars for excellent service, fantastic food, awesome drinks and location. Duh! ;)

I came here with a meetup group.  Most of us had never been, and our reviews were mixed.  I had the Mediterranean salad with shrimp (cold boiled shrimp which was fine with me).  Two friends had the fish of the day which they enjoyed.  Two ladies had the turkey hoagie with french fries.  One said her fries were cold.  Service was great.  I feel like it must be difficult to serve a table of ten ladies who all want separate checks.  Our waiter did so with no problem.  He was pleasant and courteous.  I would like to return and maybe sit outside and enjoy a different meal with a smaller group.

On a connection flight to Honolulu, my girlfriend and I had a layover in the Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport. Starving, we found Olive and Ivy and by our gate, and it looked promising with its long sprawling lines.    Customers can order sandwiches, pastas, salads, and the like, freshly made. If you're in a hurry (like we were), plenty of pre-made items exist and are accessible for those in line. We grabbed two things:  *Turkey Grinder: Fresh tomatoes and cherry tomatoes, with a slick slab of provolone and the oregano was a nice touch. It's something that I would totally get again.   *Chicken Panini: Like the turkey grinder, it had quality ingredients, and the sandwich artists (lol) put generous amount of salami and fontina. The lettuce and tomato were fine.   I would totally return to Olive & Ivy, if I were to visit the Phoenix airport again. It certainly beats airport food

This is my go to restaurant in the PHX airport when I'm connecting to another flight. Considering a lot of airport restaurants have terrible food and slow service this restaurant is very efficient with their limited menu. They serve a limited breakfast menu and mostly sandwiches and salads for lunch and dinner although they do have other items on the menu.The sandwiches are prepped and ready for add-ons which speeds up the process. The food is consistently good. I've never had to wait very long for my breakfast or lunch sandwich and they package up your meal as a good carry out to eat on board your next flight which is ideal since most airplane food is even worse. Overall good food and efficient service.
The food wasn't phenomenal but it was very good. The service was excellent. The decor was very cool. A good experience. Great selection of wines by the glass. Very pleasant experience.

Loved, loved the atmosphere. The wine list was great. The food was a good experience being that I have always been a steak and potatoes type of girl. I loved trying the new things. Place was definitely packed on Friday night. We are glad we got reservations and it was a night where my hubby and I fell back in love...would recommend this place to anyone. Just ask questions to the staff when you are unsure about the food.

I ate there 3 times in the last 10 days.  I was waited on by Megan, Nate (as opposed to Nathan), and another gentleman whose name I wish I remembered. The last place I had service that great was at Galatoires's Baton Rouge location.   I thought my first waitperson was exceptionally great, but then I had the same experience 3 times with 3 different waitstaff. Pleasant, friendly, efficient, discreet. I was beyond pleased. No annoying interruptions to ask me how my food tastes (fishing for compliments that add nothing to the dining experience) or to ask if I am done with a clearly finished plate.  The food there is great, too. I recommend the chicken pesto flatbread and the beet salad. They had a special gelato, cherry cheesecake, that I hope becomes a permanent menu item.

Solid happy hour. Good white sangria. Grea view on the Scottsdale Waterfront. We had the bruschetta it was good but not as good as Postino. Great location above average food. Great spot to meet a friend.
Great place to eat or go on a date for sure. tHe atmosphere is great. We ate outside near the heaters and water.

I love Olive and Ivy. I go there for breakfast at the cafe and lunch and dinner in the restaurant. Fav dishes are the ravioli, salmon ceased and burger. Fav drink is peach Bellini. Bartenders are always cool. Servers are decent managers are on point it's a good vibe. It's a bit overpriced but it's at the mall so that's expected. Oh the patio...perfect when the weather is nice! When I don't know what I feel like I go to Olive and Ivy I can find something.
The pesto and bread are DELISH.   God help you and your dining experience if you get stuck with Gino as your waiter. He is slow and rude and unpleasantly loud.

This is  a great spot. I was taken here on a date, we had a reservation for 2 on the patio and I was really pleased with the seating I dont usually perfer outdoor seating,  but at this restaurant id say Its one of the best seats and very gorgeous.  We were seated within just a few minutes of arriving.  The atmosphere is really warm and inviting as well as the staff I really appreciate when Im welcomed immediately by the hostesses it has a huge impact on my perception of a restaurant ( customer service is key and they have it)... The food was very good  also they have a good variety of choices we stuck to a simple  but yummy margarita pizza with fresh basil, bruchetta appetizer,  and drinks. Our waitress was attentive,  but not overly smothering which I liked especially while on a date.  I can absolutely see myself coming back here wether its on a date, with friends, or family....
The medi salad and pappardelle was really good.. The whiskey sour hit the spot!!! Pretty happening for a Sunday night

We went here just randomly looking for dinner. It was a nice place.  Food wise: we went with the Bruchetta Brussels sprouts which was ok. Then we had Flat bread chicken which was well made and I highly recommend. Kale salad was also ok. Kale can be difficult to eat but they had some ok flavor added to it.  Ambience wise: This is a total date night spot. If you're looking to impress, go here.  Service wise: They said it might take 45 mins for a table but they got us a table in short fashion. I wish the waiter was as good but he wasn't. He screwed up our order. Forgot to give us bread and we were starving. He couldn't remember to bring my fiancé water also..   Ambience wise: The view is impressive in how it over looks the canal. The Live DJ makes it hip spit as well.. If you're looking to impress your date. Come here.  Overall: Id come back because of the ambience.

I got here at least once a week for either Brunch, Lunch, or dinner. I also thoroughly enjoy the marketplace. Everything from the food to the service is impeccable and by far one of my favorite places to dine in the country. The ambiance is especially notable, with the most pleasing aesthetics and impressively trendy, modern, yet comfortably inviting atmosphere.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  We went here for dinner with our friends and started out with the bruschetta and artichoke heart salad. We got the funghi, manchego(sp), and chorizo toppings. 2 out of three were great, we don't eat pork so we skipped the chorizo one. The salad was very good as well. I really loved the fluffy bread they serve with the pesto sauce! Yummy!  I got the sea-bass...it was the BEST sea-bass I've ever had. The orange peels and grapefruit all meshed so well together. It was just incredible! My bf had the salmon and it was grilled to perfection. It was tender and crispy and those baby beets they serve with it are to die for! And I don't even like beets! Out friends ordered the scallops and the mushroom tort-something and were very pleased with their selections.  Our waiter was super patient with us and gave excellent recommendations. I wish I could remember his name. He was just a great guy and seemed like he enjoyed his job. He definitely went above and beyond for us.  The only reason they didn't get 5 stars is because I made reservations for 9:15 but weren't seated until about 9:40.

As I write this, a helpful associate has just checked on me at my seat and has brought me a glass of water. The service at this casual restaurant is better than any regular cafe you'd stop at in town. What makes this place special is their food, the service and the ambience.
