Yes, this place is inside a airport, but once you step inside, you forget that you are. (And thank geezus for any place you can go to that makes you forget you're in an airport!!). They sell panini's, loaded pizza squares that look so delicious I could almost break my diet to eat them, salads, soups, smoothies, cookies and breakfast items. Everything is fresh and tastes like it was made with love.  I've gotten their salads plenty of times - never a wilted green in sight. I had the chicken pine nut salad today and highly recommend it! And their tomato bisque never fails to comfort me and lift my spirits after a long business trip.  Treat yourself and try the snickerdoodle cookies. I'm not much of a cookie eater, but I always buy a bag of these to take home. Soft, chewy and perfectly seasoned, you'll wish you bought another bag!  Try this place out for breakfast, lunch or dinner and you won't be disappointed!

The best breakfast sandwich!!! I was thrilled to find this place and it was quite the popular spot. I would give it 5 stars, but there was only one person taking your order and one person checking you out. Other than that, Jose (the man who made the sandwich) was friendly and helpful. I willed finitely be back.

This place is super fun - great vibe, high ceilings, grand bar, a HUGE open patio over looking the river. We had a private event with about 30 people, and they seated us in a private room in the back. At the end of the night, we moved to the patio where there were several fire pits and a gelato bar in the back. I mean, what else could you ask for..??!
The food was amazing we were able to be seated outside.  The staff was friendly and the vibe was upbeat.

Perfect spot for afternoon dining on the patio (at least in the spring time).  Nice happy hour menu.  My favorite thing is actually the croissant bought in the morning at their "market".  It is perfect - flaky inside and kind of crispy outside.  Treat yourself to one if you're here.

What an awesome, awesome place.  Went here with my mom for a casual friday lunch and really enjoyed it.  The bread and pesto are amazing.  The reason I am giving 4 stars is because the menu is a little too funky for my taste- I am more a fan of the basics.  The dessert menu is also amazing, and all of the desserts are made in-house that day.  Definitely recommend for a nice lunch or dinner! And make sure to get dessert!

I went to Olive & Ivy in Scottsdale on the waterfront. After hearing good things I went there with my Aunt on a Wednesday around 4:30 pm. The inside was crowded so we had to sit out side. The weather was decent, but it was just starting to get hot out side so the misters were on. We ended up sharing a table with other people, they were nice enough to allow us to sit with them. There was a reason those chairs were empty, the chairs and cushions were wet. We just flipped the cushions over, they were not quite as wet on that side. Other than the crowd and wet chairs I enjoyed the place. I enjoyed the food. The service was great. Good atmosphere, nice decor, friendly staff. I think next time I go it will be a different time of day and or different time of year. We went the third week of May and this year it was warmer than usual. It was not a terrible experience but now I know what to expect and can plan accordingly.

Olive and Ivy is a great concept. Fun, classy vibe with a phenomenal waterfront patio, great DJs on the weekend, and excellent food. They even have a gourmet market attached.  We sat on the patio even in summer due to their misters. You can hear the music outside as well. I imagine this place is packed in peak season!  We wanted a light dinner so enjoyed salads and a hummus platter. For dinner we shared tortelli pasta with corn and English peas. It was incredibly fresh and cooked to perfection.   Great cocktail program as well.  Would definitely return!

The food here is great, amazing breakfast. Only thing wrong is picking up an order. When you call in and place an order for pick up, and they tell you 15 mins Over the phone. I am realistic, normally expect 15-30 when slightly busy, and I am a very patient person but when it takes almost and hour for 3 breakfast items, it becomes and issue. This is unsat, I would expect better service than what happened today.

Went here on a Friday night after work with a friend. Made a reservation easily with Open Table and was seated immediately. The atmosphere was very nice. I really liked the place. The waiter we had was friendly and helped us decide what to get.   Simply put, great bruschetta and great drinks. Definitely going here again.

The restaurant atmosphere was great, the ambiance was beautiful its right by the  canal and there is outdoor seating as well. The food was brought out to us very promptly and the presentation of the food was great, the thing that impressed me the most was that my boyfriend had ordered the sea scallops and i had ordered the awesome lasagna we had asked to "split the orders so that we could share" they beautifully arranged the two dishes on a rectangular plate and a bowl so it looked as though the two dishes were suppose to be together and they split the orders and put it on one plate, I have never seen this done before in any restaurant.The waiter was very attentive and very nice. The other item you need to ask for is the pesto and bread,that is a must, so delish! I even looked up for any other FOX restaurants that might be in California which I plan on visiting since I had such a great experience at this restaurant. the next time I come to Scottsdale I surely stop by here again!. Thanks Olive and Ivy for a memorable eating experience!

Sub far airport food, over priced, and not super tasty.... My sister enjoyed her Greek salad, I had trouble keeping the grilled cheese down..... Very bland. But it's airport food, so when you don't have a choice I guess it will do... At least there are plugs everywhere to charge your phones, etc. next time I'll grab a bag of chips n try to hold out till I get to my destination!

I eat here frequently and really like the food, location and outside (along the canal) dining.  The food is very good but a bit pricey.  The ambiance is upscale casual and the restaurant can get very, very loud during busy times.  Staff are always attentive and service good.

Disappointed! We have been coming to this restaurant for several years and came again tonight to celebrate my husband's birthday. We were saddened to find out that Olive & Ivy has cut back on everything food wise. You now have to "ask" for their bread and pesto when it was always part of their initial table presentation. The entree presentation is very plain and blah. The food portions appear to be smaller. I notified them when making the reservation that it was my husbands birthday celebration and all the past years the birthday person received a complimentary desert. Not anymore! Nothing was offered. We are so disappointed that they have become a run of the mill, cut costs, restaurant. The food and service are still good but the extras that made this restaurant stand out as a superior FOX restaurant are gone.

Great food we loved the lamb meatballs such a nice Mediterranean item as an app! The filet mignon steak had a great flavor nice and juicy! Sea bass was great too we just didn't like the Mash as it was a bit salty. Service wasn't bad. Our server was nice but not friendly just very direct not sure if that works for working in a restaurant but we enjoyed the food and ambiance

Two words.... HAPPY HOUR!!!!!   My girls and I went to happy hour last Friday, Olive & Ivy was the first stop, cuz everyone knows HH isn't just one hour. :-)   We had never tried their HH before and wanted to see what it was all about. It's flipping amazing is what it is. Half off almost everything.... bottles of wine, flat bread pizza, salads, sangria, appetizers, beer, cocktails.... The three of us split a couple craft's of red sangria (one caraf = $10 one caraf = two glasses per person) Needless to say we were very much pleased with our HH choice this day.   We also got the margarita flat bread and the pick three cheese plate. So good! If you are looking for a fab HH in Old Town this is the place to be for sure!
Amazing !! Everything I've eaten here is amazing . Try the risotto ! You'll thank me :) unless you're allergic to seafood .

LOVE their home made gelato! Great scallop & fish dishes. Good home made pesto, though bread served with it could be better (maybe a more rustic, crusty, flavorful bread). Fantastic location by the water.

Another amazing restaurant by FOX Concepts! From the ambiance to the out door seating in Scottsdale on the stream - it was a great experience. Great service and great food. All the food was 100% on point and here is a break down of what we ordered:   Appetizers:  (1) Seasonal Chefs Board - great cheese and meat board. I have had better, but it was great. The breads on the board were AMAZING! (2) Lamb Meat Balls - These were also on point. Their pita bread is VERY delicious and the lamb meat balls with tzatziki was GREAT! (3) Hummus - this is honestly some of the BEST hummus I have ever had. It is flavorful and delicious!  Entree: Lasagna Bolognese - The portion was a great portion and so delicious also. Some of the best Lasagna I have had with pieces and bites of Broccoli, which was new for me, but the texture and taste profile added to the dish. The bread again with this was AMAZING!  Drink:  Grapefruit Mojito - I am a BIG fan of grapefruit, and if you don't like the grapefruit flavor I would not get this drink. It isn't so much a  Mojito but more of a Grapefruit cocktail!

This place is wonderful for larger groups. It has a great outdoor seating area that would be better to visit not when summer's in full bloom. The food is good and it has a great happy hour that I visited with an MBA group. Its also has a great brunch.

I've been here a few times now, so I think I'm finally qualified to review it. First off, I'll say that this place is gorgeous. They put a lot of thought and money into the look of Olive and Ivy. It's very fancy. Even the bathrooms are impressive - the stalls are like little closets with no way for your neighbor to hear you pooping or to reach under and touch your feet... you just better hope there's paper in there before you start to go. Also, the doors to the stalls are nicer than any door in any house I've lived in. I'm talking big hand carved oak stained wood doors... for toilet stalls.  Anyway - the rest of the place is opulently decorated and well furnished as well. There's a swanky yet sophisticated feel here. The food is above average - as are the prices - though I don't know if the prices reflect the quality of the food. They carry a decent selection of wines - having sampled quite a few, I've decided that the least expensive ones taste best.  The service wasn't great, but it was pretty busy. The layout here would be pretty confusing for any server - but combine that with low lighting conditions and you have a recipe for service disappointment. Our server on my last visit was at least very sweet. In fact, I have yet to feel mistreated here, so I'd say at least they have "nice" down.   This isn't my type of crowd - unless you're asking me for a crowd I'd like to see burned alive. But as with many great places in Scottsdale, you may have to bring your own crew in order to really enjoy yourself. This might be a good place to meet up for an early drink or a happy hour snack before heading out for the evening. It's definitely in a great location and like I said - it's pretty nice.

Just moved to Scottsdale in May. My favorite type of food is breakfast. Olive and Ivy has the best French toast in town. On top of this is the great service behind the marketplace counter! The manager (with the beard) is always pleasant with his genuine appreciation for every guest. I frequent this spot and have yet to have a negative experience. Try the parfait served fresh daily with a hint cinnamon. Don't miss out.

This place should be phenomenal....The ambience is awesome and the building is beautiful but the food is so so. I ordered the sea bass and it was so dry it was like smoked fish. The one thing I really liked was the fig and prosciutto bruchetta.

It was our three year anniversary and we were  Treated with kindness and amazing customer  Service.  Olive and Ivy was top notch in all  aspects of service.  Thanks for letting me  Share.  I will be returning for some more  delicious dinning.

I have lived in the valley for nine years and this spot is still one of my go-tos... With a date, with girlfriends, with out of town friends or family. The menu is great for ordering lots of dishes and sharing and you can't beat their happy hours.  The patio is fantastic .... Just be sure to make reservations during spring training season!

We came here on a Saturday night and we were a little late for our reservation because of traffic. Walking in the place is dark, modern, and really loud. We got seated outside on the patio right next to the Riverwalk. Only problem is you can't see the Riverwalk because of the bushes.   The patio has lots of trees for shade covering and water misters. It was a pretty hot night and the misters help cool it down some.   Our server greeted us fairly quickly. Got our drink orders and water cups pretty quickly especially since it was pretty warm outside.   We started out with the Bruschetta comb. We had the Strawberry & Apple, Prosciutto & Fig, and Manchego.  They give you one of each but cut it up into three pieces so everyone can enjoy a variety. They were all good but probably my favorite was the strawberry & apple. They were all very fresh and tasty.   I had the Bouillabaisse. Huge bowl of basically seafood soup. Not a lot of soup but just overflowing with seafood. Muscles, clams, scallops, shrimp, and fish. Everything was cooked perfectly. Excellent dish. Really enjoyed it.   My wife had the chicken Scallopini. Very tender chicken with spinach. I had a bite and and it was delicious. Very good and my wife really enjoyed it. My daughter had the pacific sea bass and her words were that is was cooked perfectly. Very tender and really good. She loved it. Son got the bone-in ribeye and they put some cream sauce on it and he thought it was one of the best ribeye he's had. That's saying a lot there.   We ended our meal with lemon pudding cake and the strawberry Mille-Feuille. They were both really good. Lemon cake was so good. Not dry at all. Very moist with a scoop of ice cream. Really really good. The strawberry Mille-Feuille had three wafer waffles with a scoop of ice cream on top. It was good but the lemon pudding cake was the best in my opinion.   So overall we had a really good meal. Very good service. Really good food. It was pretty loud outside but really warm. It reminded me outside of a garden with lots of tree. Too bad there was no view of the Riverwalk. The outside wasn't as loud and inside. It seemed like people were trying to talk over everyone else so really loud inside. I think I would prefer to come during the cooler time of the year but everything else was really good. Enjoy

Olive and Ivy is clearly the place to be on a Saturday morning if you're a millennial looking to get your brunch on. The building is beautiful inside, offers both quick take out as well as seating if you're looking to linger. Not to be forgotten is the outdoor seating waterside that offers a view of the canal and a gentle breeze on this nice fall day.   We were on vacation, so we started with dessert - a lemon cake that was delicious. They also started us with a plate of focaccia and pesto. The pesto was fragrant and well-seasoned.   I opted for the kale salad with chicken. It was complemented by blue cheese and candied pecans. It is sure to satisfy any kale lover's  hankering.  My husband ordered the breakfast burrito which if consumed entirely will require an obligatory 30min to 1 hr prior to activity. It is filling, and has just the right amount of bacon, cheese, and potatoes. The home fries served alongside were crispy on the outside and delicious on the inside.   Service was excellent, and this place is very reasonably priced. Make sure to stop in for brunch soon.

My boyfriend and I came here for a late dinner after a long day of hiking while on vacation in the area. This restaurant was wonderful. We had really friendly and prompt service. I wish I could remember our waiter's name because he was attentive and informative without being pushy. The food was very good -- we got a flatbread to start and both had generous helpings of pasta, not to mention the delicious bread and pesto combo that came with the table. We really wanted to try some of the delicious-looking desserts, but our main dishes were too filling. What really makes this place shine, however, is the ambiance. The indoor/outdoor vibe and the trendy atmosphere was perfect for our "fancy date night". We loved the feel of the restaurant, with its fireplace tables, soaring ceilings, innovative light fixtures and a wide open concept. I just wish there was an Olive & Ivy in Chicago!

Very Cute dining. It's perfect for a quick lunch or a dress up dinner. It would be perfect for a celebration or an intimate date. They make their foods from scratch daily and bring you bread while you wait for your meal(s). Their patio seating is really cute and very spacious as well. There is a marketplace adjacent to the restaurant where you can basically order anything off the menu at if you are in a real hurry.   Loved it! It seems that the FOX restaurant chain has yet to completely disappoint!

Came here for a bachelorette party. Such wonderful service! They greeted us with shots, weren't too on top of us, gave us more shots. When the check came, they gave us our food individually and the carafes  of sangria/dessert on a separate tab. So awesome for a group!

The easiest way to describe Olive and Ivy is ABSOLUTELY STUNNING.   From the moment you walk in you feel like you're in a whole new world. On my recent visit, i sat out on the patio which felt like I was having lunch and drinks somewhere far from Arizona. The entire patio was nicely decorated and laid out. It wasn't over crowded with tables or anything. The service at Olive and Ivy was beyond great. Everyone walked around with a smile on their face and always made sure everything was going well with your meal.   I highly recommend Olive and ivy for anyone who is wanting an "out of this world" experience. It truly felt as if I had just walked out of Arizona and entered a tranquil, beautiful space.   I had one of their Grapefeuit Palomas which are fantastic. Please order one when you go. You will not regret it. They have a great list of wines and cocktails to choose from as well.   I will definitely be returning again soon. This place is amazing.
Absolutely beautiful patio to enjoy and this place really has wonderful food. The service was so poor. Will have to seriously consider going back or not because of how poor the service was.
If you like the stuck up Scottsdale vibe this is a good place for you. The food isn't impressive. Nice outdoor seating.

Foods just OK. It is more of a scene. But I will say if you're a guy and want to see some beautiful well dressed ladies then check this place out. Since I'm married to my gorgeous wife i do not need to go here but for you single gents check it out.
I've been here for brunch, drinks, and dinner.  Brunch was very disappointing.  Dinner and drinks were just okay.  Overrated.

Came here for restaurant week a couple weeks ago. I usually enjoy Fox restaurants, but for some reason had never come here before. For a starter I had the mini tuna tacos, which I thought were great. The taco shell was really crunchy which went very well with the texture of the tuna.  My entree was the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin. The bacon had a lot of taste, but wasn't overpowering and went well with the pork. It had a bbq sauce that had the right amount of sweet to it. What really made the entree excellent was the side dish. It was sweet corn with roasted peppers and tomatoes. It was great! Best part of the meal by far, and that shouldn't take away from anything else, it was just that good.  One reason I love restaurant week is that I get a dessert with my meal, which I usually don't ever order. I ordered peanut butter chocolate torte...so good. It came with a small scoop of peanut butter ice cream. A perfect way to end a good meal.

Spinach ravioli was great. the portion was perfect for me but I don't eat a lot, I recommend ordering a side with it to be completely satisfied if you're super hungry, other than that the environment is very fun, alive and relaxing.

Not only was the food excellent (I had the prosciutto and potato flatbread with an egg on top), but the service was amazing. The atmosphere is terrific as well. My only complaint is the coffee- I ordered an Americano, and it tasted like drip coffee. With that being said, the coffee was acceptable, and everything else made up for it. Highly recommended!
Best meal in a long time. Take a credit card, not cheap but way worth the money. Eat dessert. You'll thank me afterwards.

Drinks were so good!! Sat outside on the patio. Open seating on the patio outside and it was really pleasant. We loved the whiskey sour mash, Bloody Mary, and Bellini. Service was great also, Jael was really attentive!! Awesome Sunday drink spot!!

If you are looking for a hidden gastronomic gem, Olive and Ivy fits the bill. The Italian/Mediterranean/California influence shows in the decor. The booth we sat in possessed a warmth reminiscent of many upscale restaurants I have been to in Chicago.  Our server, Melinda, was one of the most attentive servers I have experienced. She even did something special for me (mint iced tea) that I will be permanently ordering each time.  The Bruschetta were all delightful with the strawberry being my fave. All flavors were light and enjoyable on the tongue.

We went when it first opened up a few years back, then again in November 2010.....definite change in atmosphere.  Although the food was very good, the service was mediocre at best, the server really had a "no care" attitude.  We had to ask for place settings, then our food came out before our appetizers which was very disappointing.  This could be a sign of the times and the business may be circling the drain.  Worth a try though, the food is very good.

Typical airport food breakfast. I was suckered in by the trendy and updated wood and chalkboard appearance which looks like someplace higher-end. Really it's barely edibile, something equivalent to a fast food breakfast. If I had been more patient I would have trekked on to Wildflower.

Must go!! I have been going here for years and every time it is amazing. Awesome location, in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale, Waterfront. The outdoor patio is very beautiful and comfortable and a great place to lounge for happy hour. On the weekends they have a live DJ, playing chill lounge music. Atmosphere is what makes this place stand out. The complimentary pesto and focaccia is to die for. Great wine list and drink specials. Mediterranean Mule is my favorite. Service is always spectacular.  I would highly recommend checking this place out!!!

Was my first time there and everything was simply impeccable. Our service was amazing although she had just moved here from Dallas and the country gravy biscuit and Spicy Bloody Mary with blue cheese stuffed olives  where the perfect end  to my hectic week.

This place is ok. The paninis are a bit dry, but for airport food, I can't complain... it far surpasses McD's!  Stick with the chicken and pine nut salad Or Mediterranean salad for a better meal!  It does take some time to order the paninis, so make sure you plan accordingly.  And definitely choose the rice krispy treat over the snickerdoodle cookie (too much nutmeg!)
Nice restaurant on the canal, but very busy. My wife's salad was excellent. The brunch menu was limited so I had a burger and fries. Only three stars cause I expected better.

I love the vibe of this place! I would love to just come here and hang out outside. They have these patio seatings with patio furniture where you'll still get waited on and it's just such a perfect seating arrangement! Along with all the seatings inside. The feel for this place is closer to mature like 20-30s. I really really love the set up and would definitely try to make this place a regular spot to hit on a random night. I went on a Sunday and it was still decently busy. I do rate this place four stars though because I had ordered a margarita pizza which I thought was not good at all. I actually didn't finish it. But I did order the melon salad which was three different melons along with goat cheese which I switched it for feta cheese and avocado. I did think the presentation of the food looked very nice and our waiters were rly kind. My boyfriend and I will definitely be back here often!

O&I at the Waterfront is a very nice restaurant. Their patio has recently even refurbished and is a great place to hang when the weather is nice. The place is very near Scottsdale Fashion Square so the atmosphere is a bit more upscale, but still approachable- I've been here in jeans & a t shirt many times! It's one of my top 5 fav places for weekend brunch - they have $5 mimosas!! And I like that you get to pick your ratios of champagne to OJ as they do them table-side! The restaurant is very large and get a bit noisy at peak times but is a cool vibe! Also good for large crowds and groups dining!
Great place to eat when passing through PHX Sky Harbor Airport. Consistently Good. A heathy choice with great taste.

We took my parents here for dinner on the water.  The table we had was right next to the water and the temperature was perfect outside.  The waiter was knowledgeable and very attentive.  The Strawberry Thyme drink was good but very earthy.  The Mediterranean Salad was amazing for dinner.  For dessert I recommend the Peanut Butter Mousse, Delicious!  Very pleased and will definitely be going back again!
Really good, much better than any other food I've had at an airport. Had the I &O breakfast sandwich. YUM!

I had brunch at olive and ivy last weekend and had an amazing experience. To start brunch off right I had a mimosa that was way above the average mimosa. He used fresh oj and very crisp champagne. I then got the breakfast sandwich which was fantastic and we shared the cinnamon role (Amazinggggg). The service was excellent and the atmosphere was perfect for brunch!

The word "Eh" pretty much sums up how I feel about Olive and Ivy. It wasn't great, it was terrible.   I came in with some friends when it wasn't all that busy but even that was a bit of a stretch for the staff. I'm not sure if it was just the day I was but they were super understaffed. At first glance, the menu looks awesome but the execution left me wanting. It just seemed like they wanted to put as little onto plates as possible, I'm not sure if they are trying to save money or if the chef thinks it's artistic. Either way, the food is underwhelming.   The location is nice it's just a pain to get too which is pretty much how all of Scottsdale is. But I knew that going in.   Just to reiterate, eh.
Mediterranean salad? Yes, yes, yes, and yes. Add shrimp..of course. The little cafe is great and the patio is wonderful during the cooler months
Rahim is wonderful. So good at helping us rookies at selecting perfect dishes. Wow. Amazing place food and service.

Seriously my favorite Fox Concept restaurant. Lets begin with there fresh bread and pesto with are to die for. The mediterrean salad is two thumbs up with extra dressing. Seriously cannot go wrong with anything on their menu.

Tips:  The pesto here is to-die-for, a must try Potatoes are diced fried, sort of like "homefries"  --------------------------------------  I came here on Valentine's Day afternoon for an afternoon brunch after calling just 2 hours before to grab a table for 2.  We got the vegetable scramble and prosciutto flatbread pizza.   I would highly recommend getting the prosciutto flatbread.  The vegetable scramble was pretty standard and it is not a white scramble by default. What really stood out to me was the potatoes that the scramble came with. The potatoes are delicious and worth getting with your breakfast choice.

This is a 'fresh food' option for an airport.  I especially appreciated their offering of oatmeal-I don't do eggs very often, so airport breakfast can be difficult if it's not a bagel.  Not the best oatmeal ever, but it fit the bill for me.  They had quite a line, but it moved pretty quickly and the staff all seemed focused on getting customers the correct orders quickly.
Food was excellent.  I had the lamb meat balls, and some wine. Service was great as well.

If I could I would give 0 stars. I took my girlfriend for our 6 month anniversary dinner thinking it would be a nice dinner. When we arrived the entire restaurant was under construction , the floor was covered in cardboard and looked awful. The appetizers were over priced and tasted bland, the main dish took over an hour and was small and had a disgusting bitter taste to it which made my girlfriend terribly sick. The waiters were awful ignoring guests for over twenty minutes at a time and never refilled the drinks. Overall the worst experience I've had at a restaurant, I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Food, Service and Ambiance was amazing.  Cool looking spot in Scottsdale.  Ordered the bruschetta and it insanely good!  Sea bass was a little over cooked but it was still great.  I highly suggest you go here if you're in town.

Great place by the canal for a waterfront feel. I've had the salmon and the ribeye and both were incredible. As far as cocktails I didn't know what to think of a strawberry thyme martini but it was pulled off really well.  Plan to come back again. Only downside was the bruschetta was a little underwhelming but overall a pleasant experience

We come here often, and the service and food are always amazing. We often book their private rooms for meetings, and they have always been helpful and on time with all of our requests. The food is fresh, and has many different flavors, and we find ourselves craving it often. The chopped chicken salad is a favorite! Highly Recommended!

Used to enjoy this place, but the last 3 breakfast experiences have unfortunately been subpar.  From a food standpoint, during 2 of my visits I ordered some fried eggs over medium with the yolk runny - both times the eggs were cooked over hard.  The other time I ordered an omelet and the eggs were overcooked and the potatoes were over salted.   Service was also mediocre as on 2 occasions as I wasn't greeted at the register and the employees seemed to be in a bad mood - was a little awkward.  Hopefully there are positive changes that happen soon as this restaurant has a great landscape - probably won't return any time soon as there are several other places that consistently deliver on both food and service for around the same price point.

We went to olive and ivy on a beautiful late- Sunday birthday brunch. The atmosphere was lovely, very visually satisfying, me and my girlfriends sat on the patio with the surrounding of the Scottsdale canal, flowers and plenty of shade. I requested we ask the server, Valentino (sooo handsome) to assist us with a few items to share amongst us. We ordered the chopped salad, French toast, chicken pesto flat bread, Salmon bagel and bacon x 5 plates. We also drank mimosas,that were kept full, with decent champagne and the perfect OJ ratio. The food was average in taste and approach for common dishes, I would suggest more personality to it but it was enjoyable and satisfying none the less. Priced appropriately.   Valentino, our server, was very attentive, very knowledgable and had over all provide exceptional service to "4 Hangry females from Scottsdale and a birthday girl." He kept the table nice and clean, was very informative of the menu and concept and the thoughtful service was more then appreciated. Wonderful service!!!   Over all I rate this as a deserving 4 stars, because it was exactly what I expect from the name and location of this establishment. I will recommend for a lovely brunch spot and look forward to my return.
I absolutely love this restaurant. The service is always top notch, the food is excellent and the ambiance on the outdoor patio is perfect. It's a true FOX example of excellence in dining.

Maybe I am just an LA girl with LA expectations.  I found most of the restaurants, in Arizona, not up to my taste.   However, Olive & Ivy was  a breath of fresh air.  And I am writing mostly about the ambience.  It was refreshing to find young, trendy people in a place full of energy.  Vibrant décor that came to life as the DJ spins EDM.  The glasses of wine helped too! The food was pretty yummy. I would recommend the roasted mushroom bruschetta if you like balsamic.  The scallop entrée was bit on the sweet side but the rib eye was pretty good.    Appetizer + 2 entrees + 2 drinks + tip = $130 Reasonable.  We will go again...  I can see it being a personal favorite.  A place to go with we are sure in going to be good.

Pretty fricken good experience bud. Had a good time with my bud dirty corey. Drink sangria and stuff had some sick pesto doeeeee. Let's give the overall experience  a Howzitttt. Good but not great. Howzitttt. really had a great time but it's tough to give anything 4 stars if you know what I mean hyddddddd

Love the decor of this place.  Shabby chic with classy old fashion twist.  I order 3 bruchetta to try : apple caponata, prosciutto and fig and fresh mozorella. Amazing!! Small but perfect appetizer size. For my main entree I tried the prosciutto and mascarpone tortelli. Delicious,  flavorful, and the perfect amount. I paired this dish with pinot grigio. Top it off I had share the brioche pecan and chocolate cake dessert. Too die for.I would definitely ckme back and take my friends.

Went here for a company holiday dinner. Between the aweful service (45 minutes for a refill) the loud, obnoxious music, the dark atmosphere and the food that sounded amazing and was absolutely revolting (I personally took about four bites of one slice of 'pizza' and could not even tolerate to eat it. This is coming from someone who could eat a slice of dominos if needed. Thats how very bad it was.) The dessert we got, I believe peanut butter gelato was horrific. This place is for wanna be hip people. Its actually kind of sad.
Talk about stuffy. Waiter had no personality. Food was ok. From what locals told us, it's a meat market.
Definitely one of my fav place!!! What can I say - love the restaurant, love the food! The staff are pleasant & helpful. I have yet to be disappointed w/ this place!!!
Scottsdale must eats!   Flavorful food. Nice ambiance and music. Fantastic service. Really enjoyable area and food.
I've been here a couple of times.  The food is delicious and the ambience is great.  I highly recommend it.

Absolutely one of the best meals we had in Scottsdale. The service was impeccable.. Our sever, Taylor, knew the menu so well and described every meal to the point we could almost taste it.We picked four different items and each one was incredible. The the deserts, mm. Thank you Taylor and manager for making our experience first rate.

Perfect place to go to for coffee and breakfast and also a really nice meal! I love how it's split up into one side being like a coffee house and the other like a fine dinning restaurant.  Coffee side is by the mall and the restaurant part is by the canal and is absolutely beautiful.  Best part is you can bring your dog with you on the patio and it's in walking distance of a lot of things . Also the food is fantastic!!!

Meh. Went here for dinner on a date night. Have also been for lunch. My overall review is that it's $10 entree quality for $20. Not bad food but definitely not a good value for the price. Like other Fox concepts, the atmosphere is nice but generic, nice in a very trendy way, not classic or authentic. I really don't like to pay steak-house prices for medium food. That's this place.  That being said, I really do like their coffee bar/pastries (mmm the pastries!) and their gelato bar. Then you can sit outside and enjoy the waterfront and only pay a few dollars.

This was my third visit to O&I, and the first time experiencing the "brunch menu." Plenty of lunchable dishes, tho, so while my 3 yr old devoured the perfect thick pancakes with custard and blueberry compote, my wife and I enjoyed two tasty flatbreads - mine with prosciutto (bellissima!) and hers with short rib (get 'r dun!).  The serving size was generous, she barely finished hers and she hadn't eaten yet that day (we arrived around 2 pm), and I got to bring home 3 pieces for a nice snack later. (which she scammed from me!! lucky I love her....)  Everything was cooked perfectly, and delicious. The decor of the place is top-notch, making me feel like I just had my living room decorated by Vern Yip from Trading Places. (always love his designs) Lots of hanging candles, rustic furniture, and an open air feel with a large outdoor patio.  The bakery has a nice assortment  of freshly baked goodies (my son loved the gingerbread man cookies - and I must say, they were still warm and soft - best I ever had) and even gave me a free homemade biscuit for my "best friend" at home.   And the prices, though a tad bit steep, are very reasonable for the food quality. Lunch for 3 of us, including a glass of wine and a quenching rasberry mojito was about $60.  The service was just okay, not too attentive, and the waiter, tho friendly, committed one of my most hated pet peeves. As I've said in a review for Ernie's, you are NOT impressing me 1 bit by memorizing my order. Do they not give waiters/waitresses pens and paper anymore??? You could have saved yourself a few percentage points in the tip, if you you didn't have to come back to me 10 minutes later and ask me AGAIN what I ordered. Or say "You ordered the..........(long pause waiting for me to fill in the blank)...." Nope! (buzzer) The Jones Family gets a chance to steal!!!  To all servers. Please. I'm begging you. Write down my order. In crayon if you want. Tattoo it on your forearm. Whatever it takes. Just please don't come back to me asking what I ordered. 5 minutes after my meal, I won't remember you, and I won't run home to nominate you for a mensa membership. I just want what I ordered.  (stepping off my soapbox now)

OK, OK...so I know I'm more than a little late with trying this restaurant, but in my defense I did just move back to AZ a little over a year ago ;).  I happened to be in the area picking up some shoes from Tony's Shoe Repair (which is awesome...a review for that coming soon) and was starving. I was craving something different than the usuals (Kona, Yard House and ZTejas) and I'd heard good things about this place so I decided to test it out solo.   I arrived right at the beginning of happy hour so the place wasn't too crowded yet. I was immediately impressed right when I pulled up to the place. I liked the fact that they actually had parking spots right up front instead of "complimentary" valet. It annoys me when that's all places have. First of all, I'm perfectly capable of parking my own car and walking. Second, NO valet is "complimentary". You always have to tip them or you'll look like a complete douche. I'd rather walk and burn some calories for free thanks :).   Anyway, sorry for the rant. Back to my review...  The positive vibes of this place stayed with me as I entered into the restaurant. I loved the decor and ambiance of the place. It was very open and fresh feeling. It was airy, without being to too expansive and hollow. It still had a comfort and coziness to it. It was raining that day (I know, what are the odds of that here in AZ haha) so I couldn't sit out on the patio, but from what I saw it looked like an absolutely lovely area to enjoy brunch or happy hour overlooking the water with the girls or even a great romantic date spot to watch the sun go down. The decor wasn't too rustic or too cold and modern. It was classic, cool and elegant.   I decided to just grab a seat at the bar because there were a few seats open and I was by myself anyway. It was sleek and modern and the music was at a perfect volume. It was loud enough to hear, but not so loud that you'd have to yell at the person next to you just to carry on a convo.   Since it was happy hour I decided to take advantage of the great prices and order a few apps as my meal from the happy hour menu. I skipped the cocktails this time (even though they looked delicious...especially the sangria) because I still wanted to go to the gym later that evening...and working out with a buzz just didn't seem like a very productive (or safe) idea lol.   Aside from an ice tea, I ordered the hummus plate, the prosciutto and fig bruschetta (with port salut) and also the fresh mozzarella bruschetta (with tomato jam and basil). This amount would have been a nice snack for two, and was more than plenty for me (I only finished about half the hummus).   The hummus with grilled pita bread came out first and did not disappoint! I loved how they had a good amount of chopped cucumber, onions, and little cherry tomatoes on top of the humus. It added a nice freshness and color to an otherwise monotone dish.   The bruschettas however, were by far my favorite! The tomato jam on the fresh mozzarella was amazing and added a nice twist to the traditional "mozzarella and tomato". It was so good that I seriously wish I could get a container of it to go and try it on everything from fries, to sandwiches or veggies. The prosciutto and fig one was amazeballs as well. The saltiness of the prosciutto plays off the sweetness of the fig nicely. I absolutely LOVED everything and can't wait to go back and try even more menu items. So many looked amazing. I was completely full when I left (and didn't even finish it all) all for under $15!   Overall, a great upscale place with great pricing (especially during happy hour), a great atmosphere and most importantly GREAT FOOD! The only reason why I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is because of the service. Maybe it's because I was sitting at the bar instead of a table with an actual server, but I asked for a few recommendations and descriptions of certain things and wasn't really given anything except for "It's good...I'm not sure, whichever one you feel like." The bruschetta's were also a little slow coming out.   I still absolutely love the place and will definitely be back with friends for the food and atmosphere. ;)

the OLIVE & IVY in the PHOENIX airport has a well-trained, well-managed staff. everybody was courteous, efficient and did an exceptionally fine job taking caring of us. not something that happens every time or even very often when you're flying between here and there.   we arrived hungry -- it was a long flight from MINNEAPOLIS and, since we made the mistake of flying US AIR, we ran late (which seems to happen every time we fly US AIR between here and there) and didn't even get a bag of peanuts.  the MEDITERRANEAN PIZZA had a super-thick, doughy crust and was not particularly good but JULIANA, the nine-year old, made short work of it anyway.  JODI, the wife-unit, had the ITALIAN PANINI and the seven-year old a ROAST BEEF PANINI -- both were pretty darn good. especially liked the dense, crusty, chewy bread. WYATT even said he liked the tomatoes on his sandwich -- one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind. as a parent, you take the little victories where you find them ...  i had the MEDITERRANEAN SALAD (pre-made to grab-n-go but still fresh) with grilled chicken, almonds, feta, tomatoes, couscous, greens and oregano vinaigrette. nice respite from the meat and starch options i often settle for when we travel.   cost about the same as a flight to LAS VEGAS but when you're hungry and stuck in an airport, what are you gonna do ??  at least the food was good.

Brunch!  My friend and I came in on a Saturday early afternoon. The place was well seated for Brunch. On request I asked to sit by the open kitchen bar, even though it was closed at the time, they were happy to accommodate. Check One!   Got to the bar table and was happy to see busy chefs mastering different areas of expertise. From stone ovens, to open flame grills. The service was phenomenal. Our wait-staff, as it seemed, was great. There were several staff members to help with the menu and movement throughout the meal. Check Two!  I took our server's recommendation of the Egg Sandwich on croissant, with bacon, avocado and a side of fresh yogurt, berries, and granola. The sandwich came out perfectly; wet, but not runny. Check Three! I love seeing the EXTRA detail in service in restaurants. Example would be before my meal came out, they brought a spoon for my soon-to-be-eaten yogurt. Or the fact that there was another craft of lemonade. Check Four!  Having Verdejo Sauvignon Blanc wine by the glass. Check Five!  Thanks Olive and Ivy! I'll be back soon.
Love this place. Flatbread pizzas are excellent as was the Mediteranian salad. Pesto flatbread was my fav of the 3 we tried.  We had the ice cream bar but will have the gelato next time.

so this is strictly a brunch review. "Brunch disclaimer" I would like to check this place out at night, to wine and dine...but that is another review.  This is a cool place for brunch, good service, good selection, and decent prices (it's even close to Old Town, go figure)  I had the salmon flat bread pizza with creme freshe, capers, and arugula, this was perfectly paired with a nice strong cup of coffee served in a clear plastic glass. (very nice touch) It was a quiet Sunday afternoon, rainy and gray, so perhaps this added a star to my review. (shrugs) So sleep in on Sunday with your partner, lover, F buddy, whatever...have a little "afternoon delight", and head over to O & I, for brunch to satisfy you for the entire day. I even had left overs for dinner...very nice, very nice indeed.

Olive& Ivy is great! They have a restaurant and a marketplace, both of which offer tons of great food and drinks. This place is perfect for a date or a luncheon with some friends. Their bacon-wrapped dates...holy balls, talk about memorable. If you get lucky and the patio is open, sit outside for a completely different experience from what you'll get inside. Their patio furniture is adorable and sits on the water. Inside, the vibe is very trendy and upscale, while still remaining relatively casual.   Overall, O&I is a great place to hit up after a long day at the mall, whether you want to sit down or grab-and-go.

Excellent food and service for Christmas Eve dinner... minus the refrigerator effect  Our family has a tradition of visiting a nice restaurant for Christmas Eve Dinner. From the Brown Palace in Denver to the US Grant in Sand Diego to the Phoenician in Scottsdale, it's a special occasion to celebrate with relatives.  This year, we decided to stay closer to home and agreed on Olive and Ivy for the cuisine and Yelp! ratings. It was a very good fit.   Our service person, Jessica, did a fine job-- accommodating of taste preferences spanning grandparents to children, kept the timing of courses on track, and made sure drinks were never more tan 1/3 to empty.  Bruchetta Trio was worth a try even if it was unremarkable. Hot chocolates hit the spot on a cold Scottsdale evening. Mediterranean salad, kale salad, and the plate of artichoke hearts were superb-- especially the latter.  Just as excellent, the rib-eye was supremely tasty and perfectly cooked, my wife was very happy with her salmon, and my father-in-law said the shrimp risotto was worth coming back for. The cheesecake was also good, though we were all so sated and chilly that it was a forced attempt at dessert.  Speaking of chilly: One (BIG) knock is that there is a well-used door in the back room. When wait staff traversed in and out, it sent 40-degree air our way. And when an inconsiderate family was finished eating, they held the door open for a good five minutes as everyone sauntered out. A waiter finally noticed and came to have them close the door as I got up to ask them to not freeze us any longer. The result was the same: We ended up eating most of our meal with our coats on us and our food quickly lost its heat. I'm docking one star just for that poor experience and for no one noticing or making a good effort to fix things. Could just be that it's southern Arizona and they aren't used to looking for people eating with coats on, but still...  Definitely worth the visit and I suspect the chilly letdown we had was an anomaly. The food and service staff were quite good.

Typical Italian eatery.  Nothing to brag about.  Happy hour bites are average and drinks are standard.  I wouldn't really say it's the best place to go but for food but the atmosphere is great.  Any seat you take is fun and inviting.  Open seating outside by the water is relaxing and so is the seating inside the giant space that they have.  The service can be a bit slow when it gets busy.  Overall might be a spot to stop after shopping or a glass of wine between walking around the area.

This was my first time to Olive and Ivy, I am a BIG fan of Fox Restaurants so I was excited to come here.  We went on a Friday night about 6pm and we got a table with no wait!  They brought out some AWESOME Bread with an incredible Pesto Sauce, Yummy!  I ordered the beet salad with arugula, goat cheese & pistachio.  I was NOT disappointed, highly recommend!  This was my dinner, I think I had to much popcorn at the movie before. :)  Between the salad and bread I was satisfied and not to full for desert!  We shared a desert, Apple Tart, Very Good!  My mother had the Mediterranean Salad and a Friend had the Lasagna and both said their dishes were good.  Service:  Our server was very attentive!  The only reason I did not give Olive and Ivy 5 Stars was because it was too noisy in the restaurant.  I have noticed more and more restaurants are going for the cement floors that lend to a nosier atmosphere.

My husband and I dined outside on the patio while visiting Scottsdale. The bruschetta appetizer was amazing, as was the sweet corn flatbread pizza. We highly recommend it and would definitely come back next time we're in town.

Aside from the map showing a wrong location, everything about this restaurant was right. The pesto they serve with the complimentary bread was to die for. It was so good I slathered it with my flatbread order of Prosciutto Crudo. They serve brunch on weekends (both Saturday & Sunday) until 3pm which is ideal when you don't like time constraints in the weekend mornings (meaning noon or after). The $5 mimosa was in a huge wine glass instead of a slender champagne flute. Service was fast & good even when it seemed crowded.

I visited Olive & Ivy on a weekday evening in October. It was PACKED. The patio is mostly open seating. I had the margherita flatbread pizza and it was good. Our group also had a bottle of sangria. The patio was the perfect place to relax after a day of work. It wasn't too warm in the evening and the decor was perfect. 4 stars.
I was so hungry after my 6 hour flight, I decided to stop by Olive and Ivy to grab something to eat. The breakfast club sandwich was super delicious and the workers were very friendly. :)

I travel a lot and spend a lot of my time at random airports around the world. Over the past 2 months I have passed through the Phoenix airport 5 times.  I have tried this place 4 times. I have to say I have been very impressed with the food.  It is a much fresher and healthier option then most airports offer.  I would give this place a full 5 stars, but the service has been poor each visit.    The first visit I thought it was a fluke.... I ordered a roast beef panini... After 20 min of waiting I went up to ask where my sandwich was and they had lost my order.  My second and third visits I had to ask someone behind the counter to take my order....in both cases the employees were just chit chatting behind the counter....  This is an airport place....I would assume most people passing though are like me and are in a hurry.  Sitting around waiting for employees to finish personal conversations is not an option.    That being said... The food is good.

Sometimes I think people are too hard on Olive & Ivy, the beauty of this place is how simple your meal can be (if that makes any sense)!   Although there are some $$$ items, there's also some fantastic reasonable dishes. Here's my idea of a wonderful Olive & Ivy dinner- a drink on the patio along the canal, then sit at a booth inside and enjoy truffle fries with the aioli dip PLUS the house focaccia bread with pesto to start. wow. Then I eat the chopped Mediterranean chicken salad to make myself feel better. The salad is AMAZING. Beautiful place, very romantic. It's probably my fav Fox restaurant. Other items on the menu are great too like the fish and risotto.   I think the service is great, although you can tell the server is bummed I'm not ordering more expensive stuff, but who cares!!?! Still a great experience.
This place is big, open and beautiful but their menu is limited so we usually just go here for drinks. However, the last few times, it was too crowded.
Great service, location and food! The short rib flatbread was a fan fave in our group. Highly recommend!

I just had a great experience at this restaurant. From the location, server, menu and decoration, it was a perfect day anniversary night for my husband and myself Please if you go there I will recommend to order the wild Mushroom Parpadelle and the Lamb Meatballs, but I am sure anything you have it will be delicious Until the next time Olive and Ivy

This was our first time visiting Arizona. We ate at Olive and Ivy twice while we were here. The food is excellent and the service was top notch!   Our waiter and manager, Marc Anthony was the best! He rolled out the red carpet for us and gave us recommendations for the rest of the week.   We will be back! I highly recommend this place! A+

Great ambiance and friendly server but the food was super average. Looking back we probably shouldn't have gone the tapas route as the options were quite limited, but as New Yorkers this is what you usually do at a "Mediterranean" style restaurant. We did the brushetta trio (two were great, the pear was bland) and the bread was not brushetta style at all (was thick bread rather than thin). The artichoke hearts were good but sort of more of a salad than we expected. The lamb meatballs were fine but nothing memorable. The kale salad was super boring, consisting almost entirely of kale and very little toppings. Overall, I think we would come back for a drink only and eat somewhere else.

I went to Olive & Ivy last Friday night while on a girl's trip to Scottsdale and really enjoyed the restaurant. We made a reservation earlier in the day but when arriving to the restaurant realized that we wanted to set outside (the back patio is very cute and quieter). The bar scene is pretty good and I really enjoyed the red sangria. We ordered a bunch of items to share and everything was delicious. I recommend the roasted veggie crostini, the arugula salad, and the sweet corn and margarita flat breads. I'd give the restaurant 4.5 stars - the service was fast but our server sounded like he was reading off of a script in his head and didn't really understand the food or wine menus.

My wife and I had one of the best meals tonight. The bruschetta was excellent, the scallops were excellent and the peanut butter desert was superb. Chris was our waiter and really knew his menu and guided us to some really great choices.  I would highly recommend this restaurant!!

The food was ok, even though it didn't come out how we requested (ordered the steak with no sauce, came smothered in it- no big deal except it's the most expensive item on the menu). The WORST was that my boyfriend ordered a couple glasses of 18yr Macallan before I ordered one. I don't know what they brought me, but it certainly wasn't the 18 year, though we still got charged ($$$) for it. We did a couple blind taste tests just to be sure... Maybe they thought I wouldn't be able to tell the difference? They should be ashamed. The food was pretty good, but really overpriced. We sat outside and the atmosphere was nice. Definitely will not be back and will never recommend this place. For the money we spent, our dinner should have been flawless.

Had a fantastic experience dining at Olive & Ivy! Believe it or not, we even thoroughly enjoyed dining outside in the August Scottsdale swelter- their misting system works amazingly well.  Went with my daughter and two of her friends- and I totally loved this place! I liked the high ceilings, the cozy decor, the lighting, and the marketplace feel of the interior... Because of numerous raves on yelp, we ordered the bacon wrapped dates for an appetizer. It's true, they are totally fabulous- not to be missed!   I had chicken scaloppini, which was delicious- perfectly prepared, and served with just the right amount of sauce and Mediterranean olives. The girls all ordered pasta dishes- raved about, and then subsequently demolished them. There wasn't one crumb of food left on anyone's plate!   The focaccia bread with pesto is wonderful, and they have a great wine list here. I had a glass of Syrah from Washington state, which was thankfully served at the right temperature and was very nicely balanced. We were celebrating one of my daughter's friend's birthdays, so our delightful waiter brought us a complimentary dessert- an "ice cream bar," which had ice cream, marshmallow, and lots of rich, luscious chocolate. It was totally delicious, and reminded us of a s'more.  Olive & Ivy is a nice place to people watch- the patio fronts the waterfront, and reminded me of a sidewalk cafe in Europe. I will definitely be back- only wish we had an Olive & Ivy in Tucson!

I've been here twice in the past few months for a quick solo lunch and a laid back Saturday brunch.  For lunch I sat at the bar and received prompt service and a friendly banter from the bartender. My glass never stayed empty and my Lamb Gyro was sent over right on time....and oh my was that thing delicious! I finished my meal with a decadent blackberry vanilla gelato from the marketplace.   A little while later I chose it again for a casual brunch with my visiting sisters this weekend. Being from LA, I knew they'd appreciate the atmosphere and decor. We opted to sit outside on the gorgeous patio. Our server was warm and genuine, and he spoke enthusiastically about his favorite meals.  We ordered bellinis that arrived in big, fat glasses filled with perfectly peachy effervescence. The bread and pesto was just divine. It's clearly fresh and house made; didn't take us long to devour it all. My veggie scramble was perfectly made accompanied by whole wheat toast, softened butter and housemade strawberry jam.  My sister's turkey grinder was a bit heavy on the turkey but light on the lettuce, tomatoes, pepper and oregano that was supposed to give it flavor. It's Definitely a sandwich for someone who likes their protein.  It was my other sister's Lamb Gyro that stole the show. Again, tasty, perfectly done Lamb with the right balance of ingredients.
Over rated, not bad by any means but definitely doesn't live up to the hype and I don't understand why its constantly busy other than location.  Mediocre food, mediocre service, great location.

I had been to Olive and Ivy before for wine and flat-breads on the patio and thought it was good, but when we finally came for dinner on April 24th, the experience was excellent. We didn't have a reservation, so we made our way to the bar for a glass of wine. The hostess texted us when our table became available, which was a large comfy booth clad in a beautifully patterned fabric. Our waiter was engaging and attentive, and the food was superb. The people watching is added bonus, there were lots of interesting sleeve tattoos on the staff, and tables of rich blonde debutantes.I noticed a couple of metrosexual guys at the bar with Restalyn injections and nose jobs (which is a pretty common sight in Scottsdale).  Anyway about the food, we started with the hummus and veggies which was obviously house made and delicious. My entree was the Pacific sea bass, which, as the waiter explained, is substituted with a cousin to sea bass that is not endangered but just as tasty. The braised cauliflower was great, and the portion was perfect. The preserved grapefruit was the perfect touch, the dish needed no augmentation. My partner had the scallops which were amazing, and our relatives had the filet and added a small side of shrimp to make it a surf and turf, they loved it. We shared a lemon tres leches cake with berries for dessert that was mouth watering. The place is always packed and it's easy to see why. Beautiful ambiance and terrific food!

This looks like a classy place to have dinner and a few cocktails with friends... We headed here for drinks after dining at Blanco.   The place was less busy than I remember, making us scoring a prime outdoor seating location possible... The seven of us enjoyed several well-made cocktails and had a very nice, attentive server.  I will be back to sample their food and their renowned happy hour...

Not only is the service amazing, the food is also amazing!! Julia, our waitress was really nice and checked on how we were doing a few times. When we asked to pack our food to go, she even wrote what was in it and the date on it. The bread and the pesto sauce were amazing and really flavorful. The mushroom, mozzarella and avocado bruschetta were all delicious. The mozzarella was a bit spicy but still tasted really good. It actually made me change the way I thought of bruschetta. The sea scallops were perfectly cooked and so so yummy!! The creamed corn tasted really light and is perfect for a hot day in Arizona. The lasagna bolognese was served in a bowl and tasted great with the garlic bread.

Love, love love! I love this patio! It sure doesn't feel like you are in Arizona... It is a breath of life from wine country. You can see the European influence, but also the laid back, sitting on a good friends vineyard patio where beyond the trees is rolling hills, orchards and elegant rural life. All this and only steps away from the lavish Scottsdale Mall! The menu is well thought out and a certain amount of effort was clearly put into the bruschetta list's 6 tempting creations: All refined and elegant in their execution and piled high with toppings. The bruschetta sell for $4-$5 each, or 3 for $11 - A hell of a deal! And be sure to try the Manchego with quince & Spanish chorizo, aaah-mazing!   The other wonderfully yummy price point find is the single scoop of in-house made sorbets and gelatos, $1.75 for a single scoop! I had the lemon butter cream and it was divine. Rich, creamy, with a lovely lemon finish.   The wine list is thorough and poignant. There are not 6 different Chardonnays and 4 Sauv blancs. But approximately 9 whites and 12 reds by the glass with only 1 selection of each type of grape: One fabulous vintage for all occasions! I really adore this concept.   The restaurant is inviting and as large as the desert that surrounds this city. My server was outstanding, you rock Lauren!

This place was awesome! The atmosphere is great and they are busy so make reservations in advance! Our waiter was very nice and the other staff was great too. The music they play is a mix of old school and new pop remixed together and I loved it!!   They have outdoor seating with individual fire pits that looked gorgeous but since it was New Years and I didn't want to ruin my hair we sat indoors.   I had the bruschetta but since I'm vegetarian we got 3 of the same mozzarella ones and it was so good! The sauce is a little on the sweet side but goes well with the mozzarella and basil on top. So good!   My boyfriend had the lobster risotto and he said it was absolutely amazing. The serving was smaller than he expected and despite not being very hungry... he finished it ALL.   The vegetarian options are limited so I had the margarita pizza from the appetizer section and it was okay. Nothing too special.. I probably should've tried the sweet potato dish because I'm sure it would've been amazing!

Such a big place, with lots of things going on!  If you like open flames, you may find it fun to watch their open-air kitchen.  The service was quite good, and they have bottles of wine for almost any budget with a knowledgeable staff.   Their lamb and couscous dish was decent, though after seeing the rib-eye steak, I should have ordered that... The fish also looked quite good.   Also, get the peanut butter caramel sea salt chocolate mousse - it's good enough to eat it every day in place of a bowl of cereal, and it's just about as big! (I'd figure out how to make it at home if it didn't have so many calories...)   You could of course choose to get just the mousse and skip dinner... and I wouldn't hold it against you, though you might want to compliment it with the chocolate-chocolate-chocolate cake and an espresso when you do just so you don't pass out from the sheer weight of all the amazing calories you've eaten!   The espresso after dinner was an excellent addition to the mousse.  Stay hungry!

As soon as I saw this restaurant had opened in Scottsdale, I just HAD to try it!   It's really new and is located toward the back of the new Waterfront location in Old Town.  GREAT place!  I absolutely loved it.  Just from the look of it, I was anticipating that the menu would have pretty pricey items on it.  But I was pleasantly surprised to see that their Sunday brunch menu was VERY reasonable.    First off, the actual restaurant is gorgeous!  They have a really charming, adorable patio that is great for enjoying a sunny Arizona day (plenty of opportunities for that!).    Next subject...the food!  Definitely a gourmet feel with a hint of familiar additions like tator tots! ;) I noticed something on the menu called the croquet madame.  It sounded a little different, a ham and cheese grilled sandwich with a fried egg on top and some weird sauce that I could barely sound out!  Weird means that I definitely had to TRY IT! lol  It was soooooo delcious!  I savored every bite!  The different flavors errupted in my mouth! yum yum yum!   I have no doubt that their dinner menu is fantastic as well.  I will most definitely be checking it out again when I'm back in town!
Salmon was okay but nothing special. It came with a few beets and potatoes. Bar service was a little slow.

Great-tasting restaurant- if not one of the best at which I've ever dined. My group of ~15 was able to sit in the private dining room with the beautiful round table- perfect little room with warm, romantic lighting. Our server greeted us enthusiastically as we entered, and never wavered in service the entire meal.  We were fortunate to be eating during Restaurant Week- most of us chose that menu since the rest of the menu was a bit pricy. Because I'd done my research beforehand, I had a decent idea of what I wanted to order. I'd never even had a date before but selected the wrapped dates! Absolutely delicious. My second course was the scallops, and I wish I could've finished it, but I had to save space for dessert. The apple spiced desert was one of the best variations of apple pie I'd ever eaten, all in a cute little serving jar. If I had to give Olive & Ivy room for improvement, it would be the drink specials. Not sure if the few I had were worth the $10-15 price tag/per.

After a really bad experience elsewhere, I needed somehing positive. Olive & Ivy came through. The Mediterranean pizza was delicious and a generous portion. The grab and go salad was fresheven at 8:00 PM. WOW!!!   The service was quick and extremely pleasant.

Olive and Ivy is a solid choice in the Scottsdale area for a decent lunch and a glass of wine. I probably wouldn't wait more than 25 minutes for a table, there are other restaurants in the area I would prefer to eat at.   I had a business lunch here the other day, we split the bruschetta (the pear and avocado options were delicious). I ordered the Mediterranean salad (much larger than I was expecting but a decent salad).   We were lucky enough to have good weather and could enjoy the patio and view of the canal.

I am between a 3 and 4 on this place.  I love the location and sitting on the patio was beautiful.  A friend and I settled for a leisurely evening of catching up, having some appetizers and drinks.  The service was good and it was bad.  They were attentive but maybe too attentive.  It is bothersome to me when they take away a plate when there is still food on it (and don't ask) and take away your drink when it is almost still half full.  Those are just silly mistakes.  Otherwise, the hummus, bacon wrapped dates. lamb meatballs and gnoochi were all worth the calories. Dessert not so much (I think it was the ice cream bar).  I think it is definitely a great place to spend some time and hang out.

This is a great place to go for a special occasion. The food is fantastic and the service has always been amazing. If the weather permits try to get a table outside near the water because it will make the experience just that much more amazing! Make sure to come hungry and order the bruschetta. There are many different types to pick and choose from.
This place was sooo good! Everything was raw and organically sourced. Our server was the sweetest and our seat was right by the waterfront.   Great vibes! Perfect place for brunch :)

We stop in here a lot after our Saturday runs for breakfast.  The location near the canal is nice.  They have some delicious pastries and berry yogurt.  Also have been here for dinner.  We've found it is a nice place to take guest as it has a huge patio with lights stung across.

Went here for a moms night out and loved it!! We showed up early for our reservation and they got us right in. The ambiance was great and the food was amazing. The waiter was very attentive. Will definitely go back!

Note to self next time: Make a reservation if you plan to go on a Friday night.  This was my first time here & I definitely underestimated how busy it might be. I took a friend out for her birthday & when I walked up to the desk to ask what the wait was she said the next available table was at 9:30! (Mind you it was 6:15) But we had the option to sit at the "chefs table" which ended up being really cool anyways.  Landiss was our server & he was great! He grabbed our stuff quickly & was really friendly. I love it when I can go to a place & the people act like they genuinely enjoy their job, & he did just that.  Food: Bread & pesto is killer. Non negotiable. For a starter I got the Artichoke Hearts which were tasty & well cooked. My entree was the Wild Mushroom pappardelle & that was really delicious. I wish there was maybe a little more cheese or sauce going on, but it was still good. I also liked that I was able to be a pain in the butt & get a couple Jameson Mules even though its not on the menu. :)  I enjoyed this place & it had a great atmosphere. Will definitely be back, but next time Ill make reservations.

Went here 2years ago in May, Great ambiance and atmosphere if you don't mind the testing of lighting and waiters stumbling around and starring at you. It was my birthday and Upon moving here a guy on my flight told me to check this place out. For a special occasion I think I would recommend to pass, For an afternoon of tv and football sounds great. This place is like an Italian Applebee's! So if you like Applebee's great, go. I obviously am not..a fan of Applebee's

Absolutely perfect! Olive and Ivy is class all the way. From the hostess stand to walking out the door nothing but magical.The bacon wrapped dates are amazing. The mousse dessert was delicious. The restaurant and patio are beautiful! Staff is top notch. Will recommend and will be back again and again.

A truly classic fox restaurant. Bacon wrapped dates stuffed with Italian sausage, utterly delicious. Roasted artichoke hearts as good as it gets.  The wild mushroom pappardelle pasta was fantastic and The sea scallops with white polenta were equally scrumptious.  Energy filled vibe, good wine list, excellent service and a really nice atmosphere. This  is a "go to" for me when I am in Scottsdale.

I was so excited to eat here at Olive and Ivy on my visit to Scottsdale! The setting was lovely, but the service and judgement was nothing that I expected. Our food was DELICIOUS! Until I found a beard hair cooked INTO the dough of my pizza. Our waiter visited before and to take our order, but we did not see him after that until our bill. Water was empty, and my food had hair in it and after waiting almost ten minutes for our server to come and check on us I got up and retreived another staff member. The manager did offer us new pizza but did not seem to sincere with his apology (most likely because we are a group of young individuals). I would liked to have seen it at least taken off of our bill because we did not get to eat together. It is not about the money, but more so the lack of judgment in the experience. I am very disappointed, I've had better care at a Red Lobster. I'm very sad to say that I do not want to dine here again, nor will I recommend it to any Scottsdale friends.
OMG their balsamic artichoke pizza is AMAZING. I come here just for that dish. Restaurant is super cute. Love this place

What a brunch hot spot.  I was with a group of 9 girls for a bachelorette and failed to make Sunday brunch reservations.  We showed up at Olive and Ivy right when they opened at 10AM and were seated immediately outside at a really nice set of comfy couches and chairs.  All of our cocktails were delicious and we loved the fresh bright pesto with warm bread.  There was a coffee shop in the restaurant for those of us who needed more coffee. This was a perfect gathering spot to play a few bridal games and talk.  The seating and ambiance of the patio were perfect and service was very attentive but not too much.
A small bottle of water cost me $3.56. I cursed myself when I found out that PHX airport had water filtration at their water fountains. Bring your water bottles & fill up; don't get gouged.

Looks like there are some haters out there!  This place - in no way - deserves less than three stars in any opinion. It is at least A-OK folks. You may have a bad experience individually, but the negative review I read were just a little snobby.  Beautiful place. Great focaccia and pesto... but go easy, Killer, or you will spoil dinner.  Tasty flat bread pizza... The asparagus/shroom combo was fine, but you must like a pronounced shroom flavor.  The Mediterranean salad was a nice balance of color, flavor, and texture.

A+ for ambience and atmosphere. The outside area at night is BEYOND romantic and gorgeous.. And the inside is just as cool.  I had the salmon Caesar salad which was pretty yummy and oddly filling? Haha Or perhaps I was already full from the absolutely amazing basil/pesto/olive oil spread that was served with our bread. Regardless, it was a good-sized salad.  My fiancé had the spinach and veal ravioli which was downright melt-in-your-mouth amazing. While it could've probably been enough for me, he arrived starving so he was still somewhat hungry after finishing his meal in a whopping 5 minutes.  Luckily we had the bread and he had some of my salad but I do have to admit it couldn't have more than maybe 8 ravioli pieces? And for the price, that definitely wasn't enough.. Hence the 4 star rating vs 5 star.  We'll still be back.. I love their patio area and wine selection, maybe this time we'll get an app for my fiancé!
Great place and awesome food! This is in a great location, with good customer service and has outdoor seating for relaxing conversation and food!

Great ambiance both indoors and outdoors. It's the best to sit out in the patio when the weather is nice out with a glass or bottle of wine . Food is great but the alcohol here is better . Price is average for old town. Highly recommend! Cute date and brunch place!!

Best Mediterranean salad w chicken on the planet. I moved to San Francisco and have yet to find a salad I am as passionate about as this one. Also they used to have this flatbread w corn and goat cheese that was to die for. Their bread and pesto is also dank. 5 stahssss!
Went on an off hour late dinner on a Saturday night. Definitely pricey but well worth for the service and food. Great atmosphere, low light good for a romantic dinner.
Amazing!!!! One of my favorite eateries in Scottsdale. The food and drinks are all phenomenal!
Food is terrific and the outdoor patio is the best seat in the house if you can reserve it :)
Awesome food and beverage menu. Great atmosphere! As long as it isn't too hot, grabbing a seat on the patio is highly recommended!

Arrived on a Sunday around 1PM about a month ago and was promptly seated in the dining area.  If you prefer, you can also visit their connected take out area.  Service excellent, although on a Sunday there were several screaming children and very loud large groups, but that's expected when you eat out so can't complain too much.  If you are a fan of pesto, you will be pleasantly surprised to taste the complimentary pesto w/warm, fresh bread.  I could have just ate that all afternoon! Delicious!  I ordered tomato bisque which was the absolute best tomato bisque ever!  If I were in the area I might try this place again, although there are so many other nice restaurants in the area I've yet to try that I'd probably opt for one of those.

Had brunch on the patio, it was a sunday so it WAS very busy but worth the wait. Kind of annoying that I ordered a mimosa first thing after being greeted and didn't get it until after I got my meal. It was all tasty none the less. I've been there several times since and everything that I've tried on the menu has been great. Love the atmosphere, if it is nice out sit outside!
Sometimes very busy, but you can get a seat at the bar instead of waiting for a table.  Their Gyros is the best in Phoenix.

Olive & Ivy never fails to disappoint! I've been there for business meetings, date night and meeting up with friends, and it's always great! It's definitely one of my favorite Fox Restaurants, and the Scottsdale location is right on the Waterfront in Old Town.   If you're visiting, it's great in the summer or winter, but especially good when you can dine outside. You can also walk from Olive & Ivy to the rest of Old Town, without having to take another cab.  My recommendations include:  -bacon wrapped dates - just phenomenal here! -bruschetta - lots of options, and some claim that they're the best in town. I like the fig & prosciutto.  -scallops - creamed corn and bacon gastrique? So good! -the filet - I haven't had this yet, but my co-workers said it was the best filet that they've had in AZ. At $39, it's not cheap, but these guys know steak and were thoroughly impressed!  Visited September 2015
Wow, fun place for a drink and appetizer after 3 hours of walking,shopping,etc. A lot of people in a great atmosphere. Fun "Happy Hour"place even better at night for dinner. Beautiful restaurant.
