Very nice place to take guests, it has an ambiance that is upscale yet not pretentious. The servers are nice and the food is pretty good. Their happy hour is nice for wintertime since you have to sit outside on the patio to get it. My only complaint is how the food costs an arm and a leg and has portion sizes not even fit for a child...

Went here for my birthday last night. I love the atmosphere but the food ... I'm on the fence. We started off with the fritto misto. Very soft, tender, not too breaded. I think that might be my fav so far. For entrees, we had the bouillabaisse, bone-in ribeye, and lasagna. The bouillabaisse was okay. My friends liked it. The broth lost flavor when dipped with bread. The lasagna is just lasagna and how can you go wrong? Lastly, the bone-in ribeye. Now, I'm the type of girl who an eat steak everyday, or every other day. I have eaten steak for 7 days straight. That's how much I love steak, and bone-in....yes! After having a bone-in ribeye at Steak 44 last week, I couldn't wait to eat another. By all means, I'm not comparing. But the creamed spinach was so rich that it took over the flavor and there was no steak to taste. Totally disappointing. If I were to order the steak again, I would ask to substitute the creamed spinach and not have any foods touch my steak. Also, it seemed like the chef really likes butter. I mean, probably not the healthiest dishes. I would come back but not order the same dishes. I'll keep you updated along the way....

Loved this place!!! The ribeye steak and creamed spinach was delicious, the ambiance gorgeous and the service left nothing to be desired. 4 people and $172 dollars later so glad the driver suggested this place and next time I'm in Phoenix I'll make it a point to come back.

Watch out what time you go. Lunch menu switches over to dinner at 3. You can't order anything off the lunch menu and half the dinner menu is still blocked off as they prep the kitchen. So expect between 3 and 4pm is relegated to salads and flatbreads, but its also happy hour. Happy hour only applies to the bar and outdoor lounge though. Overall great food, nice weather on good days, and beautiful area.

5 stars ain't enough.   This was easily one of the Top 5 meals I've had in my life (in its price range). A big thank you and hats off to our server Jeremy, who did an excellent job in providing us with superb customer service!!! He is everything a perfect server should embody :-)   Honestly, I came in with low/medium expectations because this place reminded me of a fancy version of Lemonade (a chain restaurant in California) serving Californian cuisine, which is good, but not my favorite. Jeremy assured us that their cuisine is more Mediterranean than Californian so that made me instantly happy!   On to the food-   COMPLIMENTARY BREAD W/ PESTO- AMAZING!!! The pesto sauce is the best I've ever had. It was thick and packed with flavor, loaded with pine nuts, and not overly drenched in olive oil. The bread was light and fluffy- off to a great start  CHEF'S PLATE ($18)- GET THIS. I dream about this plate. I was hesitant to order this at first seeing that it's pretty pricey for an appetizer. This could easily double as an entree, but I would still recommend getting it even if you already ordered an entree. This was one of the BEST charcuterie boards I've had. I could rave about this for the rest of my life. Plat included: * 2 kinds of bread- a buttered, light & crispy artisan bread + an extremely soft loaf of bread that melts in your mouth. 2 kinds of artisan cheese- one strong gorgonzola + brie-like soft cheese. * 2 kinds of meat- spicy salami + prosciutto * a LOT of olives, dates, pistachios, and pickled lettuce.  I loved all the contrasting textures and different tastes of this. My taste buds were doing backflips! I found myself still digging at this even after I finished stuffing myself with my meal. By far my favorite!!!   BACON-WRAPPED PORK TENDERLOINS ($24)- These pork loins were perfectly caramelized and had this EXTREME melt-in-your-mouth quality. My knife sliced through them like butter and it was the perfect amount of chewy and tasty. Came with yummy mini potatoes, collard greens, and polenta. This was such a good choice and is one of the more filling meat plates, as mentioned by Jeremy.   WILD MUSHROOM PAPPARDELLE ($16)- This pasta gave me life. They use a lot of truffle oil in this dish and it pairs really well with the mushrooms and parmesan slices. The pappardelle pasta is cooked to a perfect al dente and topped with fresh basil throughout.   I enjoyed every second of my meal and my experience with Jeremy and would 100000% come back next time I visit Scottsdale.

I have been here a handful of times. It's in a convenient location where you can get soem shopping done or grab a drink in Old Town after. The restaurant has a good vibe; great modern decor. The wait staff and hosts/hostesses are incredibly attentive. Bonus: they are crazy good looking too. The last time I ate here, I was with 4 other girls. One of my friends broke her sandal and I asked the host if we could have some tape. Bonus points to him for giving us Velcro. We had an Open Table rezzie so we were seated right away in the dining room. I will have to ask to sit outside next time when it cools down...  We ordered much needed wine and cocktails and started off with the bruschetta. It was super tasty, seasoned perfectly and was great to share with the girls. The girls ordered shrimp and grits and salads and other dishes I can't remember off the top of my head but I went with the scallops. Moral of the story: great, fresh food and at a decent price. I didn't have room for dessert but we ordered gelato for the table. The waiter messed up on the number of scoops but that was the only thing that went wrong. Everyone cleaned their plates and was swooning over their meals. I think on the weekends they have a DJ right in the entrance, the music was actually pretty good but not sure if it fits with the crowd. There were very few people/tables who were our age (mid 20's) If you're in OT, check this place out.

I love this place. I have only eaten here once but it was very fulfilling of my expectations. The place is very classy and a little bit too fancy for the area but besides that the food was amazing. I thought it was a little weird that they were serving brunch at 2 in the afternoon on a Sunday but it definitely changed my thought on that when my food came. I got the egg sandwich and it was to die for! Perfect size and getting the side of potatoes was definitely a good choice. I definitely would love to go back and try what they have to offer on their lunch menu!

Lovely spot to grab a quick meal or some of their delicious coffee. Olive and Ivy is a great comfortable place to hang out as it is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Their pastries and gelato are also to die for.

Great food. Tuna sandwich is delicious. Food just seems to vary in portions depending on who prepares i guess. Sometimes I've had a side that came with literally 12 french fries and then sometimes they overload the container. Service is always quick and friendly!!

Olive and Ivy is a great place as a venue inside and outside. Over the years they have slowly raised their prices on food items but it is still a great place none the less. I personally think they have a better lunch menu than dinner menu but you can just decide that for yourself. The turkey grinder and chicken panini are my favorite. On weekends get a drink from their brunch menu.

Wow really bad service.  Food was good though.  Their turkey grinder with greens is excellent. Our waiter brought our drinks (finally) when our lunch was half eaten.  Most people like to have their wine before the meal.  Really crappy service all the way around.  And it was embarrassing as I was taking someone for lunch. Booooooo!

Had dinner with friends. Service was great and the food was outstanding. Great bread and pesto to start. I had the sweet potato cannelloni which was exquisite. The waiter suggested adding a protein. I added shrimp, a great choice. The other guests had Mediterranean salad, bacon wrapped pork and chicken scalloping. Everyone raves. Can't wait to go back. Prices were very reasonable, too.

[RESERVATION] I had been meaning to go here for a while. However, when I came with my parents for dinner, the hostess told us the restaurant would have an opening two hours later. When I came here with friends, some time later, they told us the same thing. Long story short, you should make a reservation. I was able to get a table for a Sunday night when I called two days before having dinner with my family.  I don't think the Olive and Ivy sign does the restaurant justice, because it makes it seem like the usual casual, chain restaurant. However, the inside is great (just a tad too dimly lit). There are jars with lights in them hanging down from the ceiling and a view of the river(?)/creek next to the restaurant. It is kind of loud as well.  [APPETIZERS] We were served complimentary homemade focaccia bread and pesto sauce. For appetizers, we ordered "Choose 3 for $11" bruschetta and Kale Salad [$11]. The butternut squash was my favorite. The prosciutto and fig was also very good. The amount that they give you for the salad is pretty filling. I think this is good to share because I feel like I would become bored with it if I just ordered that for myself.  [ENTREES] The Prosciutto and Marscarpone Tortelli [$16] doesn't look well put together. I was actually disappointed by the presentation when it first came out because it doesn't look like it will taste good. However, it tastes amazing. The sauce used in this dish is great to dip bread in.  My brother ordered the Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin [$24], which was amazing. I don't usually order pork because I fear it will be tough and not flavorful, but the bacon definitely was a great addition. I don't know what they did to the brussels sprouts but whatever bad taste they left in your mouth the last time you decided to give them a chance will go away once you try these.   Shrimp Risotto [$25] was good - my dad really liked it. I'm just not much of a risotto person - I think that's what I'm starting to realize about myself. But if risotto is what you like, then you won't be dissatisfied.   My mom ordered the Pacific Sea Bass (I think). I thought the presentation for this was well done.  [DESSERTS] Desserts I would suggest that you get elsewhere. I mean, they were okay, but nothing amazing. We ordered the bread pudding(?) that comes with a scoop of ice cream and lemon blueberry cake.

If you are in this area and hungry for Seafood, go to Wildfish.  If you are hungry for anything else, come here.  My wife and I walked by here many times, but were never hungry.  We went to Scottsdale for some Cactus convention, and made it a point to stop here this time.  We ate outside on the patio, with the misters going.  I had the Natural Chicken or something like that, and it was amazing.  Chicken breast with the skin left on, over mashed potatoes.....with a mushroom sauce that is a bit misleading.  Says it is Citrus Jus, and since I am not a citrus sauce fan, told the waiter no sauce.  He suggested I get it on the side, so I did.  I tried it, and it MADE the dish.  No citrus flavor at all, very sweet like PF Chang's Mongolian sauce.  My wife got the Mushroom Pasta dish, and loved it.  Over all, one of my favorite places to go in Scottsdale.  Yelp, what is with the "gender neutral" restroom question?   Please!  Who gives a sh!t?  Restrooms have been pretty basic for centuries, look down, then use appropriate restroom!
Great food, great service, beautiful location. Don't miss this place! The sangria is amazing.

Had a great experience at this restaurant with my wife.  Our waiter recommended the shrimp scampi risotto because that is  the favorite dish of the managers and chefs.  I totally agree - it was phenomenal. My wife had the chicken scaloppini based on his recommendation and that did not disappoint either.  Highly recommend both dishes.  My wife is gluten free and they had a number of dishes to choose from.

Very nice lunch spot. I go here quite often. Whether its with my friends, or family, this place has always been extremely consistent and I know exactly what I am going to get. Great food, great service. As with most of the Fox Concepts, they don't disappoint. The Sea bass is amazing! We have had many dishes here including the pastrami sandwich, various pastas, and raviolis. All of which are great. The setting is very well constructed, and allows for a nice ambiance. This place caters to a wide variety of people, which allows for a setting of all occasions.
Just had lamb gyro tasted like burnt patties. Very dissatisfied. I usually love  the restaurant.

We missed the happy hour but the dinner was great!! We had bacon wrapped dates to start. It was tasty and interesting combination but too much for two people(5 bacon wrapped dates per order). I got pacific sea bass w/caramelized cauliflower, snap peas & preserved grapefruit. That was wonderful. I could lick the plate if it possible. I like the sea bass is crispy and tender. The grapefruit works so well with the plate. The sauce is also amazing. My boyfriend got spicy shrimp risotto w/white zucchini, arbol chili & lemon. There are tons of shrimp and the risotto taste wonderful as well. We had guava sorbet as dessert. For the price I think it is the cheapest sorbet I had in the restaurant. It taste good and real!! I wish I had a chance to visit Olive & Ivy again.

Like Minneapolis & St. Paul. Like Cagney & Lacey. Like Nip & Tuck. Olive & Ivy is beautiful and near some water, entertaining and lesbian friendly and full of people who've had plastic surgery. Great space. Fabulous patio. I know. I know. The canal. Ugh. Love it? Hate it? Hey, it's there people. Embrace it! Like the Brady's did cousin Oliver.  And embrace the Eggs Benedict, Egg Sandwich, Focacciao bread with pesto and CENTER CUT CINNAMON ROLLS! You heard me people! Center cut. No non glazed, hardened, corner piece. Service was outstanding. I noticed the patio filled up just after we arrived. Isn't that weird? Does that ever happen to you? You arrive somewhere. Nothing. Soon the place is buzzing and so are you? Anyway. I digress. We were thirsty fashionistas recovering after a night at Scottsdale Fashion Week...i.e. we were pickled and thirsty. Ice tea and water was a flowin' the entire meal. They saw it in our blood shot eyes I'm sure. Eggs Benedict was perfection and had a delightful surprise of basil on top! Rickie LOVED his egg sandwich with avocado...looked great...though he never offered me any...Hmmm..Olive & Ivy. Like Ebony & Ivory. Living together in perfect harmony. Side by side....ok ok ok you get the picture.

I like the atmosphere and energy at Olive and Ivy. I love going there for drinks and appetizers. The one at the waterfront is beautiful and the large patio is next to the water. Service is friendly. If you have a private party you can reserve the party room (which is beautiful). The Sangria is one of my favorite drinks. Try it with a couple of appetizers!

A friend and I decided to go to Olive and Ivy's happy hour on Friday. It was a warm day but we still sat on the patio and it was perfect with the misters and shaded trees. They offer great HH prices half off sangria pitchers, apps, flat breads and signature cocktails. We ordered the red sangria and it was delicious. We liked how it wasn't jammed full with chunks of fruit we felt we got more for our money. We ordered the antipasti plate that we were pleased with as well as the artichoke hearts. This was served with a salad that I thought was a nice touch. The service was friendly and attentive.

Love love love this place! We opted for the outdoor seating on the patio for lunch which was perfect. The seating is very comfortable and casual and included a fire pit. My mom and I ordered the avocado, mozzarella, and mushroom bruschettas. The mozzarella was my favorite out of the bunch. We also got the hummus appetizer which was good but kind of spicy. The braised short rib flatbread was the best part of the meal. Overall friendly service, lovely atmosphere, and great food. Definitely a must to visit in Scottsdale.

There's something about Olive & Ivy that makes me want to go back. Sadly, its not the food, as much as I wish it was. Yet, I go back. [Sometimes, it is for food. Those lamb meatballs are not meant for sharing. Take my advice and there will be peace at the table.]  Where else can you sip on 5$ mimosas, on a balmy Saturday afternoon, in a Mediterranean inspired well manicured backyard? The setting takes you miles away from the brown overloaded Arizona. The ambience and service more than make up for the 'just a notch above mediocre' food. I particularly like taking the unreserved lounge seating and linger around for longer than they may like!  At some places, the food just takes a backseat. Here, it's for a good reason.

The food is very good for the style of restaurant (some hot food & sandwiches at a counter) and they've got good options. But the staff is what made all the difference. I was delayed for a long layover and ended up sitting there for the better part of 4 hours. They not only didn't complain that I was taking up a seat, but continually brought me fresh water & lemon, even before dinner time hit and I ordered my turkey pesto. They went out of their way to make sure I was taken care of.

What's the most important piece for your decision at an airport on where to eat? Time.  I give it a 4 because the line moves pretty quickly and the people were cordial.  Food quality is pretty decent. Price is a little ridiculous, but hey all airports are.  Bacon eggs toast and home style potatoes were $9. My iced coffee was another $2.   They have a lot of choices for lunch for sandwiches, and they seem to make everything fresh. Plenty of seats.

Walked into this place on a Saturday night (i am from out of town) with my 4 girl friends...this place is HUGE!   Very packed and loud but in a fun way.  Love the decor and ambiance. Huge bar in the middle with a nice wine list and a variety of drink options. The wait was a little annoying, as we had reservations and still had to wait about 40 minutes. The menu had some vegetarian options, not a whole lot, but what i ate was really good.  The vegetable Crostini appetizer was amazing and the Hummus was not that bad either. I had the margarita pizza which was good, my friends had a pasta with chicken and they loved it as well. The sangria we had was ok, I've had better in Chicago.  The crowd was upbeat and lively, seemed to have quite a few out of towners as well, and the age ranged anywhere from college to seniors...price wise it wasn't the cheapest place but it won't rip a hole in your pocket either.
Fun chic atmosphere.  Great patio.  Food is consistent and good.  Pastas are wonderful.

Anyway, we arrived and without reservation we were seated immediately. Everything about our dining experience was excellent. Our waitress was awesome. It was my lovahs 30th bday dinner and she went above and beyond and even offered to take pics for us when she saw me struggling to do a photo shoot myself. We picked a trio of bruschetta and they were alllll delish! My honey got the sweet potato ravioli and omigod i couldn't stop opening my mouth so he would feed me another bite. I had the risotto which was good but his ravioli was just downright fantastic! We had champagne and they come in cute flutes and also a bday dessert with a candle on the house!!!   The ambiance here is great... good music and lighting. We will be back. I def def def recommend! (no stuttering prob, just expressing you should DEF try it out ) :)

Just happened upon this place while traveling to Arizona to visit my parents.  Wow!  The ambiance is great and the food is even better.  We started with the bacon wrapped date small plate which was one of the most delicious tasting things I have "ever" eaten.  I highly highly recommend ordering this item, you won't  be disappointed.  We followed this with the kale salad and the funghi trifolati flatbread, both of which were made of very fresh ingredients, many of which were organic.  I will definitely be back here next time I'm in town.
The food and service are always amazing. The Sunday champagne brunch is great. The morning coffee/breakfast bar is quick and delicious.

Three stars for service. Thereafter, the food is average at best.  We split a flatbread pizza and garden salad.  There was so much grease it puddled and we literally needed paper towels to sop it up.  Additionally, the garden salad's lettuce was very limp and unappetizing.  Most of the food was still on plates when we exited. With so many epic restaurants in town, I recommend not immediately choosing the most recognized establishments....

I came here during my stay in Scottsdale for work on a Sunday night. It happened to coincide with Spring Training so I was told that all the restaurants were much busier than usual. This is probably the reason that despite the many empty tables both inside and outside (they were all filled by the time I left), I was told there was only availability for one at the bar or area in front of the kitchen. I opted for the kitchen area and got to watch the cooks at work during my dinner.   The atmosphere is very chic, but the patrons were a eclectic mix of retirees, families and young partiers. The concept is Mediterranean, although I didn't see any traditionally Mediterranean dishes on the menu. The menu is pretty sizable with a variety of pasta, fish, and meats to select from, with vegetarian and gluten-free options marked.    FOOD: PROSCIUTTO CRUDO FLATBREAD (topped with rosemary potato and soft egg) - When I ordered this, I didn't realize the portion was supposed to be shared so it ended up being way too much for me. If I had just one slice, it would've been great, but it got tiring after my third slice.  BIG EYE TUNA (with charred scallions, snap peas, couscous & miso caramel) - I'm a sucker for couscous! I always order it when I see it on the menu so this selection was a no-brainer. The couscous and the snap peas did not disappoint. The Ahi Tuna was sesame seed crusted and was fine, but not mind-blowing. I wish it were marinated more to give it extra flavor.   The reason I rated this as 3 stars is simply because while the food was good, nothing was that impressive, especially for the price. Maybe if I came back and tried a few more items and drinks I would change my mind, but for now, this is just an OK restaurant.  I would still recommend this restaurants for groups because I think their outside patio area is lovely. The menu is also diverse and safe enough that everyone should be able to find something they enjoy. However, definitely make a reservation, otherwise you'll be stuck at the bar like me!

Very cool place! Our party of 4 sat outside. What a terrific outdoor space they have there. The inside was just as lovely. Really cool decor with incredible lighting. The service was impeccable too. All the food was delicious, although the portions were a bit small for the price. Two of us had seafood, and the other two had pasta. We had enjoyed some wine and cheese before coming here so we didn't order any appetizers. We saw someone else with the bruschetta trio and it looked really good. We definitely plan to return on our next visit to Scottsdale!

We came here as part of our celebrating 40 years together. This place is really nice. The decor and lighting promises a romantic and relaxed experience. The menu pleasantly surprises with items not commonly found. We are warmly welcomed and promptly seated in a high backed booth that allows for privacy. I've given 5 stars and here is why. I got the veal and spinach ravioli. It comes and the presentation is beautiful. Then I take a bite and it is cold. First in a restaurant of this caliber cold food should never leave the kitchen. But more importantly how the restaurant handles things when mistakes are made. And this is why despite getting cold food I am still giving 5 stars. The manager immediately apologized, told me they would not reheat it, but will remake the dish for me so it would be fresh. My dish comes back piping hot, beautifully presented, and the taste was worth amazing. And then the manager told me my meal was on the house. And that is exactly how this should have been handled. No excuses, make it right. And on top of this, when I made the reservation I had indicated it was our 40th Anniversary. The brought us an on the house dessert to share that was so beautifully presented, and again the taste was amazing. We will definitely be back.
Excellent service. Excellent tasty food. Outside patio atmosphere under the lights was perfect. Took Yelp reviews to heart and gave it a try. Will definitely go back. Many times.
FANTASTIC SERVICE!!! They ran out of Sam Adams. Robert went to get me a draft Sam Adams next door! Who does that?!?! A++++ service!

While my buddy Mike Z. was in town, we hit a few high spots...by which I could mean that we were high when we hit them...so munchies:)  But, no...my drug of choice is KetelOne or Bunnahabhain these days:)  One of the high spots was the fabulous Scottsdale Waterfront and Olive and Ivy:)  Of all the things that you can say about the Scottsdale Waterfront the most accurate is that it is, indeed, on the water:)  I grew up in the northwest and then lived in San Francisco for many years...I've dined overlooking the Mighty Columbia, the Mighty Pacific, The Mighty Willamette.  While traveling, I've managed to sup while overlooking the Mighty North Sea, the Mighty Atlantic and the Mighty Mississippi.  I'm probably not a good one to ask about the waterfront appeal of the Mighty Arizona Canal:)  Never the less, Olive and Ivy is a nice enough place:)  It's another Fox Concept (don't you just love the branding and labeling of these kinds of things:)  I suppose it would just be too darn simple to just say "Hey, look!...Sam Fox just opened a new place!:)...Yay!"...or something like that...no, it's a "concept"...and if you know me at all (and most of you don't) you know that restaurant nomenclature is nearly a complete mystery to me.  Fox Concept is no exception (oh, I get the "Olive and Ivy"...it's sort of Mediterranean, with a what...California overbite?:)...is that a concept?  I any event, The Beautiful Carin, Mike and I strolled over for cocktails and dinner, stayed for desert, sat out on the patio (which is very pleasant, BTW:)  And we enjoyed ourselves!  Well, why not...it was an enjoyable evening...pleasant atmosphere... the service was very good (I sometimes wonder if my reputation as a stupid good tipper is being spread around town...I seem to get great service even in places that don't really have a reputation for good service...I don't know...maybe it's just a coincidence:)  At any rate...the concept was hoppin'!:-)  Ton's of terrific people watching...people dining, people strolling along the Mighty Arizona Canal, people doing the hook up dance in the bar...dinner and a show...what a concept! :-)  We each had a couple of marti's (oh, the joys of being able to walk to dinner!:)  We started with a hummus something appetizer and antipasti...The Beautiful Carin and I split a perfectly serviceable Caesar salad and I had a nice risotto, while Carin ordered her standby...roasted chicken (I wish I could remember what Mikey ordered, but I was too busy with my marti's, chit chat and what not:)  After dinner, desert seemed like a reasonable idea:)  Mike and I each had a Porto, while we all shared something chocolate and another something kind of cinnamon and orange...  It was all pretty good, not the best risotto, but good...actually, not the best anything, but still good...all pretty well executed (if not truly inspired)  If Fox's Concept is separating me from my money on a fairly regular basis, then I guess it's a successful concept:)
Another Fox concept success. Tried it and really enjoyed everything about it. The service, the food, and especially the outside seating area. Just a beautiful place to go chill.

Having been back a second time, I can't say i understand why this is so highly rated. While I get that the ambiance is cool, the food was relatively mediocre and greasy. Also, it took over 30 minutes for us to get any dishes. Definitely not acceptance during a weekday lunch. Crossing this one off my list to revisit.

We celebrated my cousin's bachelorette lingerie shower in the gold room last weekend and it was such a great experience! Since none of us were from the area, it was so nice to have a long, private dinner. Our server MA (Mark Anthony) was great! He was personable, fun, and really knew the menu (we kind of tested him on the menu!) The food was fresh and delicious, and the ambiance was perfect for a great girls night. The manager came in a few times to check on us and thank us, and even brought us a round of shots to get the night started. I'd recommend this place to anyone in the area or traveling to Scottsdale!

My second or third time going to this restaurant first time was mediocre the second time was my birthday and I had an amazing time just because the staff treated me and my guest with utmost respect and we got the room in the back so we had a really good time. So this last time we were just there this past Saturday night for dinner and I can say I was server John was perfect. Because I am vegan vegetarian there was nothing on the menu that I could have eaten so he suggested a alternative dinner option and I got the Catalonia(sp). It was very very tasty and for dessert I had the sorbet. Everyone said the food was OK however the choices for dinner could have been much better. Everyone came to the consensus that the brunch menu is way better than that dinner menu. I just wish that the restaurant would be able to have better options for groups of parties I understand it's easier to have one menu or two menus but if I am going to be paying 50 or $60 I think the food choices and the servings should be just a little bit better tasting.   All in all I will be back but not for dinner most likely just back for brunch!

Somewhere between a 3.5-4   We tried to find Aye Caramba with another GPS fail and in frustration I just drove to the Fiesta Bowl Museum so at least my plus one could get to see his football stuff..... fail (again) turned into a positive. We went in for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised.   My egg sandwich was yummy. They said Kaiser roll but what I got was something soft and delicious (similar to Matt's Big Breakfast's Five Spot). Eggs were well done, avocado was fresh, cheese was yummy and the highlight was the potatoes. The potatoes were crispy outside soft inside and decently seasoned. It was a lot of food for 7.50. Boyfriend got the 2 eggs and he was happy. While we were waiting for our food we caught sight of the french toast.. it smelled like cinnamon and sugar and they were three large thick slices along side some berry compote....next time.. next time...   Liked the decor (we sat near the wine cellar wall) and our food came within 10 minutes.    In looking at the reviews maybe breffix (breakfast) is a better option than lunch.

I note with interest that Olive and Ivy appears to advertise on Yelp, and also that numerous negative reviews have been buried by Yelp in the "Not Recommended" section.  Coincidence?  Who knows.  We'll see where this review ends up...  In short, this restaurant's location is terrific--in a vibrant spot on the Scottsdale waterfront, perfect for strolling and window-shopping before or after dinner.  Food is so-so.  Restaurant is very loud.  Service is horrible: we were seated at 6:30 and when I finally left at 8:45 my entree had not yet been served.  On a related note, the valet service doesn't use paper check tickets, they use an app which requires you to provide your cell phone number to them, and which appears to slow them down considerably because it's difficult for them to use.  Retrieving my car took about 15 minutes even though there was only one person ahead of me.

During the spring and fall in Phoenix, I'm a huge fan of Olive & Ivy. You can't beat their patio - its first come, first served on huge, comfortable furniture along with fire pits. The areas are nicely divided and its absolutely perfect for large groups. Sometimes the stench of the "waterfront" aka canal can creep up on you, but its usually fine.   What to order? I typically don't get dinner, but like to share small plates like the flatbread with my party. The sangria, margaritas and wine are all really good. Oh - and if they don't just automatially bring it over, but sure to ask for the bread and pesto. Delish!

We visited Olive & Ivy while we were on vacation for a long weekend in Scottsdale, and it was hands down the best meal we had.  We were seated promptly when we arrived (we had a reservation) and our server was awesome- knowledgeable, informative and not overbearing.  The ambiance was great, sort of trendy/modern.  The space is large and the tables are spaced nicely, making it a nice date night spot.  The food was really great.  We had the hummus for an appetizer, which was amazing and had just the right amount of garlic.  For entrees I had the scallopes and he had the bacon wrapped pork tenderlion, both of which were supurb.  Dinner was a little pricey, but for the great quality of food and service I'd say that it was worth it.  If we visit Scottsdale again we will definitely return to Olive & Ivy.

Two words, the ones to influence you when making your decision: Thoroughly. Delicious.   Moving on to the specifics, highlights include:  Mushroom asparagus flat bread: Seriously beyond the beyond. Shaved bits of parmesan, melted mozzarella, asparagus tips, mushroom pieces and *deep breath* drizzled with blessed truffle oil.   Market salad: fresher than fresh bitter greens, candied citrus peels, balsamic vinaigrette. The market salad is not an every day option, but really damn good so if this is offered on the day you go, get it as a side to make you feel less guilty about eating all the bready wonders in this place (more to come!)  Sangria: True grown up grape juice. Maybe *too* much homage to Welch's.    Hummus: Good. Possibly great. But the aforementioned flat bread eclipsed the shit out of it. I broke my usual rule to only order hummus in straight-up Middle Eastern restaurants. If the hummus is the only veg option in a place, fine, but there are plenty at Olive & Ivy (read: get the damn flat bread!)  And then there's the bread that comes out before everything else. Almost focaccia, but of a less heavy texture, these slices of heavenly gluten come with a pesto dipping sauce.  Note: do not come here if you're god forbid trying to avoid carbs. Not that this is me.  Environs: oozes atmosphere, whether you dine out on the patio or the high ceiling dining room (check out the opulent private dining room which is enclosed in glass, just waiting for wannabe Prince Williams and Kate Middletons. Or even wannabe Gene Simmons and Shannon Tweeds).   Special shout-out to our "darling" (as Jeffrey H puts it) waitress.

Bruschetta (salmon lox, avocado, prosciutto choices) tasted amazing - seasoned great. Also great we're the Mediterranean salad and chopped chicken salad. Larsen was our excellent server. Great view, people watching near the Soleri Bridge.

If you find yourself wondering what this place reminds you of, think no more - it is a glorified Cheesecake Factory.  The ambience is Willy Wonka meets Alice in Wonderland with the super high ceilings, geometric decor and frankly, a color scheme that needs to be muted down a notch or two.    The bartenders are obviously swamped so they are sloppy with their cocktail creations, with luxardo cherries carelessly dropped into my old-fashioned drink, waiting to be diluted by the generic ice cubes that overflowed from the glass.    Frito misto and lamb meatballs sounded like heaven but when the plates arrived, the frito misto looked like sad calamari rejects from Olive Garden.  Not sure what proportion of the meatballs were actually lamb but they sure resembled the factory-made ones they sample at Costco.    Now I'm not some grumpy old fart but what's with the loud music being blasted by the DJ awkwardly positioned by the door? Such a weird vibe in a weird space- it was all so disappointing...

My girlfriend and I both started of with the eighteen dollar margaritas(which are actually $11-though they would be $18 in California for how strong they were). Then we had the bruschetta sampler appetizer, which was enough to be a meal. The ambiance was far nicer than the mall setting would seem to allow. And our server, Alyssa was prompt with getting our order, bringing our food, and guiding us toward more optimal options. I wish she would wait and on us every time. All in all it was a great place to dine out in Scottsdale

what's the point of this place? Besides the little hipster drink shop, the food i dont think is very impressive, what's the appeal? the location? I don;t get it, maybe im missing something but i remember never wanting to go sit down there again, i just swing in for a kombucha if my chakras are balanced.
I want to fly to Phoenix airport every week just to eat their pizza. So...SO...SOOOOO good!

One of my favorite Fox Restaurants and an Old Town staple for me and my friends.  They have amazing pesto and bread that is served complimentary with every meal.  The Ivy and Ginger cocktail is refreshing and not too sweet.  For breakfast, the cinnamon roll is amazing and so is the sausage sandwich.  For lunch, I reccomend the chicken pesto flatbread and, for dinner, I reccomend the Sweet Potato Cannelloni. They also have the most amazing Oreo Cheesecake Gelato.
Amazing food!  We had the Shrimp Rissotto... A must have!  The Mediterranean salad with Shrimp and the cheese and mushroom flat bread.  The service was top class.  I will return!

Olive & Ivy sounds cool because in SD we have "Juniper & Ivy^ and it's a super cool spot, so we were hoping Olive & Ivy was super cool too... turned out the name wasn't lying!  We couldn't decide were to go for brunch so I yelped "bloody mary" and O&I came up so being alcoholics we needed our morning fix...well by the time we woke up and came here it was noon. We were able to make resos through opentable and got seated really quickly. Upon being seated we were greeted by our server and ordered drinks- Bloody Mary & Gin Greyhound.   Bloody Mary- good mix to it, it wasn't watery. Garnish was a bit bare, but my second one they stepped up the garnish game (olives, lemon & celery). I love BMs were  you can get a lot of garnishes. My friend hates gin, but he said that was one of the best grey hounds! You can't even taste the gin. They were pretty generous on the alcohol portion as we left with a great buzz.   Now on to the food! The house bread that came with pesto dipping sauce made it all better. I love bread with good dipping sauce. Plus one for that! I couldn't decide if I wanted breakfast or lunch as now it's noonish and it's already really hot in Scottsdale. So my friend and I decided to order lunch portions and split it. We got the prosciutto flatbread and the lamb gyro. I'm glad we got both because O&I is mediterranean and it didn't disappoint. The highlight was the prosciutto crudo flatbread with an egg on top. They also had basil and rosemary potatoes on the flatbread. It was soo good and portions were generous. We were able to take half the flatbread back and ate it a few hours later and it still tasted good!  *Side note: One of the bartenders looked like Manny Pacquiao,,,and we came on the fight weekend. We really wanted to go up to him and say "hey you're going to be late for your fight" but I'm sure he gets shit from everybody that weekend.

Beautiful restaurant!, unbelievably delicious bacon wrapped dates for appetizer!!!! Only problem was distracted service.... having to ask for water refills etc and it is pretty expensive, particularly for a very large restaurant that is part of a chain. We will check it out again though!

Probably not going to be a popular review but here goes. Went in Sunday for lunch and sat at the bar. The place is very loud. The bartenders were responsive but to say they were stiff would be an understatement. The food was good but pricey and I asked them to skip the couscous on my salad and did not remove it. To be fair I think this place is a hipsters dream with the vested pretentious bartenders and the Bellinis and other fancy drinks. If that is your scene you will love this place but it is just not our speed.

Olive & Ivy is everything a brunch spot should be.   Elegant, relaxed, refined, and outdoorsy. Brunch in the outdoors is just a necessity!  The BF and I got a late start on our Saturday. We became Scottsdale wanderers and became lost in the shiny retail-roads of old town.   Eventually we found our way to the canal, only made obvious by my recent Yelp excursion to a nearby eatery.   We took in the noon-time sights: art, people, etc. I perused Yelp for a decent late lunch and O&I was top of the list. With the gorgeous canal views I can see how it would be!  We ventured near and requested an outdoor table. Unfortunately our table was Also a favorite hangout for a local bird (apparently a protected bird). My BF and the bird became instAnt mates - much to his dismay. A few encounters later we were ushered to another table. FYI we named the bird Pippy (aka Poopy).   The views and weather were fantastic. Roughly 75* and breezy we could not have asked for better weather. The art installation at the canal made for an even better view.   Our cocktails were fantastic. A Fig mule for me and a apple/jalapeño margarita for him. With just the right blend of flavors and alcohol we were pleased. Plus the price was right (or maybe that's our SoCalroots showing).   I had the salad - which after reading a local CM's review I wish I would have ordered the warm chicken. The BF has the Tuna sandwich, which was a tad lackluster.   My salad had hefty amounts of bleu cheese which is always appreciated, but I do wish the choice of warm chicken versus cold was made more apparent.   We also ordered desert - lemon pudding cake. I found myself enjoying it, however not loving it. I did, however enjoy my fresh espresso - even thought it was received after we had finished dessert. Graciously, the server removed the espresso from the bill. Thank you for that!   I would not hesitate to visit O&I again as the atmosphere and service are five stars in itself.

It took forever to get a seat, even though only about 1/3rd of the tables had guests. Our server had a terrible attitude and appeared agitated that she was working. Also, the table next to us got piled up on several occasions with dirty dishes. Just disgusting, and overpriced.

Had helpful hosts even though we had no reservation on a busy Sunday brunch and got seated at a nice table by the window with my friend who was amazed by this gem and the interior design. Drinks, food, service was all 10/10
I took my wife on a date and it was well worth everything. We had fun at the bar, the service was perfect and the food was the best. I will be going back.
Came here for lunch and I LOVED IT!! It's my favorite restaurant for now on, and also we did received the best service our waiter was TOMMY he is amazing !!!! Ask for him
This restaurant was my favorite restaurant in Scottsdale. I can't believe I never reviewed it when I lived in Arizona. Yum. I miss this place.

This place left quite an impression on me, I have to say.  First, the waiter (forgive me for not remembering his name) was refreshingly eloquent. He explained the menu item-by item in the the most intricate and juicy detail. Actual quotes: "I personally recommend the ice cream bar. I dream about this dessert when I sleep at night and I have to beg the chef to make it for me the next day. Creamy, indulging, satisfying" After his 5-minute spiel, our table was already sold on every item he listed. He wasn't just a waiter; he was a poet.  The appetizers were particularly good, with the bacon-wrapped dates taking the gold for the most creative and delicious plate. The pesto here is great; make sure to request some with your bread. Also consider the beet salad, which was my favorite among the greens.  I had the natural chicken as my entree and while it sounds like a very basic dish, I enjoyed every bite of it. The chicken was moist and slightly tangy while the yukon puree adorned the sides of the plate.   Finally, the ice cream bar ended the feast on a perfect note. It is served with a steak knife so you can carve out your bite from the log of rich deep chocolate+toffee ice cream  Distinguishing factor: this place takes the bacon-wrapping trend to a new level with the bacon-wrapped dates. The plate was the star of our table.

This is definitely a five star review. Reservations were smooth, check in easy. We were seated promptly and when asked at the last minute to sit outside, they were very nice about it. The ambiance is a bit dark inside, and slightly noisy, but very warmly decorated with a great atmosphere to it. Outdoor seating is a must as long as it has cooled some, which it had. It was just perfect. The patio is decorated very lovely, cozy, and it's spacious, great for groups, and there are misters.  A must try are: The prosciutto and fig appetizer The sea bass entree, light and creamy  The salmon, cooked perfectly and seasoned with this delicious honey like glaze and beats, yum! I was five seconds away from ordering a second salmon entree it was just that great The desserts, amazing! A must try: The toasted coconut cakes with mint chocolate chip ice cream Their blackberry balsamic ice cream amazing! All fish made.  If you come to Scottsdale you cannot leave without stopping by for dinner. Trust me it's a winner!

My coworker and I eat lunch here at least one to two times a week. The food is always great, the atmosphere is comfortable, and the staff is incredibly friendly. This is seriously the best patio in Scottsdale for day eating & drinking. The only reason I gave O&I 4/5 stars is because the service is consistently slow. They feature a full-dining side and a market side where you can get anything & everything to go, including lattes and smoothies. Agan, great service on either side of the restaurant, but the full dining portion is rather slow.

I come here for the atmosphere and food, but the service brings me back.  One of the coolest things about this place is that you can pick an open seat in front--no waiting, sink into their soft leather chairs--and people watch.      The food is prepared with such detail and care.  I ordered a vegetable cheese soup and it was perfectly seasoned.  My salad was fresh with a tangy oil and vinegar dressing...Wow! what a taste.  My companion had the fresh salmon.  Served over a bed of lettuce, the taste and presentation was just terrific!!    The breads served here really satisfy.  And the dipping sauce has just the right amount of garlic and spice to keep you nibbling throughout the meal.    But what makes the difference at this eatery is their unmatched service.  Everyone is friendly and professional.  The wait staff are trained like no other.  Ask them what is in the pesto sauce and the rattle off about 10 different ingredients.    What pleasure early weekend breakast is at this place.  You will not be disappointed!!
Amazing place. Great atmosphere and service.  The bacon wrapped dates were fabulous.  Highly recommend this place!!
We love their waterfront location and their menu. Happy hour is great too! Nice inside out and friendly stadd

Bread please! I love this place for anytime of the day! We come here about twice a week and I haven't had anything bad! Brunch is great! Lunch & dinner I love the chicken granola salad! Make sure to ask for extra granola and to have the chicken grilled. You'll thank me later! The complimentary bread and pesto sauce is brilliant! It's worth the calories!!!!!!!! Service is always great. I personally love the outdoor seating and misters. Also make sure to sign up online you get a free meal on your birthday & $10 credit toward your email just for signing up. Also to note, happy hour is super cheap! Enjoy!

Came here at the recommendation of a friend and was very, very pleased with the entire experience. From our hilarious, accommodating waiter to the beyond-delicious food (I had an appetizer of bacon wrapped dates and the rare seared tuna) I would return here in a heart beat. They also presented me with a beautiful desert for my birthday, complete with a glowing candle and fancy "happy birthday" spelled in something edible, but without the embarrassing waiter-ensemble happy birthday serenade. Anxious to return as soon as possible!

Olive and ivy is a cute and fancy place to go eat! If you don't have a reservation, beware because you might have to sit outside or wait a bit. We sat outside on the patio area (had misters and umbrellas) that was great. I had the two eggs any style, which was good. Also, $5 mimosas on Saturday!!

Next to the river. Inside and outside dining. Trees outside. Very interesting decor. Friendly staff. Noisy. Interesting selection of starters. Dessert menu pretty ordinary. 25 bucks for 4 scallops on a small puddle of polenta is not a price performer. Was told later it is a famous "pick up spot". Could be. Seemed pretty popular. Would go again for a glass of wine and perhaps bruschetta selection. Not for a meal. Have been to better places for food including one at the Sky Harbor airport. Have a favorite in Tempe which I will not mention. Don't want to have to wait in line.

This is a fabulous restaurant.  We were 10 minutes late for our reservation, but the staff was really friendly and accommodating and made us feel comfortable.  Our waiter was engaging and fun.  The entire kitchen is open to the inside seating area, which was awesome to watch.  We sat outside on the patio which I highly recommend; it's right on the canal and it was fun to watch the giant "waterbugs" on the river change colors throughout the evening.  If you're going to order cocktails, I suggest the Daiquiri No. 4.  The waiter suggested a locally brewed beer for my husband and we both thought it was one of the best beers we'd ever tasted.  Now for the food:  I ordered the sea scallops, which were possibly the best I'd ever had.  My husband had the chicken entree, which was good, not great.  For dessert we shared the peanut butter pudding, which was to die for, and the Napoleon ice cream sandwich, which was just fine.  The only reason I'm not giving this a five-star review is because this restaurant is LOUD.  It's surprisingly big and it was completely packed when we were there, which was a Monday night, so I definitely wouldn't go there on a weekend!  It's definitely not the place for a chill, family meal.  But for a nicer, trendier date night, it's an awesome choice.  If I'm ever back in the Scottsdale area, I will definitely try to get in here again!

The most specialist place I love to go to  it was our first date we had the same server for two years and she left we were so sad but love it no matter what the menu changes upon season which is cool even tho I only order the same thing lol

Since my last visit to Arizona I've come to accept there are some truly exceptional restaurants in this desert state. Going to one of the wealthier areas of Arizona, Olive & Ivy is located next to a river and features a luxurious interior of velvet, wood, and spirits. From the moment you walk in you feel like this is going to be a special evening.   Interior - 5 stars Olive & Ivy has this beautiful, romantic mood at night. The lights are low and the shadows seep into the wood work. Homages to the old style of tungsten light bulbs hang from above while plush curtains drape from ceiling to floor. The style is open and wide, allowing light to come shine from the outside and having both outdoor and indoor seating connect with no walls to be a border. The kitchen is large and open letting anyone see the beauty of their art and the giant bar located near the entrance wraps around to the back where the gelato and take out area exists. Walking around just a little a bit shows Olive & Ivy is much bigger than you initially expect.  Service - 3 stars The service was good. Nothing exceptional comes to mind though the staff did seem to work as a fluid team. Good wait staff who'll probably do their best to accommodate your needs but more likely you'll get normal, friendly service.  Food - 4 stars The menu here is simple, with only about 5 categories of food and 4-6 options underneath them. This includes a section for bruschetta, salads, flatbreads, meats, and entrees. The bruschetta was excellent. They use fresh ingredients and the bread is crisp and flavorful. All the ingredients come together to compose a symphony in your mouth and though some are better than others, none are sub par. I was intrigued to try their shrimp risotto. Often times I have found risotto is usually under or overcooked so I was hoping Olive & Ivy would be the outlier; I was happy to be correct. When the risotto came out it did look like it might be overcooked but it was perfect. The rice was moist, plump, and took in the deep flavors of the stock it was boiled in. The spiciness of the Spanish chorizo was full and a great accent to the creaminess of the dish. Along with a tasty kale pesto the shrimp in the dish is plump and plentiful. They don't skimp on the meat and the bowl is a wonderful, filling meal. If they could make this dish this well every time more people would order risotto happily.  Price - 4 stars The price for the items aren't cheap. Most entrees will run around the $25-$29 range while the salads and flatbreads lean themselves to the $17 range. It'll be a bit on the expensive side but I highly recommend trying the food and it'll change your mind. You'll see food this good is worth it. Bring friends and do it as a share meal and you'll see it might even be less than you expect.  Conclusion  Olive & Ivy has a gorgeous atmosphere fitting of impressing dates and creating happiness. With a lavish interior and robust food this riverfront restaurant has all the makings of a great night out. A must try if you are in the Scottsdale area.

This place is great. The scenery is beautiful and the food is good. BUT most importantly the servers are fantastic. I've been here a few times sometimes dressed up, dressed poorly, and once had to sit in the awkward little sitting spot in the front. But the servers are consistently kind and caring. I didn't feel like dressed up, or dressed poorly, or put in that weird little spot that I was treated differently in any way. Keep it up servers and sorry for making you move around those outside heaters that one time. Arizona blood here.

Love, love, love this place. The Marketplace as well as the main restaurant. Had coffee every morning here while we were vacationing. Great espresso and friendly service. We especially loved their patio out back that overlooks the canal and into Old Town Scottsdale. Allie at the hostess stand is fabulous.

I'm sad to say that my very first meal in Arizona was a bit of a letdown. Admittedly, the setting is pretty scenic, but I kind of felt like I was in a suburban "upscale" mall restaurant that was trying to be more chic and happening than it could ever hope to be.   I went with a Cobb Salad, which should have been a simple choice but the leaves seemed a bit wilted and the entire serving just a tad bland, even after a hefty dosing of pepper on my part.   Still, service was relatively fast and friendly, so if I worked nearby, I can see how this could be an alright spot to keep on one's lunch circuit. No doubt about it, the best thing going here is the waterfront.

This place has amazing decor which creates the perfect ambiance. Very hipster but classy at the same time. The place is big enough for large parties.  I really like the bruschetta on their menu. It's $11 for3 bruschetta and you can choose from the 6/7 they have on the menu. Try the FRESH MOZZARELLA , ROASTED BRUSSELS SPROUT, or the  PROSCIUTTO & FIG. In addition, I got the MUSHROOM PAPPARDELLE which wasn't too bad.   Wish I came here for brunch because I hear great things about it. I definitely would recommend this place!

Came in for Sunday brunch w/4 other friends. This was our first of the Fox Restaurant Concepts and they made quite an impression on us! No one ordered any of the breakfast items--instead we had salads, gyros, and lots of drinks. I'll take that pesto dip & bread over chips & salsa any day! Lamb gyro was legit & VERY filling. The tableside mimosas were delicious especially for $5 a pop. The other cocktails were about $8 a pop and equally good. Altogether we spent about $150 for 5--a little pricier than expected but had a great time and left full!

A really nice and welcoming restaurant. Service is met with high expectations and received. I went hear for my birthday, in which my girlfriend got them to surprise me with a birthday cake she got from a store. I had the veal and spinach ravioli, the dish has me craving for it even now.

Of all the Fox restaurants in town, I think this one is in my top 3. I've been wanting to try Olive and Ivy for a long time, so when I got notification that they were offering 25% off on Memorial day, I pretty much had to go. I (luckily) made a reservation (otherwise there was a 45 min wait at lunch time). We were seated right away. We had fantastic service throughout with a knowledgeable and friendly waitress. We had the delicious pesto and bread ( 2 servings because I'm a pig) and we split the bacon cheeseburger and the lasagna. The cheeseburger was tasty, with a definite charred taste to it. The onions were really good (and the pesto that came with the bread was good on it too). The lasagna was also tasty, with a distinctly red wine based Bolognese sauce. The portion was large allowing us to take half home. Also, it came with some of the most fantastic garlic bread.... just oozing with butter and garlic... I'd come here just for that. I'll be back!

I was super impressed by Olive and Ivy considering it was in the Phoenix airport. After a terrifying flight from Los Angeles, a diverted landing to Tucson because of a dust storm, and a missed flight because of the diversion, Olive and Ivy made for a great breakfast after spending the night in the airport. The prices were just right, especially considering the airport location, and the food was fresh and good. Check it out next time you are trapped in the Phoenix airport.

Really cute little brunch place! I loved the atmosphere of it!  I came here for brunch with a friend. I think I've only been here once before. I ordered the Potato Hash. This comes with over easy eggs, onions, pepper and a sausage gravy. I really liked the sausage gravy that it came with. I felt like it could've been better with some more meat in it or maybe if there was actually hash browns. Of course I had to wash it down with a Mimosa since it IS brunch AND Sunday Funday. =) Their mimosas are only $5 on Sundays and do NOT come in those skinny little champagne glasses. lol.   I'd like to try something else next time I come and probably sit on their cute little patio that they have. Also would want to try their happy hour. =)
Bacon dates Enough said You can't go wrong with that nor the hundreds of wine they have here. Drink some wine and look at those sculptured heads on the wall, guess how much they cost

I have only been here for drinks so I cannot review the food at this time.   The design of this restaurant is great.  I love the wine room with wine stack floor to ceiling.    We ended up ordering drinks at the bar then wandering outside to sit by a fire  outside. I had a very nice view of the river and it is a very nice area of Scottsdale. It was a fun place to dress up and go out. I will have to come back and try the food.

Parents cane in from cali to visit and them here.   All of ours first time coming to olive and ivy and we were left speechless. This place is perfect from the second you walk in.  The decor, the ambience and the location alone make it a place to go to. The staff was helpful and the food came out quick. The food was phenomenal the bruchetta to the pasta to the seafood, all a must have.

This was a cool, bustling little spot for an afternoon lunch. Food was good, not over-the-top amazing. Sat at the bar with a colleague and we enjoyed our time. I would suggest not putting the receipt in front of the guests at the same time as they receive their food. It gives the customer a sense of rushing and that they cannot order another drink or dessert.

I can't wait to come back here. Everything I had was delicious. My favorite part might be the pesto sauce for dipping...  We had brushetta, the soup (it was something with cauliflower in it), the proscuitto flat bread, and the gnocchi. All of it was so good, I can't pick a favorite. They also have a great wine list. Our serve was fantastic, attentive, and had great suggestions for us.
Great patio. Food was very good. Had the beet salad and the fungi flatbread

Not much to say that hasn't already been said, so here's the short review.  The starter bread and pesto were amazing. Best pesto ever.  Appetizer was the calamari/shrimp/zucchini and it was so good. And I'm not even a super fan of calamari.   I had the lasagna and my girl had the flatbread. Both were excellent.  Our server was great, and even the water was good - which outside of AZ isn't usually a consideration, but not having it taste like dirt was nice.   Been here a few times and always have had a great experience.

Atmosphere and location was great. Service and drinks were good. Food was mediocre. I had lasagna bolognese, and it was bland. I had to add a lot of salt. My husband had veal ravioli which was ok. I would give the atmosphere a 4 or 5, and food 2.5 to 3. Great people watching, and location is great.

I have to say Phoenix airport has the best restaurants.  This was a very nice airport restaurant, I had one of the best breakfast shakes ever, and for a decent price of $5.  They also had very good cups of soup for only $2.

Love this place!!  Amazing food, design and atmosphere.  Had a perfect birthday dinner tonight for the GF.  Bread with pesto to start, bacon wrapped dates, Sangaria to drink and Lasagna/Pasta entries... All perfect!  Thank you guys!!

I'd like to keep it short here goes...  Location is very nice.  Inside or out, the atmosphere is very pretty and pleasant  The food is good.  Some dishes are very good, but over all not great.  The bar is were we had the biggest disappointment.  It is a pricey bar that serves less than impressive drinks.  The Moscow mule was a sour pill and I have never had it this bad. The sangria my wife had was also disappointing.  The scotch selection is basically what you find on the super market shelf - not bad but only the average stuff.    The staff is young, nice but a bit scarce.  We can't go back but it is in a very nice place.
The location is terrific even if the parking is moderately terrible. The food is good and it has really terrific outdoor seating area.

Unfortunately I didn't have a good experience here... I took my Mother to lunch for the first time and we both ordered salads. The cashier asked us if we wanted to add chicken - we both replied "yes" and she said "cold or grilled" - we both said grilled. Our total bill was a little higher than expected so my mom nicely asked why. The girl was extremely rude and said, "grilled chicken is more."  and basically laughed at my mom for even asking the question... We were not rude, we did not ask for it to be taken off the bill - just a simple question. I've worked in the service industry for years and it rubs me the wrong way, because she was completely polite while asking a valid question. I have had lunch in the actual dining room and I had a wonderful experience with a MUCH more friendly staff, so I will just stick to that instead.

Almost walked out as hostess was without the mostest! BUT because we always (in the past) received the BEST service we decided not to leave and treat mom to a new restaurant and just wanted an enjoyable afternoon.Food was AMAZING as usual as well as our waiter Christian (Thant you for your excellent customer service).
Perfect date night restaurant! Try to get a seat on the patio it is very romantic. Our food was amazing and the waiter made us laugh and was very attentive. We had the best time here!

The food at Olive and Ivy was delicious, with options for different dietary preferences/restrictions. We really enjoyed the bruschettas and the fish entrees. The lamb meatballs were great as well. The space is huge, so there is plenty of room for large groups. The only downside was that while we got appetizers fairly quickly, the kitchen took forever with the main dishes. Otherwise, the service was great and they did apologize for the delay in the kitchen.

I like this place! I'm a fan of the restaurant in Scottsdale and I was pleased with the selection at the airport. It is definitely limited, you can't expect a full menu in a to-go line, but the food is fresh and good.

I am definitely a fan of this place! The layout alone makes it worth it. They have a huge outdoor patio which is lovely most of the year. The inside is great too, they have a bar that is perfect for happy hour, and a market as well with coffee, pastries, other drinks, and various sorbets if you want something light or something to go.  Don't be afraid to dive into the bread they bring at the beginning of the meal; the pesto is fabulous! I'm a huge fan of the Mediterranean salad, which I get with salmon. I have a lot of business lunch meetings here, but day or night this is a great place to work or play!
There was a 30 minute wait so we went next door to the Marketplace (same restaurant). This is a bacon lovers paradise! The blt sandwich was great and the service was awesome.

The two star rating says this "Meh. I've experienced better." and that's exactly how I would describe Olive and Ivy. I've been here two times now and each time left thinking "nothing special" "over priced".  First time I went here I had a gyro and it was good. Nothing to make me go back again, but good. Second time here, I honestly don't even remember what I ordered.  The service both times was very good. Attentive and as fast as they can. The bread is also very good, probably my favorite part.  Take a look at the menu and see what you think. This place is very popular and people love it, I guess it's just not for me.

Absolutely wonderful atmosphere and scrumptious food! The pesto is superb! The hummus - best I have ever had and I am a hummus lover! Mason was our waiter. A true gentleman! He made our night! Great service! We will be back!

Brunch menu is straightforward with a few twists. I struggled finding something that jumped off the page that I wanted to try but was happy with my order.   Their version of a Moscow Mule is excellent. Overall we have always been happy with our drinks here but I was a little disappointed in their take on an old fashion.   Atmosphere is modern but the lighting makes it cozy. The outdoor patio is near the canal, from your seat you can see the art installations over the canal or near it.   Park at the Nordstrom parking garage if you can't find street parking or don't want to valet.

Came here to celebrate a birthday and was very satisfied with the visit. Our waiter, Kevin, did an outstanding job and was very friendly. The food was amazing as always. We tried the peanut butter mousse dessert for the first time and it was so rich, full of texture, and delicious! I would definitely recommend it!

Worst service, my food took 40 min, to get my food and the server just gave me attitude and forgot to place an order, not worth my money, and yes I'm disappointed with the service, because it's a nice place.
Great friendly service.  Breakfast sandwich is the greatest! Really!!  They do need a soda fountain, but that's ok.

The food looked nice on the plate but the taste wasn't anything my family can't cook in the kitchen. The ambiance of the restaurant was very impressive but there is nothing that can save a restaurant if they can't put out stellar product.
Amazing place. A definite go to for lunch and great patio. Food is way above par and reasonably priced.
Really liked this place.  Beautiful setting.  Good food except the lamb.  Don't order that.  Wine was good service was great.  Not cheap

A bunch of my friends surprised me with a birthday dinner here and I was impressed.  We got the whole back room to ourselves and this place was booming!  I started off with two Moscow Mules and they were reallllll good.  Liked that they put in a little more lime.  The dinner was great and everyone had something different.  I had the chicken scaloppini and it hit the spot.    They let us bring in our own cupcakes, ya know this dude has a sweet tooth. Really enjoyed our experience and I dunno about you, but I'm coming back!
Great atmosphere eating under the lighted trees beside the canal. They make delicious pesto fresh every day for their bread. Good pork tenderloin and amazing tres leeches!
Food wand ambiance was phenomenal - Amanda was a great server she was so nice and knowledgeable !
Great food. Great service. Best place to eat if you are in Scottsdale area. Food taste amazing.
I love this place!  The restaurant itself has an amazing ambience and the food is amazing! We always check this place out after a busy day of shopping.   Very reasonably priced and very, very good.

In celebration of how awesome our team is at work, we were taken to Olive & Ivy. We were seated at a large table inside that overlooked the patio the fountains and the "waterfront" (i say "waterfront" because it's actually a canal, and it seems so silly to refer to it as the "waterfront"). The weather was beautiful, so all of the sliders were open, and the view was actually really nice.   We started out by ordering two bottles of the Russian Jack Pinot Noir. It was the perfect choice with our dinner- light but flavorful. I'd definitely order it again. We also ordered two flatbreads, the sweet corn & tomato and the asparagus & wild mushroom. If you really twisted my arm, I might say that the corn & tomato was my favorite. But they were both so delicious, that it really is a tough decision. Before bringing our entrees, our waitress brought out the focaccia bread with pesto dipping sauce. I had to really try and restrain myself from eating all of it, so I would still have room for dinner, but it was hard because that stuff is delicious!   When my meal arrived, I was slightly disappointed by how small it looked. I thought that maybe I should have loaded up on the focaccia while I still had the chance. I had ordered the Sweet Potato Cannelloni, and after the waitresses ravings, was really hoping for something a little larger. But when I took my first bite, everything changed. The sauce was so rich, and the only thing I can think to compare it to was cake. Each little bite of cannelloni was taking a bite of the best cake I've ever had. It was so sweet, but not overly sweet. And with little pearl onions and brussel sprout leaves scattered throughout, I was seriously in Heaven. I devoured my meal, even though I felt full about half way through, I just couldn't stop.   The ambiance and service was great, but the food was amazing. It's definitely on the pricey side, but so worth the cost. I encourage everyone to stop in for a little bit of Heaven.

The food was amazing, and the atmosphere was even better! It is a bit pricey, so come prepared. Overall, Olive & Ivy had great service, and I will definitely be going back. I gave it four stars because there isn't a whole bunch of options to chose from.

Loved this place!!!    My husband and I were in the area attending my family reunion, and this restaurant was recommended by a staff member at the Hyatt Place.   It was a short walk from our hotel.  We went around 1 pm for lunch on a Monday. There was no wait at all for inside seating and 1/2 hour for outdoor seating (we were in a rush so we sat inside).  It was a nice atmosphere both indoor and outdoor, and their bathrooms were also very clean and cool looking.  Our waiter was friendly and gave us good recommendations.  We started with the bread with pesto. This was the best pesto I've ever tasted.  I think maybe it had more cheese than most I've tried.    I ordered the butternut squash and spinach cannollini (sp).  It was absolutely delicious! I LOVED the different flavors I tasted with each bite, a sweet and salty taste - almond slivers, spinach, mushrooms, squash, butter sauce, etc.   My husband is a basic kind of guy when it comes to food, so he ordered the burger on toasted wheat bread (he does not like ciabatta and all of the other fluffy 'foo foo' type of bread).  He said the burger tasted fresh and it had arugula on it, not your standard burger.  The fries were also good.  My husband had a peach bellini which was delicious, and I had a red sangria which was also great.  When we were done, I decided to walk through the area with the gelato.  I ended up with 1 scoop of Oreo cookie and cheesecake gelato and another of blueberry cheesecake gelato.  Both were creamy and delicious.  This was our last dining experience before leaving AZ.  We had a great time in AZ and this was the icing on the cake.  I am SOOO glad we decided to come here!

Lunch business meeting.  A bit loud for this type of event.  Superb service .  Interesting dinning room.  Limited menu but very nice portions.  Cup of delicious soup and 1/2 Mediterranean salad with shrimp was plenty.

My fiance and I had a romantic evening here for Valentine's weekend and I loved every moment of our experience. The mood, the customer service, the cocktails and the food! Nicole D. was our sever and she recommended sooo many delicious things! We had the sweet potato cannelloni- so phenominal and unique, and the chicken scallopini (again- amaze!!!) Such a lovely night and we can't wait to come back!!!!

The location along the canal with the open doors and courtyard of sorts is aesthetically pleasing.  The menu is mostly tilted toward Mediterranean cuisine with some more American standbys mixed in as a back up for those less adventurous.  Overall, the quality was quite good and the service prompt and professional.  This place falls into the "after work, wine and a light bite" category.  The layout is conducive to social interaction, so bringing a group of 6-8 is definitely feasible.  I would go back.
This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants to have lunch with friends. The food and the service is outstanding!

I've been here a few times and it's always consistent. The service is attentive and knowledgeable (in fact... some of the most knowledgeable wait staff I've seen).  The drinks are consistently good and they have a good wine list. They are also fairly well equipped for large groups with private rooms and large tables in the main dining room.    The food is good, but not great.  It's never bad...  it's consistently decent, but doesn't blow me away.  I recommend the scallops, but replace the corn with salad...  the corn is a strange combination and not very tasty.  The kale salad is good, but too much kale without enough other parts of the salad mixed in.  The staff and ambiance are the winning aspects to this place.
They have the best patio in AZ. Comfortable and beautiful and right on the waterfront. The drinks are fantastic!

Although I haven't been back to O&I, I was contacted by a fox rep and they were very courteous and made things right after my bad experience. I go to Blanco and Culinary Dropout frequently and will probably try North this time around. Thanks FOX!

It was only a little after 8am when I arrived in Phoenix so I was still on breakfast time. I wasn't starving but had a long flight ahead of me so I made my way over to Olive & Ivy. I was a little disappointed to see that many of the photos uploaded by the restaurant were not options for breakfast (i.e. eggs Benedict, pancakes, etc...). It's not a huge deal, but I assume those or professional photos from their other location which is a bit misleading.  I ended up with the O&I Breakfast sandwich. It was your standard sausage, egg, and cheese on an English muffin, but they add a tomato to make it fancy. It looks like the quality of products used was slightly elevated but not worth the $8 price tag. The lunch menu looked better so I'd prefer to try that in the future.

Love the ambiance here! The drinks (both alcoholic and coffee) are delicious. Loved the Moscow mule I had there. I've gotten the sweet potato cannelloni twice and loved it both times, highly recommend. The beet salad was light and refreshing. Everything is made in house, so their bread is incredible. This is a fun place to take friends for lunch if you can't decide where to go!

I went here with my boyfriend on a Saturday night. Very nice vibe with a live dj. The service is phenomenal and don't have to wait for food because they have four lines in their kitchen. Must have- red sangria and their chicken scallopini. The outside patio is huge for lounging with cute patio furniture and lights. Gentlemen, take your ladies here

This place is absolutely amazing. The atmosphere is beautiful, the service is impeccable and the food is beyond delicious. Highly recommend getting the scallops - I didn't even like scallops until I had them from here. Everything is made from scratch too. Again, absolutely amazing and was a great experience!
Josh P. offered impeccable service tonight! The food and ambiance was amazing! So happy we made it out here. Highly recommend this restaurant!
The best patio experience is Olive & ivy.  I love there food and wine selection.
Such a great place! Love the location near the mall and the ambiance is great. The service was fantastic, with our drinks always full. Food and menu are terrific. Highly recommend!
Great fox concept in old town. The only o&i and is still a great spot to come for lunch dinner drinks. Plus they have a good happy hour m-f 3 to 6. Great patio on the waterfront.

Nine of us gals ate here on Saturday night this past MDW and.... WE.ABSOLUTELY.LOVED.IT!!  Our server (ugh!! I can't believe I forgot his name) was AMAZING! He took such great care of us, never once let a water glass go empty, made sure our cocktails kept coming, and paid close attention to our few friends with food allergies. We all enjoyed the appetizers, our mains, and dessert. I can't remember what everyone else ordered... but I do recall ordering the artichoke hearts, lamb meatballs, and bacon wrapped dates to start with.  Did we enjoy them?   Uh - yah... I would say so as there wasn't a crumb left on the plates, haha. For my main, I ordered the shrimp scampi risotto.  Those who know me well, know that I love risotto so ordering this dish was no surprise.  Plus, I needed to eat something hearty that would soak up the alcohol once we entered Scottsdale's "entertainment district", lol! Anyway... I really enjoyed my dish and have no complaints.  I would definitely return to Olive & Ivy the next time I'm in Scottsdale.  We all had a wonderfully delicious time here!
